text:
I sent an email but never heard back....

I just returned from a trip to Vegas, and I wanted to reach out to you about my stay. I called a couple of months ago to book my weekend visit, and was given 1 night comped and a discounted night as well. I was also provided $30.00 in free play and $50.00 in food credit. The purpose of my visit was a getaway for my mom who hasn't been to The Mirage in 27 years, or to Vegas! She and I were very excited.
 
I checked in at The Mirage on March 4th for a 2 night stay. Upon arrival, I was provided an upgrade to the 25th floor into a King Suite, and we were thrilled with the customer service at the front desk.
We got into our room, and everything was great....on the surface. Then it all went downhill.
 
The bellhop brought up our luggage (7 pieces) and placed some things on the counter above the refrigerator. Because of this, we did not see the flyer that stated not to place personal items in the fridge. We placed food that my mother brought to me from the east coast. Needless to say, that food spoiled as the fridge wasn't working.
Our toilet didn't flush unless you flushed 5-10 times, our shower was filled with mold, the ice bucket had a bag of water inside of it and we had invoices and personal letters in our room (from previous guests) that were dated February 5th, so we knew that our room hadn't been cleaned well.
 
At first we called the front desk and we were assured that someone would come to our room, fix the toilet\/mold and clean for us. We were given an additional $50.00 food credit but the cleaning and fixing never happened.
The following day, Saturday, we called again to the front desk and again, we were told that someone would come at noon to take care of the problems, again, this didn't happen.
On Saturday night, I had enough, and stood in the check in line for 40 minutes so that I could speak to someone about our room. I spoke to a lovely lady, and I should have written down her name. She tried so hard to assist, and provided an additional $50.00 in food credit but explained that the hotel was sold out due to the race and there wasn't another room to put me in. I understood, and was grateful for her trying.
On Sunday, I was done..the toilet put me over the edge, and it was truly disgusting.
 
I checked out, and graciously was comped for the entire weekend. I was and still am very thankful for this gesture.
We went outside to get our car from Valet, and then all of the kind gestures went out the door once again.
I saw the valet attendant pull my car up, he got out said my name, but didn't give me enough time to gather my 7 suitcases and get to the car, so he drove off and parked my car.
I went to the valet stand to let them know that I needed my car pulled back up as I couldn't carry all of my baggage and they refused!!! What the heck?!!
 
I don't know how the staff can be so great in some areas, and then not so much in others.
If it wasn't for the front desk and customer service, I would never return. I have stayed at almost every hotel in Las Vegas, and I have seen worse, but I have definitely seen better.
 
Thank you,

Great Hotel and Casino. The hotel has just been revamped, so all the rooms are extremely nice. Very spacious and clean. My view overlooked the strip, which was beautiful, however the sound of the volcano show was a bit loud. I also liked that my hotel room also included free internet and free access to the cardio room. Most hotels charge you extra for these "perks". 

As far as the casino, the gaming area is clean and doesn't smell nearly as smokey as the other casinos. The restaurants and bars are great (they have Stack, which is one of my favorite) and the staff is friendly and very helpful.

I didn't really get to check out the shops, pool, or dolphin show. I guess that will be on my list of things to do on my visit.

This was the first time I have stayed at the Mirage. The prices were great! They do add the resort fee which can be irritating, I would rather just have one price and have it all included. Seems like just a new way to get another $25 a night. Despite how old this casino is, you would never know it. The rooms are extremly well maintained. No issues what so ever with cleanliness, older stuff, etc. Was very happy. In Vegas we are never in our room long so I prefer the more reasonable rates like they had to the fancy ameneties of other places which is nice if you are in the room a lot but we were not. They do have a really nicely stocked mini bar that has some interesting items in it! Room is good size, shower has great water pressure, and the rooms are quiet. Customer service was fast and friendly checking in. A very long line only took 5 minutes since they had all the counters open helping people check in. 
If you stay here, you get a discount at the shows and secret garden which is a nice bonus.

Finally stayed at the Mirage after many years of eating and playing at this joint.  We stayed Thursday through Sunday in a hospitality suite.  I would definitely stay in this room again.  The master bedroom is large with a TV that comes out of a cabinet at the foot of the king sized bed.  The bathroom has a dual vanity with plenty of counter space for two (2) people, and probably more than that.  There is a large soaking tub, a separate water closet, and a separate shower.  We were on a high floor (21) and had a great view of the Strip.

There is a living room with a large couch and a 60 inch (approximately) flat screen on the way.  There is a wet bar with two (2) bar stools, the minibar, and a separate fridge with ice maker.  The center of the room has a large square-shaped table with 4 bench seats.  You could probably seat 8 or so around the table comfortably.  This would be a good room for entertaining, in addition to the space there is a half bath right off the main entrance.  So, if you did have guests over they wouldn't need to use your personal bathrooms in the 2 bedrooms.

The second bedroom is a standard Mirage room with double bed and a much smaller bathroom.

There are three (3) main table games areas to the Mirage casino.  There are a total of 6 craps tables on the main floor, and a couple of banks of table games, plus another bank that is dedicated almost entirely to blackjack.  Limits were appropriate for the Vegas Strip.  $10 during most days and at least $15 on a lot of games during the weekend nights.  They had limits of $10, $15, and $25 for craps on weekends.

The poker room is remodeled since I had last been to Mirage.  It's right off of the sportsbook.  It was a decent room, but it doesn't get any games besides 3\/6 limit and 1\/2 NLHE.  There were a couple of tourneys available but I did not play in them.

Love is one of the better Cirque shows in my opinion.  Highly recommended.  Mirage also has the best lineup of stand up comics in town with their "Aces of Comedy."  David Spade and Ray Romano were in town the weekend I was there.  I have seen Daniel Tosh, Brad Garrett, and Jay Leno in the past at Mirage.

Like most Las Vegas casino hotels, you have your choice of several cuisines:  Japanese, Chinese, Italian, steakhouse, buffet, American, and the ubiquitous 24 hour Vegas coffee shop that every place has.  On our last trip we ate at Pantry and Fin.  It has been a long time but I remember liking the buffet, Cravings, very much.  

I would stay at Mirage again.  The dealers were very friendly for the most part and there are enough dining options for a few days.  Recommended.

My family of 8 recently made reservations to stay there for four nights during the Thanksgiving holiday. Reservations were made for 3 rooms. I have never been so disappointed there were so many things that were wrong. 
My son checked in first with me Wednesday the 25th. We got adjoining rooms. I was in the room with my 2 granddaughters. Around 12:30 we decided to call it a night. When I pulled down the bedding there was blood on the sheets. Apparently the sheets were never changed, I don't know what else wasn't done. I can't even express how bad that was. They came and changed the sheets . My son kept his room. I decided I could not stay there another day so I checked out. 
My daughter and son in law checked in late that night and got a beautiful suite. Later that night , due to a leak they had to be moved. A day later my son and his wife also had to move due to water leaking thru the ceiling. They sat in the room for quite a while waiting to be moved.
We paid a lot of money to the Mirage thinking we would have a great rooms at a beautiful resort. We also paid your resort fees .. For what? The pool is closed, we paid extra for the secret garden. I have never stayed at Mirage before and am not sure any of us will again this is really unacceptable. What is going on there???


Update Jan 2nd ..... I sent an email to their customer care team. After getting a little bit of a run around I did hear from a manager. Bottom line she's sorry but they had talked to my family members when each event happened and they seemed ok. IF we stay there again she will personally make sure everything runs smoothly. Left me feeling a little flat and I don't really think spending hundreds of dollars again just see if it works out is not going to happen! 
That's her best offer??? There are to many other choices in Vegas!

This was my third time in Vegas and the second best hotel that I stayed in. The worst was Circus Circus and the best was The Mandalay  Bay. The Mirage was pretty decent, it was clean for the most part and not crazy expensive. I checked out some reviews on Yelp and they weren't too bad so that was a good thing.

Got there on a Sunday around 11am expecting to wait to check in because check in was at 3 or something. Surprisingly they checked me with no problem so I was happy about that. The employees were pretty nice and helpful which is always a plus in my book. I got to my room and it was a nice size but the bathroom was a little small for my liking. Also the bathtub was just a regular size which is fine because I didn't reserve a suite or anything.

They have some decent places to eat like a burger spot I went to it wasn't the best burger I had but it was good. The star of that burger spot was the milkshakes which I had a Twinkie shake but it needed more caramel. I didn't spend too much time at the Mirage because I was at the Venetian across the street which has a pretty nice food court. My favorite was the Haagen das ice cream, the pizza and the lobster.

So if I came back to Vegas would I stay at the Mirage probably not but I did enjoy my stay and it was affordable. There wasn't anything really bad about the Mirage but it wasn't my cup of tea.

Room Cleanliness D-
Valet Parking C-
Resort Charge F
Bathroom Cleanliness D-
Location B-
Front Desk C

Overall this hotel was built in 1989, the updates that they have attempted to do are done in poor quality and taste. Unfortunately I rank this place a D+ overall.

I LOVE THIS PLACE! I don't know how any of you can say anything negative about the Mirage. Did we not stay at the same hotel?

I will start with their taxi stand. I think that they have a very organized system. Jason (I think thats his name) is AWESOME! My husband and I stayed there in April and he remembered us every single time. My husband and I also stayed at the Mirage in September AND HE STILL REMEMBERED US!! I was so blown away! AMAZING!

The check in line does look pretty long. Especially because check in is usually at 3pm unless you request\/pay for early check in. Don't be fooled though. The line moves pretty quickly. However the check in\/concierge staff is very efficient. 

The rooms are nice. I mean if you ARE paying for a standard room, don't expect a huge amount of space with a gorgeous view. You do get what you pay for. I would also like to note I love their elevator system. They have about six or so different areas to take you to your room. So like the first area is for floor 1-5 the second area is like 6-10 etc. There are also about six elevators in each area. I really love this system because you are never waiting for an elevator. The elevator is never full. & each elevator only goes up a certain amount of floors. We've all had those horrible experiences where we are at the 24th floor, but other people in your elevator are on floor 8, 12, 19, and 21. HOW ANNOYING. That problem NEVER happens at the Mirage!

The housekeeping staff is very friendly. You are always greeted while walking down the hall!

I also love the Mirage casino. I think that the casino here ISNT as smokey as some other casinos. I think the high ceilings near the waterfall help. Also, the casino is very easy to navigate around, unlike Caesars. Eeek. 

I think there are good dining options here, different varieties. However, no cheap food court like options, except for Starbucks. Although if you are staying on the strip, you should expect to pay a lot for food!!

LOVE love LOVE the Mirage!! Will definitely be back!

Everything in the hotel is beautiful and the staff are well versed in what is going on. However if you have any problems in your room it may be a different story. I had a problem with my AC as the room was set to 60 and would not go below 72 degrees. I called three separate times to see if it was possible to have it looked at, the first time the gentlemen came he was extremely polite and acknowledged the room had an intense mold smell as well as the air not blowing below 75. After he adjusted it, he told me to keep the fan on HIGH because if you kept it on auto the sensor would detect no one was in the room and default to 72. After walking around all day and going to see a show, we came back to our room and it was at 75, So I called again  to see if someone was available to fix it so we could get it to 67-68 so we could sleep a little better. I was told a gentlemen would be right up to fix the issue  and after returning two hours later the room was even hotter, so I called again and the manager told me someone had already came to fix it as long as a do not disturb sign was not on the door.  The was no sign on the door as the manager stated to make sure there was not one. A gentlemen named Won came back to the room after my third time calling and said he didn't enter because no one was in the room. So this time he came in used his temperature probe to check the room and it was at 73 not the 65 I had set it, just to ensure it would get to at least 68. He was extremely rude to my girlfriend as I was in the bathroom and I heard him trying to intimate my girlfriend and I came out, asking him to please just leave. Overall the issue was not addressed and the "5 star room" I booked could not get any cooler than 75. Due to his rudeness and attempt to intimate my girlfriend I told the manger and she was as polite and apologetic as possible, however she did not do anything to fix the issue. I am writing this review after one day even though I am staying for 4 because it bothers me greatly that my girlfriend was intimated by a staff of the mirage and the issue was not solved. The hotel is beautiful, the staff is great but the manger and the maintenance staff would rather intimate you than accommodate you. Best of luck to anyone else who stays here.  I stayed at a holiday inn recently and their rooms would easily get to a comfortable temperature well below 68. I am by no means the type of person to write negative reviews as you can see by my reviewed establishments. Just a heads up and take care all.

Nasty buffet 


They have a great selection of bullshit. No flavor,mushy just ughhh I had high hopes smh the only reason I'm not giving it one star is because of the variety of beverages
Unquestionably the worst hotel stay I've had. Rundown room, limited water pressure in the shower, broken lock mechanism on my door, and a buffet with overpriced, nearly inedible food. Stay far away.

A cut above the sleazy downtown hotels, but they close the pool at 7 pm. Never had that happen at a marriott. Room is mediocre. If the convention was not here I would not stay here and next time I will walk from another hotel.  Inside restaurants are mediocre that we have tried.  Staff generally is foreign and does not speak English that we can determine. 

Find another place to stay. There are many other better options.

I have stayed at the Mirage about a half a dozen times over that many years and I am always pleasantly surprised of the great deals that they offer along with the up keep of the hotel. In general the hotel takes good care of their patrons and out of the 6 times I have been upgraded 4 of those times without even asking. It is one of the oldest on strip, but it has kept up quite well with surrounding newer places. 

The lobby is real nice with the mini rain forest and the wall length aquarium. The rooms are well kept and were recently renovated (3yrs), the casino is one of the nicest and lower priced tables in that part of the strip and even better, it's right across the street from the cheapest casinos. I like the sports book here...nice and tucked off to the side allowing for me to sit and do what I do without outside interference.  

I like the Brazilian steakhouse (Samba), but it is a tad over-price when compared to other comparable places. 

I like the regular and European-style pool (Bare) even though I do not agree with the surcharge for Bare. 

Moreover, the Mirage has housed one of the hottest clubs in Vegas for a while in Jet and now 1 OAK...and nothing beats going out to a hot club and stumbling upstairs to your room instead of taking a taxi.

This hotel is not 4.5 star quality. We stayed here 4 nights and after coming back from an afternoon walking the strip, tired and ready to relax,  our room was not cleaned and towels were not replaced. We called house keeping, the front desk, and finally asked the housekeeper herself. The housekeeper had never been told despite our 4 requests through out the day. We even went to the front desk personally. The people at the front desk were rude and abrasive. We spent thousands of dollars only to get disrespected. The resturaunts inside the hotel are over priced and the service is lacking. A waitress at BLT caught an attitude with us because we didn't know which salad we wanted. I would recommend looking at some of the other hotels if customer service is important to you.

I always stay at the mirage when I go to Vegas. Our family friend is a VIP member at the hotel, so he always gets us fantastic rooms. What I love about the mirage is that it's seemingly the only dog-friendly hotel in Vegas. So many hotels on the strip have a nonexistent pet policy. However, that being said, I had to fill out an extensive amount of paperwork regarding my dog and put down a hefty deposit. The pet relief area, however, is amazing. While the mirage rooms are nice, the lobby is extremely dark, dirty, and smokey. While this is nothing new (I mean...c'mon it's Vegas), it's much more run-down and tobacco-filled than many of the other casino resorts. The carpet seems filthy and there's literally no room to breathe. I had to rush my poor pug outside so he didn't get sick. Secondhand smoke is a real problem that the mirage needs to acknowledge for the safety of their guests. They also recently changed the room service menu. While it is 24\/7, which I appreciate, the new menu is not nearly as good as the old. The food is supplied by the lobby restaurant. Rather than rolling food in on a cart with silver trays and ornamentation, they literally hand you a bag. Not very upscale. 1 oak is a blast. It's rather small, so definitely get a table if possible. The dance floor is super crowded and several men attempted to pickpocket me. I would recommend this hotel especially if you are visiting with your pet. I would highly recommend going the VIP route at the mirage, as well. The VIP lounge has a separate check-in\/check-out lounge with free drinks and snacks. The VIP concierge can also guarantee you tickets to sold-out shows which I never knew. I went to the regular concierge for Daniel tosh tickets. They told me they were sold out. I then went to VIP and they got me and my boyfriend fantastic seats. Lastly, they can put you on the list at any club in Vegas. Well-worth the heftier price.

My husband won $1000 dollars playing at the $1.00 Wheel Of Fortune slot machines.  He had spent about $30 bucks, when he hit Jack Pot!! 

Actually I did win $800 on the $1.00 Wheel of Fortune slot machines at the Bellagio too.

Too bad we had to try out luck again and lost most of it, but it was so much FUN!!

Had high hopes; alas dashed by small bathroom, parking fees (!), & poor customer service at the Rum bar, & Carnegie deli. Good room housekeeping, & service at the Still bar, & at check in. Sadly the good doesn't out weigh the disappointments & we won't be back to stay.

My hubby & I stayed here along with my sister and her husband.  This was our 3rd or 4th time staying at Mirage.  My sister had 2 nights free\/comped, but my room was booked through M Life called "run of the house." I did the online hotel check-in, but did not see the email from Mirage with a "code" that needed to be scanned. (I didn't have internet connection to get the email).  Fortunately, a man at the desk was able to get me my room cards and complete our check in.  We had a nice 2 queen bed room with a nice view of the strip, away from the elevator and ice machine. (as I requested)

    The beds are comfy and the rooms are spacious, but the bathroom was small.  The shower had excellent water pressure.  What I didn't like about our room?  1) we could not put any of our waters or beverages in the fridge, as the fridge was full of alcohol and beverages set on sensors.  (you remove it, you pay for it).   2) there was no in-room coffee maker.   The only coffee available for room service is from The Pantry downstairs and cost $15 for a BOX of coffee that holds about 6-8 cups of coffee!!!   I ordered coffee the morning of check-out, as I wanted coffee and we had about $12 left on our $50 credit we had, included in our room rate.   Out of the box, we only drank 2 cups of coffee before we had to leave.  I didn't want to get dressed to go down to Starbucks for a cheaper cup of coffee.  3) no free bottles of water.  Expect to pay $4.50 at the store downstairs for a bottle of water, or about $5.00 for a bottle of water in your room. (another option is to get a small bottle of water from a cocktail waitress while your gambling...if one comes by you).

    Another thing that changed since our last stay 4 years ago at Mirage was the restaurants downstairs.  At the deli restaurant, you now order BEFORE you sit down.  And BLT is now called LVB, but still has good burgers.  Their shakes options are different, but they look good.  

  At least 2 times, I waited for a waitress to come by while I was gambling so I could get a drink, but no one ever came by. Another time, I ordered a bottle of water, but the waitress didn't come back.  On Friday morning & afternoon, we kept seeing a very friendly cocktail waitress who was always coming around us & everyone in her area to see if we were OK and if we needed anything.  Of course we didn't need any beverages at that time.  Wish she was working in the other area when I was thirsty and waited for a drink and never got one.

   We spent more $$ than usual on gambling, so I stopped by the M Life desk to see if we had any rewards earned.  The man at the desk commented that we only had 200 something points, and would need 1,000 points to get $10.  He was a little condescending.  At least the front desk staff were very nice and helpful, along with the bellman, the man who helps with taxi service, the restaurant staff, that one pleasant cocktail waitress and the housekeeping staff on our floor.

     I may stay here again some day, or I may decide to try someplace new next time.

1st time staying here .  love this place.  room 110 - 22nd floor.  great bed.  great pillows.  awesome view.  nice bathroom with tub. - big bonus .  I bring my own coffee maker.  free wifi and super fast.  great pool deck.  lots of places to eat.  not too smokey in the casino.  really enjoying mh stay here .

I seem to get more MLife comps at the Mirage and at first I didn't like this place but it has grown on me and now I dig it.

Location is great you can walk to Caesars or Venitian\/Palazzo in minutes. 
Casino seems dark and smallish but I have won here three times.
Pool is nice and good drink service.
Buffet is decent, not the best but good for a trip.
Aces of Comedy...seen Tosh, Lewis Black, and Ron White....hilarious!
Beatles show is also pretty cool.
Stack steak house is amazing.

I had a serious problem with my stay at the mirage. While I was away from my room for a few hours housekeeping threw out my most prized personal possession that was given to me by my grandmother who has since passed, and I've had my entire life. After verifying with the manager of housekeeping and multiple other housekeepers, I learned the hotels policy is that housekeeping is not supposed to remove or even touch any of the things in the room until the guest is checked out. However the housekeeper who cleaned my room was obviously completely unaware of this policy as evidenced by his obliviousness to the gravity of the situation. From this point on it only got worse. The director of housekeeping was pretty rude over the phone and in speaking to the manager I was told that they in fact claimed that It had been thrown out by me which was not the case. They told me they were looking for it but I could tell by the tone it didn't seem of concern, or a priority that the item got return to me. I spoke to multiple representatives from the mirage who said they would get back to me but none of them ever followed up about it by calling me back. This was especially difficult and frustrating because I had spent an entire day of  my vacation dealing with this issue to only be left hanging several times. Security wasn't much help either they just had me fill out a form and said Risk Management would get in touch with me but they never did. I am devastated about this loss and so frustrated with the lackadaisical and insincere attitude of the staff at the mirage who handled this and as a result I will never get the item back.
POUNDING music in our room in the middle of the night.  2nd floor, right above the club?  Staff unconcerned.

I do not like being forced to go through a stinky casino to get from the reception area of a hotel to my room.  The rooms were also bland - and unspectacular, even a little shabby.  I would never stay there again.

I came here for my honeymoon and stayed two days. I was really excited to stay here, since I love the ambience and the restaurants and shows in the hotel. However, the room wasn't that nice, definitely not worth the price we paid. The front desk even said they upgraded me and my husband to a nicer room since we were on our honeymoon, and what we got was a boring, plain room with TWO queen beds. What are we going to do with two queen beds? I had specifically asked for a king in my reservation, and this is an upgrade?

We had a lot of leftovers from dinner, and even though there was a fridge in our room, we weren't allowed to put anything in (if you take any of the drinks or snacks out of the fridge, even if you don't use it and put them back, you get charged). They couldn't provide us with a fridge, nor could we rent a microwave, so we were stuck eating cold food that had been out all night. I've been to Travelodges that had fridges or microwaves, if not included than at least you could rent them. 

Worst of all, I checked out on my phone, which I thought would be more convenient. I was never emailed a copy of my receipt. I have called at least FIVE TIMES and emailed TWICE in the last month asking for my receipt so I can see why I was charged $90. No one responded to either of my emails, and I was on hold 20-40 minutes each time before hanging up. I will not be staying at The Mirage ever again, and I go to Vegas quite often. How difficult is it to get a copy of your receipt?!? It's been over a month!

My girlfriend and I were out to see Boyz II Men, and we stopped by The Sports Bar by the sports book... I had to jump on Yelp just to tell all of you, that not only is Mirage fabulous, but Curt a bartender of 24 years or so... Is incredible. He has the most wonderful personality and a total joy. MGM has made a wise decision keeping him all these years. Interacted well with his coworkers and made our night... Made me not mind how much I was paying for the drink, it's all about the experience.

I have stayed at the Mirage many times and have been very satisfied every time.  The best part of the Mirage is location on the strip.  It's right next too the Caesar Forum Shops and just across the street from the Venetian.   Though it doesn't feel the same since Sigfried and Roy ended their shows, it's still nice being able to see the white tigers on display.  

I've had good experience gambling here.  I'm a craps player and the dealers have always been very friendly which helps keep the game interesting.

Well what can I say.  Went to stay at the Mirage because of all the great things I had heard about it.  Sadly I am very disappointed.  When we arrived to check in rep told us that we coul upgrade for $20, I said wow just $20 she said yes!  But we needed to wait 2 hours for them to get the room ready..and they would text us once ready..When I walked away we noticed my hotel receipt showed I paid $268-- Well we waited 2 hours went back to the desk --spoke to manager by the name of Gage who said that the upgrade was $68 all together..We told him that the girl told us $20..he said OK I will change you back to the regular room and never apologized...So we waited 2 hours for a room that we never got..because he DOWNGRADED us!  I met up with my sister and her husband who had come the day before...they were not happy they had to switch rooms 3 times since there arrival..because of cleanliness and smoke filled rooms.  They also dealt with the same manager Gage!  Of course let me tell you about our room-- the carpet was dirty..and the lamp shade was busted up.  Awful-- we had to wear our shoes on the carpet..But it gets worse..My sister told me to come and look at there room because it was an "upgraded room"..I was shocked her room was worse than ours!! I finally called the front desk spoke to a great manager by the name of Shannelle. he was able to apologize and offered to refund all my fees --offered to move us..and also offered my sister and her husband the penthouse because of all the trouble associated with 3 moves.  He was the only professional manager that we dealt with.  There were other problems that I could go on about--My best friend was humiliated at the Mirage Buffet..We had already eaten there every day since our arrival, until the very last day when the cashier told us my friend could not use her military ID for the discount, we explained that we had used it previously each day, she said that my friend could not use it because she was a spouse and not an actual military member--The funny thing is my friend also served in the military which is how she met her husband.  The manager came over and belittled us and said I will let you use it this time but that's it.  And how awful it is to say you cant use your military spouse Id card was the last straw.  So as you can see there were so many inconsistencies it was crazy.  So No more Mirage ever!!! going back to the LUXOR where we got amazing service..cant believe they are under same hotel group!!

I love the Mirage and would definitely stay here again during my next visit to Las Vegas. The hotel was nice although the casino smelled a little smoky and seemed a little outdated. But the rooms were clean and fairly modern; and everything else about the hotel was lovely so I certainly would recommend it to others. What really sold me on the hotel was the customer service. Everyone throughout the entire hotel was consistently friendly, accommodating, and eagerly helpful. I encountered terrible service almost everywhere else I went in Las Vegas...it was beyond frustrating. But every time I walked into the hotel or exited to head out into the city, I could count on a warm smile and pleasant disposition greeting me along the way. My stay here truly was the highlight of my trip.

Great hotel experience all around.  Fantastic restaurants, awesome spa.  the pool is one of the best in Vegas, especially if you rent a cabana.  LOVE the beautiful fresh flower arrangements in the lobby -- works of art!

December of 2015 was my first time staying at The Mirage and it was Great! I was a little apprehensive because of a few slightly negative reviews but I, and my friends, we're glad we stayed here. I have stayed at other MGM properties in the past. This one is the best so far.
 The Mirage may be a little older but is very clean, updated and very affordable for all that is available. The staff is above average!

I would highly advise this property to anyone who is not after the most current or "trendy" hotel\/casino on the strip.

Always a good time at the Mirage.  Still the best pool we know of in Las Vegas, surrounded by foliage, able to find shade if we wanted to.  Hotel is nicely updated, with a few new restaurants since our last visit in 2004.  We would go back again in a heartbeat.

We have stayed at this hotel about 5 times. The last before our trip this past weekend was 4 years ago.  wow - its changed.  You dont feel like a hotel guest here you feel like a burden on them - they make it feel like they are doing you a favor by doing their jobs.  We liked to go to Bare pool which was one reason we chose this hotel.  We called a month in advance to reserve chairs at Bare for Friday and Saturday - Friday we showed later (3pm because we just got in) and they had given our "reserved" seats away.  He promised we would have them on Saturday.  We arrived at noon and he said he had to give our "reserved" seats away again but he did save a day bed for $1000 for the day!  It totally ruined our saturday and they really didn't care.  Most of the bartenders will barely make eye contact with you.  Most of the staff has no idea what is going on - its like they are all new employees - they must have a high turn over rate.  Our room was not cleaned by 7pm after returning from the day.  The house keeper in the hallway told us they dont make beds anymore.  We had to call the manager and they said yes they do clean rooms and make beds, but now we had to wait until 9pm for them to come back up.  We ordered rooom service - waited an hour - called down and they did not have record of the order.  Re-ordered had to wait another hour + and call down 4 times to check on it.  Overall - its like you are lucky if any one helps you and you are more of a hassle they have to deal with, then a guest paying their checks.  The pool staff at the regular pool were nice.

This was our first visit to this hotel but our 6th visit to Las Vegas.

We chose this hotel based on price (great deal on retailmenot.com) and what the pool looked like since we knew MOST of our time during the day would be in the water.

The Staff:
Our check in was very easy and since we were there celebrating our anniversary, they allows us to check out at 3pm and waived the $30 late checkout fee. Unfortuantly for us, that was all they could do since we had already paid the hotel in full. 
The Bell hop was also very gracious and helpful with keeping our bags safe and hailing a taxi out front for us.

The Room:
We "upgraded" for only $25\/day to a Resort Tower King room which promised a strip view and a few extras we were sure to use. The 'strip view' wasn't straight out of our window and technically we had to crank our necks to the left so that wasn't worth it. What was nice is that these rooms included private elevators to the 24th and 25th floors, spacious bathrooms, dual sink vanity, soaking tub and separate walk-in shower in the bathroom. Those upgrades were worth the splurge.

***We lost power in our bathroom and hour before checkout and maintenance NEVER showed, despite TWO phones calls. Very dissapointing and unacceptable .***

The room's & pool's Wi-fi was nice to use each day and since you're FORCED to pay $25\/day for it, might as well take advantage when you can.

The Food & Drinks:
Vegas has gotten down right RUDE with their pricing. Expect to pay TWICE as much as you would back home (Seattle for us) but at least most of what we ate was really great. We had the best meals at California Pizza Kitchen and great wings at BLT but also had a handful of dissapointing meals. This included breakfast at the Deli and a horrible chicken caesar salad at the poolside restaurant. The next day the hubby and I shared a FANTASTIC club at the same place (super big and satifying) so go figure.

Expect to pay $5 for a coke and $15-24 for a drink with a couple shots of the good stuff while laying poolside. Crazy to think about spending that kind of money but when it's 100 degrees outside, you'll do just about anything to cool down.

The Pool: Waterfalls, palm trees, friendly serve staff and overall a very relaxing experience. We were VERY surprised\/dissapointed to see the same amount of trash (bottles, cigg butts, bottle caps, food wrappers EVERY morning we were there. There is no excuse for this and they really should clean up each night after closing. Makes the place looks trashy.

The Show:
We saw the Beatles LOVE show and it was honestly the best Cirque du Soleil show I've ever seen, hands down. The staff were very friendly helping us find our seats and chatted with us about our event before we were sat. It's a MUST see!!!

Never again will I stay here.  The room wasn't ready at check in,  I waited until almost 3pm and went back in line she said the housekeeper still needed more time. I told her we were on time and what they can do she gave us a ready room. Yet when we were going to our room we seen a housekeeper chillin' by her cart on her phone texting smh...REALLY small TINY bathroom,  felt like I was in a cheap apartment restroom. Light kept shutting off had to have engineering reset and the toilet wouldn't flush the 1st time had to wait a few min to flush. Online it says heated pool that is a LIE it's cold,  waterfall was off as well all 3x I went to the pool.  Also the Internet wasn't working had to call a few times actually and still crappy internet. Paid for a view it was not worth it to be honest. If you are going to Vegas do not stay here it will disappoint you. Not to mention the price I paid smh

Not so great.  The deluxe room is 2 queen beds with a big tv and plain bath\/shower.  The tub had several chips in the porcelain (how does that happen?).  The pillows and bedding are pretty good but I still felt like I needed to check for bed bugs.
I ate at the buffet here. It wasn't very good but the hotel seemed nice and clean.
The beds are way too soft. Good  service and pleasant staff though.

This is our 4th year in a row coming to Vegas for EDC week in June. I've stayed at a few different hotels ranging from a suite at the formerly known PH Towers, South Point Hotel, Suite at Treasure Island, Stratosphere and now Mirage. I'd have to say that without a doubt the best overall experience I've had was at the Mirage. I do think their rooms are a tiny bit over priced for the week we were there however. The hotel itself has nice amenities and we loved the pool (The do need more servers at the pools however). We tried most of the restaurants inside and the only one we did not like was the Carnegie Deli. The Carnegie Deli is a huge blemish on this hotel. They are very disorganized, slow and the foot options just don't all really make a lot of sense. We tried it last year and gave it another go this year and had almost identical bad experiences. As for the rest of the hotel the rest of the staff was always friendly and we had no problems. 

The beds in this hotel are down right amazing! I think we are going to order one of their pillow and comforter sets they sell in the hotel shop. 

Our biggest complaint would be the night club. Each night we returned to our hotel there were always some very unsavory individuals lurking about that had just left the club. One night a man was making very inappropriate gestures at my girlfriend making her very uncomfortable. Other nights there were just people being really loud and obnoxious coming from there, making her and I both a bit uneasy. We would love to see a dance music based night club in there. 

Great job Mirage, I think we will be back!

Now that my oldest boyfriend Steve Wynn no longer has control of The Mirage and my gay boyfriends Siegfried and Roy either retired or were half-eaten by tigers, I'm not the huge fan of The Mirage that I once was when I was younger. 

Just like with the Bellagio, you can tell Mr. Wynn has left the building. 

There is something that has been cheapened by the Kerkorian takeover of the former Wynn properties and the elegance and uniqueness of The Mirage is mostly now gone though some hints of former glory still exist. 

Not much has been updated in the past fifteen years and what has been updated or added stands out against the traditional tropical decor of the property like a sore thumb (such as the entrance to "Love" by The Beatles and the Revolution bar). And it has not been kept up like it would were it still a Wynn controlled property. The location is prime and parking is good but there is nothing about The Mirage that makes me want to stay and gamble, drink, or eat. They offer a nude pool, which is great, but the tasteless posters of a woman's backside right in my face - funny how in 2013 they don't advertise any shirtless men to lure the ladies - that litter the casino floor do not make me want to go and are more reminiscent of one of the cheaper, rowdier casinos.

Meh comes to mind...  Look, I spent a week at this hotel.  The carpet is dated.  It smelled musty in the room.  And I can hear every noise from both sides of me and the hallway.  Add to it that the pool area isn't very pleasant, the food is underwhelming, and the casino is mediocre at best....  I've tried six different hotels on the strip.  I rate this one middle low.

We were very pleased with our stay at the Mirage in Las Vegas.  We booked our trip through Travelocity and got a pretty good rate, complete with a $50 food\/beverage credit.  We had an early flight, so we arrived in Vegas around 10am.  Check in is 3pm. Oh no.  Well, turns out The Mirage rocks.  I went to the front desk to ask if they may hold our bags until check in, that way we wouldn't have to lug our luggage around.  She did better than that, she said our room was already ready to go.  Sweet! The woman that helped us was so nice! Great first impression. I will note that you will have a $200 deposit.. no matter what.  We found it strange since our room was already fully paid for months in advance, but oh well.  Resort fees are about $30, which is standard at any hotel on the strip. Our room was gorgeous, we had a strip view and we were on the 22nd floor.  The view was so nice, especially at night.  The decor was very modern, and the room was comfortable.  No complaints.  The walls were a bit thin as we could hear people conversing outside, but it wasn't to the level of bothersome. The bathroom came complete with shampoo, conditioner, face wash, body wash.. yay! Oh, and skip the mini-bar! Unless you want to pay $6 for a water bottle.

The reason I'm giving a 4 star instead of 5 is because of the hotel itself.  I noticed that the casino in the Mirage was quite smokier than some of the other casinos we visited, but I guess that's just something you have to accept in Vegas.  The pool at the Mirage is also FREEZING! I should have had my husband film me as I got in, because that was the ALS Ice Bucket Challenge right there! This was in August, so it was a scorcher out.  Yet nobody was in the pool, except a few kids of course.  Kids don't seem to feel cold. Weirdos.  Also, I'm not a fan of the dining options in the hotel.  I noticed that other hotels such as the Venetian, Caesar's, Flamingo, etc.. all had food courts.  The Mirage has no such thing. This makes for pricier meals or having to walk off property to grab a bite.

Overall, the central location of The Mirage is fantastic.  I would definitely consider staying here again.  Now if you guys could turn the temperature up on the pool, I'd be forever grateful!

I decided to give Mirage another chance, and it didn't disappoint this time.  I opted this time for one of the Resort Tower King rooms (as opposed to the standard rooms).  The room was well appointed, the bathroom is much larger, and in general, the room was very quiet (note the upgraded rooms have separate elevators and the floor is generally quieter).   The location is perfect-- right next to the Forum Shops and across the street from the Venetian.  The only minus for Mirage is its buffet and its overall lack of dining options.  The food at the buffet in particular was truly subpar and tasted as though it was microwaved.

Great price. Rooms are renovated and comfortable.  Got an  to a "private floor" however never had to use the key to access it, as they said, so doesn't seem very private.  Couldn't get the wireless internet to work, they offered to send someone up, but being here on business didn't really have time for that.  Check in was slow.  A tad loud in the halls in the mornings.  Good central location.  Weird sort of faux furry pillow thing on my bed.  It's orange and looks like a creepy giant macaroni with cheese.  Whoever designed that needs help.

I've stayed at so many Strip resorts I am always excited to stay somewhere I haven't stayed before. The rooms are tastefully remolded and the pool is amazing though it closes at 6 pm and the food made me sick (like food poisoning sick stuck in the room sick). The window in our room was screwed shut so we couldn't have any fresh air. I could see other windows cracked, it was just ours. The shower was half broken and a light didn't work. I manage an apt complex and felt like I should leave post its for everything that was broken. We tried to get maid service on Saturday and the 6 hours were at the pool weren't long enough for them to get in. Mandalay's rooms are nicer, they all have a nice bathroom and I have never gotten food poisoning anywhere else. I go to Scottsdale often as well and they don't poison people at the pool, don't blame it on the heat. LOVE was the highlight hands down. Also-hallway noise: substantial. The AC is the old ghetto kind that can't block out noises. I had to run a rain noises app on my phone all night so the screaming and banging in the hallway didn't keep waking me up

The Mirage was everything I thought it would be. Old School Vegas feel but up-to-date. Right on The Strip with Foo Dogs, Turtle Dragons, Dolphins placed all around the resort. Check-in went smoothly. Don't forget to pass by the Mermaids too and rub them for good luck! Asked for complementary upgrade and got it with a view of the Volcano and The Strip. (You gotta take care of the front desk and they'll take care of you!) If you got time, get to the poolside early because its fills up quick or you can spend a few more tokens and lay in secluded shaded area. The pool got that Playboy mansion grotto feel to it. Go have a screwdriver at the Sports Bar or get your buffet comp'd. Cravings Buffet isn't the grandest of buffets but for a fat boy like me it does its job and there's a White Castle across the street if you wanna step out of the resort. The room we stayed at was clean when we got there and housekeeping kept it clean when we were away. Just remember you pay to play over here. All in all, I highly recommend staying at The Mirage. It set the standard when it first opened and the high standard is still present now. The only thing we didn't get to check out as guest of The Mirage was 1OAK smh ...wish we did looking back at it. Cheers.

Points for being clean with a very warm and welcoming staff. 

The perfumed air made to smell like suntan lotion made me a little sick but I noticed that the Cosmopolitan also smelled perfumed so maybe that's a thing now.  I am sensitive to chemical fragrances so it wasn't for me plus I don't appreciate my clothing smelling like the Mirage. My room smelled a little of cigarettes even though it was non-smoking.

Other than that, it's decent. Like a mid range Hilton decent. 

The furniture in the room had some scratches and nicks and there was a wet spot on my carpet when I checked in. I stepped in it with my bare feet. Yeah gross. I called the front desk and they checked with housekeeping and told me that the carpet had just been spot shampooed. Hmmmm okay. They offered to move me but there were no other rooms available with a strip view.

No one offered to help me with my bags to the room. 

My view was cool and a free upgrade. 

The bed was cozy but was uneven from side to side as if one side had been slept on more than the other.

The hair dryer was a Babybliss and was awesome!!! 

The decor was fine with me though I wasn't a fan of the carpet.

The bathroom is tiny as was the basic tub. Just a bathroom.

The trash cans didn't have plastic liners in them which I think is GROSS. I hope they wash them out after each guest ! (Hello women and sanitary items!) 

Biggest complaint  with this room is that there is a door that connects to the next room but is locked. The problem? You can hear every word the people in the next room speak. Every. Word. Luckily the ladies next door to me where quiet ... And I was out all night. Otherwise the lack of soundproofing would have ruined my trip.

I had forgot my earplugs at home and had to pay $7.00 for earplugs from the store at the mirage called essentials.

They only carry foam earplugs but not the good silicone kind. With rooms like that they might want to consider the silicone!

I would give 3.5 stars if I could. 

Not bad. Not great.

Good for the money I suppose...

I have seen the rooms at the cosmopolitan and at the Wynn and didn't find those impressive either.
So maybe I'm just not impressed by ugly carpets and Formica furniture ...

Stayed here recently and was pleasantly surprised at the modern touch the rooms had... There must have been a renovation of sorts in the last few years. The room we stayed in was a good size. 2 queen beds,  a desk, mini fridge, lcd tv (no espn news though), bathroom was decent...  The only problem was that our room was the one closest to the ice machine so we could hear the noise from the ice buckets being filled every time someone went for a refill. Wasn't too happy with that... I mean, it wasn't terribly loud. But it was loud enough to be annoying after a while.

Another negative was the amount of time it took for the valet to retrieve our car. Not a pleasant experience waiting for your car for about 30 mins in Vegas heat when you just showered and cant wait to jump in the rental, blast the AC and go grab a bite off the strip. The valets did apologize for the delay but I had to mention the wait.

Pool area looked happening. There's a waterfall so that looked like the place to be on a blazing hot day. Will have to check it out more closely on the next trip... We were headed across the street to the Venetian pool. Next time...

I will NEVER stay here again!  I've stayed all over the strip in various price ranges from the Cosmo and Vdara to New York NY and Treasure Island.  The Mirage rooms have thin walls so you can hear a pin drop in the room next to you.  I was in Vegas this trip for a convention and rented 2 rooms for 2 night.  My co-workers room was clean and quiet after 10 pm on the 1st night (not on the 2nd night).  I wasn't as lucky.  The room next to me partied off and on until 4am.  At one point I did call the front desk and they sent security up promptly to address the noise.  The next day the front desk was very accommodating in switching me to another room at 4pm the following day.  Unfortunately this room was rough.  Carpet was dirty, floor was sticky, smelled musty and smoky and there was hair in the tub and toilet.  The 2nd night proved to be just as noisy.  At 1am I had a drunk gentlemen standing outside my door playing music on his phone for everyone to hear while he waited for a friend to let him into his room.  This went on for 15-20 minutes and there were multiple other groups yelling in the hallways until 4am.  I do believe the Mirage staff is doing the best they can with what they have but I wouldn't stay here again if it was free.

Our room had an awesome view of the strip and it was very clean when we walked in.  It was spacious, the bed was comfortable, and felt fancier than most hotels around the price we paid and more.  I would definitely stay here again. Some gripes that I had but aren't too important are the bathrooms need updating and that our room was all the way at the end of the hallway, so we had a long walk to our room.

Normally, I'm a fan of The Palazzo.  Love it there  .... but, when going with kids, staying at the Mirage was simply a better choice.  It just *seems* more kid friendly.  

We spent the week in the 2-bedroom version of the Tower Suite and it was, well, SWEET!  Floor to ceiling windows in all rooms, colors were dark woods with red (unlike the lime green on the hotel website), spot on strip view (and truthfully, the kids room had a better view than the master simply because of where the bed was placed), 52" flat screen in the living room, 42" flat screens in the bedrooms and 32" flat screens in the bathrooms and a crazy comfortable bed .......all wrapped into 1650 square feet of fabulousness.  

I will say this though .... the shower in the (insanely large) master bath had the worst water pressure evah.  If you have long, luxurious locks be prepared to spend some time rinsing out your shampoo and conditioner.   

Location is awesome and walkable to all the places we wanted to go.  The pool looked cool but was closed (and drained) for the winter.  I'd love to check it out when the weather gets warmer!

This was my 8th time in Vegas and the 6th resort I've stayed in and I feel this was possibly the best value I got for my money. The hotel might not be the newest, but it doesn't feel old at all even compared to some of the newset additions like Aria. Pool was definitely the best I've been too, food selection is good and the Cravings buffet is definitely a bargain. Staff was helpful and always nice and the personnel at the Mlife desk was definitely better than in many other MGM casinos. Our room was a resort king and was clean and spacious enough, climate in the room was so good we barely used the A\/C at all. It might miss the gazillion of trendy shops of many other resorts, but honestly who needs them when you can find them basically everywhere on the Strip? Loved the Essentials shop right in the middle of the escalators aera, it has been useful at times.

Self-parking area is perfectly located and doesn't require hours to get back and forth from your car if you have any

If I should say something about defects, I miss the frequent volcano shows (2\/3 a day? Definitely not enough). But I can understand the cost might not be justified and that's not really a defect is it?

Only real defect is that rooms are not really sound proof and at times we got a lot of noise coming from the corridors.

But overall I've been so happy with my stay that we booked again for another 3 days when we went through Vegas again a week later!

I chose Mirage based on a number of reasons for a three night to trip to celebrate my son's 21st birthday. The fact that it was a couple of guys spending little time in the room had a lot to do with it. We were good with average, but we did want resort level with all the options expected in a Vegas resort. Nail-on-the-head best describes the choice.

We arrived on Saturday at about noon and checked in quickly from a line with only one young lady ahead of us. No surprises- the room provided was precisely what we had reserved. I'd been to The Mirage a couple of times before and it had been several years since my last visit. I depended heavily on recent reviews to set expectations about how she had aged. She's taken quite good care of herself. I've based at the full spectrum of Vegas properties and covered the top (Four Seasons) to bottom (Imperial Palace), so I have a balanced perspective. The Mirage is an outstanding value and offers an experience that cannot be easily criticized when kept in perspective. So The Mirage can be forgiven for a lot of things if one is careful about fitting it into one's standards. We had a strip\/volcano view and frankly watching the volcano from street level is the only way to do so. I loved the open window option but it was obvious that their windows have not been cleaned in years- possibly never. Sadly, the crud is so thick it is probably impenetrable anyway.

I appreciated the room redesign since my last visit and remain slightly disappointed in the bathroom size in the level of room that we selected. But really, two guys don't need a luxurious and oversized bathroom, so it was fine.

We both felt comfortable with all the public areas including the most important part for a Vegas property- the casino. Everything was clean and tidy. For a first timer, by the end of the trip my son preferred The Mirage Casino to the others that we visited. I've always been comfortable playing there, though I do have other preferences. With the exception of places like Wynn, Bellagio and Aria the smoke factor doesn't differ much from one to another so I won't knock The Mirage and they will probably never go smoke-free. With one exception, the dealers were friendly, personable, helpful and tolerant. They were not generous- consistent with all Vegas casinos. 

We only ate at the buffet twice and weren't impressed, except for the fact that our Sunday breakfast included a whole lot more than our Monday experience. We didn't visit any other restaurants during our stay. I did start my morning walks with a stop at The Roasted Bean a few steps off the elevator. I didn't get his name, but there was a young man at The Bean that was especially helpful and friendly. I mention this because that style of greeting and care are sadly becoming the exception. 

Even though most of the reviews clearly describe the resort fee, it surprises me that some are still shocked and annoyed at it so be prepared. You really get nothing for it. The wifi is the only tangible thing that you can make any use of and we didn't because my iPhone hot-spot provided a better connection. So to me it was worthless.

We saw one show. Daniel Tosh is one of the features of The Aces of Comedy series. He's caustic and nothing is exempt. I never stopped laughing. The Terry Fator Theater is a great place to watch the show. I've seen The Beatles' Love during a past visit and would recommend it as one of the (my) top five Cirque shows.

Again, The Mirage has its place in the full spectrum of properties in Vegas and unless the purpose of your visit or your preference of luxury dictate otherwise, there would be very little reason to avoid a stay at The Mirage.

So they charge you a $15 a night resort fee. They very kindly tell you when you check in, but I mean, by that point, what are you going to do, argue?

We had a really nice room though, it was a corner room, so windows on two walls of the room, so we had an amazing view of the strip. If I were rating solely on the view, it would get 6 stars. Excellent view. 

My friend and I wanted to get a nutella shake, and BLT burger was closed. So no shake.

Thought we'd try to see the volcano (you know my many attempts to see it, and how it never seems to be working), and surprise surprise, it wasn't working. Again. 

The light switch in the bathroom stopped working at one point. How am I supposed to do anything in a dark bathroom? 

The trip from the check-in to the elevator was much too far. 

I wouldn't stay here again.

Staying at the Mirage was quite a trippy experience... I remember staying here with my family when I was about 8 years old.  Now, 15 years later, I'm paying to stay here myself.  And I'm glad I chose to come back, because I can finally appreciate the Mirage for everything it is.

I stayed in a 2BR Penthouse Suite.  I originally booked a Tower Suite but they hooked up a free upgrade to the top floor... +2 stars right there.

My bathroom was humoungous.  Seriously though, just the main part of the bathroom had enough floorspace to fit a kingsize bed.  Dual sinks, huge tub, and big shower.  Bathroom hallway with a separate toilet\/bidet room, large walk-in closet, and empty dressers.The toiletries were very nice, and the amenities were excellent.  My girlfriend said that the blowdryer in the bathroom is worth almost $200... not that it mattered to me.  But pretty cool nevertheless.

The beds were super comfortable.. I slept better than at home... and the bedding was clean and soft.  The furnishings in the living room were also very nice, and room service kept our room clean and stocked with fresh towels.  I loved the couches... they were super-comfy.  The TV's are all old CRT's (no Plasmas or LCDs everywhere) but that's fine, we don't need to watch TV in Vegas anyway.  The stereo system (with a real receiver) was great for bumping the party music, and being on the penthouse floor, we were able to stay up late and be loud without anybody complaining.  They also did not charge me for a roll-in cot I asked for (had a couple friends staying in the living room).  +1 star for general satisfaction with the suite.

Check-in and Check-out were quick and efficient.  The bell service was very quick with our bags too.  Valet found my car within 15 minutes even though I had lost my valet ticket sometime during the drunken stupor of 72 hours in Vegas.  +1 star for good in\/out service.

Two days before arriving, we decided to buy some tickets for the Beatles Love show.  However, the only tickets remaining on the website were for very crappy seats and very overpriced.  I called the concierge service at the hotel and informed them of my dilemma.  Once they verified my hotel reservations, the concierge was able to get me excellent reserved seats for a ridiculously good price (they were about $30 less per ticket and 6 rows closer than I could find online). They were also able to help me check availibitly at a couple of MGM Grand restaurants, though I didn't end up making any reservations.  +1 star for the helpful concierge desk.

All in all, I was very pleased with my experience at the Mirage.  Even though it's one of the older casinos on the strip, everything is still quite nice, without the pretentiousness of other places.  There's a good reason why the high-roller room at the Mirage is always waaay more packed than any other 4-5 star hotel on the strip.  I definitely felt like I had a 5 star experience.

Had a conference this week and stayed here. Not a huge fan of vegas because of the smoke and over the top gambling everywhere.  However as for my room it was awesome.  I was able to upgrade my room to a penthouse 1 bedroom suite for just a bit more then I was paying.  The room was awesome.

Several tv's and a great view of the city. The bed was super comfy and the bathroom was huge.  My wife and I had a great time.

Just spent 2 nights at the Mirage. Overall it was a great stay. I thought the room was nice and clean. The bathroom was nice, but small and it looks like they've redone the sink area, but completely left out the bathtub. The bathtub may be the original, it really needed some help! My other complaint would be that the walls are extremely thin. It wasn't an issue most of the time, but anytime people were walking in the hallway it sounded like they stopped, came in our room and continued their conversation. We had a strip view on the 22nd floor and it was great. We had a great view of the volcano and Venetian. The volcano is not to be missed! We never used the pool area, but we did walk out and see it. It's beautiful and if the weathers right I would highly recommend making time to spend out there. I love that they have many restaurants open late. I stayed at the Luxor and Caesar palace prior and if you're hungry after 11pm you're out of luck. We had a package that included tickets to Love. It was great! We had nose bleed seats, but honestly I think it was better to sit at the top and be able to see everything that was going on. Great stay, would definitely stay here again.

Great pricing on rooms (I guess this depends on the time of year). Central location (all the good stuff is North of Caesars ;) ). Down pillows are AMAZING.

Mirage, while not the fanciest hotel on the strip, gets the job done. After all, you're just here to sleep, right? And in some cases, not even...so why pay a premium for a place to put your luggage?

If you book at the right time, you can even get food credit to spend on any restaurant or room service...and since I didn't fancy any of the restaurants, the credit went a long way towards 4AM buffalo wings!

And what's with the resort fee?

My hun and I stayed here for a few days to celebrate the big thirtay and were both surprisingly impressed with how lovely our room was. Our overall experience here was pleasant without any glitches.

The rooms were recently renovated and stylishly done! It had a Jetson style feel\/look to it with a mod look about it. The best thing was we had a plasma tv AND Ipod docking station which allowed me to pop in my Nano and play my tunes! NICE touch Mirage!

The only complaint we have is how small the pool is. C'mon folks, ya gotta  work on the pool area! There was barely any space to wade in the pool to cool off in the freakin' truple digit heat! We had to walk around like morons for what seemed to be forever before we clawed (not really) to some free chaise lounges! It felt like an outdoor club with all the bodies one ontop of the other which didn't really allow much relaxation.

It has Jet nightclub in the hotel which saved us the trouble of leaving the hotel to endure the insane taxi line and heat which is another plus! 

We both agreed it's a reasonable price for what we got and would come back....after we check out other places...

Stayed here for my BFs bday  (we're locals) 
Check In took all of 10 min from line to key so that was amazing
Check Out took all of 2 minutes on the kiosk so that was even more amazing
You better get to the pool at like 8am if you want a spot it gets crooooowded. (It was MDW so that may have been why though)
Room was very clean and pretty

Overall very pleased will stay again

There's just something about The Mirage. It's a perfect old meets new. It's old enough to have a bit of the old Vegas feel (not Rat Pack old, but dated enough), but also new enough to not feel like it's going to be imploded in a matter of weeks. It's just dark enough, has just the right amount of a\/c, and doesn't smell funny. Plus, it has decent restaurants and bars, a fun free show, and an aquarium behind the check-in desk. The table limits are typical Strip-level for the most part, but not so high that I can't dabble in some roulette and waste a few hours. And to top it all off, it's a great location on the Strip to take off on-foot from.

Great service and food at the Pantry in the Mirage. Quick, with so much to chose from! Especially the service, Janel Ramirez was so sweet, helpful and always makes you smile! Loved it! I recommend big time!!

Check in was fast, but I arrived early on a mid week day.  I had to wait 4 hours to get a room, but the best thing was i had the key an was only waiting for a text of which room.

The room was dated, several harsh stains on the carpet.  The tub plug was broken and first time to use thought it was just me, then next time still couldn't get it to work had to call after I was out of shower.  So lost a few days of being able to take a hot bath(a must on vacation).
The sensor bar and fridge was over the top.  I was so afraid to be in the area of the bar that I might "touch" something and be charged.  The TV was good, nice selection of channels.
The resort book was missing most pages.  Only 2 pillows and 2 towels, but left note\/tip and got more the next day.  They did a good job cleaning the room as well.  The resort Wifi, which the over charge in the resort fee, was not good most of the time.  Was a non smoking room, which was VERY smokey smell.  My view was of the ugly roof and mess as well

The pool is pretty, but nothing deeper than 3 1\/2 feet, wish a least part of the pool was deeper, or even an area kid free would be nice.  Plus needs to be a non smoking area for those who actually want fresh air someplace.  

Their food is good, the cafe had a great breakfast and the coffee shop \/ bakery is nice and people friendly.  LV burger was very good as well.  Gift shops nice people but overpriced drinks, but there is a CVS and Walgreens nearby.  

Not a big fan of the table games, too many high rollers tables.  But enjoy the poker room here.

One of the good things, is the location of this hotel, central and easy walking distance.  Would of tried the spa, been years since I have been here, but my favorite person no longer works here.

We were really happy with our most recent experience at the mirage. We booked this as part of a southwest vacation package and the price was great. The hotel was very clean, the staff friendly and accommodating and the hotel has a very convenient location right on the strip.
The pool has ample lounge chairs, we never had a problem finding a seat. The fire show offered every night at 8 and 9 is also fun to check out.
The food at the buffet was pretty meh but we had 2 passes for a free meal so of course we are going to take advantage. They did have some nice charcuterie and an omelette station but most other areas were just ok. Food at the pool was also decent.
The property, like most others on the strip, was massive with lots of dinning (and drinking) options,  shops and more. I would stay here again.

I was disappointed with our latest stay at The Mirage. Last summer my husband and I had such a wonderful visit, we brought our kids and encouraged another family to stay at The Mirage. My disappointment was in the room. It was smaller than any other hotel room we have stayed in on the strip. The bathroom was very dated. There was a long black hair in the shower. The toilet seat was broken. When I went to use the hair dryer, it was broken too. It took nearly 50 minutes to get a replacement. Our friends' room had a used razor in their shower!
I would give The Mirage a one-star rating based on the room, but a few exceptional people helped make our stay better. Dennis in the fitness room was a delightful man. He gave me tips and was very accommodating. We also enjoyed the pool. It is a perfect pool for families. We enjoyed The Secret Garden as well. Siegfried did magic tricks for our kids. He was very charming and was so nice to our entire family.  
In general, The Mirage has a nice ambiance and is in a good location. It was a good choice for families; however due to the uncleanliness of the rooms I would be hesitant to stay here again which is unfortunate because it used to be our favorite hotel.

I love the mirage. 

We were totally hooked up by the check-in folks. Gorgeous view, nice room, and complimentary champagne. The rooms are clean, good restaurants, nice clean pool area,  and slots that I like. Overall, great experience we will be back for sure.

I had the pleasure of staying here for an evening recently and I have to admit the accomodations were very nice. The room was clean and sleek. and the staff was very friendly. The pool area was great and carried almost a Miami-esk vibe. The only downside I really have to comment on was the fact that you have to pay for internet access and the elevators to our room were at the back of the casino.

We called to see if the hotel would give us an offer we had not used that expired. They put me thru to a host and it all came about within 2 days of our request. Upon arriving we had a few unexpected issues that were suppose to be complimentary and had to make some calls and get it fixed. The players club gals worked so well with fixing things that I would like to say their efforts paid off. Nancy and co worker made a few calls and we got what was promised to us. As a result it was worth the drive from CA to Vegas 4 plus hours to stay and play and dine. We absolutley enjoyed it all from our room to the restaurants and entertainment. We will go back soon.

Oh my god.. I am going through the worst experience so far in Vegas.  Booked at Mirage for our Christmas break thinking that they are known for their hospitality, decor and central location. But what a GRAND disappointment this has been so far!

We checked in an hour ago. 

A few problems were apparent right when we checked in.

1. Safe did not work
2. TV did not work
3. Bathroom door could not be locked
4. There was a line of ants in the room (WTF)

We went to the front desk to report this and requested a change of room, talked to a rather belligerent (and frankly imbecile) employee named Anthony, who refused to change the room for us. He kept insisting that he would rather have someone "analyze" the problem before taking an action. He also mentioned that they would not put this room out of service. He said someone will come to our room to "analyze" the situation in 10 minutes.  What a bad bad way to even converse with a guest (This is despite of the fact that we kept our cool and never argued or raised our voices).

We are waiting for past 40 minutes since, yet no luck... My wife just called the front desk and (sure enough) they had no idea about such a service call being placed. So, the ETA now is 20 more minutes. It is 11 PM, my kid is really sleepy and we are sitting in complete disgust, waiting for someone to show up and "analyze" the situation,

I hate to begin our long coveted vacation like this :-( 

We are checking out tomorrow and am going to spend the rest of our vacation in a different hotel.

I would NEVER ever stay at Mirage again. 0-stars for them. I wish this never happens to any other fellow traveller.

I was very fortunate to get an incredible deal on my room, so was able to enjoy it for a few more days. I was very pleasantly surprised at the quality of the bed, the room itself, the bathroom, and the amenities. If this is the "regular folks" room, I can only imagine the others.  
I must say was very disappointed to find the snacks etc which are placed in the room, are not free.  Six dollars for a bottle of water..... yep..... wonder if that is how they make up the difference in the price for the room. Why bother putting them in there- I buy my own and for much less expense. Note, if you lift an item, it automatically gets placed on your bill. SO watch those kiddos, and if they pick something up- call the desk immediately so they can verify. Do the same if there are any items missing from the selection. 
Nightclub is a problem. The crowd extends well into the lobby path making it difficult to maneuver through. Also some pretty freaky looking folks hanging out there. I was traveling alone, so waited for crowd to get to elevator before getting on. It's Vegas- I trust no one...LOL.... 
I received one free meal with my stay. Big disappointment. The salad chef messed my salad up and insisted I take the one he made- he made it with blue cheese and I cant stand that stuff- and I was clear about that from the start, another chef stepped in and corrected my order. I also  ordered the prime rib, it was cold enough for grease to set in on the bottom of it, and little lumps of fat in the broth. What the heck happened here? Anyway, free or not, I will be off the strip at some nice steak house next visit.  Their buffet is right expensive, definitely not a good bang for the buck.

Great hotel. AWESOME BEDS. My one problem, the stocked mini fridge. I like many others drink all my alcohol on the strip cause it's CHEAPER. I'd like them to remove the mini bar fillings and just leave a fridge so there's place to put left over food so it does not go to waste. Self check in was sorta frustrating, check in at the desk, so much less confusing. Anyways, great hotel, especially if you want to save on great shows at The Mirage.

Stayed here in the hospitality suite. We had 28 people total who came with us and booked their own rooms. Although the room was nice, I won't be back. Harrahs just has way better customer service and comps for their players. One dealer I played with (Lori) was so insulting that she just crossed me over to never ever coming back again.

At first, waking up behind the orange and red volcano seems like a great idea, until somewhere around Day 3, and the reality sets in that thing never stops going lol! Not a bad price for a hotel, we caught "Love" the Cirque show nearby as well as a few others, but it can be, like most Vegas joints a little tired in places. Staff was friendly, but the food sometimes leaves a little to be desired, especially in the nicer eating interior places you'd expect top notch from. Not bad for a budgeted trip for Vegas!

We stayed at the Mirage for 2 days and our experience was OK. It's located right in the center of the strip and makes getting to places were easy and close. The casino staff and the reception desk were excellent - greeting and taking care of their guest was very welcoming. However, the reek of marijuana on the 11th floor was something when we exited the elevator. 
The room was not so big and the towels smelled a little. Prices for the snacks and beverages were very expensive. Bed sheets were clean though. The valet although were nice, had a problem locating out vehicle after the checkout. Other than that, we had a good time.

At first I was pretty excited to stay here after looking at the amazing pics of their property and after having a great experience with one of their booking reps over the phone. We stayed there this past weekend and our experience was anything but great. First off, will say I have paid a lot less for nicer rooms on the strip also inside of much nicer hotels. The rooms were nothing special especially with the view we had of an empty pool. We stayed in room 19091 and have no idea what noise was keeping us up all night. At first I thought it was the people upstairs then I realized it might be coming from the elevator. Please whatever this is get it fixed!!! It is horrible to charge someone so much and they can't even get a decent night sleep. The resort fee of $32 per night they charge is a joke. Why should I have to pay for services I do not utilize? Oh and top of that also pay for parking because it is no longer free. RIDICULOUS!!! I will not be staying here again!!

I know this hotel's been here for a good while so I wasn't sure what to expect. First of all, I really like what they did with renovating the rooms here. I especially love the bathroom mirrors; the lighting's pretty intense. There's plenty of room for your luggage and to roam around the room but I do wish that the bathroom was more spacious in comparison to the rest of the room. The mounted plasma TVs are great when you have downtime in your room in between Vegas outings during the day and night. And the generally central location on the strip is great so walking to Caesar's Palace is very do-able.
