I didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel, I don't know if the amenities are great.  It's a decent price for a centrally located, decent hotel.  Expect no frills.

My boyfriend and I stayed here from the 1st-5th of this month when our friends were in the World Series of Beer Pong. They were at the Riviera and, after looking at the pictures of the hotel, I was kinda grossed out. So we decided to book at the Mirage instead. We went through Southwest Vacations and (unlike a previous reviewer) we had absolutely no problems. There were quite a few people checking in, so it took us a while, but they were super friendly. Signed me up for the mLife card also, which was nice. 

Our room was a pretty decent size, everything was clean, and never had any problems with the cleaning staff or really anyone else. With our vacation package, we got 2 free tickets to a show and decided to go to the Beatles Love Cirque du Soleil, which just happened to be at the Mirage. We went to the Sunday night showing, so there really weren't very many people there at all and we got upgraded from balcony to lower level seats, which was a big plus. Show was excellent, as can be expected with any of their shows.

The good thing about the Mirage is that it's (fairly) centrally located on the strip, so you only have to walk a short distance to get to most of the good things around. We bought a bus pass (3 days for $20 each) and rode that if we wanted to go up to the Riviera where our friends were staying or to the Stratosphere, or down to Luxor. On a side note, definitely recommend the bus pass. Cheap, convenient, and saves you from miles of walking.

Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here and it was reasonably priced for an above average room. When we looked at the prices, the Riviera (by FAR a lower quality hotel) was actually quite a bit more expensive than the Mirage, so it wasn't a hard decision at all. This was my first trip to Vegas and it certainly won't be my last. I would definitely stay at the Mirage again, and would recommend to anyone else coming to Vegas.

Had thousands of dollars stolen from my room, WHILE I WAS SLEEPING. The hotel didn't have cameras in the halls, therefore they were unable to find the thief. Was instructed to deadbolt the door because these professional thieves have their own ways to bypass the key system. I guess this could have happened at any hotel, but I think that the mirage management and security were aware of this problem and did not take appropriate steps to prevent it from happening again.

Located on the Las Vegas Strip, this was one of the first properties of the "corporate era" of Las Vegas. A theme property with out a theme (I mean that as a good thing). Yes the decor is lush and tropical but it is evocative of nowhere in particular, it is your own tropical paradise. 
They have a great selection of restaurants and clubs. I always feel welcome when I go there. Oh and did I mention that they also have a volcano? Worth a stop in. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

I know, The Mirage is an aged Hotel for the new glitter of the Las Vegas Strip.  It was one of the first Lux Hotels aside from the MGM Grand and before Treasure Island.  It had style. And refreshing next to aging mildewing Caesar's Palace.  But you know what, I got the BEST personalized service.

I stay all over the strip, and have stayed in almost every major Hotel. The all have their niches, but few have actual Customer Service.  At least, the Customer Service I like.  What I mean is, people who are willing to actually have a conversation, or know how to have a conversation.  People who can work, tell a mild casual joke to break the ice, and expedite my needs with ease.  People who can actually explain things so there are no surprises, or so I don't have to ask. Yes, the old Mirage, that's getting an interior face lift, did just that. And it started with the Bell Man, and ended with the Bell Man. 

What I don't like, small rooms. Or, rooms less than 400 sq ft.  However, their new room rates reflect this so I'm ok with staying their again.  

The Pool, OK. Well monitored. The drunks are kept under control, so families, be not worried.  Unlike CP.  The room, clean, decent, updated. But, I hate the lack of ventilation. So if you have bad gas, go to the lobby bathroom, unless you want to stink up the whole room for hours. 

All in all, I'd stay their again.  It's worth the $$, go see "Love." enjoy your stay.  The staff is great.

I really enjoyed staying here.  Granted, I used a promotional code and got a great deal and probably never will stay here again without one, but I liked it.  
Check in was a little confusing, but there was an employee to guide us the right direction.  The girl checking me in had a weird smirk on her face when I answered her questions that I got a weird vibe from, but I was hungover, could have been me.
My standard size room was much larger and felt roomier than any other standard sized rooms I've stayed in in Vegas.   It was decorated tastefully and modernly.  Our view sucked, however.
It's in a good location on the strip.  We walked to the Forum Shops, Caesar's Palace, Harrah's, Paris, Bally's fairly easily.  If you're leaving by taxi, you exit onto the strip.  That suckkkkkks.
They have a lot of tables, machines, a huge sports book, and many restaurants.  They have a Starbucks too which is a necessity in Las Vegas.
One complaint I have is about the dolphins.  Dolphins have no place in the Nevada desert.  How sad are they living in a little pool doing tricks for fish to entertain hillbillies?  Set them free.  They have the tigers there that attacked Roy.  No concern about the true welfare of WILD animals.  They are not domesticated pets.  (That's the end of that soapbox)
Anyway, beautiful hotel.  Great food.  Great Cirque show.  Big casino.  Great location.  If they dropped their regular room rates, I may be a return guest.

Pros:  Nice property, clean, beautiful, great guests, staff is helpful and kind, great location, great view, windows that open, great beds (I am about to order one!)

Cons:  No coffee pot in room, in-house restaurants and nightclub are not the best 

TIPS:  Yes, the city lives on them.  Be generous and you will have a wonderful time!

Located on the beginning ( or the end ) of the Las Vegas Strip, and 10 minutes cab drive from the airport ( as almost all hotels on the strip). The Mirage is an excellent hotel, I've stayed here twice and both times very enjoyable. My first time was over New Year's Eve(2009), and I came back last year for the Rock'n'Roll Marathon(2014). It is one of the " family-friendly" casinos on the strip, as you won't see nudity on lobby's screens. Also, the adult entertainment is hidden on the far end of the hotel.

Room: CLEAN and spacious, with a very comfortable beds. 
Bathroom: Decent size with good water pressure!
Entertainment:
1\/ Cirque du Soleil "Love".
2\/ Volcano eruptions: Every hour from 8.00pm-midnight.
3\/ The Siegfried & Roy Secret Garden and Dolphin Habitat.

Sign up for email and get their updated promotions and specials.
Solid four Yelps.

re: Buffet.    DId not stay at Mirage (sorry but when you stay at the Wynn Encore, it is hard to do anything else).   But we did have a quick bite at the buffet before the Beatles show.  I understand you can't ask for much for $25 a person, but what what I did NOT expect is how rude most kitchen personel were (the one manning the various food stations) to the customers...  At the carving station, a guy was yelling at a customer because "she needed to speak better English (?!)"...at the noodle station, the Chinese chef was purposely ignoring customer, faking being busy prepping stuff...totally obvious. The Sushi station was ALWAYS out and no one really caring about re-filling it. Sad to see that customer take 2nd place, no matter how "good value" the place is.  Will never go back.  Oh yes, I spoke to the manager on duty, and during the whole conversation she kept looking over my shoulder as if she was not interested in any constructive feedback.  Sorry bunch, this crew...  go to the Wynn buffet and you'll be treated right the first time.
The location of the hotel is great. It's not far from many of the newer hotel\/casinos. I wish they had better food choices there. The staff encounters we had were all positive.

Stayed in a Stay-Well room, so nice and relaxing with aromatherapy and mood lighting. Check in was quick. Had an item on bill that was unknown. Went to check out , so courteous off the bill immediately. The pool area is pretty large with waterfalls and lots of seating. LVB restaurant was good. You have to get the onion rings, crisp , crunchy delicious. We only stayed two nights, next time longer.
Looking forward to our next visit soon.

Our room was gorgeous (terrible view of the back roof, though) and super clean. This was a perfect way to end a 9 day road trip. The bed was so comfy and fluffy I didn't want to get out of it! I wish I could have stayed for another night. I had issues making my way around the hotel and figuring out which direction was which... its so big!

As a member of the MGM Resort I knew I would not be disappointed with the service and quality of this hotel. I am an avid Vegas goer and I stay in various hotels so I can compare which ones are worth visiting again and which ones I'd steer clear from. 

CHECK IN \/ OUT
I checked in on a Sunday afternoon in the summer and the line was fairly short. My desk clerk greeted me with a warm smile and addressed me by name several times during the check in procedure. Check out procedure was fairly simple. Like most hotels they have express check out so I was able to check out via email at the end of my trip. 

ROOM QUALITY
I booked a king bed in one of their standard rooms in the smoking section of the hotel. Very clean and tidy. Spacious. Only thing I didn't like about the room and the hallway was the decor. I suppose it's supposed to have a bit of a desert theme in an oasis since it IS called The Mirage, but it didn't personally excite me. 

AMENITIES
I strongly believe that this hotel has the best packaging for their shower amenities and they smell delicious!

I had a particularly bad experience as far as In-Room Dining went but when I filled out an online survey at the end of my visit, one of the representatives took it upon herself to refund us for the meals we ordered as an apology for the terrible service. If that's not good customer service then I don't know what is!

Mirage is a great hotel located in a very central part of the strip for a relatively inexpensive price. I would highly recommend guests to stay at this location and will definitely be coming back here again--especially for their Beatles Love show by Cirque du Soleil!

First off - I've never been inside of the Mirage, I've simply been to the volano show out front. It's a perfect stop for any out-of-towners who are visiting. The jungle sounds are a little whacky, but it's a great way to let you know that you're about to be wowed, momentarily. I love the combination of fire and water, the volcano is fun and first timers get a huge kick out of it. 

I love that it's just a little peek of how Vegas loves to wow its guests :)

Clean rooms and grounds. 

However doors are very thin, closet type doors. You hear everyone's conversation especially if you're next to rude oblivious people who think they're the only one in the hotel. Nice view of the strip but comes with a price of hearing the volcano erupt every 30 mins. House keeping did not service our room, very disappointed with that. We came back from a long walk, I was expecting a tidied room for the price I paid for. 

We will stay elsewhere next time.

Came here for a guys weekend trip last weekend and got a great deal on one of their penthouse suites. This was my first time staying at the mirage and it will definitely not be my last. The room left nothing to be desired and I now wont be able to stay in any room of a lesser quality when in vegas. All of my interactions with the staff were top notch. 

The only reason for the one star missing was that the shower in the second bathroom was horrible. I understand that it has to handicap accessible but the shower head was 4ft high and while the shower was 6ft wide it was only about 2.5ft deep which made it near impossible to comfortably take a shower.

Quite a nice hotel--smells GREAT! The ambiance is very enjoyable.  The room was clean and classic--not too big but not a dive by any means.  The TV was hit and miss when it came to channels working but let's face it--this is Vegas so you don't watch a whole lot of TV.  

The casino is kept very clean.  The cocktail waitresses are hit and miss as far as being available to get you a drink but once they do come they are quick to serve you.  The dealers are delightful--what a hoot!  

The restaurant options are great!  We LOVED BLT Burgers but really there are a lot of great places to grab a snack or a full meal.

Let's face it--BEATLES LOVE is the absolute BEST!  We've seen the show twice and it just gets better and better...would love to see it 100 times!  I only wish we could afford to bring the whole family to see the show.

Check in is a bit of a nightmare--it seems like there are millions waiting to get checked in.  Baggage handlers are hit and miss as far as being friendly or helpful.  We've had some great service from them and some terrible service in that area too. 

I honestly wish the room came with a fridge that guests can actually USE to keep drinks cold.  If you touch anything in the fridge you are charged for it so you have to bring your own cooler.

Bottom line, we will be back for sure!  We had a wonderful time!

The casino staff is very friendly here! They have some good slots and the buffet (Cravings) is pretty legit! The Chinese cuisine restaurant Fin is spectacular! They have a ton of cute restaurants in the mirage! 

Also the servers were living for me and kept bringing me free drinks so I made sure to tip well ;)

I went to Las Vegas and stayed at the Mirage for my girl friend's 21st birthday.  Let me tell you, I was so thankful for the pillow top beds and black out blinds.  The instant I hit the bed, it felt like I was on a cloud and I slept like a baby.  

The only thing I disliked about the Mirage was the pool.  It was over crowded and there was no place to lay or sit down.  Thankfully a helpful worker invited us to go to Bare.  We had tons of room to lay down and it was adults only.  Although most women kept their tops on, a select few went topless.  Most of the exposed breasts where Tijuana hack jobs.  Not so great but it was free entertainment!
Front office guy was nice enough to check me into a dirty room. They sent me keys to my new room about 20 minutes later. The clean room was nice but just my arrival to the dirty room ruined my stay.

So I'm feeling a little mixed about my stay at the Mirage these past two nights...

Pro 1: 
I lost my ball cap and they found it for me and even called and left a voicemail to let me know that they had retrieved it. I was able to get it downstairs in ten minutes!

Pro 2: 
The spa is awesome and I had a fantastic day of relaxing in the whirlpools. Jenny made me a fantastic juice mix drink that gave me the little extra sugar boost I needed. She even sprayed eucalyptus on the iced towels per my request! But it is so dry in Vegas...I had hoped they would have coconut water.

Pro 3: 
The gym is pretty stacked for how small it is. The trainer (Craig) is nice and friendly...really easygoing guy with a smile on his face and helped streamline the whole "can I get a cardio machine" process. 

Pro 4: We accidentally bumped some of the sensors holding snacks and drinks when moving in but nothing was taken so they were kind enough to take my word for it and remove the charges.

Con 1:
There was some mold in our room the first night on the ceiling by the thermostat. 

Pro 5: After the engineer (Cedrick) came to see it, we requested to move to another room (which is how I lost my ball cap) and were granted the request. They even offered to comp that first night as a result of the inconvenience. They also sent someone to escort us to our new room and help us with our baggage. Thanks Todd!

Con 2: The charge removal from the first night was not reflected in the statement when we were trying to checkout so I had talk to a front desk associate about it. Instead of removing the room charge and the resort fees and taxes for the first night, they only removed the room charge. As I was explaining to the associate over the phone what I was told the previous night, she grew frustrated and raised her voice at me. I asked her not to raise her voice at me and she apologized for it. I expressed my dissatisfaction in the lack of clarity of everything and was about to just call it day and give up on this circular conversation but then she shouts at me,"You wanna talk to someone else? FINE! (CLICK)"

Pro 6:
After being on hold for 5 minutes, the manager I spoke to was accommodating and much more polite to me. She did ultimately remove the charge for the room and resorts fees and taxes for the first night and apologized for the rudeness I encountered earlier. 

Pro 7:
The LOVE show was AMAZING. For anyone who really understands the music of the Beatles and the message that it represented...you'll LOVE it. 

I was annoyed to have had to spend so much time on the phone with the front desk and housekeeping and IT (wifi connection issues in the room) during what was supposed to be a nice vacation but other than that it wasn't too bad. The staff did try their utmost best to make sure I enjoyed myself for the most part so I am grateful for that. Thanks Mirage.
I love this place! The pool and clubs are amazing! I want to give a special shout out to elvin and James for helping us they were amazing and so kind!!
I always walk through this hotel, but I can't seem to recall it's selling points. I think there are gardens, or some sort of zoo, which is different, but it's not my favorite hotel on the strip.

Dear Mirage,

It is with great sadness that I write this.  I have loved you for many years.  I always chose you over the others.  You were special.  From your tropical decor and aromatherapy- to the tiger habitat.  I even had my wedding reception with you.  Well, it's been a few years and I am shocked and disappointed at what you have become.  I could almost say that you are close to sleazy.  

Yes, I know that you're trying to stay "hip" with your new art deco rooms with orange accessories that could trigger a migraine.  Sure, it's probably hard to control the odor of cigarettes and beer in the casino. But- somehow you used to do it. The Wynne does it, as does Bellagio, Venetian, Pallazzo and many others.

But what I really found distasteful was the new Revolutions Club where anyone walking past- on the way to the elevator- was given a show of half naked go-go dancers.  You know I'm not a prude.  There are some women that enjoy going to a strip club with their man and I say "you go girl".  That's their choice.  But I'm not one of those women.  I don't like anything pushed in my face.  And I do mean "pushed in my face".  The dancers are in little arched doorways between the casino and the club.

I know it's Vegas, but I expected a little more class from you Mirage.

Good bye forever.

You cant go wrong by staying at The Mirage. Everything runs so smooth here. From when you valet your car all the way to the end when you check out. Checking in has never been a problem takes about 10 mins. The rooms are nice. Always clean and smelling good. If your a M LIFE member most of the time you will get a good rate per night. The casino floor is good, a little bit of everything. They have a variety of restaurants that you can pick from. My two favorites would be BB KINGS HOUSE OF BLUES and BLT BURGER. Check out the Rhumbar also. Very good stuff. Staff is very friendly, Valet brings out your car ASAP. Will stay here again

Previous stay here was great about 3 years ago.  This time our room card key didn't work...had to replace them twice.  We found that housekeeping didn't shut our door completely when we returned from breakfast.  Unacceptable.  We were awaken 3\/4 nights that we stayed by different guests every night talking so loudly in hall between 2-6 a.m.  Lady across hallway was not pleased either, so she opened her door and told them to keep it down.  One night someone tried jamming their card key in our door until my husband yelled for them to stop.  Won't stay at this hotel again.

I arrived at Mirage on a Thursday night 11pm and the reservation desk agent was nice and friendly. I don't have to pay Thursday night due to Myvegas comp room and paid Friday on mlife deal. The walk to 3rd floor room is a long near the pantry cafe. The room is nice and clean with comfortable beds and goose down pillows. The restroom is clean and toilet is awkward positioned. My view of roof, effifel tower and swimming pool. It's a short walk to elevator. Also Plenty of drawers to put clothes in. Easy to check out by email which is nice. I like Mirage due to centrally located but difficult to drive to Mirage self parking lot due to people crossing the intersection. I had to change cards on Friday and didn't wait at long reservation line instead went to key card line.
Was having a great time until I realized they house six captive dolphins. Was shocked...they are literally in a swimming pool. Really sad. No thanks i'll stay elsewhere next time.

Went to Vegas for a couple days and LOVED this hotel  IT is amazing I stayed in a stay well room which is purified air. AC, light controls, bathroom mirror light up, moisturizing water. Etc. would TOATLY recommend

I'm in love with this hotel. The rooms are fantastic!! They are larger than most other hotel rooms. Very modern and comfortable. I will defiantly be coming back. The pool is also great. Plenty of chairs to lay out on, and great music.

The best thing about this hotel was that it was comped! YES!! but the bad thing is that... they lied to my friends mom telling her that they will give her tickets to the Pacquiao fight and on the day of her picking up the tickets, they told her it was the close circuit fight not the actual fight.. the boys were BUMPED.. but they had vip tickets to close circuit fight and they said it was fun watching it there. They got free drinks and food, and got to sit with Joe Jackson. haha. 

One thing that REALLY bugged me was that... their toilet handle was broken! I was having a hard time flushing the toilet... its twice as hard when you're really tired and drunk. I wanted to complain and get a new room, but everyone was okay with it so I didnt want to be the one comaplining. The bed was comfortable.. but the room was pretty small for me. Ever since my stay at the Palazzo, I just cant go back!!  It was just sooo spacious and nice there! and the environment is so much more fun and so much bigger. Mirage is just too small for me... but the nice thing is that its right on the strip so you;re so close to everything and can walk everywhere! but I wouldnt pay to stay here.

This review is long over-due. My boyfriend and I stayed here last year. When we first checked in we told that the room we had originally reserved was no longer available. Fine. They gave us another room instead and when we got to it we find that it is unserviced with clothes and beer bottles everywhere. Irritated at this point, we head back down to the front desk, walking once again through the entire casino, and they finally gave us a decent room. I wouldn't say that they deserve zero stars but I do feel that two stars is fairly accurate. Poor service, poor layout, definitely won't be coming back.

I thought this hotel was beautiful. We had excellent service and a great experience staying here. The rooms were extremely clean and we had a nice view of the city. I stayed with a group of girls & we were there with a group of guys as well. We had 2 rooms and the girls room had MANY mirrors! Which we had no problem utilizing. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for friendly employees and really  nice rooms!

Top 3 rules of real estate? 

1) Location
2) Location
3) Location

The Mirage succeeds by having a great location on the strip wedged between Caesar's Palace and TI.  Across, is the cheapest place on the "new" portion of the strip Casino Royale.  Their Buffet, Carvings, is marvelous and the rooms are newly renovated and very comfy and have got a good feel.  

The hotel is well priced in the middle compared to other places and with a huge pool, who can complain?  

My only complaint is they always seem to take my money.  But hey, that's vegas.

I stayed at the Mirage on a recent trip to Las Vegas.  We were able to get a good deal by calling the hotel and booking vs. booking online or through Expedia.  When we arrived at the hotel, it was pretty late but we still had our room!  We told front desk we were in town celebrating a few birthdays and they were nice enough to give us a free upgrade!

The upgrade gave us a great view of the strip.  And, we were able to see the famous Volcanoes of the Mirage erupt a few times!  The hotel was pretty easy to navigate.  Unlike some of the other ones where you get lost and don't know where you're going.  The walk from the garage to the front desk to our rooms wasn't too far.

The room we had was pretty spacious, and new.  This is a pretty old hotel, but it didn't seem like it from inside the hotel room.  There were nice flat screen TVs, an iPhone Dock, new panels and drawers, nice mirrors in the bathroom.  There wasn't too much of a cigarette smoking issue in the casino, and we didn't smell it from where we were.  However, we were on the 22nd floor.

The beds were nice, but a little lumpy.  They were soft but you kind of also fell in.. in the middle.  The sheets were nice and clean, and soft.  I liked staying at the Mirage because of its location.  You're almost in the middle of everything.  If I were to go to Las Vegas again, I would not have a problem staying here!

Quick Tip, if you're looking for parking at the Mirage park on the third floor! That's where there is the least amount of cars!

Having stayed at the Wynn during my last trip to Vegas I was a little spoiled and thus could not help but make comparisons. This is definitely NOT the Wynn but, perhaps because of having been owned by Mr. Wynn in the past, The Mirage still packs a nice atmosphere into a reasonable price. 

The lobby here is very cool with the huge fish tank and tropical garden; it is almost reminiscent of The Polynesian at Disney except without the Disney-esque fakeness. The rooms are tastefully decorated with mid-range contemporary furniture (better than Ikea but not as nice as Bo Concept) however the bathrooms (although nice, with marble and granite) are rather small and lack a separate soaking tub. Also, there is no coffee machine in the room and when paying a $20\/night resort fee they could at least give us the cheap hotel-room coffee for when we need to nurse a Vegas hangover. The beds were EXTREMELY comfortable though. 

The casino here is pretty lively but there are not many 5c and 25c slots...$1 slots rule here which is fine for a while but once you've lost a couple of hundred dollars at the tables it is nice to relax at a nickel machine for a bit. 

The palm lined swimming pool with waterfalls and tropical flora is a great feature of The Mirage. It is a wonderful place to relax on a hot Vegas afternoon before a night of eating and gambling. 

The buffet here surprised me. The night before we ate at the Wynn's buffet which is always fantastic so I had low expectations for Cravings at the Mirage, however I was mistaken. The food selection was excellent and everything was super fresh. One of the better buffets I have eaten at in Las Vegas, though the desserts here were just so-so (especially compared to the Wynn). 

I would stay at The Mirage again if I got a great deal however I don't yearn for it the way I do other hotels. The location on the strip is great though and all in all it was a good experience for a good price.

I was contacted by Marsha Biava MGM corporate risk management team on 7\/29\/15. I was asked to give them all the receipts and pictures of what was damaged. I was told once again, that I would be notified and once again I am waiting for them to tell me what's going on. It's getting ridiculous. I emailed her a few times asking if they received all of it, and if that was accurate enough. Not even a thank you, I received it or any kind of reply. Smh. 
All of this should of been handled right away at Mirage when the incompetent bellman made the mistakes. They should of said, we are going to move you to a new room that doesn't smell like an open container or an alleyway and hey, maybe a bigger room for my troubles? Lol. Nope. I come to Vegas a lot, I stay in different hotels and most of them are really good, quick and efficient when there is a problem. Mirage needs to step up their hospitality and discrepancy department. Step it up man! Smh.
Hope they answer me back really soon. It's really not professional to keep customers with a problem that they created hanging. That's not what you do to your customers.

I was surprised how much we liked the Mirage. We had a suite (D12) that was bot spacious and affordable considering it had to be 1000sqft. You have a cool little bar and gift shop at the bottom of the escalator. Jet (nightclub is in the hotel and the tables are convenient. The main pool was never overcrowded and "Bare", the adult pool was easy to get in and find a seat. the one negative I would mention was the California Pizza Kitchen and the BLT Burger place next door... AVOID and stick to the higher end restaurants. Easy tram ride next door to Treasure Island and their new Club (can't remember the name) and a quick walk across the street to the venetian and Tao Beach.

PS Go see "Love", the Cirque de Soleil show with music by the Beatles!

This review is for the Hotel & Casino.

The Mirage is definitely in one of the best spots on the strip! The placement makes it easy to get to other casinos and clubs.  

The rooms in the Mirage are really clean and beautiful.  They did major renovations on all of the rooms a few years ago and totally revamped the casino.  Every room is decked out with marble bathrooms, wi-fi, flatscreen tv's, huge views of the strip, fresh accommodating beds, robes,  mini-fridges, and iHome's so that you can blast your own music!  They constantly have promotional deals going on, and the last time I went we got a deluxe suite for $110 a night.  

The casino is relatively smoke free and the craps tables are great too.  I have no complaints about the casino although I could have asked for more waitresses on the floor, they don't come around as often as waitresses at the Wynn or the Venetian.

I'll finish with the most impressive part of the Mirage.  THE POOL.  The pool is off the hook! They have a huge sprawling pool with thousands of beach chairs, cabanas, restaurants at pool front, waterfalls, and full bars at pool front.  Lounging at the pool is by far the top activity in Vegas day-life, and this pool hangs with the best!

For an older resort, this pioneer of mega resorts still retains it's luster. Stayed here 3 nights (2 in standard room, 1 in tower suite) and both rooms were spectacular and above the average. the tower suite is a 100% recommendation for the price, and the regular rooms are on par with higher priced properties. Overall the casino has a great vibe and good layout. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

First time staying in Vegas.  Was here for a conference and was hoping the Mirage would be a nice as it looked.  My room smelled like smoke and the mini fridge was making a loud squeaking noise. I was also on the 2nd floor with no view.  I called several times to see if I could get someone to come and try to clean the room and fix the noise.  No one ever came.  After the 4th call, I gave up.  Didn't really sleep well at all.  Called the second night and complained again.  Again no one came and they could not move me because the hotel was sold out.  The smell was so bad I was coughing and sneezing during my entire stay.  I hate that you have to walk through the stinky casino to get to the restaurants.  No coffee maker and room service did not have a single cups of coffee.  Major bummer because I like to have coffee right when I get up.  Can't use the mini fridge either.  On a good note, the room was clean and the cleaning staff was very friendly.  By the 3rd night I was able to move to the 16th floor.  Had a much better room.  No smell and no noisy fridge with a nice view of the volcano.  So two nights in hell and two nice nights.  Wish I could give it a better rating but after making 6 plus calls to the front desk and having no solution for 3 days, I really can't.

The Mirage is like one of those girls that hangs out with the super-hot popular chicks that the whole lacrosse team wants to get drunk and screw, but she's not one of them, not quite as popular or pretty, but enough so that they let her stick around. I know it doesn't sound like it, but this is a compliment. These girls wouldn't let the MGM Grand hang out with them, and certainly not Treasure Island. But they like the Mirage and invite her to all the cool parties because she's fun and witty in a way they'll never be, but still totally non-threatening because she's an eight and they're totally tens.

In fact, what's weird about the Mirage is that she's kind of cool for NOT being the super-hot popular chick. She doesn't drive daddy's BMW Series 3 or wear Manolo Blahniks. She's classy, she's approachable. Nice to the lesser girls and secretly smart -- she's going to Cal Tech this fall on a full scholarship and she doesn't even talk about it. She's athletic instead of bulimic, she can play the trombone, and she once hiked the Pacific Crest Trail. And what are those other girls doing? Indoor tanning to death and getting hammered on wine coolers. They're overpriced, all bling and no substance. The Mirage is easy going and can hang with the boys. In fact, she's coming over today to watch the Super Bowl, she's got money on the Ravens and she's not going to spend the whole time asking what's a two-point conversion and standing in front of the TV while hoovering Diet Sprite and vodka.

OMG I JUST REALIZED I LOVE YOU PLEASE MARRY ME MIRAGE!!!

Really enjoy this hotel overall. The staff is friendly and professional, the gym is decent, they have some good pools on property, neat volcano, and some decent eats. 

I have stayed here twice now. The rooms are updated and fairly modern. The prices are not terrible. My only qualm on my last stay is the cleaning lady forgot to 'clean' one day, then the second day it seemed as though not a whole lot was done to the room other than making the beds. Dirty cups were left behind, the floor did not seem vacuumed, etc. Also had to request for more towels since those were not refreshed either. Hmph. 

I also like it's location on the strip. Across the street from Venetian and within walking distance to all the great stops. 
Didn't get much of a chance to use the casino here but it's decent. The Beatles LOVE show plays here....there's a candy store...burger joint...Starbucks (thank goodness)...cafe, and many more eats ranging in all different prices. Their outdoor patio\/bar Rhumbar is also quite nice. Hookah, cigars, music, and drinks...can't go wrong!

It's a good thing that Mirage decided to have a make over for their rooms. Stayed here a long time ago and the rooms were very ugly and had an odd odor. The newly improved Mirage has better more modern looking rooms. I think they remodeled in 08, but the rooms already show signs of needing maintenance. The bathroom was small compared to other hotels and the shower head was weak. Since it was only a one night stay for us, this was a good enough hotel. Good walking distance to other hotels and moderately priced. Would stay here again.
One of the oldest hotels on the strip but kept up to date and quite elegant.
Great service great stay the Rome was perfect great view of the strip of Las Vegas also had dinner great buffet  great resort will return

I hadn't  been to the Mirage since the 90's, so I was excited to see the renovations. To be honest, this place really is the best value for your money. Spent a few nights here for 80bux a night and was very satisfied.

To make it short and sweet for you, here are the pros and cons:

PROS:
+ Across the street from Venetian & Palazzo, next to Caesar Palace (Forum Shops!) & Fashion Show Mall
+ Rooms JUST renovated, and come equipped with the following: iPod mount, hair dryer, cable flat screen tv, robes, iron\/board
+ Has two coffee shops located at each end of the hotel
+ Shuttle in back of hotel entrance to Treasure Island 
+ Tram in front of valet entrance to Treasure Island
+ Discounted LOVE Cirque Du Soleil & Mystere Cirque Du Soleil if you are a guest here (buy one ticket, get one FREE of which is a great deal!)

CONS:
- Rooms do not have coffee machine which is quite odd
- Room Bathroom amenities are barebone (only shampoo\/conditioner, bar of soap)
- The white tigers are no longer free to watch by the large glass window, you now have to walk to the pool area and enter a small "park section" and pay an admission of $15 to see the white tigers, this was such a pisser
- DO NOT DINE HERE! Unless you want to eat at California Pizza Kitchen, the buffet is below average and the restaurants have mediocre food with expensive prices. 

Overall I had a great experience here (minus the food) and you can't ask for more when you get good, clean rooms at a good price. The location is also hard to beat, you are by the best shopping & best clubs.

Really good hotel and casino.. all kind of fun available.. lot of parking space.. you can check out up to 2 online.. awesome girls.. huge pool.. adult pool.. dolphins show.. zoo inside having animal like lion, tiger, jaguar, leopard..

A few of my friends and I stayed at the Mirage for 3 nights. I have mixed feelings about it, so I'll break it down by the good vs. the bad.

THE GOOD:
Convenient location
Right next to Cesar's Palace (awesome shops @ Cesar's)
Good buffet 
Clean
Friendly staff 
Comfortable beds 
Nice restaurants and nightlife (1OAK is here actually)

THE BAD:
Slow room service. We had to call the morning of our second day to ask for clean towels. After 15 mins (and no towels), we called again. They apologized and said they'd be up. After another 10 mins, we had to call a 3rd time. Finally, about 2 mins after the 3rd call, we got our towels. I don't feel that we should have to call 3x and wait almost 30 mins for towels 
No one offered to help us take our bags to our room for us when we arrived 

Overall it wasn't a bad experience. It was just mediocre. If I ever come to Vegas again, I don't know that Mirage would be my 1st choice.

Rented the two bedroom penthouse suite in June, amazing service and the room was spectacular especially for the price point!  We were signed up for the suite life which was great, limo ride to and from the airport, separate Check in with ammenities (free drinks) in the separate lobby!  The staff was great and the location was ideal. Love the additional nightly turndown as the room was always clean and fully stacked everyafternoon and every monring we came back! 

Had our lunches and dinner at the Japonais Lounge which was delicious and arranged bottle service at the 1 Oak!

Had a great time at the Mirage!

I was pleasantly surprised when we stayed at The Mirage. The room is decent sized... Choices for late night dining... Bathroom kind if small, but try going to Paris or any other European city and see the size of your bathroom. Just sayin, spoiled Americans.. The check in staff.. Awful.. Rude beyond words. The girl acted better than anyone.. & never mustered a smile the entire time.. We were stuck here after flight issues so it's okay for one night.. But that check in girl.. Wow. The hike from check in to elevator.. Long. And no one offered to take bags when we got out of cab. It's the little things.. Location is good... Mid strip.

The person checking me in at the front desk was so rude! No hello, no smile, and she wouldn't even answer my questions! I asked her how I transfer my Hyatt diamond status to MLife Platinum and she shrugged her shoulders! Head down like she was pissed off at the world. Unhelpful is putting it mildly.

Additionally, even though I told her I was there for a major event (for which I was apparently supposed to receive a special packet from the front desk), she didn't offer it, nor mention it to me. It was almost too late when I finally found out I needed the packet - two minutes before the event!! If I wasn't in such a good mood that day, she would have set a negative tone for my entire trip! As one of the first people to greet you when you enter the hotel, I would recommend Mirage either get rid of her or put her in a non-customer-facing job. This chick is miserable, and that is being kind.

I was dreading having to have to talk to her a second time, when I returned to the desk and she was open for the person next in line. It had only been about 5 minutes since she checked me in, and she looked straight at me, without any discernible amount of personality and asked, "Checking in or checking out." I replied, "You just checked me in. My room -" She interrupted, "What can I help you with?"

As I was saying... my room was unbearably smoky and I wanted to be moved to a non-smoking room per my reservation. She didn't say anything to me... just typed away, looking down, making annoyed sighs every time I spoke. I told her I had called from the room and the person who answered said they'd take the resort fee of my bill. She gave me a blank stare and said, "It's taken care of... next!" and handed me new room keys. Zero emotional inflection whatsoever during both of our interactions. 

The second room was clean and didn't have that smoky smell. The bellman, Tom, was extremely kind and helpful. I told him of my front desk experience and he seemed almost personally bothered. His empathy made me feel much better and led me to believe this was probably an issue with the person and not necessarily the hotel management of the staff... Tom got a big tip.

At night, although signs were posted to the contrary, there was no security at the elevators during the Saturday through Monday of my stay. I thought that to be a bit strange, since every other hotel I've stayed at on the strip checks your room key after a certain late night hour - certainly by midnight.

There are a plethora of things to do, see, and indulge in within the Mirage; rainforest, dining options (Heritage Steak was fabulous), Secret Garden, casino, dolphin habitat, 1OAK, Aces of Comedy, Terry Fator... there's something for everyone, and MLife gives you great discounts! 

I finally found out, on my own accord, that MLife platinum status is automatic with diamond Hyatt status, but you have to go to the MLife counter to receive your status upgrade and new card. I recommend doing this before checking in, so you can get the room perks that I missed out on.

The monorail is across the street, behind Harrah's. It's about a half-mile walk through the Harrah's casino and out the back side to the monorail station. This is my main mode of travel up and down the strip when visiting Vegas, as it goes south to MGM and north to SLS. So easy!

I'm not sure whether I'd stay at the Mirage again. There are so many other options on the strip, begging for my business, with front desk agents who are elated to greet you and take great pride in their jobs!

We got an email offer for $44.00 for a Thursday night and $77.00 for the weekend nights. Bear in mind that nearly all the hotels and resorts are now tacking on a 'resort fee' of $15-$25 per night. For this added tax you get free internet, parking, and can print your boarding pass. Big whoopee, you cannot say, no thank you, it is annoying, why not just slap it on the room rate and be done with it? Despite that, our rate was amazing value and we expected a little room overlooking the parking garage. But no, we had a large room facing the strip and the volcano! The rooms have been refurbished and are airy and stylish whilst feeling comfortable, we were impressed. The bathroom was a little cramped but the free toiletries are lovely and the towels and robes were fluffy and soft. The casino itself is a nice size, not overwhelming, nor poky and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. There are several choices for food and they offer a good range of prices, there should be something for everyone here and if not, then you are in the heart of the strip. We would not have stayed here if not for the deal and now we are glad we did.

4.5 Stars 

When choosing a Vegas hotel, my two main selection criteria are location and pool; mirage receives 5 stars for both. 

The moment you walk into the hotel you are greeted by a total tropical, lush ambiance with large palm trees, flower gardens, waterfalls and a check in desk that is back dropped by a tropical fish aquarium. 

The casino floor itself is a little dated and in definite need of a face lift; however, not to the point where it detracted from the overall atmosphere. 

The rooms were recently renovated; it has probably the most comfortable hotel beds I have ever slept on. Alot of yelpers were complaining about the small size of the bathroom's; I found it to be more than adequate. 

Wide variety of food selections. We ate the BLT, Carnegie deli and their buffet (amazing)...all were affordable and tasty eats. 

The location is probably the most appealing quality of the mirage; dead center of the strip, right across from the venetian and in between ceasars palace and treasure island...perfect for trekking the strip. There is a tram across the street if you get lazy or if you want to travel to the tail ends of the strip i.e. go north to the stratosphere of south to Mandalay bay. 

Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Vegas for any reason -- you get the best of all worlds without breaking the bank.

This is an old hotel, so I expected old stuff, but my sister booked it because she has stayed here before and liked it.  I was surprised when I entered.  The room was spacious and everything looked modern and clean.  They have different color rooms.  The pink room looks the prettiest so ask for the pink room.  My only complaint are the small pillows.

The pool was nice with a waterfall. Just show your keycard and you can get in.

The white tiger exhibit is a rip off, so don't go.  I didn't go, but my sister went because my niece wanted to go see.  The tigers weren't even that white she said and they were sleeping.  Seriously, for $20, it's not worth it.  Should've been free for hotel guests.

Irritated about the parking charges!  I liked free parking, and valet service.  MGM is the only chain on the strip charging for it!  18 bucks plus tip!  The Cirque de Soleil Beatles show Love was great!  I thought the hotel was lovely, but not planning to return.

The worst front desk customer service from Jessica and would not allow me to speak to manager of course...I only ask that their representatives (ESPECIALLY JESSICA) take a course of customer service who I would be more than happy to teach but people like that cannot do more than bare minimum unfortunately...(no room for improvement)

I love this place. Mirage is very nice and fun atmosphere. The rooms are very nice and those beds are amazing. Great places to eat and who can forget about the famous Rhumbar. Sick place to chill, smoke a cigar and drink. 

I really wanted to give Mirage a 5 star rating, but the front desk people take their job way too seriously. I almost could have gotten locked out of my room where me and my friend were staying if the lady didn't confirm the room number. pretty much long story short.. it is late my friend is sleeping in our room and i decide to go up, but i totally forgot the room number. So i go to the front desk and i tell them the last name of the person the room is under and she wouldn't tell me the name of the room number, i told her it is either 2134 or 2143 or something like that. she said pretty much said it was the first one, so i told her can i get another key since you are telling me mine doesn't work and she said without a id of the person that the room is under i cant give you a key.. I'm like wtf really? wow.. so i call my friend who is dead sleeping and no one picked up.

So i decided to go give the key another try and luckily it worked.. I love this place, but he front desk needs to stop taking their job seriously, this is Vegas i am a paying customer who came and stayed at Ur hotel and of course lost my money. so answer me question.

8th trip to Vegas in five years. I've stayed everywhere from the Excalibur ($) to the MGM Signature Suites ($$$$) and I would say the Mirage is just smack dab in the middle. It doesn't blow me away but it's not a dump lol

Bachelorette said check in line took FOREVER and the second room on her reservation took hours to get ready. I don't get it, I know the hotel is massive but when check in is at 11, it highlights the staff's inefficiencies when you have to wait until 4 for your room to actually be ready.

Great location- chipotle and McDonald's are across Las Vegas boulevard. That is great because sometimes you just want a quick lunch that's cheap. The McDonalds I think is open 24 hours so you drunkos keep that in mind lol.

 The pool was pretty, and VERY calm. This is a great pool for kids! 

Come here for a cheap room that is just a place to lay your head down at night. It's Vegas how much time do you spend in the room anyway ;-)

PS- WIFI ACTUALLY WORKS! The entire time! I was seriously expecting to have to add extra gigs of data so that was a savior!
Hotels in Vegas are always so gorgeous looking, with spectacular stuff. I loved my stay here.

I spent 3 nights at the mirage, it was my first time in vegas and I was worried about picking the wrong hotel but I have to say the mirage lived up to my expectations!! The hotel is very beautiful and I LOVED the volcano show, the room I stayed in was nice and clean and the workers at this hotel were all very friendly and helpful I felt so welcomed. The location is perfect it's in walking distance to almost everything, the only time I called for an uber was when I was just being lazy but still the ubers didn't cost much cause I was so close to almost everything. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is cause the buffet food wasn't that good. It was ok but I don't think it was worth the amount they charge for it. All in all I had a great time and I would definitely stay at this hotel again if I ever return to vegas.

2nd 1 star review for Mirage.  Why its the 2nd time, well, they do give me a free room and $100 resort credit so they lure me back.  You know its bad when u get free room and $100 and Im still giving them 1 star as i go across to the Venetian and then Caesars to gamble.

I book for 2 nights while letting the vip marketing agent know that I usually arrive in the early morning so i book the night before to make sure I have a room upon check in.  Low and behold, i arrive in the morning and the room that i book for the night before was booked out and no rooms are clean.  The front desk attendant says they missed the notes and that i had to wait appx 4 more hours to get my room ready.

Anyway, if you play craps and like to gamble...i highly recommend the venetian or caesars...much better options and better experience.  I just need to build my gaming over those 2 places more to get comp nights there.  However I should have just paid for my room at venetian or caesars if i knew mirage was going to do me dirty like this.  Avoid

We've been staying at The Mirage for years after a bad experience with another high-end casino.  We are VIP's (which I think almost everyone is now-a-days) and we are treated like one.  It always makes us laugh to see the older folks who eat nothing but the freebies in the VIP Lounge.  We are VERY low maintenance and I know they appreciate that.  They pool is fabulous as well as the spa.  We always stay in either a Penthouse or one of the Villa's (we like the Villa as there are no loud teeny boppers slamming doors down there).  Jet is your typical nightclub...nightclubs were so much better 10 years ago, when people dressed in classy clothes!

Prices are very reasonable and the restaurants are great...especially Japonnais.

I've probably stayed more at the Mirage than any other place only because I didn't organize the trips.  I prefer the Bellagio or would like try the Wynn or Palms in the future.  But this place has a pretty good balance of everything for every age.  Rooms are okay, buffet is famous and Cirque de Soleil usually has a show going on there.  Good stuff.

This was a pretty nice property. They did a great job with their interior landscaping and interior decorating.  rooms felt clean, sheets were crisp, white and clean.  Bed was fluffy with a pillow top.

Did a late night check in at about 1am... the gal that checked us in looked like she was half asleep... very little conversation came out of her... so little that she never asked us if we wanted one king or two doubles!  checked into our room, and ended up with two doubles... we were so tired that we didn't even bother going back to the desk to change rooms... 

Valet parked the car, they allow you to call the valet desk to have your car pulled up to the front in 10-15min.  Pretty nice, no waiting needed.
You don't get much for your player card status at Mirage . Wi-Fi Internet access in the hotel room is terrible; which you are paying for with a resort fee.

My husband and I were there last week for the National Association of Residential Property Managers convention and I had gotten my nails done in town before leaving.  When we got to LV I had 4 broken nails--Aaargh! Went down to the beauty salon and was met with a very delightful lady named Diane.  She apparently had just started working there.  I asked for a seasoned manicurist, because I am very picky (sorry). She fixed my nails beautifully and sent me on my way.  Kudos to this lady beautiful work and beautiful conversation and disposition. BTW- When I made reservations on line I asked for a view room, did not quite get that, but the young lady at the reception desk quickly accommodated us! Thank you!

I was seeing the Beatles LOVE and stayed here for the convenience. And the reasons to stay end there. This place is stuck in 1990. Dated decor, and a room safe that was too small to fit a lap top (after all they weren't invented in 1990) and a room service menu that's basically hamburgers and wedge fries. I'm a vegan. There wasn't one single option in the whole place.  The wifi went out once.  I was on hold for front desk way too long and when I got someone, I complained about the above - she sighed and said "yeah we are due for a refresh".  Let's not even discuss the thin walls or "blackout" curtains.  Unless you have a retro fetish I suggest one of the more current hotels on the strip. However the show LOVE is great.

I had a great experience staying at this hotel. My room and view was awesome!  The checkin line when we arrived was long, but moved very quickly. Everything was very clean in the room upon our arrival. I also liked that we had a private elevator that only went to 2 floors. 

The restaurants I wanted to eat at and LOVE by the Beatles is also at the hotel. It's location on the strip is the best. 

I'm looking forward to my return trip. We will be back!

I loved, loved, loved the pooldeck. Great rooms, good service, we were treated great. Drinks and food were a bit pricey but overall I would definitely stay there again. Was treated awesome at Jet, got VIP service all night long and the best table in the house for free!

Add this hotel to the suck pile! It was dirty. We complained and it never got clean. They took our resort fees off our bill, but still. We complained twice about the puke splatter all over and it never got clean. I mean take better care of your customers if you want them to return. The resort fee reimbursement wasn't enough to make us want to come back.

My stay at this hotel hasn't happened yet. But I needed to give The Mirage a review, just based on the customer service I've received so far. I've been dealing with the M Life reservation line and have gotten exceptional customer service every single time I call. Based on bad service I received from the Luxor, I called this hotel in a panic looking for hotel reservations and event tickets. The M Life rep that I spoke with, Allan, told me "Don't panic.. let me see what I can do for you." He basically reinstated previous hotel reservations I had and secured the event tickets for me. He didn't have to transfer me to a supervisor and I didn't have to explain my situation 100 times. He just asked me what happened and took care of my issue right away. Thank you Mirage for saving my vacation. I am really looking forward to my upcoming stay!

Second time visiting Las Vegas and this place has a ton of value for what you spend. The Mirage has one of the best pools on the strip, great restaurants -BLT Burger is amazing, casino floor is well kept and nicely laid out. The Rhumbar happy hour is a great deal and the frozen drinks are delicious. The Beatles Love Cirque show is a must-see and the Sportsbook puts Caesars to shame. Only negatives I can think of are: slow Wifi, small bathroom in the standard room and the TV remotes don't work very well.  All in all a great experience and I would definitely return!

**If I could rate no stars, I would. In short, my stay at the mirage was a NIGHTMARE. They DO NOT care about their guests and are not helpful!!****

1. To start, the lady checking us in was EXTREMELY RUDE. I had Nothing but problems from check in, however they gave me a $50 dollar credit to make up for the mistake at check in(that took an hour to fix! We were waiting in the lobby with no room until 4:30pm) so I thought "okay cool! I can let it slide and enjoy my weekend" .. Lol I was wrong! 

2. What threw me over the edge most was when I went to use my credit, they told me it was ran up. So I was transferred to the front desk, where they told me I had about 12 different items from the mini bar, which added up to around $100. The credit was ran up then the rest put on my debit card. Apparently, the mini bar is censored, which they failed to tell us. 
Okay, this can be fixed easily right? WRONG. They fought me on sending up a manager to check the mini bar until the morning.  In the end, I never got my credit back. I was told that i would be refunded my money back to my debit card, so I came back home and received my receipt via email, the charges from the mini bar are still on my card. REALLY? 

3. Then, I spent $2,300 on a suite in January with floor to ceiling windows. But the pictures of the love\/Beatles show covered them!! You couldn't event see out of them!! 

4. Oh and no one speaks English, went to CPK for lunch, I couldn't understand anything they were saying, on the bright side, they were the only people in the hotel (minus one maid and the ladies\/gentlemen working at the spa) who were actually friendly.

Thank you Mirage for making my 21st birthday incredibly stressful. I will not be returning and when all my friends ask me how my vegas trip was, I will proceed to tell them NOT to EVER stay at your hotel and in any conversation about vegas in the future for the rest of my life, I will make sure I put your hotel on the "DO NOT STAY" list.

This was the only hotel where I could actually tolerate the smoke. And as a result, they made quite a bit of money off of me in their casino. I didn't even think to ask for comps. Nonetheless, a fight broke out and it took security forever to come and break it up. This was very scary. I have mixed feelings about the security or the perception of security based on this fight. It doesn't matter what you look like, anyone could pull out a gun and start shooting. I literally thought this was going to happen at this casino. People need to feel safe when they're spending their money, so heads-up Mirage. You all need to get it together on the security end so people can be safe!!

OK this is not your Mirage from the 90's... They have remodeled their rooms and its really nice! And not to mention that this hotel is located right smack dab in the middle of the strip!  Winning!!! 

The lean rooms are all upgraded with really squishy comfy beds and feather pillows that will make you feel like your sleeping on clouds! I would have given them five stars but the noise in the hallways echoes though out your room. You can hear everything in the hallways and every time your neighbor slams their door. And the walk from the front desk to the elevators kind of suck. You have to walk across the casino floor and a ton of people to get to the guest elevators.  

The check-in service was very polite and accommodating. You can probably slip them a $20 and upgrade your room because they ask you if you are celebrating anything special and slip them the cash and I am sure they will hook you up! I have never tried it but I had heard it works! And if you park in the parking structure try to park on the fourth floor over to the right hand corner of the structure to be close to the elevators. If it's too crowded then park on the third floor, less cars. The hotel is also in walking distance of Venetian and Palazao.

For the price, location.. location...and the remodeled rooms. You can't beat the deal!

BTW.... We only paid $33 for Thurs and $53 for Friday night.. Score..!

Pretty much everything about this place is awful. I stay on the strip a lot and this is my first time here. Let's star with how crappy this place is:

1) Cable is constantly pixelated and watching TV isn't possible unless you want to watch a constantly stuttering show.

2) The worst internet ever, practically non-existent. The few times I could contact in the room page loads were so slow it took minutes to load a simple web page. I called several times and they couldn't fix, speed test was .08 Mbps. Finally they moved me to a so called "Internet Room" which supposedly had a router in it. It worked in the new room but was still very slow, speed test was about .4 Mbps. Barely passable to do basic web browsing. Apparently they are aware that there internet sucks here and have special rooms set aside for people that complain about it. Cable TV was even more pixelated in this room.

3) 5-10 min wait times whenever I call the Front Desk.

4) 5 min wait time when I called Room Service. Then they tell me they can't give me what I wanted because there supposed 24 hour kitchen isn't all working. Then they tell me I can't put it on my room because there systems are down. Then they call back 15 min later and say what I ordered also isn't available. I Finally told them to cancel the whole damn order.

There's probably more bad stuff that I can't recall at the moment.

What was good about it:

1) Checking out and getting the hell out of there and never coming back.

I feel like home at the Mirage. I've been staying here for over 8 years and have nothing but great things to say about the rooms, service, the Carnegie Deli, the pool, it's all classic Vegas with updated decor. 

The Mirage is in my favorite part of the strip which is centrally located next to Treasure Island, Caesars, and across the street from the Venetian\/Palazzo.

seeing that all the action is happening at the end of the strip (xs, tao, lavo, tryst, etc..) this is a great location to be in the middle of it all! 

the room renovations were well done. flat screens, bright bedding, and backlit bathroom mirrors. too bad the same cant be said about their casino or the rest of their hotel. the casino floor still feels like old school vegas, no smoke ventilation, front desk was pretty run down, and their god awful atrium... sucha mess!  ist just a buncha plants everyehwere! 

nevertheless, the location was pretty spot on, and the prices were reasonable.

The Mirage Hotel and Casino is an oldy, but a goody. It was built in 1989 making it one of the  staple hotel options on the strip. While it's older, it's still quite nice and classy inside. I love their indoor water fountain, good for photo ops.

We stayed at the Mirage on a Thursday night. We opted to check in online and use the self-check in kiosk but due to our late arrival (after 10pm) the kiosks were closed. Not to worry, we were assisted at the front desk with no wait. 

Our room was located on the back of Las Vegas Boulevard so no view except the freeway and rooftop of another building. Overall, the room was very spacious and clean. It had all the conveniences of a standard 3+ star hotel room. Very comfortable bed and pillows, minibar, black out curtains and a large closet space. The cons was that my room was missing a safe. Also we were placed in an accessible room with a poorly designed bathroom. Once I took a shower the entire bathroom floor was wet. There is no partition between the shower\/toilet\/sink, which caused me to slip and I almost took a TUMBLE (thumbs down!). The drain is level to the floor and simply does not let enough water drain quick enough. Poor design. I had to lay down as many towels as possible on the floor just so that I could safely tip toe around in the bathroom. This is really silly considering that this is to accommodate someone who is disabled and could easily slip and fall. The lighting was also very dim in the bathroom. 

In terms of parking, the charge is $12 per 24 hour period. Your license plate is printed on your actual ticket. This fee is only waived if you are a high level M Life Member. If you are staying here, I highly recommend you sign up for M Life Rewards.

Overall, I wouldn't mind staying here again because of the convenience of where it is located on the strip. I would just request a non accessible room due to the slipping liability.

Took hubby here for his birthday in Jan 05'.  Nice rooms, clean marble bathrooms.  The best thing we loved about it was the jungle forest in the casino and the guy feeding the fish in the HUGE fish tank behind the reception desk.  That was fun to see.  The buffet Cravings was wonderful.  Great food. Got so full we sat there for an extra hour.

My review score is based solely on costumer service. I came here on a whim for a buddies spur-of-the-moment wedding. I'm not here to discuss the legitimacy or ingenuity of a shotgun wedding, he's an idiot and we fully own that... regardless, the costumer service experience was appalling. 

We came and got two rooms. Upon coming back to the room, my keys didn't work. I will fully admit that I was way too drunk. My fault, but I wasn't here to get lectured about my addictions or poor lifestyle decisions. It's Vegas, are you kidding me?! 

So I get to my room, my key doesn't work , and I'm way too drunk to walk down. I sleep on my front door. I'm okay at this point, I assume it's a technical error and I can let that slide. Shit happens. 

Security finally stops by and let's me in. They te me I can call front desk to have keys delivered. Cool. The security was cool, and he did what he could. 

But when I call front desk, and ask for more keys... explaining I'm too drunk to walk down... you know what the lady tells me? 

"Sounds like a personal problem. "

Really? Are you kidding me? 

It's a personal problem that the keys you assigned don't work? Is it a personal problem when I pay for the room? Or only when I can't get into it? 

Unbelievable. Utterly, ridiculously, unbelievable.

Overall, I had a good experience here. The room was nice enough, though the bathroom was kind of small. We couldn't figure out if the lamp shade in the room was dirty or if it had a weird design on it. It kind of looked like someone spilled coffee on it. But it was a minor thing. The lobby and casino almost always seemed to be really crowded. Trying to get to your room from the self-parking garage at night was challenging at times. But what I really liked about this place was the friendliness of the employees at the table games. I am new to gambling and the dealers at the roulette table I went to were really friendly and helpful about answering my questions. The blackjack dealer I had tried to help us out and was nice to talk to. We were able to find $5 minimum tables here, though it was during the week so it would probably be different on a weekend or holiday. I would stay here again because of the nice dealers and pit bosses and because of the Mirage's central location.

Don't doubt, just do!  Go ahead, book a room here, and I'll tell you why...

Well situated on the Strip, fabulous tropical atrium, insane buffet, friendly service, spacious rooms, and a fantastic pool area.  Okay, about the pool....

The Mirage has a beautfiul, large, refreshing pool with plenty of waterfalls.  Behind that large pool is "Bare."  It's an adult-only pool area that was incredibly fun for two gals looking for some Vegas indulgence (that would be myself and a friend).  You don't need to be bare to enjoy it, but you can go topless if you'd like.

 Bare charges a $10 admission fee, but we got free passes after making purchases at the Mirage swim shop.  They have super comfy lounge chairs and beds with thick, thick mattresses.  They have yummy cocktails, play great music, and change your towels whenever you get up to take a dip.  Now, the Bare pool is NOT refreshing.  It's totally warm (too warm) because it's tiny.  They also have a glass-enclosed jacuzzi area.  The bathroom is fantastic....it's clean, sleek, and offers all sorts of goodies like mouthwash, lotions, etc.  We had a great day sunning ourselves here!

To wrap up, let me just say I really loved almost everything about The Mirage.  The service was really friendly and we loved eating and drinking at their newest restaurant and lounge, Japonais.  My only complaint is that the rooms are not sound-proofed at all.  Mornings were a little rough with neighbors taking showers, making calls, etc.

I can not give a full review but after visting for a two days, I can truly say I'm in love with the ambiance and evironment. Very clean, well kept and up to date.  The restaurants,club and shopping area was just beautiful. By staying at the sister hotel T.I, I was able to enjoy some of the amenties like the pool, the dolphins and the volcano show. I'm definitely looking forward to booking my next stay when I  return to vegas to get the full expereience.

During my mancation in Vegas we stayed here for a couple of nights. It's high tech and feels Glamorous like Fergie. The rooms are swanky, have big flat screen tvs, multiple hook-ups for your computers, usb ports, you name it. It's a geeks dream. The decor is of course ultra modern. They have a bunch of restaurants to order from if you don't feel like leaving. The pool area is huge and the women are classy. 

I was gonna write more, but I just remembered. 

What happens in Vegas, stays in Vegas.

Awesome hotel!

A nice hotel, rooms are nice.  However, if you want coffee in your room in the morning,
you will have to go downstairs and pay $3.50 a cup.  
There is a $20 a night amenities fee you pay even though you never used any of their facilities ie. workout room, etc.  
If you eat there, the buffet is really good but is $24.95.  
Nothing in Vegas is free anymore.  No bar shows, nothing. 
They have really tightened the belt so bring lots of money.
I won't be staying at any of the big hotels again unless they change their policies.
Hope this helps.

We've stayed at the Mirage 3 times now when traveling to Vegas.  I'm surprised I haven't written a review yet!

There are so many things to love about the Mirage.  The entrance alone transports you to a tropical island.  It feels like a major standalone resort.  The atrium has such a peaceful feel to it, it lets you know you're on vacation.  

Check in can take a while so time your arrival to avoid long lines.  Early afternoon is usually best.  We're Gold mLife members so we get to bypass that main line which helps.  

The casino is very fun, and if I play smartly - I can usually win!  I can't say that for other casinos.  Now I say 'play smartly' because not every slot will pay off, and it's not consistent, but I've held my own on several trips.  They tend to have great machines and keep up with the new ones.  Dealers are always friendly and helpful.  Table min's are a little high, but unfortunately, the days of $2 blackjack are over.  

The rooms are great.  The hallways can be a bit long if you're at the end, but just request a room closer to the elevators.  They have an honor fridge, but not one for your personal use, although I'm sure you could request one.  Bed and pillows are super comfy (a huge plus for me).  

For shows, you can't beat LOVE, Terry Fader, and Boys II Men.  Great line up!  

Their buffet, Cravings, has been a favorite for years (see other review).  I try to go around 10:25ish when it's still breakfast and eat slowly as lunch gets set.  Self-serve drinks is a nice touch.  

Location is great.  Walk straight across the street to Harrah's or Venetian.  Next door is Caesars.  Use the side door by BURgr (I think that's the name) and it a quick hop which is important when it's 114 outside.  

Like all casino's, you have some hit and misses with people.  Some are great, others could use a little more polish and friendliness (people in the store Essentials come to mind), but overall this casino has become our Vegas home.

Very disappointed to leave a sad review because this used to be my favorite hotel and casino. My girlfriends and I had an annual Vegas vacation and stayed here a few times, always leaving with smiles and great memories....not this time. My hubby didn't want to stay here to begin with and now we won't be back (one of my girlfriends also came with us and also had a poor experience). 

Highlights: LOVE by Cirque du Soleil, Private Reserve Pool (sort of), security staff and housekeeping friendliness

Opportunities: Check-in, rooms, restaurant options, casino, cleanliness

I had reserved a Mirage Suite a few months ago, checked in online the day before arriving and still had a terrible check-in experience. We planned to arrive after check-in time so we could go directly to our rooms. My friend got her email that her room was ready before we even got to the hotel. The check-in line was way too long so I was glad to have done online check-in but didn't have my email so went to mobile check-in desk. The guy at the desk didn't have a great attitude and proceeded to tell me that they only had accessible suites left and it would be ready within an hour. I told him that I didn't reserve or want an accessible room but he gave me no options and said I would receive an email within an hour. We went and waited for the email in The Still. 1.3 hours later I still had no email and went back to the desk where there was now a woman. I told her how displeased I was and asked about my room (I was not rude or loud or bitchy). She found a regular Mirage Suite that was immediately available and said she put a $50 beverage credit on my account. 

Upon entering room it was warm and dark. We turned down the temp but it took about two days to cool off to a comfortable point. I couldn't tell if the bathrooms were clean. Meaning, I didn't see obvious signs of uncleanliness, but it didn't feel clean. We did like that there was a fridge in the suite for us to keep food or drinks we purchased elsewhere and The separate sitting area is nice. The shower could be larger and the furniture could be in better shape. We did love the complimentary slippers.

My friend was in a regular room. She found hair in her bathtub when she was going to take a bath the first night. She also said it didn't feel super clean. She didn't have complimentary slippers.

Room Service is much more limited than it was last time we were here. A very limited portion of the Pantry menu is available. Some other restaurants offer takeout but you have to go down to order and take it. The restaurant options are very limited and pretty disappointing. Go take a look at my reviews of Stack, The Pantry, The Still, LVB and Carnegie Deli. The nicer restaurants are hidden away and not really advertiseso didn't entice us to try them.

The pool wasn't as clean as it used to be. But I still prefer the Private Reserve for the comfy chairs and umbrellas, along with random fruit and essence water. Waitress was friendly but was surprised that "last call" was just after 3. 

Casino was VERY DIRTY! The video machines were covered in ashes and sticky stuff. The chairs were burned up. The ceiling looked gross. It was super dark in there, probably so you couldn't see all the dirt and dinginess. I would suggest putting rolls of paper towels and windex around for guests to clean their machines. Several times I just gave up on the casino bc it grossed me out. 

Overall this is not what it used to be. We will be selecting a different resort when we return.

Great check in experience. Resort Tower rooms have an awesome pool view or city view depending on what you ask for. They certainly try to accommodate you. I had a pool view and it's really cool, I was able to see the dolphins from where I was at & my friends had the city view which was also pretty impressive. Rooms are clean and spacious. It's pretty close to lots of shops but it's a bit of a walk from the rooms to the parking lot, which was the only downside. Will definitely be coming back!
Still my favorite place on the strip. Has the best food choices and the place is always hopping. Also closet self parking garage that takes you right into casino.

My first stop in Vegas was my hotel, the Mirage. 

A note on my hotel selection: I selected the Mirage for my first trip to Vegas because I wanted 1) to stay someplace nice and classy 2) near my conference at the Venetian, but not as expensive as the Venetian or the Pallozzo, and 3) that wouldn't be positively crawling with kids. No offense meant to anyone of any age. This is why: if you've been to Disney World much, you know there is a different atmosphere between the All Star resorts and the Beach and Yacht Club. I'd heard Vegas was similar, so I opted to stay at the Mirage. Please note that I like kids just fine and that my conference was for educators... and we generally don't want to see kids over the summer. Lol! 

I ended up with a nice-sized corner room on the 5th floor of the Mirage and I loved it! I did have a discounted rate that made my stay more affordable, but I'd spring for it in a heartbeat even without the discounted rate, and even with the $30\/day amenities fee. The Mirage isn't the only one with that fee - apparently most or all of the major hotels do it. Annoying.

This is the hotel the Griswolds stayed at in Vegas Vacation. Yes, that did factor into my choice. Remember the long directions at the beginning? Well, I received a short set of directions: walk to the phone booth and then turn and walk straight back until you see the elevators. The path isn't straight and it splits, so I walked with some uncertainty, but I got to the elevators easily enough.
