As I had a corner room, my room was all the way a t the end of the hall. It was worth the commute. My room had an exceptional view. I had an extra-large (king) bed, a TV, and a little refrigerator. Home Alone references aside, I have only good things to say about the room, from the attractive toiletries to the light-up mirror vanity mirror on the bathroom wall. 

I ordered room service the first night because I didn't feel like going out but I did feel like eating in a fancy manner. I ordered a macaroni and cheese that was about $19. It was huge. I could have eaten just that for three meals. It tasted good, but I wouldn't order it again. There was a special - order an entre and get a glass of house wine for $4. When I called to order, I planned on getting the white wine over the red, because I thought sweet wine would be difficult to get out of my MO wine country and I can tolerate dry whites better than dry reds. Imagine my surprise when I heard that the red wine was on the sweet side! It was pretty good. By the time my food and beverage came (about an hour after I ordered them), I was unwound to the point that I had to force myself to finish my meal. With the $4.50 room service fee, tax, and dip, my meal cost over $30. I was glad that they had been out of the Nutella ice cream I'd wanted to order - I wouldn't have had much appetite for it after the mac and cheese and it would have put my bill at over $40. Maybe that's not bad for Vegas, but I didn't order room service again. 

I gambled in two casinos while in Vegas, and I had better luck at the Mirage than at the MGM Grand. I thought the casinos would overwhelm me in terms of size, but the Mirage didn't. I went in a few other casinos and hotels during my 3 days and nights in Las Vegas and I have to say that the Mirage's dcor is refreshing after seeing several hotels more ornately decorated and initially more impressive (Caesar's, The Venetian, the Palazzo, the Bellagio, etc.). Someone told me she thought the Mirage looked a little outdated from the outside, but she'd heard good things. The Mirage perhaps looks dated on the outside, but I wouldn't call it OUTdated at all. Photos will communicate this best. 

The pools in Las Vegas close at 6 or 7 p.m. At first I was bummed that I couldn't go for a dip my first night, but instead I just arrived at the pool shortly after its 8 a.m. opening. As I went in the morning, it wasn't super hot, so I mostly just sat by the side of the pool and tried not to get a sunburn. The pool is large and positively gorgeous, with rocks and waterfalls in a couple of places. Many chairs surround the pool. The hot tub is near the pool, but seems far away because you have to take a little walk to get there and it's surrounded by plants. The hot tub is pretty large, too. A kid did a little swimming in it. Okay, I followed suit. 

Check in and out were both easy and brief. I did check out at a kiosk. The only things that would have improved my stay were lower prices (perhaps waive the amenities fee every third night) and to have the pool open until 10 p.m. or so. But it's a different world in Vegas, and aside from loss of revenue gambling, I imagine the clientele might not be such good swimmers. Anywho, I wholeheartedly recommend the Mirage and would certainly stay there again. 

I will also be reviewing The Mirage's Pantry restaurant, Essentials store and Beatles LOVE show. 

P. S. The volcano eruption is awesome!

When you go to a casino,  you place a lot of trust that they are treating you fair.   When it comes to gambling,  it's usually hard to tell if they are being fair, so you have to look at other things,  like how they treat their guests generally.   Here is an example of not just unfairness,  but downright fraud.   The Mirage has a restaurant and bar called The Still.  To draw you in,  they hand out discount cards to get you to come in but they don't honor them.  When you dispute it,  they threaten to call security.  The discount scam is a typical two for one drink card, which we took along with another couple who had them too. 

We ordered two beers and two mixed drinks.  They tried to charge us for both mixed drinks.  The so called
manager states "he can do whatever he wants".   You have to wonder if The Mirage let's these guys pull this within their premises,  what else are they allowing to go on? 

I would stay away from this place

I came here for my daughter's cheer competition and I've never felt like I've been taken and  taking advantage of before in my life customer service really isn't customer service here when you're dime a dozen I have no other choice but to stay here 12\/16\/16   


What a poor ass response from ur hotel. It's not about keeping customers anymore Lori. !  Back in the day u guys would have done something to make my stay alittle better and gave or comped  alittle something to make ur customer feel as they were first priority. ! Thanks again ! For a poor ass response !

Randomly decided to make a stop in Vegas from our trip to California. It was a very nice hotel and rooms were very comfortable. However I deducted a star for the inconvenience and rudeness of front desk clerk who did not help us with accommodating our room mix of for 2 beds instead of one. After requesting to speak to manager of course she gave us the room we needed. I would stay here again.

ehh for the price i think this place is okay, and doable its not the most luxurious but its better than monte carlo

theres some scuffs on the wall and stuff which takes away from the look but its still good! i recommend this if your going to vegas on a budget, if you got the cash then go to BELLAGIO!!!

Just got home from a 3 night stay at the Mirage. The room was cleaned very well, bed and pillows were comfortable. (now wishing I had those pillows at home.) Service at the front desk and the concierge was wonderful. The buffet was very appetizing, especially because beer and wine was included. The pool area was nice. However, Wish it would have been open later. Overall, very nice experience. Would be interested in coming again.

Throughout my 5 day stay here, I was locked out TWICE because THEIR lock was broken. I called the front desk using my phone to tell them that my card key was not working and that I was locked outside my room. They had told me that they would send someone up to my room and that it would take about 10 minutes or so for them to come up. 10 minutes passed, and then 15, and another 20.  I was sitting outside my room for a whole hour frustrated out of my mind because I was on a time constraint. In the end, the person they supposedly sent never came, but luckily for me, I had a friend staying at a suite on the 19th floor. When I came back a couple hours later, we went straight to the guest services to tell them again what happened and they moved us to a different room while they jumped the lock and got our things for us.

Two day after the incident,  I requested room cleaning three times within the same day, and every time we got back to our room (after two or three hours) it was not clean. Called them up another time to express my frustration with their services and they apologized and they finally sent someone up to clean our room. 

After my experience here, my advice to you is to stay at another hotel\/casino. The service here is terrible.

My husband, myself, our 10 yr old daughter and our 18 month old were staying at The Mirage Thursday- Monday for a wedding that was being held there for a family member. Months before the wedding we were given links for "special wedding discount pricing". We went online and we're quoted and then called and we're quoted. When calling we saved $400 dollars. 

We rented a car when we got to Vegas so we wouldn't have to take a cab with our 18 month old. We chose valet parking which was about $20 every time we pulled the car out.

Check in took about 30 minutes. We were on the 14th floor. When we got to our room the carpeted floors were filthy. They were not vacuumed at all and the bathroom was worn down and gross. We requested a crib which they brought up almost immediately. The crib was a travel size not a full size and there were no fitted crib sheets which we were told they offer. We were given a regular bed sheet to use for the crib and the bell hop walked out. 

We decided to go to Cravings buffet. It wasn't busy at all but there was a 20 minute wait to get in. It had separate sections like Asian, Latin, American, make your own omelette. Wine and beer were included in the price. The food was just ok. The best part of the buffet came about an hour after we ate. I became so sick I didn't think I would be able to leave the bathroom the whole trip. Don't go to Cravings. 

There is a place called Essentials that is a gift shop\/mini CVS where Pepto & ginger ale was able to be purchased. It also carries alcohol, snacks and other items. 

The Pantry is open 24 hours which was nice because the 3 hour time difference sucked for the kids. They were able to eat on their normal schedule, which was 4am Vegas time and our server was great. 

The casino wasn't bad, but it was super smoky. My lungs hurt after an hour of playing and drinking. One thing that irritated me was the smell of air freshener vs actually ventilating the smoke. Caesars Palace wasn't bad to walk through when we visited and it smelled fresh even though a ton of people were smoking. 

The pool was ok. It was really really cold even though it was in the 90s our entire stay. They offer towel service for free and have a shop outside so you can buy sunscreen, sunglasses, hats, bags and so on. 

The food & drink girls were nice and brought everything really fast. Please be aware that if you use a debit card to book your room you can not use it to room charge anything. All room charges must be done on a credit card. We also got a cabana for the day. Cabanas have TVs, fans, water, soda, snacks and a fruit tray in the fridge. Life jackets are available for kids at zero charge. 

Housekeeping was terrible. While they work 24\/7 and there were always 5-6 carts on the floor at any given time they never came to our room, and no, we didn't have the "Do not disturb" sign out. We had to either call for maid service or ask one of them directly. Pain in the ass when you have to dispose of diapers and need towels. 

Checkout process was ok. The TV checkout process was not working for anyone so we had to call which wasn't a big deal. 

Our floor was super loud and noisy. It would of been nice if family's stayed on certain floors because hearing people yelling "Have you seen Mike Hunt" and running up and down the halls banging on random doors made me want to kill them. This happened all 4 days & nights. It was never quiet.

We went to the Mirage to see a performance of Cirque Du Soliel.  A performer was injured at the end of the show they announced everyone would be refunded admission.  The Mirage reneged and sad it was a mistake.  They never posted on their website anything to tell you how the performer was.  While the accident happened at the end of the performance, it was a very bad way to leave the event.  Hard to watch someone carried off on a stretcher and feel good.  I wrote an email to the Mirage and they called back nearly a week later and said they would arrange for us to see the show another time.  That is rather odd since many of the people attending were probably like us and visiting Las Vegas.  Some times there are things that happen that show the true colors of a place.  The Mirage makes a mistake and then does not stand by what was announced.  For us that is a very sad statement about a place that makes a lot of money and will not honor what they say.  Sad comment on society and a reflection on a hotel and casino and in a way on Las Vegas.

Stayed here with some sorority sisters. I didn't pay or contribute to paying because of a hook-up, so my evaluation does not include value. 

Pools: They're alright. The beach club "bare" was literally empty. It has a strange scene. Really empty, and the bar tender wasn't particularly good. We got a bunch of free drinks though, haha.
Good bang for the buck. Great staff. Middle of the strip. Mixed group. Not a new property but it's not outdated by any means overall. Would come back

Gave this iconic place a try and we were surprised. The rooms are very modern and clean, service was good and they host some of the best shows on the strip. Met Bill Engval and Terry Bradshaw there and it was a great time. View from the top floors in awesome. Would recommend for a budget trip Vegas

The Mirage deserves 5 stars for their outstanding customer service this weekend. So a friend and I flew in and right away checked in. However, not noticing the check in was past dated for the 6th and we arrive the 16th was very unusual. So we missed our check in and was very disappointed that we didn't know. However, Crystal guide us through the whole process and what to do. She made a few calls which in then we spoke what was the problem. She was very patient and most importantly very welcoming. Knowing that we were at least there for a hour she made us feel like nothing was wrong. Indeed, the people on the phone were able to give us a room in which the price was decreased because of the Inconvenience. I just want to thank everyone at The Mirage for a good stay and especially Crystal for making us feel wanted and comfortable! Excellent service!

I stayed here for my friend's birthday back in April.  We got adjoining rooms, both with two queen beds.  The rooms were all the way down the hall which kind of sucked when we came stumbling back in the wee hours of the morning.  There was plenty of space, so we had lots of room to throw our stuff around.   The beds were nice and comfy with fluffy pillows.

The only complaint I have is with the a\/c unit.  It worked fine until we all went to sleep.  We think there was some motion sensor because it seemed like it shut off once everyone stopped moving.  We would wake up every now and then because it got so stuffy, and once we moved, the a\/c turned back on.  

The pool here was pretty nice, but we got there too late to get a good spot.  We were only able to snag two lounge chairs at first, so we hit the pool and ordered drinks.  There's nothing better than waking up and having a Bloody Mary for breakfast!

The Mirage now has a phone check in- u get a email and follow the steps it confirms your check in and beats waiting in a long line. However nice clean hotel. 
The volcano show sucks- it last for about 5 mins and that's it- nothing spectacular, might be cool for little kids to see fire erupting. Overall beautiful hotel, good service make sure to get a M life card and if you qualify for a M life master card - your upgraded with points and discounts because now you get the silver M life, there's a gold M life to- but you have to earn it.  If your here you must see the love show - now that's a wonderful show for any age.
This review is exclusively for Jamie in the business center! I had a work emergency and he really saved my day! Thank you Jamie! The Mirage is lucky to have you!

Stayed here to celebrate my 21st, it was a great experience all around! All staff is incredibly friendly, the hotel is beautiful and clean, and all that the location has to offer on its property is a blast! This is where my parents always stay, and this is where I'd recommend for others to stay as well!

I'll definitely return next time I'm in Vegas! My only complaints are:
1. For the amount they charge, they really should offer free wifi access to guests.
2. The prices at Bare (the Adult pool party) were a bit high. I'm from NY so I'm no stranger to the cost of things but c'mon, $50\/bed...that's a bit much!
Other than that, I have no qualms. I'm a stickler for cleanliness and they definitely lived up to my standards. Staff was friendly, casino was awesome (I won $2000!), great time all around!

Overall: 4.5 stars.  Needs more space at the pool and to get rid of that stupid resort convenience fee (if i'm paying $15\/day i expect more than a 50 cent newspaper (that i never got) and slow-ass wireless internet).  

Location- great.  you're next to Caesars which has fantastic shopping and a block\/hotel away from the mall.  Across from Venetian and close to the Wynn.

Pool: nice. oh, and no more slide (definite downside).   a little hard to get seats but if you walk around you can.  The Cafe in the pool area is fantastic- service and foodwise.  They accommodated our large family (20 persians!) and were really great about getting all our orders correct.

Service: at restaurants, great.  Reception- meh.  I waited 20 minutes behind this stupid couple who asked 20 questions that should have been addressed to the concierge.  The woman didn't apologize, but she did give me a room on one of the higher up floors that was facing the pool.

Rooms: MODERN!  I love their remodeling updates.  Freakin' gorgeous and comfortable.  Downside- the doors you have to really shut (like hold the hand til you hear the click) and they're a bit thin... definitely heard some hanki panki two doors down.

Noise- overall no problems until there was a concert til 3 AM on Saturday night.  Typically no prob, but i was exhausted and needed to catch an early flight, so that was a bit annoying... 

Clubs: disliked Jet.  The outdoor Rhumbar was awesome though.

I played craps for a couple hours at the Mirage.  I had more fun the previous two nights at playing at Binion's and at Planet Hollywood.  Three nights of gambling and I broke even.  The problem at the Mirage appears to be burned out employees. There was a palpable level of disdain emanating from the craps table workers.  One employee bragged he'd worked there 10 years but to me, seemed to hate the customers and players.  These gentlemen should retrain and find new careers maybe?  Other tables at other casinos were joyous, the personnel helpful and positive. 
My cousins hung at the bar while we played.  My husband said the service was disdainful there.  We all tip well and have good jobs, so it isn't us. 
Later
 that evening I went to another table at Mirage and one employee was great, so it's not all of them.
I have to recommend crap lessons at Planet Hollywood.  I lost some money there after but that's just the roll of the dice sometimes.
I have to recommend Beatles' Love show--fantastic!

Big hotel, you can have a double room ( 2 double beds ) for 80$ , just ask , we never know... They have too much rooms to left empty... many restaurants inside this big building, casinos , stores, spa , gardens, pool etc ... seems clean and very BUSY !! I like it. The SPA cost 30$ for all day.

I just had a girls weekend in Vegas! It was all three of ours first time there! We were so excited to finally be going to Vegas!! We stayed at The Mirage hotel and casino. 

The check in staff were ok. Not super friendly. It was memorial weekend and the line was long so I'm sure they just wanted to check people in super fast, but it made me feel like I was in a cattle drive or something. Funneling us all into the long line to quickly process us and send us to our room. Not very friendly and not the best first impression. 

The room was very old feeling. You can tell this is an older hotel with very few upgrades. Our bathroom looked like it had mold in some of the caulking around the shower (gross). And there was some of the wallpaper\/paint or something missing in the bathroom as well. There are stains on the floors in the bathroom as well. 

The windows were very dirty no don't know if they ever clean them. And it just felt like you were staying in an old best western or something. Not like a famous nice hotel in the Las Vegas strip! So that was disappointing. 

EVERYTHING costs extra! You want late check out? That costs extra. You want a refrigerator in your room? That costs extra. We were afraid to ask for extra pillows for fear they might charge us more! I guess that's just Vegas though. 

Drinks are super expensive (also just a Vegas thing I guess). Poolside pina colada with barely any booze will run you $16 a piece. The Starbucks in their lobby has definitely inflated their pricing! My usual $3.15 drink cost me $8- no joke! And it makes me mad that there aren't coffee pots in your room! Seriously! We are already spending enough you can't just give us one free cup of coffee?

We went to the concierge to ask for ideas on what to do in Vegas since we had never been. She was not friendly and not helpful. Of course she first suggested that we stay at The Mirage and hit up all the restaurants there. We said we were looking for a happy hour which she did not help us find. We found one on our own at the Bellagio (Check out Harvest! $7 drinks and bites to eat!). 
 
The nicest people at this hotel were the valet. So friendly and so fast. Always smiling and very helpful. So I liked them. 

Lastly, my friend booked her room through Hotwire and the room was on her credit card. We did not use anything from the minibar and brought a lot of our own snacks and booze. She checked out and everything looked good on her bill. The next day SHE GOT CHARGED $1200!!!! They tried to charge her for the the room AND a $126 minibar fee! Are you kidding me?! She called and finally got it all sorted out. 

TWO DAYS LATER THEY DID IT AGAIN! Ran her card for $700!! And then they even did it a freaking third time! SO WATCH OUT FOR THEM STEALING YOUR MONEY AND RUNNING YOUR CREDIT CARD WITHOUT AUTHORIZATION. 

The worst part to me is the headache she had to go through to get her money back. The Mirage was not helpful and not really apologetic for it. And she had to cancel her credit card once she finally got the money returned to it for fear that they might run her card again. CHECK YOUR CREDIT CARD STATEMENTS! MAKE SURE THIS DOESNT HAPPEN TO YOU. 

We will definitely never be staying at The Mirage again.

Not a secure place....used ATM there and got identity stolen.  This was the only place we used our card.  After contacting the Mirage....they said "what do u expect us to do about it"?  Really...that's how much u care about ur patrons.  Won't be back after that!  They wouldn't even help with a police report.

Terrible consideration!

**For standard room only**

Everything is really clean, no odor, and would definitely stay here again. Staff is super friendly and helpful. What makes this even more awesome is I got it for free. I play the my vegas app on my phone and used my point to her this room!

I highly recommend visiting the Spa & Fitness Center. There is a package offered where you get a training session AND a massage. Derris was my trainer and he was very educated and we did some really awesome strength training; and having a trainer here in SD, I feel that I am familiar with a lot of techniques and versions. He was solid, provided me with a great work out and educated me on a few methods to try here at home in the gym. Patrick was my masseuse and he was also a good guy, who did a really good job with a deep tissue. I left feeling stronger and relaxed all in a few hours.  If you're looking to doll it up, I would recommend visiting Lisa in the Spa. She did all of our make up one evening and she's not only a doll, but she did such an awesome job. We all felt so beautiful for our night out on the town.  Mirage may be an older resort, but the employees I had encounters with during my stay were 5 star in my book.

This hotel is beautiful . It has so many wildlife features throughout the hotel. From the front desk, it has a large aquarium behind the front desk. it also has a large atrium with many trees, different types of exotic plants and flowers. In case you didn't know, the Mirage is one of the hotels that Steve Wynn had created, but then it was bought out and now its part of MGM Resorts International.

The hotel has about 16 different eateries ranging from casual to fine dining, including restaurants like Heritage Steakhouse, California Pizza Kitchen, BLT Burger, Starbucks, and a buffet. But my absolute favorite part was the shows. They have the Beatles Love Cirque du Soleil which has the only official Beatles store. Terry Fator as well has his own theater where he performs in, and it looks like they use that same theater for different comedian performances. 

Its also connected to the Treasure Island so they have a tram that takes you back and forth between both hotels. The pool area looked beautiful and even had a large waterfall u can bathe under. Make sure you also check out the Secret Garden and Dolphin habitat which is basically like mini zoo and a dolphin tank.

I've stayed at the mirage 4 times now and I have no complaints. From the front desk, to the house keeping, to the pool, and the pool staff. It's always a pleasure to stay here. We will be back!

P.S. The Beatles Show is outstanding!
Not a very good hotel.  I would not recommend using their spa.  Not worth the extravagant money.

The Mirage is one of the landmark casinos of Las Vegas and it's easy to understand why. This place is beyond awesome - especially if you go during an "off season" time.

I will warn you that I'm not much of a gambler, so I can't really comment on how good the games are here, or whether they ripped me off and stole all my money. I'm one of those types who only pretends to play when the waitress comes around taking drink orders and throwing a dollar or so at her for bringing it back to me. Because to me, that's what Vegas is really about... getting wasted for free. That and walking around the sidewalk with countless number of alcoholic drinks in my hand. This town is awesome.

Our reservation for the piddly lowest suite was somehow upgraded to one of the nicer King suites for no extra charge... which might give me a slight bias in my high rating of the Mirage. This room was something else, I've got to admit - and this was before they had done all the remodeling, so I'm anxious to go back and see what the new stuff looks like. The bathroom area alone was bigger than my entire apartment in Los Angeles. And that see-thru shower with the tub facing it? Yeah... nice touch, somebody. You can actually see a video tour I did of our suite with my digicam if you're so inclined on YouTube. Scope it out at: http:\/\/www.youtube.com\/watch?v=PV7Vkr2VT74 if you're interested.

Everything was totally on point and comfortable as hell. The only thing I would complain about would be getting lost in the casino... but that happens everywhere because all these damn places are so friggin' huge. Being drunk to the point of idiocy (just like most of the tourists my age) doesn't seem to help very much either.

So maybe the Mirage is getting an unfairly high rating from me from just having an overall awesome experience in Vegas. I didn't really interact with the staff, I didn't gamble in the casino, but the waitresses were on time with the drink delivery and quick, and the couch I ended up sleeping on was right up there with the most comfortable couches I've slept on. Way to go, Mirage!

Could there be better places to stay in Vegas? Yeah, I'm sure there are. But this wasn't a bad experience and with the free upgrade to the better suite, it was a value well worth our money (at least I think so). The Mirage has proven to me that Vegas is one hell of a kick-ass town. That's for damn sure, son.

There's a few things about The Mirage, but overall I really enjoyed my stay here.

I was here for 2 nights, a Sunday and Monday, with my mom and sister. We requested a non-smoking room but had concerns about the smell anyway, since smoking is still allowed in the casino. For $20\/night, we were able to upgrade to an "executive" room that wasn't a whole lot bigger than a standard, but definitely worth it. It was clean and smelled just fine (good in fact) and had a really nice bathroom with a walk in shower and jacuzzi bath tub.

The casino is a little meh. It seems oddly outdated and it's very, very smoky. Just walking through it, the smell of cigarette smoke is a little overpowering.

Overall, The Mirage is a nice choice for a stay in Vegas, particularly for it's central location on the strip. Make sure to see Beatles Love while you're here!

Booked a weekend stay during memorial weekend for adjoined rooms. We paid extra to check in at 10am but when we got to the rooms we noticed they weren't adjoined so we had to go down and wait until 3pm. Their rooms do not provide a coffee maker or microwave. A mini fridge is available but to rent for $40\/night. The comforter didn't have a duvet cover so it's wrapped between sheets. Def not as fancy as I expected. We had to request housekeeping to clean our room the second day because they skipped our room and then skipped it again the next day. My vehicle was oversized and could not use valet but they have a shuttle\/limo that picks you up at the oversized parking. As far as the hotel goes it's nice and the staff is friendly. There are plenty of places to eat and play. Overall a good stay.

Front desk a nightmare but other staff like house cleaners are pleasant.  Linens left out all day but not the housekeepers fault! I called front desk numerous times.  I was Suppose to have a view upgrade but checked in a non view upgraded room then after most of the day waiting for staff I was transferred to a moldy bathroom and almost non functional av as the upgrade then front desk girl refused to let me return to the room I felt more comfortable.  Because" we're not going to move you again " Talking to managers didn't make a difference,  wanted the love this place but no follow through ! A VIP was helpful.  Dolphins were great but I didn't like the Tigers in small cages! The Beatles LoVE show and the box office guy was super nice but they don't work for Mirage.  Very professional and beautiful production.  I wish the hotel had equal standard of excellence.  Mirage needs to get off there high horse.  Food mediocre and way over priced.  Save your money for the show.  Starbucks was great. BLT served me a burnt burger I ordered medium.  Pool has too much chlorine but nice atmosphere.  Lifeguards are nice.  I should have been comped the first night.

Wow! So all I can say is that I was thoroughly impressed with my most recent stay at the Mirage Hotel & Casino! Talk about receiving world class customer service! I recently booked just a one night stay and upon arriving I was greeted by a friendly gentleman in training at the Vip MLife members line. My expectations where exceeded by far! The check in process was easier than ever! I booked a king room on a high floor and boy was it worth it! The views in the towers facing the strip are breath taking! Watching the fire show outside of my window was fantastic! All the amenities were very nice as well as the bed was extremely comfortable! I would definitely stay here again!

The room that we stayed in is no longer good condition, carpet is dirty especially the bathroom tub. Any treats that was on the bar in your room, if you removed them and didn't put it back within 30seconds you have to pay for it. The outside line call will cost you $12.95 even if a missed call.  Getting free buffet when we booked our hotel per stay is misleading.  You have to pay extra at the end so u better be careful.  The pool water is cold not warm not good for kids. The reception who assisted us was kinda rude... If I didn't ask for the manager she will not give me back my reimbursement.  I would not recommend this hotel.

Flew out to Vegas to celebrate Elite Yelper Darren804's birthday.  Booked rooms at the Mirage and agreed that we would try the $20 trick.

I decided to check in later since my stuff was still in the car, but noticed a buddy was already checking in.  Walk on over just to check out the status.

Buddy:  Dude. Check in, now.
Me:  Naw man, it's cool. I'll check in later.
Buddy:  No really, you should check in now.
Me: Naw, I'll just do it later.
Buddy: DUDE.  Check in, NOW.

Got the hint and proceeded to check in.  Didn't ask for anything special, just told the man working the front desk to put me near my buddy.

Got the room keys.  25th floor.  Not bad.  Really not bad when your elevator requires a room key and only has two choices: 24 or 25.  Hot damn.  No stopping at every god damn floor just to get to yours. Sweet mamma.

Not a bad upgrade at all:  plasma tv, blinged out bathroom, complimentary bottle of champagne and one sweet ass view of the city.

For the good man that took care of us at check-in:  We thank you kind sir, we salute you!
After all these years the mirage is still doing it, don't be afraid to stop in and check it out, offers everything from comedy shows to fine dining and everything in between.
Great location, decent prices and great customer service. I stay here all the time. Nothing extremely fancy, it's just right!

I received a phone call from a member of the Mirage Guest Experience Team regarding an email I sent them that was pretty much a carbon copy of my review.  He was very apologetic, and cared that we did not have a good experience.  I was not trying to get a free future stay, and was not offered one, but an incentive was dangled.  I appreciated the call.  We will give the Mirage another try.  So many people can't be wrong.  Thank you to Tyler for caring about the experience of your guests.

Stayed the past week; we were excited cause we received one of the newer remodeled rooms. The room's decor was super nice, the only problem was that you can hear whenever someone walked by our room or when our neighbor opened\/closed thier door. The staff was super friendly and especially the host at bare. He gave us a tour of bare before it opened.

Beautiful hotel and LOVELy bedding and surroundings I would have easily given this hotel a 5star review, but the housekeeping staff sucked, and really needs to learn how to clean.  Nothing personal but ain't nothing like a good latina or filipina housekeeper!  NUFF said!

stayed here for my one year anniversary. got to the room and discovered they put us in a room with two queen beds. how romantic...took us about half an hour to get into another room with one bed (what i originally booked for). i really wanted a smoking room and they claimed that they were all out but will be willing to move us to one the next day. great, now i cant smoke for one day in my room and i cant unpack because id have to wake up early pack up all my stuff and check back into another room. we checked later that first night to see what time was best to call them to see what time to check out and call for the new smoking room. they said between 12-3pm. fine. we called them at 1pm the next day and they said to us oh dont worry about it just stay in that same room and u can smoke in it now., we'll just fog it out when ur checked. WTF....couldnt u have just done that the first time??? it wasnt like i just asked once. when we checked in we asked 3 different ppl. when we got to our room with two beds we asked again. we came again that night to check another time. sigh** oh and when im on vacation i enjoy a nice bath since my bathroom at home is only a standing shower. low and behold my bathtubs drain did not stay plugged up to even draw a bath. great. awesome. cool. never again mirage...never again

Came here for a cheer competition but was not able to stay in the rooms.  However had to review what I did see. 

1.  This hotel smells fantastic.  I don't know what it is but wow.  Not the usual smoky stale smells.  Just a little humid near the water falls.  
2.  Beautiful hotel.  Loved the xmas dcor.  Great job. 
3.  Convention center is huge.  Give yourself a good half hour to walk there from the front of the hotel. 
4.  I swear these were the cleanest nicest bathrooms I have seen so far in a public facility. 
5.  No food courts and a ton of lines with the places there were.  a lot of bars and places for adults but this is not a kids hotel. Thank god for the yogurt place that kept all the kids fed during the competition.

This was a nice place to stay.  The rooms have recently been renovated and were very nice and new and comfortable.  The bathroom was a little small but the rest of the room was pretty big.  The beds were super comfortable.  I have two main complaints: the walls are very thin and you can hear a lot of noise from the hallway and everything that someone might be doing in the bathroom (note to self: always bring earplugs), and they messed up our comps so it took forever to check out and get it right.  They also charged us for something at the pool bar that we never had (we didn't even go to the pool bar) and the girl at the desk just could not figure out how to remove it and correct the bill.  It was so frustrating that we finally gave up.  But, everything else was good.  Everyone was friendly from the baggage service people to the players' club people to everyone in the restaurants.  There are a few popular lounges and clubs in the Mirage (Jet, Revolution) so expect to see lots of clubby people running around.  Also, the pool at the Mirage draws quite a crowd and it provides excellent people-watching as scantily-clad people are parading along the edges of the casino to get to the pool.  The price was right to stay here (very reasonable) and I would definitely stay here again.
Beautiful hotel at very reasonable rate! The rooms were very clean and the beds were amazing to pass out in after a long night.  I would recommend and return in a heartbeat.

Worst hotel experience I have ever had. Our room was not cleaned by hospitality during our stay. The front desk said rooms are cleaned by request only. I requested the room be cleaned 3 times and was told they were too busy with people checking in.

Horrible rooms. My first one had a broken toilet. Waited 2 hours and still not fixed so I requested for room changes. The 2nd room's key didn't work. Took them another 30 minutest just to open the door. Never again.

Don't you just love it when you have a great night out. Have a great dinner and a show. Get to bed when the clocks are running late ( am the next day). Only to be woken by maintenance sawing, hammering, drilling in the room across the hall. As  a m life platinum member I am furious that maintenance feels compelled to apologize profusely only to permit the work to continue until I called again to stop the madness. Finally, magically they stopped.

I truly feel this hotel is the best for the money. The service is wonderful and I love the rooms. The hotel is very clean and not smoky. Plus they have the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in! We plan to stay her from now on when we visit every year.

I can't say anything about the food, the rooms, the shopping, or even what it looks like inside.

I always WIN when I play here.  I don't know what it is about this casino.  It just brings me luck.  Doesn't matter if the dealer is a mean mugging old Asian geezer or a sweet white lady with a super teased frizzy perm.  I always win.  Any business that puts money back into my wallet is 5 stars.

This is one of my favorite hotels on the strip.  The rooms are spacious and the location of the hotel on the strip is ideal (right in the center).  The staff is very nice and take good care of guests from the bellhop to the bartenders.  My only complaint is that the slot machines always take my money, but it is Vegas after all...

I stay here at a recent visit in Las Vegas. The hotel rooms are nice and space-y. However, our view sucks (it was basically all blocked off). Our room was at the end of the hall basically next to the fire exist. Every single time coming to and out of our hotel room was a long walk and the look of the hall make it even worse because it is all the same (visually make it seems like it was endless). Anyway, the stay here is nice. The staffs are very helpful. I like how the hotel was connected through Treasure Island with tram.

Another incident: I was waiting for my friend so I seated the branch outside of the bathroom beside the check-in area. I was tired, I closed my eyes for a bit and this lady that work there told me, "you cannot sleep here!" I was confused and I replied, "huh? I was only resting my eyes." So yes, they are not kidding, at a HOTEL, they do NOT want you to sleep, but if you drink, gamble, get all drunk and do all kind of things, that's fine. As long you don't sleep there. So I guess the staffs are nice, you just have to pick them well.

Also, at night when we get to our hotel room, the security guards there need to check your hotel room key card. Because we have other people in the room they told us we can go in to the hotel first with the key card and the other person can come back to the hotel later bypass the keycard check as long he is registered to the hotel room. We asked them twice to make sure that is the case. Later, when my friend attempted to go up, they won't let him go up! He has to walk to the check-in area to get another key card and called us to wake us up at 5AM.

I really like the Mirage for it contains an understated elegance in its rooms, setup, and casino \/ hotel that I have yet to find elsewhere.

I always get suckered into visiting the garden. Yes I pay for it every time except for when I get a free hook up from registration. I don't know what it is about it, it's just great.

The location of the Mirage is fantastic, they host LOVE which you can get a discount to if you stay with the hotel, which is fantastic, and the rooms are so comfortable, understated luxurious like I mentioned, and the new flat screen TVs are a great touch since everyone in Vegas seems to be getting in on that.

The Mirage, contrary to what I thought, was not old and run down at all. Perhaps it was because of the renovations they did, but either way it is way nicer than you think. The only thing I'm not too fond of is the club. They freely discriminate against men, so don't bring your significant others but do bring large groups of girls. Eh.

Horrible! We booked the penthouse suite 4 months ago for the Superbowl weekend and my bachelor party.  When we got there, they overbooked and gave away our suite.  They compensated by giving us free rooms next to each other and some credit towards the casino.  The next day, one of the rooms, the door wouldn't close all the way and somebody came in our room and stole all our friend's money.  This is the worst experience ever.  We called security and filed police report.  They didn't even have cameras on the floors.  So be careful, always make sure your door is closed behind you.  Apparently, it doesn't close all the way like the other hotels. Will definitely never come back here again.
Amazing hotel and pool and view and room and LOCATION  every thing else!! Just one thing they charge us the every single thing in the mini bar $500 not even what we paid for the stay
Fantastic experience, great room for a great promotional price! Excited to return, had a wonderful time playing cards and getting drinks! Definitely reccomend!

I've never actually stayed in the hotel (though I'm planning on it on my next trip).  I've only gambled here, and I love it.  Right down to the smell of the casino (yes, the smell).  And I always win money here.

The dealers are all very friendly and so too are the other gamblers.  I have run into many a sour dealer\/gambler in other casinos.  Never once here.

And this is the nicest casino I've found that ALWAYS has $10 blackjack tables (even during extremely busy holiday weekends).  Especially considering its location near Caesars, Venetian, Wynn, etc.  And I'm not talking continuous shuffle or single deck like you find at the other classy places around here for $10 min - this is real, 6 deck blackjack, dealt from the shoe.  They do use an auto-shuffler in between shoes, which doesn't really give you that break in play to go to the bathroom or buy some smokes.  But other than that minor gripe, this place has never done me wrong.
DO NOT GO TO THE "lobby bar" rude bartenders who charge overpriced drinks! Seriously $26 for REDBULL Vodka!!!

3.5 stars

Pros:
-Resort fee includes cardio center (treadmills, elliptical machines, stair machines and bikes) and wifi
-Great location on the strip
-Good places to eat (Carnegie Delicatessen, BLT Burger, Japonais, kokomo's). Even the room service food is good and available 24-7 (Chicken Pesto Classic Casar Salad, Pizza).
-Rhumbar is a great outdoor bar to kick back at.
-Complimentary Valet Parking (don't forget to tip)
-Rooms and decor are great.

Cons:
-Room service charges $3 per person dining
-Restaurants are not cheap. Even to go orders can be about $15 per person. Maybe a food court of some sort would be great.
-Complete is gym access is $28 per day. That's a bit excessive.

Some helpful info:
-11am check out. 12pm is complimentary, and any later checkout and they charge you a fee.
-Refrigerator are available with a per day fee.

Perfect spot on the strip. Good choice of restaurants inside the hotel, we tried The Pantry and LVB. Room was clean however we found multiple shirt\/jean size stickers stuck to the table legs from the previous guests. Additionally, the towels smelled of must and cigarettes. We used the express checkout which was very convenient however we could not find bell services to store out luggage while we waited for our flight. We asked 2 employees yet still found ourselves walking around the hotel trying to find it. I pulled up the online map and immediately realized it was outside of the hotel and not one of the employees stated to walk outside, very frustrating. I will try another hotel if we visit again.

Finally a new Vegas hotel to add to my list of places I've stayed.  Mirage is definitely one of the older ones, but still pretty nice.  

I booked this hotel on MLK weekend, normally a disastrous time to do so but I was able to use a promo code to get a room, on a SATURDAY, at $69\/night.  That's pretty much otherwise impossible on the strip; all other places were around $150\/night, including Excalibur.  Resort fee was about $34 with taxes.

The resort is a little smoky.  The room itself was fine; I liked the furniture and the amenities.  Shower was a little dated.  Bathroom accessories were fine.  Bed was comfortable and had plenty of pillows.  Hotel distance wasn't horrible from the elevators (although dragging around a 30lb 4 ft cardboard box that I had to bring to a show tomorrow made it annoying).  

The casino itself I hate but that's mainly because I have never won, ever, playing at Mirage.  This trip was no different.

I'm docking a star because there's not really any good vegan options for my GF.  We ended up having to go elsewhere to get something for her.  

Would I stay here again?  It's not really the top of my list, but if I can get it at the price I paid (vs let's say other hotels being double the price), definitely.  If I had a choice between Mirage and a CityCenter hotel and the CityCenter spots were only about 25% higher, I'd still go to the CityCenter.

This is where I stayed when I went to Las Vegas and the room is nice. We got a room with two beds and it was spread nice and neatly. The bathroom has shampoo, a soap bar for the face, and they provide towels. My complaint about this place is they only provide you with one toilet paper! Also in the morning at 5 am there was a loud alarm that awoke us for idk what reason it went on for about two minutes and I was irritated because I have a hard time sleeping again after awoken. I managed to sleep shortly after but the alarm went off stating the problem was resolved repeating the phrase three times before going off! I don't see why the warning went off if it doesn't pertain to us, but yeah the food in here is expensive!

Mirage was a great place to stay, staff was very courteous.  Rooms have a good layout, inexpensive due to getting 20% off on their specials on facebook.  The pool is really nice, but gets crowded on the weekends.  I hate the idea of having to pay $25 per chair to get to the other areas other than the main pool.  I should all be open, and then there would be enough chairs for most everyone to get sun.  Anyway, the beds were very comfy, rooms are nice, and we were high enough up to have a beautiful view of the strip.  Plenty of things to keep you busy here.  We also had our wedding reception here, and the staff was 5 stars all the way around.  Catering was unbelievable, reasonably priced, did everything that we asked for them.  The hotel does sneak in a $15 "resort fee"charge, per day,  on top of your regular room price).  You have to pay this upon checkout.  The resort fee is basically a sneaky fee that you pay to use the small cardio gym, pool, and internet.  So people that think they are getting free internet because the hotel is nice, are wrong.  I guess knowing that I would be using the internet, I would rather have it like this than actually having an option to pay for it, because if I had a choice, I would not pay the $12-15 fee for it, and be p'od that I have to pay for it.  I know, it doesn't make sense, but I didn't say I was rational.  Valet parking was very quick in getting my car everytime.  The only downside that there wasn't much action in the poker room at the Mirage.  Its the only game I play, and fortunately for me, The Venetian which is right across the road (and much more expensive to stay) and has a lot of action going on.  So it kept me pretty happy rather than having to drive to the Bellagio looking for a action packed poker game.

I remember a time when The Mirage was considered fancy...yeah, hubby and I stayed here on our first visit to vegas in '96 (yikes, that long ago??).  

Fast forward to 2017 and we were back reserving one of their 2 bedroom tower suites.

Pros:
Service, Service, Service.  Every staff member I interacted with (valet, bellman, maid, desk clerks), were friendly, courteous and seemed to enjoy their jobs.  WHAT?!  Management must treat their employees right!  (I noted that the bellman all did fist bumps as they passed one another).
I also love that this hotel is not a maze (unlike the Venetian) and I could easily find my way.
Conveniently has a FedEx shop 
Had no problems with internet
tvs had HDMI access 

Cons:
Rooms need updating; paint fading, cracks in wall etc.  Also, decor felt like I had stepped back to the '80's.  And I hated the screens on the windows.  I guess they block the sun, but it obstructs your view.
Room service has limited menu (i.e. yes on coffee, no on cappuccinos).

We had a very enjoyable visit!

My vacancy experience here was wonderful. The staff members that I encountered were very professional. Our house keeping was top notch and very friendly making our vegas experience more enjoyable. I stayed in one of the hospitality suites that had the in room pool table and bar which was a great way to kill time as the ladies got ready for dinner and the shows. Everything in our rooms stayed cleaned and our room service meals were delicious. I plan on staying again this summer.

They've got a tropical forest entrance for starters. You walk in and you take on a jungle atmosphere, mist of the waterfall and all. I love Kokomo's Steak and Seafood which is downstairs. At night, you can look outside your window and they have this dramatic volcano fire show, pretty awesome. Cute hotel and I fancy its location on the strip.

My boyfriend and i stayed at the mirage for two nights and absolutely loved it! The staff was super friendly, quick check in, crystal clean room, valet parking was easy as can be. the view was upgraded upon arrival so we had strip view and could watch dolphins swimming in the morning. the casino had a lot of classy people no bums. security was awesome and i felt really safe. cant wait until i stay there again!

Mirage is a good hotel. I got a room at a cheap price, and it came with a buffet credit at Cravings and 2 free tickets to the Habitat thing in the hotel, so I basically got my money's worth. I wanted to take a look at Bare, but there was no time to go swimming in the nude. The room was nice, surprisingly comfortable. For the price I paid, I wasn't expecting the bed to feel that good either. The volcano was still in its renovation period when I came recently. Can anyone tell me if it's better now than in the past shows?

let me bust one.....
It was cool! i'll keep it short and sweet,
not like MGM where it stank and reeked.
the room was roomy and the bathroom was small,
i didn't smell the cigarette smells at all.
the mirage, yup i'd stay there again.
and i'll even recommend it to a friend.
burppp, haahaa, burppp, burppp!

thank you all for coming out! god bless good nite!

We love staying here during Winter months (Mandalay or Bellagio during Summer) but we should definitely try them out during Summer too since their tropical pool is impressive. The Mirage is centrally located, within walking distance to numerous properties: Caesars, Venetian\/Palazzo, Wynn\/Encore, TI, & Fashion Show Mall.

Hotel: spacious modern room with all the ammenities you could hope for. 42in LCD w\/ functional media plug ins, powered work area, fridge, & rear lit vanities. The only thing drawback I could see is there is no separate shower & tub. Although, their villas are probably the best Vegas has to offer... check them out they're unreal.

Casino: everything you need... even though Mirage is one of the first massive Vegas casinos they've stayed with the times and updated their gaming floor. Nothing seems too dated and they keep with the theme nicely.

On-site restaurants: BLT Burger - amazing sliders & shakes. Carnegie Deli - the Woody Allen is a MUST for any pastrami & corned beef fan. BB King Blues Cafe - great service, tasty food, and lively bands. CPK - it is what it is. Rhumbar - great drinks, service, and outdoor lounge. Fin - pricey but awesome Chinese food if you're too lazy to drive down Spring Mt. Road. Kokomo's - perfect for that romantic\/special ocassion. I still have yet to try Samba (Brazillian Steakhouse), Stack, & their Buffet but is on the to-do list.

Overall it's great value for all it has to offer: rooms, location, ammenities, and if you sign up to their mailing list you'll get offers almost too good to be true. When you check in be sure to ask for any available upgrades. They'll usually place you in a higher room or one with a view of the pool or volcano.

Nice hotel and beautiful pool area.  The rooms are pretty decent.  We hit up the Cravings buffet for breakfast\/lunch and service was fantastic and the food was decent.  The breakfast food was fantastic; lunch was decent.  The sushi was very bland and full of rice.  The dessert was alright - the oreo cake was just hard and the gelato was mouth-watering.

Good hotel but got caught up with one of the most angry dealers ever. It was late night so I get that you don't want to be there; but really Mary you are the worst person I've ever met. Mad from step one; sorry you signed up to do a job you don't want but leave it at home. Could not get away from her table fast enough. Find so thing else to do. Nobody could be happy around you.

The air condition was not working so they gave us another room. The next room still as facing the west and warm.  We set the room temp to 60 but the room only got as low as 69 which still was not cold enough. The hotel did not have fans to provide air circulation they said we could go and buy one. And apologized for any problems.  Not the best service for the price we paid.  The room was just muggy for us.  Apparently the hotel has a way of monitoring movement in the room and change the room temp. Also the buffet meat was cold ham and beef. And when I asked Jose about the queso (hot melted cheese) he didn't know what I was talking about. Overall the food could have been better for 25.00 per person.  The only good thing was the bed.

Love love loved the poker room here! The boy and I played just a few hours on two separate nights, but found the action to be ridiculously soft and easy to make money!! The players are friendly, a good mix of aggressive young guns and super tight older folk, but they all seemed incredibly willing to call down to the river with a second best hand. Yay! The boy sat down to play a little blackjack on our final night and we won at least 10 hands in a row. I wish I got that dealers name because he needs one serious raise. He busted so many times though, its more likely he'll get fired.

Last time I visited Mirage was 2 years ago and had an exceptional experience. This time around , however , I cannot describe my experience anything close to satisfactory. To start of , we had to wait almost 30 mins inside our car because all bell boys were busy due to a 'high volume'. This wouldn't be a problem if I hadn't seen other guests getting serviced ahead of us even they arrived after. Anyways , after bringing up and complaining about the issue with the valet attendant, we were able to get help and get our stuff out of our vehicle. At the registration, we discovered that the room we were hoping to get were no longer available. We eventually got a room and once we got to the room the issues continued.

To start off the A\/C was off. Given that it was a 113 degree day, this made the room insufferable. I called to get our luggage so we could get some water to starve off the heat. However, the bell desk line was busy on multiple calls. I called he front desk to talk about these issues and was told that the AC being off was a feature and that all of their rooms had motion sensors that turned off the AC by itself if there wasn't any motion for 20 mins. She said other hotels were adopting this feature also. When I said that I stayed at the Venetian the previous night and that this feature wasn't present, the associate had no reply.

The room itself had issues. There was stains on a pillow and sheets. Given that these were white stains inside a Vegas hotel room, I'll let the reader use their imagination on what it could have been. The toilet was also a little annoying with the water splashing somewhat high when flushing.

We tried to get the car so we could make our dinner reservation, but the valet could not find the car because the valet person that parked the car did not enter a space number. The process took over 30 mins and I had to follow up with the valet multiple times to finally get the car.

We are staying here still until Tuesday and somewhat dreading what other annoyances Mirage has in store for us.
I'm a fan of the show LOVE at the mirage, but not so much of the cockroaches roaming around the garden... beware of this place, but watch the show LOVE... it's awsome !!!!

Had a room here for a friend's birthday, others in our group had a suite.  The location is great, and there's a Starbucks in the lobby.  The staff was friendly throughout the resort.  The place was ALWAYS clean.  I had low expectations, but I was pleasantly surprised.  The bathroom was on the small size, but we got GREAT rates, so we made it work

A. Central location to other hotels a plus
B. Flat escalator no longer there a minus
C. Buffet is killer
D. Rooms I stayed in were clean 
E. Pool was sweet
F. Casino is one of my favs

I will hit again.

I love this hotel.
Every year for the past 8 or so years, my dad's company convention was held in Las Vegas and he'd take us with him.
We always stayed at the Mirage and over the years it had grown into a magnificent hotel & casino!

When I was young, I didn't pay much attention to the decorations or the things I could do as an underaged kid.
But this year, I realized a lot has changed, for the good.

We eat our breakfast every morning at the Caribe Cafe and it's always hearty.

We loved their Noodle Kitchen but apparently it closed :(

Their set-up for the Cirque Du Soleil show LOVE looks groovy and fun! It's colorful and very artsy. 

The way the new Revolution bar\/club looks really attractive however, i didn't get to go inside because I was underage :(

The other restaurants here like Craving Buffet, Fin, Japonais, BLT burger, California Pizza Kitchen, etc. are also yummy!

The Craving buffet serves breakfast, lunch, and dinner.
For dinner it cost us $24.95 each, i think. However, they label their sections to the types of food they have, like: Chinese, Seafood, Italian, Salads, Roast meat, Latin, etc.

If you're going to Las Vegas with underaged people, this place is great! It's also close to the major shopping places and hotels on the strip!

Wow I had the most amazing birthday ever at The Mirage! We stayed in a huge 1,200+ sq ft Tower Suite Room and it was so perfect!! I highly recommend this suite to everyone planning on staying there! I also loved the pool area and the Siegfried and Roy Secret Garden.

With so many great hotels in Vegas why would you ever stay at this place?  Check-in was rude although I'm in a suite, I'm here for work and I can't even get the wi-fi to work and I'm using my phone to hot link. There are so many issues with this place I can't even begin.  It is well located and that is the only thing it has going for it.  Seriously, this place has NOTHING to offer that you can't find someplace else better.
This casino is kind of jungle themed ... with all the plants and fish every where. Loved the Beetles show here and the volcano show! I really want to see the tigers next time!

--- casino review only ---

Not a fan of the floor layout, but variety is okay.  Tables that were open were packed and the whole strip of closed ones never opened up despite it being a weekend (really?)

Waiting for MLife to offer a decent promo for here, but I guess even as Platinum it doesn't matter (but for some reason Bellagio offered us a free stay?!).

Would be back eventually when (hopefully ... or ever) we get a good enough offer.

I stayed at The Mirage back in May for my first ever visit to Vegas!  I cannot describe the amount of fun that I had while I was there!  First of all I went with 20 or so people... 

Frequent stops to the bar by the pool were necessary to regroup!  

Went to Beatles Revolution\/Love show.... AMAZING!!!  Nobody can stop talking about it even 2 months after the fact!

The Revolution Lounge was also a frequent meet-up location. 

The Spa was great, too... trust me you need a daily spa treatment when you're on Vegas time!  Gym\/Sauna\/Spa.... are a must to keep up with the pace.

The hotel itself was gorgeous and the room was great!  

I suggest the Mirage if you plan on hitting the pool... one of the best that I saw while I was there (didn't see Mandalay Bay, though... and I heard that was good).

I had gained a free night at the Mirage plus 25% off via the Facebook game My Vegas.  I was not expecting much, but was VERY impressed when I walked in.  So many are saying it is older...I so no signs of it feeling old or run down.  It was well kept, the people above and beyond friendly and EXCELLENT customer service.  Our room overlooked the pool, smelled clean, beds were comfortable and I cannot say enough about how impressed I was.  I have stayed at Luxor (bleh) Tropicana (construction at the time...bleh) Circus Circus BLAH, and Mandalay Bay (Nice) but The Mirage beat all of them hands down for customer service.  I will stay there from now on in the future.  They won my loyalty hands down!

I'll give a more extensive update after, but...the Sandwich tip worked again!  $20 between the Driver's License and the credit card when you hand it over to the Front Desk clerk and ask for an upgrade and Voila!..they upgrade my room that was already comped.  So far has worked every time.

Very nice room that includes a huge bathroom with a Jacuzzi tub, shower, and double sink.  More later.

It has been awhile since I last stayed here so when I finally came back, I was impressed w\/ the way they fixed things up. I noticed that the rooms were alot nicer, it has a modern look to it which I liked & the bathroom looked nice as well. In general I like staying @ the Mirage because of it's location, It's in the middle of the Strip so basically it's walking distance to alot of the hotel like Caesar's, Treasure Island, Venetian, Palazzo etc. although the Mirage is a good sized hotel, you could easily navigate through it and not get lost. The gambling area is big and spacious and the sportsbook area is also big (one of the biggest... I think), the pool is one of the nicest that I've seen so far. The room rates here are reasonable compared to the other hotels on the strip and the restaurants in the hotel areok. One recommendation I would make if you plan to stay @ the Mirage is to watch Cirque Du Soleil's Beatle's Love Show that is showing at the Mirage, It's the best show in Vegas!! I've always enjoyed my experience here and would come back again.

Very smelly needs lol
First thing I noticed when I walked in was that it was very smelly and old design need an upgrade asap ..... has like a dirty environment feeling but it's not dirty it just looks dirty and dark.

I've always really liked The Mirage but had never stayed there until 2009 when a friend of mine and my daughter took our yearly trip together to Las Vegas.

I am very happy I got too stay there. We had a great room on like the 20th floor. Our beds were awesome and our view was looking directly at The Venetian and Harrahs. The windows open up here but DONT drink too much and start yelling out the windows because you will have 5 huge security guards break into your room, like we did. No biggy I thought it was funny and it gave me a great story to tell.

Now we really enjoyed the pool. My daughter was pool crazy so we spent a lot of time down there and I even got in once or twice. The temp of the pool was perfect so I was very happy. The only bad thing that happen at the pool was it was very windy.

My friend and I spent a lot of time downstairs every evening on the slot machines and I even won. I was playing on a penny machine and was on my very last spin and ended up winning something like 229 dollars. I cashed out and left happy.

Everytime I come to Vegas I always make it a point to visit The Mirage. This is where I like too do most my gambling and I just really like everything about this place.

I cant wait to visit again..,.soon!

Ever since I visited with my family in 1999, I have wanted to stay at the Mirage. As a child, this was the closest I thought I was going to get to tropical vacation. Luckily, that last part hasn't been true, but Mirage still has a romantic hold on me. Like most hotels on the strip, its huge, but I think manageable. Getting to our room from the main door took less than 10 min, which was a big plus after a night on the town and aching feet. One of my favorite things about this place is the massive aquarium filled with tropical fish that they have behind the check in counter. It made standing on line (which wasn't that long) very entertaining. Keep an eye out for the eel! You don't see it often, but when you do, it's quite a treat. Our room was spacious, clean and had some of the most comfortable beds I've ever been in. We were cold our first night there and we asked them to bring us an extra blanket. I swear this blanket must have been made by blind monks on a mountain sanctuary with wool from Alpacas that are fed rainbows and happy thoughts. It was THAT comfy. The beds were memory foam, so no contest there. 

Overall, I love the laid back easy vibe of this place and the little garden in the lobby. When I came here back in the day, the white tigers were in an enclosure that was open to public view. It's sad that now, we have to pay for it. One problem I have with Mirage is that it didn't have a food court. There were no options for a quick cheap bite, so we walked over to the Venetian for many of our meals. The other problem was that the WIFI was horrendous. It was hard to spend a day in bed streaming movies if we had to pause to buffer all the time. Otherwise, I had a very pleasant stay.

It's more 3.5 stars.  Why do people put strange pillows on top of beds?  One of the rooms had this ugly, orange, rectangular, long shaped, raggedy pillow.  Our room had burgundy purple one.  They end up on the floor and then they put it on a clean bed.  Go figure.  The room was clean.  We were told not to use the refrigerator in the room because the refrigerator's items are on weights.  That is how they charge items you take or remove to your hotel bill.  How strange to put a box of cards inside the refrigerator.  Another strange thing is that every day, the stocking of supplies weren't complete.  It's like what is missing today?  The first day, there was an empty facial tissue box.  Second day, no hand towels and no body cream and no glasses for drinking.  One wonderful thing is that they have Chinese Jade Channel.  That is very cool to cater to the Chinese crowd.  You add $10 or something like that to get the room facing the Volcano.  Whatever!  The Long corridors makes for good exercise.  The rooms were sound proof, didn't have to hear loud crazy noises.  If you like sinking beds, these would be your favorite.  Maybe it is because it's a down bed.  On the second day, I finally figured out how to adjust the temperature, which was about time.  First night was freezing!  You can actually hike it up to refrigerator temperature.  At night, they have security guards standing next to the elevators to see door passes before letting people go beyond.  I just wonder, let's say, I didn't turn in my key card, and use it to bypass security.  How do you tell who is current guests and past guests?  Yes, the other nice thing is that Mirage is centrally located.  I have to give the shout out to the wonderful valet people.  They were fast and courteous.    I love the mist when you drop off the car on a hot day, reminds me of being at Universal Studios.

Recently went to the Mirage Buffet. Was disappointed. Much of the food was sitting around much too long, i.e. the roast pork, brisket, mashed potatoes. I was not happy that you could not order pasta to order.  The desserts were fine. The selection of entrees was not too great. Prime rib was ok.  The ribs were very good.

Aaaah my favorite casino. I love The Mirage, everytime I stay here it's a great experience. The pools are freakin' awesome and the casino is great too. I always stay here when visiting Las Vegas and enjoy my leisure time. I really enjoyed the Cravings Buffet inside and the Carnegie Delicatessen is off the chain as well. Vegas Run in about a month for me, so guess where I'm stayin??? MIRAGE!!
Great location.  Nice, clean bright rooms, updated a few years ago.  All the restaurants were good to.  service, very good.

I was disappointed, my wife booked the Hotel and a show. I went down to get us coffee the morning of the show when I slipped on some coffee that someone else had spilled. I notified the staff who were very concerned at the time. I said I think I will be fine and carried on with my day. A couple hours later I started to feel a little strange, so following the instruction from the staff I went and informed them that I thought I may need medical care. They gave me instructions to the local facility. They informed me to use my insurance. This was after they told me they would cover any cost. They offered to cover our stay, they did not. I had a concussion from the fall, where I missed work and had a bad case of vertigo. Which made the ride home to Arizona difficult. After talking with there staff they offered me $500 if I signed a release. I did not take their money or sign their release. I sent them a letter with medical records and receipts which they skied for and I never heard back from them. Their care of their patrons is subpar.

Even though this place is just about as old as me, it still seems to have a bit of charm. It shows that they have continued to put money back in the property. The only thing keeping it from a 5 star rating is the "old-ish" feel. Vegas has extremely high standards but this property does hold it's own. Location is also helping it's rating.

Very disappointed for the cost. First not enough towels in the restroom of the room, black hair all over the walks and the ceiling. No bath mat to get out of the shower, and the toiletries smell like cheap men's cologne.

Up until last week, it had been about 10 years since I have last stayed at The Mirage. Fortunately, we had a great stay, even though The Mirage isn't considered one of the swankier spots on the Strip. What I liked about the Mirage was that it was a large hotel with a small-ish feel. I love the decor in the lobby from the giant fish tanks to the tropical rainforest-like dome. The casino is well-kept, the staff are friendly, and it won't cost you and arm and a leg to stay there comfortably. 

We shared a double room and were surprised by its spaciousness. They have undergone renovations and so the room was sleek and modern. The bed was very comfortable, the room amenities, bathroom, and TV were good quality, and they even had a really nice work space\/desk area complete with outlets and two chairs. Ideal for those on a quick Vegas trip, couples, party-goers, and business types. The prices for rooms were reasonable and the check-in and check-out process was quick and painless. Ample free parking and prime location. There's even a tram that connects to Treasure Island, a Carnegie Deli, and a plethora of other dining options. While I found the nightlife to be a little cheesy (an Ink Tattoo themed club and a bad Beatles-themed lounge called Revolution), I would definitely stay here again out of convenience and when on a budget.

Cocktail service?! Nonexistent.  The cigarette smoke in this hotel is absolutely nauseating. I don't understand why there isn't a way to filter out more of that nastiness. 

I came here for Tosh.O, which was a great show. Before the show we were in the casino gambling and after the show we headed to the sports book. By the time we left I was so sick from all the cigarette smoke. 

One thing I dislike about Vegas is not being able to enjoy most places without being disgusted by all the cigarette smoke.

First time in Vegas and i stayed at the Mirage hotel. As I work in the hotel industry in new york i couldn't stop checking everything and comparing everything with my midtown hotel. The Mirage has a nice lobby and a nice front desk. The employees are friendly. You have to walk through the casino to get into your room. The room was clean but i found to long hair in the shower which was kind of disgusting. The mattress was not comfortable either. However the service was really quick. When we arrived in the room we realized it was missing some shampoo bottles for 2 of us. The housekeeping team came to fix that in 5 min. The view from the Strip is also pretty cool and i loved the volcano show. I would recommend the hotel.

Hmm. Ive actually stayed in this hotel many times during my stays in vegas but more so recently since the reno in 2008. The rooms are modern and fresh, the beds are comfortable, and the housekeeping don't seem to knock on the door at 9am on a sat morning! I hate when that happens..

I mean I know its vegas and we hardly sleep but I need to catch at least 3 hours before I go again!

The bathrooms are clean, the hotel staff are nice, the hotel is pretty much in the middle of the strip with access to everything.

I will def stay here again :)

The Mirage is *hands down* my favorite hotel in Las Vegas. My first trip here was Christmas 2009 (2 Queen Volcano View) and I've had two subsequent trips back (Feb: 1 King Tower Deluxe and April: 2 Queen Strip View) and I've already got another booked for November.

The BEDS here are pure HEAVEN! The linens are soft and the mattresses just sort of hold you and make you feel relaxed and soothed. They are available for purchase in one of the stores on the ground floor, but I've never checked out their price.

The location is perfect. You're immediately across the street from Ceasar's, Harrah's Venetian\/Palazzo and connected by a tram to the TI. It is far enough up the strip that the cabbies at McCarran will most likely try and "tunnel" you -- they will claim it's faster but it is racking up your total fare and making their profit margin look better. Insist on being taken up Swenson. 

Inside the casino are some pretty great places to eat. My personal favorite is BLT Burger. I haven't tried any of their fancier places, but the food always looks amazing as you walk by some of the places that have seating near the casino floor. I, personally, was not a fan of their buffet, Cravings, but I seem to be the odd-man-out in the group of people I went with as I know everyone else enjoyed it, and it is often rated #1 or #2 in Vegas.

Check-in and Check-out have always been smooth. Never an issue, upgraded two out of three times without having to ask. (And keeping my fingers crossed for an amazing Suite upgrade in the future. It has to happen eventually, right?!?)

The hallways can be loud with the sounds of shutting\/opening doors and the occassional drunk, but I've found that the crowd here tends to be 30-somethings and older so the noise doesn't last all night like it does at NYNY or the Luxor. Bring some ear plugs if you're a light sleeper who likes to complain. 

Sign up for the MGM Player's Club, too. The rates you start to get after just one trip of light gambling (I think I 've lost like maybe $100 per trip) will get you some amazing offers.

I love it here. It's the second happiest place on Earth. :)

Really enjoyed my stay at the mirage. I have no complaints. The rooms were nice and spacious, and the hotel Is conveniently located on the strip. The casino is nice, with good restaurants and a great pool. If you are looking for a good time in Vegas, hit up the mirage!

Couldn't stay another minute at Caesar's, able to get a deluxe room via Vegas.com for about $125\/night, upgraded to a 24th floor room for an extra $30\/night, very modern, sleek, WORKING wi-fi (covered by the $20\/day "resort fee"), mini-bar, fairly quiet, great view looking NE (flat city, with mountains and freeways), but staff actually smile here!  Would definitely book here again.  Nicer buffet than most, but gotta admit, I blew it at the craps table.

The front desk staff is very friendly and helpful. I like that this hotel & casino isn't too fancy and is not overcrowded compared to a lot of places in Vegas. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is the lack of quality of their hotel rooms. There is no "wow" factor here.

I enjoyed my stay here. Right in the heart of the strip where all the excitement is. I loved that the resort was not so busy and packed with people like the more "popular ones". It was clean and the staff were very attentive and helpful. I would definitely return.
Best hotel I can remember going too! I'm speaking to the room decor, view and connivence to shops. Solid joint!

Overall it was a fairly pleasant experience. Check in people was super nice, and we got a nice room with a kick ass strip view. Unfortunately we found a suspicious large brownish stain on the bedspread and when I squirted my contact solution (with a hydrogen peroxide base) on it, it bubbled up. EWWWWWWWWWWWWW... You don't need CSI to tell you that hydrogen peroxide reacts with blood! Called housekeeping and management and they remedied it with giving us new linens. What I don't understand is how they're still using bedspreads in this day and age! This was the first hotel I stayed in, in a long time that still uses these outdated festering pools of bacteria!

Two stars... one for the nice service and the fact that they had that nifty REVOLUTION lounge bar area where I could take pictures with the letter "V
