Few minor things like maybe a dirty towel I came across last time but other than that it's been good. my major thing most of the time is having a nice clean bed and I was given that and a damn comfy one too might I add.  If you get a room with a view it's pretty good view while the non view ones are fine if you just want to go back to your room to get ready and\/or rest for a few hours.  As for the other stuff at the hotel...people there are nice and helpful, the pool I totally like since it's pretty spacious and looks nice...not that froo froo modernish minimalistic nonsense, plenty of restaurants from different ranges to choose from, and lastly...IDEAL LOCATION.  It was one of the main reasons why I've stayed here a couple times.  

Overall good experience at the Mirage and it's a good price, decent, clean, and great location.

The Mirage has hip places to drink (Revolution Lounge and JET), a cool pool (Bare Lounge), Cirque de Soliel shows, and a fun casino. The hotel is very nice and the rooms have an ipod stereo, a flat screen tv, and the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in.

This was our first time staying here & will probably be the last!..rooms are ok... Decent food choices...valet service is the worst...we had an incident where our car came back dirty and covered with dust...their valet supervisor was extremely rude...she had no customer service sense...we also filled up a survey after our stay and no one seems to care about the bad reviews and improve...thankfully, there are plenty of other nice options to stay and enjoy than this in LV!!

So, for my grandfathers 80th birthday he wanted to go to Vegas and see the Beatles "Love" show. Awesome! 

Naturally since he wanted to see Love we booked at the Mirage, which has always been a bigger name on the Strip, so we thought nothing of it.

The entire family set off and made reservations months in advance, 4 couples and my grandfather, five rooms. Day one we made it clear that we wanted rooms close by each other, at the least on the same floor and was told they'd do everything they could to accommodate us and since it was so far in advance it shouldn't be an issue. 

Fast forward to the day of arrival and we go to check in, we were a little early (1pm) and was told the rooms weren't ready and they would text us when they were. Four hours later and no text we wander back over to the desk only to discover our rooms are spread out over multiple floors with different elevator access points, after much discussion where it was clear they didn't really care about the issue we were finally able to get 2 couples and my grandfather on the same floor, success?

The rooms were decently nice, moderately updated and clean, few small issues of flickering lights and such. The mini fridge was absolutely off limits though, it has weighted trays and if you even pick an item up it gets charged to the room, wtf? No coffee maker, even Motel 6 offers that and the free wi-fi was spotty at best 

The Hotel itself wasn't as nice as expected, it seemed a little more run down then I would expect from such a prestigious establishment, I've stayed at a number of Hotels in Vegas previously and I put this one below all of them, places like Las Vegas Hilton, Rio, Mandalay Bay, Bellagio. It was more in line with a place like Stratosphere, which was surprising, the pool area was pretty nice though, with the exception that the Hot tubs closed at 4:30.... The prices of everything were definitely too high for the quality of the establishment. 

The Love show was very good and we weren't disappointed by that, even not being a Beatles fan myself I didn't feel like I had wasted my $100 for the ticket. 

We had dinner at Samba grill and the steaks were very good and everyone was pleased with the food over all. 

The huge glaring issue which made the stay much less pleasant than it could be was the staff. You could tell they knew they weren't going to see you again for a long time and didn't have the time or patience to deal with, well, anything. Everyone from the front desk to California Pizza Kitchen to the club Revolutions, and even the servers at Samba were just flat out unfriendly. No service with a smile and never felt very welcomed. The ladies at Starbucks were friendly though, which was the highlight of our staff interaction. 

I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone, there are so many good hotels on the Strip, find one of those and enjoy your vacation, this place will just add hassle where you really don't need it, and everything will be slightly enough below your expectations to make you want to complain, and thats a bummer, because the staff won't care when you do.
Expect rude checking in experience if you book with Expedia or hotels.com. The front desk was so rude!

Stayed here for a weekend getaway. The room was clean, staff was very friendly. 

We choose to have Sunday brunch at Cravings. It was just ok, especially compared to Ceasars buffet. 

They did give us a Strip view room right above the volcano which was pretty cool. But the blackout curtains need to be better...I know it's the Strip but it wasn't dark in the room even with the blackout curtains pulled. There was also a lot of light coming from under the door. When I called to confirm our reservation, I mentioned that it was our 15th wedding anniversary. The really nice gentleman on the phone told me he'd have something waiting in the room for us. There wasn't. Not that big of a deal, but I'm just one of those people that promises something, I make sure it's done. 

It's a very convenient location on the strip. I'm not opposed to staying here again, but I'd probably want to see some of the other hotels in the area.

We checked into our room at midnight and found the area rug in the bathroom was pulled.  The bed was also slept in.  There was also a portable fan also running in the bathroom.  We had to haul our luggage back to the front desk to get another room.  I wish there was more quality assurance.
It's the Mirage.  Not the level it once was, back in the day, but still a decent place to hang out.

The pool is the best thing about our stay at the Mirage. You get basically no comps. We bet $200 on sports and were told no comps for sports bets, and we were betting $10 per hand at Black Jack, which was the limit, and when we gave the pit boss our players card he handed it back and said we only comp if you bet $25 a hand. What a crock. Very expensive, felt like they only cater to the high roller crowd.

I am down to my last 40 dollars. I am sitting at the bar with my brother and a friend when I look down at the end of the bar at an absolutely gorgeous woman in a black dress.She sees me looking and waves. I stupidly look behind me to see who she is waving to. I play another 20  dollars. I am now down to my last 20. I look down at the end of the bar and this beautiful woman waves at me again. This cannot be happening. I stupidly look behind me to see who she is waving at. I still could not figure it out until I saw several people approach her. Holy shit she is a lady of the night. Damn she is hot ! I go for a walk just me and my 20 dollars and after looking around for awhile I see this lady escorting a man up to the elevators. I go back and sit down and play 2 hands of video poker and win a progressive for 4800 dollars. Holy crap I won 4800 dollars. The reason for the 5 stars is 1 -I won 4800 dollars, and 2 - I won this after this Hot,Hot,hot, looking escort left so I kept my money to myself. Not that I am weak willed and an easy target for sinful distractions. Did I mention she was Hot?

the casino is kind of old looking ... I sure expected more. They make so much money... they should invest some back and get it renewed and beautified... maybe hire more waitresses cause we could not find them and end up going somewhere else

My wife and I stayed here for two nights for the first time. We've stayed at many hotels in Las Vegas and never got the chance until now (Presidents Day) weekend. I booked through the M Life website which saved us a bit of money. 

We've walked through this casino before but never took the time to stop and gamble. I was impressed by the overall cleanliness, attentive waitresses who come around for cocktails, and layout of the casino floor! 

There are quite a few bars and restaurants and a Starbucks. The only eatery we tried in the hotel was a nice spot called The Pantry. They're open 24 hours and serve breakfast items all day long. My wife had an omelette and I had the chicken and waffles. Was pretty good and the price was reasonable. 

Now I read some not so good reviews here on Yelp about the Mirage. I didn't experience that at all! We booked a volcano\/strip view room and it was fantastic!! The room was spotless, the bed was super comfortable, and our view was terrific! At 400sq ft. It was plenty of space for my wife and I. I'm very picky about water pressure and like hard showers. The Mirage didn't disappoint! Pressure was great and never once did the water go cold. No stains, no mold... Nothing wrong with out room! 

Last, we did check out the Boyz II Men show conveniently located in our hotel. Growing up in the 80's\/90's.... was great to see them perform there biggest hits and a couple other surprises. If you're into RnB and appreciate there music... this is a must! 

Great job Mirage property and staff! I've stayed at newer hotels and Vegas and this property still holds it down! Classy, clean and holds its own! Will definitely return for another stay in the near future!

Regular hotel. 
Clean and good rooms. Pricing is regular and they have free parking. 
Inside they do have good restaurants though.

The Mirage has always been one of the classiest places on the Strip.  Props to Steve Wynn for ushering in the resort era with this beautiful property.  (Jeers to him for destroying the Dunes sign in a meglamaniacal gesture during the opening of Treasure Island...but I digress)  

The Mirage has stood up well to time, wear, tear, countless invading tourists, varying economies, changing corporations, MGM-Mirage excecutive meddling, Ray Horn getting mauled on stage, as well as American Idol visiting.

Overall the Mirage is still a gem on the strip!  The volcano show is still amazing.  The casino is beautiful.  The atrium is amazing.  The pools are very gorgeous.  The pricing is generally reasonable as well.  

If they'd open up their own micro-brewery in the hotel, I'd give this place a fifth star.  Until the day I enjoy a micro-brewed "Danny Gans-weizen", it'll give them some perfection to work towards.

Mirage is one of the first hotels on the Strip. At first I thought it would be some 3 stars hotel. But hey I was wrong.

The pool is so huge with nice design, I loved it when I was floating around. Also many good restaurants are located here. 

On top of that, my room got upgraded and we got a very nicccccceee room. Yippee Did I mention the pool??
Had a question about booking a room, called the customer service line, and the rep was extremely rude and unhelpful. Only way to get any customer service is to be an "M" member. No thanks.

DO NOT BOOK HERE! I paid with points for a bachelorette party and on the day of my arrival had a family emergency land me in the hospital, canceling my trip. When I called to alter the reservation so my friend could still keep the room without me there, I was told I had to call the obscure 3rd party agency that booked it. Mind you, this room is paid in full, under my name, and I'd already changed the room type and check-in time via phone with The Mirage earlier in the week, yet this nasty woman keeps cutting me off to insist NO CHANGES can be made through them directly. (Guess I imagined all that!) Finally, I get the 3rd party agency to call The Mirage and make the changes, only to have them come back and tell me it's actually been at the discretion of the hotel THE WHOLE TIME and they are simply refusing to update the name on the reservation because it's "against their policy", so I'll just have to cancel the room I already paid for and re-book it at a new rate, including a one-night cancellation fee. Are you kidding me!? 

After much argument and nearly three hours of back and forth phone calls, the hotel eventually relented, but I will never stay at this establishment again, and I will make it my personal mission to ensure that everyone I know avoids The Mirage moving forward.

It's getting old. The room smelled oldy. The Parking structure is dirty. The buffet is great.
The Mresort is the best!

I like this hotel for one thing.  The location is great and the hotel rooms are Hilton-quality.  Its a great launching pad for a night on the town and have enough space to spread out when you crash at an affordable price.  The room quality is consistent and definitely more on the affordable side given the central location on the Strip.  During the downturn, we stayed here for $39 over the weekend one time.  It was amazing!  The prices are nowhere near that now but its still reasonable.  The only affordable place I like here is BLT and the discount for the in-house show "LOVE" is a great deal.  The pool is large and hardly has anyone in it since everyone is too busy sunbathing in the huge rows of chairs.

The ladies at the roulette table were both very rude asked for my ID multiple times after I had already gave it to them one of the guys cut off my family friend after one drink and told her too 'cool it down'. They were just very rude and would NOT recommend this casino maybe the hotel is nice but not staff at the casino.
very dissapointed with the whole experience. long check in lines. no coffee makers, weird smell, volcano not working. I'm sure there are better hotels in Las Vegas.

Been to LV many times but first time at the Mirage;  beautiful & CLEAN room with a nice layout, fine casino and a great location.  However I have three minor complaints:

1.  There is no quick place to get a bite to eat.  When the casino is busy (Thursday, Friday, Saturday) all restaurants have a line.  Sometimes I just want a hot dog, burger, steak sandwich something you can pick-up and have a seat yourself area.  It's not the money (that's flying out of my pocket anyway) and I'd gladly pay $7.00 for a "special" hot dog or $11.00 for a burger.  Just want it quick.  There is no traditional "coffee shop" either.  The only quick option is an overpriced Turkey & Cheese on dry wheat bread or similar choice with sprouts at Starbucks.  

2.  Our room door key card only worked on it's fourth to tenth try.  A helpful bellman told me you need to slide the card in "gently".  It eventually works but a recurring pain in the a**.  The area to replace the card always had a line.

3.  On the weekends this hotel seems to attract the cockeyed hat, pants below your a** crowd, along with 20 something girls in skirts the size of band-aids and ridiculous high heels.  Other "better" hotels did not attract this crowd on weekends.  It may have to do with the late night club on the premises and\/or who was appearing\/happening that particular weekend.  This ain't my crowd but I will admit the girls were interesting!

We would stay at the Mirage again, however there are many hotels in The Mirage quality and price point and next trip would mostly likely give another a try.

We booked this hotel for a quick weekend getaway, 2 days 1 night. We chose it because it was the cheapest of all the nicest hotels (that we found). We booked the regular suite for $200 and ended up getting upgraded for free to their tower suite (a $450\/night room). The suite was amazing! We heard amazing things about the pool. It wasn't that great. Very crowded, but what can you expect. We went to the Siegfreid & Roy Secret Garden, its $15 to get in and so amazing. They only let a certain number of people in at a time so it wasn't crowded (but it was also right when they opened, so it might be a different story later in the day). This place is truly amazing, you can get so close to the dolphins and all the animals. They are all out, not tucked away under a log where you cant see them. Very much worth the money. The buffet was good. I don't think I'd go there for it if i wasn't staying there. Over all a great experience. Friendly staff. They lack the 5th star because it isn't as great as a lot of the other hotels, with things to see and do inside.

Stayed in the one bedroom suite at the Mirage and loved it! One of the best hotel experiences. Our room was beautiful and had so many little extras. Our jacuzzi tub came with bath salts and the bathroom had a toothbrush, toothpaste, and razor, and shave cream. Overall we just loved the room and the service we received while staying there.

Fantastic, fast, friendly checkin! Bell hops are super friendly and well worth it! Excellent value! The best customer service! Would have given 5 stars except for the very slow WIFI, rude casino mafia and slow room service!

This is a wonderful resort to visit, but a stay here is really nothing special. With Jackie and I here for the Mariah Carey concert at Caesar's and our youngest son just along for the ride, fortunately we only were there for one night. A very small bathroom with poor drainage in the shower\/tub combo was just a part of our disappointment overall. Not terrible, just rooms that are considerably below expectations. 

On stepping outside, Jackie and I were constantly reminded of our wonderful stay at the Venetian directly across the street, just a few months prior.

Also, the longest hotel checkout lines I've ever seen in all my years. I almost thought I was at McCarran International.

I can't really complain about Mirage either. My experiences here have been great. The room was decent in size and also had a strip view, though I couldn't really see the volcano show. The last time I stayed there, we were behind Brian Friedman (dancer\/ judge from SYTYCD)... so I guess it's not that bad of a hotel!

Oh, and I wrote the same about Treasure Island: I think The Mirage easily balances out price, quality and convenience (center of the strip).

My friend had organized for us to stay at The Mirage a few years ago. I remember our hotel room being okay. The beds were comfortable, there was warm water, and all of the appliances worked. It was modernly decorated, but very plain. The hotel was also conveniently located on the center of The Strip.

Sooo why the one star rating, you ask? Well...our experience with the front lobby was terrible. We had made reservations a few months in advance, but when we checked-in, they told us that they had made an error in our reservation and that they no longer had our rooms. I have had this happen to me once before at another hotel and in response to their mishap, they upgraded our room to a suite without any extra charges. I mean...if you're going to make a mistake, you're going to have to make it up somehow, right? Well, that's not something The Mirage is familiar with. They simply told us that they could not do anything about it, other than book us for their lower grade rooms. Had there been rooms available at other hotels, we would not have settled. We had no other choice, so we agreed. I will never even think about staying at The Mirage again.

Always a good stay at the Mirage. We arrive early on Super Bowl and they got us in without a problem.  Used my MLife card and got a great rate.  Nice, comfortable beds with very clean bathrooms.
Used the gym every morning (was not easy after being out all night)
Ate at Heritage and Cravings.
Enjoyed outside beverage at the Rhumbar.
Good central location and very friendly staff.

Overall this a great hotel in Las Vegas.  Casino is huge and plenty of  tables to lose you cash at.  Their sportsbook is in good shape and comparable to the Bellagio.  I spent about 10 hours in a black leather chair there losing every possible bet.  They have a deli... I forget the name, but they have bad ass Rueben Sandwiches.  My gramps and I split one and we were both stuffed.

stayed in a standard smoking room during the MTV VMA weekend last year. despite the busy weekend, my friends and i managed to grab a room at a rate of $200\/night. originally it was supposed to be $400\/night but i guess someone messed up. 

the weekend trip was amazing and the rooms were nice and simple, yet also a bit stylish. there's even a disposable camera inside the mini fridge....i guess it's for "cool pictures"? *runs away and hides in shame for saying that lame joke*

overall, a nice hotel and i think i even won ~$300 on the slots, thanks for the free room, Mirage!

All in all, mirage had accommodated my friends and I for a strip view part of Las Vegas strip. Though I would prefer a bit closer to the elevator (our room was literally 2 rooms to the end of the hotel towards the emergency exit door). 

Price wise was reasonable for the amount of days we stayed in. Staffs were very friendly and got a call from the hotel that we were skipped for housekeeping and we can always ask for it whenever we need to. I thought that was very good customer service (high five to Mirage). 

The pool side was very nice and large (though it would of make it better if they have a deeper side of the pool since it is 3 1\/2 ft. all around). Our room was also nice and had a nice flat screen tv. The bathroom was ok since it feel really small (bathroom door had no lock in it). On the other note, I thank Mirage for our complimentary sparkling wine! =)  

Overall, I am satisfied with the hotel and the room. I would definitely come back again and tell my friends and family that Mirage hotel have mid-class rooms for a good price and excellent customer service.

If this review was based solely on the hotel room, it would have easily been four stars. However I'm basing this review on our experience as a whole in The Mirage.

The Room:

I thought it was close to perfect! The decor was next level and had a nice vibe. A friend who was also staying here did point out there were no bath robes in the room but I didn't find that to be a major problem. I've attached photos of the room.

I've stayed at The MGM, The Vidara, Planet Hollywood and The Monte Carlo .. hands down this hotel had the best room. 

I have a problem finding a shower with good water pressure but i have to say, the shower in The Mirage has great pressure - it's just a shame the shower head was the size of a quarter. Also, room service actually understood that a privacy sign on the door handle meant do not disturb, from experience, a concept most hotels fail to grasp!

The Hotel:

When we made the booking we were given a $50 credit to spend in the hotel, however when we check in there was no mention of it. We went back to the lobby to ask about it because we forgot when we checked in and we did in fact have $50 to spend, but i was a little bit mad that we weren't told that on arrival. 

I did a review for The Monte Carlo a couple of weeks ago. On check in there we were given a $75 credit to spend, $75 which paid for multiple meals for me and my wife. On the other hand, the restaurants in The Mirage are WAY over priced. Embarrassingly overpriced. There are close to 10 restaurants in the hotel and not one was realistic. There was even a California Pizza Kitchen which charged a minimum of $20 for a pizza. The line for a table was huge! Probably because this was the cheapest restaurant available. 

There was only one place which served breakfast and it cost $15 for eggs and bacon. Maybe i'm more 'frugal' let's say, than most but 3 eggs and 2 pieces of bacon for $15 
+ Tax and Tip .. Come on! 

We also ate at 'FIN' i think it was called, an asian restaurant. I had a cup of soup which was $10 and i stress that it was a cup, not a bowl. Entrees were all around $30 and all were 'A La Carte' .. In other words, you have to pay $15 for fried rice or chow mein. The soup was amazing to be fair, but the main meal was a let down and left me hungry.

All in all, the hotel itself is great, as are the rooms. If you plan on eating outside of the hotel the entire time, i'd say give it a shot.

Me and 7 of my buddies went to Las Vegas last August and stayed at the Mirage.  We couldn't have asked for a better experience.  The pool was awesome, we met some really cool people at the pool.  The rooms were nice, make sure you ask for a remodeled room.  The 2nd night we went to JET in the Mirage, huge mistake, this place is kind of trashy and doesn't live up to Vegas standards.  I would definetely go back to this hotel next time im in Vegas!

I kinda had low expectations as I had stayed here some 10 years ago and had vague memories of it being outdated. But clearly some rennovations happened and I was pleasantly surprised. Room was comfortable and nicely appointed. Loved the big almost-love-seat as a reading chair. 

Enjoyed the pool area, too. My alabaster skin is a testament to my sun avoidance and I was happy to find a little shade to relax in. I'd definately stay here again.

There presentation on food preparing and taste is good ..selection on choices is good but there's only a few that are better or excellent on taste and specialties..As far food and overall presentation and ambiance...Contemporary modern furniture decor or cleanliness is a very important part of ur experience..
Here is a few steps up from other very upbeat lively atmosphere or professional staff...
It's decent but not excellent...
Service was great can't complain...
Overall my husband and I enjoyed our visit...

Mirage is mirage.

This is my second time staying at this resort.

Room is spacious & also kept clean.
Good bed & clean bathrooms. 
No idea how they clean the glasses.

This time there was a resort fees of $25\/- & I could never get into their wifi. But still I have to pay them. Maybe next time for using their elevators & doors I will have to pay a touching fees ( dont know what else they come up with)

The most interesting was their mini bar. You have 40 seconds to check any item. Basically you check it & did not keep it back within the 40th second a fee is charged according to the weight. But you wont be uncharged if u keep it back at the 41st second. wow....Mirage is testing eveyones knowledge of counting.

So BEWARE...Ding DIng Ding.....charged credit card.

Final Verdict:-

As there are so many resorts I might try some others next time I go. May never go back to Mirage. Too many choices so no panic button.

Have a wonderful time in Vegas.

Aww... I came here thinking that to see the baby dolphin exhibit was free... I remember it used to be free to see the lions way back when, so I assumed it would be free to see the dolphins.  Unfortunately, I was wrong.  It wasn't free to see their new baby dolphins in their exhibit. x( Plus, the exhibit closes early at 5:30pm. :(

It's been 6 months and I have been back to Vegas 2 more times. The MGM hotels are still charging for parking and I have not stepped into their hotels either time I was here. I have not missed a thing. Going to other hotels and spending my dollars there. The hotels can have my money gambeling and shows and food but not parking! Don't know why you would pay for Parking!!!!!!

I really enjoyed my recent stay at The Mirage.  After a few unpleasant encounters at check-in at previous trade shows in Vegas, it was very refreshing that the front desk was so helpful with not hassling about our prepaid card and didn't charge us a ridiculous amount for incidentals when we were just there for work.  For that - THANK YOU!  The rooms are ok.  The beds are very comfortable and they sell their sheets and pillows down in the gift shop.  Lots of restaurants and bars to choose from.  My only complaint is that the ventilation isn't that good and when you turn on the fan in the bathroom you can smell smoke - even in a non smoking room.  Free Wi-Fi was also nice.  I didn't feel like the Mirage was trying to get my every dollar for anything they could think of and that I appreciate.  I would stay here again.

Stayed here 12\/25\/16-12\/29\/16, with the hubby for a much needed vacation. Checked in without any hitches, considering it was Christmas Day only took about ten minutes in the line, lobby was pretty packed too. 

Got a room facing the strip and even a nice view of the volcano. Room was clean and a pretty good size, bathroom is on the smaller side. 

Only cons were the pillows are REALLY soft, which I've read other Yelpers claim, didn't think much of it until I tried to go to sleep, they did make it a lil difficult to get comfy at first. Other con is that you can hear literally any and everything coming from the hallway, they really need to try to do something to fix that. 

Overall we had a nice stay here, friendly staff, decent room, good location on The Strip and good amount of dining options. Would definitely stay here again.

I just wrapped up an amazing weekend in Vegas, and I stayed at The Mirage for three nights.

Overall, The Mirage is one of the better hotels in Vegas.  It's just a step below The Venetian (my favorite hotel in Vegas), but the price is also a bit lower.  If you have the money to go all out, I recommend The Venetian.  If you have a pretty tight budget but still want to experience luxury and comfort, then The Mirage is a great choice. 

Positives: 
The price - My average rate for the three nights was $199.  This was during a crazy weekend with CES and AAE going on, so the rate isn't bad at all.  This was $100 lower than the lowest price available at the Venetian (but it was a regular room at the Mirage vs. a suite at the Venetian...). 
Rooms - The rooms are starting to show their age, but they are still quite nice.  I also love the beds, and the bathroom amenities are impressive.  
Location - It's in the heart of the strip.  Even if you can't afford to stay at one of the more luxurious hotels like The Venetian and The Bellagio, they are within walking distance.  
Casino floor - They have just about everything you need here including a nice sports book.  You won't have to go anywhere else because there is something for everyone (even high rollers...).  

Negatives: 
Service -  The employees are ok I guess, but I did have a few issues.  During check in, they only had a smoking room available the first night.    It turns out they gave my non-smoking room to someone else since I didn't arrive to the hotel until 8:30 pm, and the hotel was sold out.  They didn't even apologize for this.   Instead, they acted like this happens all the time and were doing me a favor by transferring me to a non smoking room for my second and third nights.  All I needed to do was to call to see if the room was ready, and they would automatically set the key cards to work with my new room.  I'm not usually one to complain so I went with it.   
The next day, I was rushing to get to a show on time, but I also wanted to transfer rooms before heading out for the day.  When I called, they said everything was good to go, but when I got to my room, the key cards didn't work.  It ended up taking about an hour for them to correct the issue, and I was late to my event.  Not cool...
Restaurants - Maybe it's just me, but I was not too impressed with the restaurants in The Mirage.  I tried Cravings (the buffet), Carnegie Delicate, and BLT Burger.  They were all mediocre, and I would never go back...
Bathrooms - These are pretty damn small...


I took a few nice pictures of the room, bathroom, and the exterior of the hotel, so check them out. 

The next time I'm in Vegas, I'll check out The Venetian first, but if that doesn't work out, The Mirage will be my next choice.

We have stayed up and down and off the strip but this time we wanted to stay in the middle of everything--sort of--so we opted for The Mirage.  We were not disappointed.  It was great.  We were there before official check in time but they had a room ready for us anyway.  The people at the front desk were so nice and helpful.  When we got to our room, we were even more impressed.  The room was immaculate and the view was amazing.  It looked out over the strip and from our room, each night we could watch the volcano.   The first morning we slept in and ordered room service from The Pantry.  It was delivered in about 20 minutes instead of the 45 they estimated.  And it was yummy--the  potatoes especially.  Everyday when we returned from our adventures, the room had been tidied and after the second night, the sheets were even changed without us requesting.  The only con is the coffee situation as mentioned in a few other posts.  There isn't a coffee pot in the room and room service coffee is $15 for a large "box."  There is a Starbucks in the hotel which is great.  I didn't mind going down to it really but the guy in front of me did not seem impressed with my early morning "Flock of Seagulls" hairdo!  But that's more his problem than mine.  We are planning on returning to Vegas at Christmas and we will be staying at the Mirage.

Wow, this place is lame. For what you pay, you'd be better off going to New York New York. You have to walk a mile to get coffee with long lines, our room is filled with money traps like candies and drink that charge you as soon as they are moved off weight triggers?!? Wtf. If you bump it up you're charged. Not cool... Mold in bathroom, very gross. Our room had a full trash can and trash still in the room from the people before. 
Maybe it's just me (brown skin) but I couldn't walk around casino for 5 mins with out some lame guard asking me to see my room key.  

LAME.

Our first stay at Vegas was at this very hotel.  I'm not sure if my expectations were too high, but this definitely did not live up to those expectations.  The deluxe bedrooms aren't exactly deluxe as they say they are.  I had no good luck gambling at this casino and when we tried booking our group's rooms to be close to each other, we ended up being spread far apart making it inconvenient for all of us.  Not to mention, we didn't get a good deal since we paid $500 for three nights (I didn't plan the trip and I definitely learned how to get better deals now)  Don't get me wrong, I like this place and everything and will probably stay here later in the future once all the renovations are complete, then I would probably change this review, but for now, I would say that it wasn't exactly worth it for the three nights we stayed there.

Its like 3.5. Hotel is old but rooms are updated. Suites are beautiful. This place is great for families. Pool was crowded but you could find a seat. Drinks are good and 16 bucks you don't care its so hot outside.  You must see Love the Beatles show, amazing!! Location is great, close to the mall or bellagio. We ate at heritage, tom collichio steak house and wow. Another must do!!  Overall I would come back.

I will not be staying at The Mirage again.

As my first time to The Mirage in Vegas, having stayed at other various big-name resorts on the strip, I know what to expect when visiting this area. I reserved a penthouse suite (level A, if it makes any difference) with an attached second bedroom. Upon arrival, first thing I notice is the key I was given did not work. I struggled with the door for about 5 minutes before the lock decided to take the keycard I was given (both keycards exhibited the problem).  The room itself was nice looking, very spacious, comfortable furniture, but after settling into the room, its problems became quite evident.

Two recessed lights in the room were burnt out, the safe in the master bedroom was locked (I presume from a prior guest), and the television in the master bedroom would not rise out of its enclosure. I immediately called the front desk and was assured the problems would be taken care of within 10 minutes. Twenty minutes later, a security agent shows up to unlock the safe. He doesn't know anything about the lights or the TV, he tells me "that's the engineering department. I'm security." He refuses to look into something outside of his department.

Ten more minutes pass, I make another call to the front desk. They apologize and a few minutes later, someone shows up to replace the light bulbs. He tries to fix the TV, and tells me in order to use it, I will need to reach behind the unit and manually press a button to raise\/lower the TV - the remote does not work. Fabulous.

By this point, I've complained to the manager and he offered to knock $50 off my room rate (less than 10% what the room is costing me for one night), and offers a brief apology. Later that night, I noticed the shower leaks over the marble flooring in the master bathroom, and the clothing iron did not work, it simply sputtered water.

By this point, I am appalled. The next morning, I wake up around 10am and call the concierge to make a lunch reservation at The Eiffel Tower. I am immediately told they only serve dinner - even though I've dined at The Eiffel Tower for lunch several times in the past. Ok I think, maybe they have changed their hours of operation. I give them a call, and they are open for lunch. The woman at the reservation desk tells me they have never been closed for lunch. I make the reservation myself, and call The Mirage concierge back, to inform her that The Eiffel Tower *is in fact* open for lunch. "Well they haven't been open for lunch before!" she tells me, and I inform her otherwise. She doesn't have anything to say.

The shoddy quality of the room, the subpar service received for a room costing over $1,000 \/ night, and the blatantly ignorant staff at The Mirage equate to being my first - and last - stay.

I've stayed here only once, but love to gamble and eat at this casino.  

The room I stayed in was okay.  The furniture\/decor was a bit dated.  But the pool was FANTASTIC.  Love all of the waterfalls and plenty of room to layout and relax.

The slots are plentiful with a ton of gaming options.  Pretty sure my husband and I will stay here again.

My stay here was perfect! My boyfriend and i stayed for 5 days last week. Everyday the bedding was changed and made up. Garbage's were emptied and carpet vacuumed.
 I found the bathroom surprisingly small, but when you're only using it to shower, brush teeth and quickly get ready for a day out, it works just fine. 
The house keeping staff were very friendly. Smiling and saying good morning or hello as you passed. 
The pool is amazing. I spent almost every morning there. 
The layout of mirage is easy to get around. There aren't many choices for shopping, but i found it a benefit as it kept the people traffic down to a minimum.
I will definitely be coming back for another stay at Mirage.
Have stayed at several other hotels, but choose the Mirage because it is center strip, great hotel, pool, dining & fun! great for groups too!

Stayed here over the weekend and had a great experience.  Rooms were large and comfortable.  Nice bathroom products.  With our booking, we were supposed to receive a dining credit but the front desk person forgot and we never went to ask for it.  Good strip location.  I would definitely stay here again!

I wish you could give a half star, I would do 3.5, so lets pretend.
We recently stayed for 3-nights (Thur-Sun).

Here is the rundown:
--Location is perfect, mid-strip and walk-able in both directions.
--Check-in, awesome aquarium to look at while checking-in.  It was quick easy and they do their best to accommodate you.  They even found us a room next to our friends that checked in earlier in the day. - 5 stars.
--The guest elevators are all the way through the casino, read the signs to find the appropriate bank of elevators for your floor.
--Casino and rooms were clean, and not nearly as smoky as some other hotels.
--Ceilings were sooooo low in the hotel (I am 5'6" and could nearly touch them flat footed) so it felt a tad claustrophobic.
--Rooms were a good size, our two queen room was nicely updated with a flat screen TV.
--Bathrooms are super small, but that was expected.  Our tub was a bit scary (chipped\/dirty looking) but the toilet flushed and the sink drained which I consider a win.  The fan didn't do a dang thing, so keep the door open if you want to be able to see the mirror after you shower.
--Our room looked onto the pool facing Caesars, you could see part of the strip too.
--Walls are paper thin, we could hear full conversations being had next door to us as well as music being played, doors being opened\/closed, water running and toilets flushing.  This was extremely annoying and troublesome when the neighbors were partying at all-hours while we were trying to sleep.  
--Housekeeping was awesome, they left you alone if you had your "privacy please" sign out, but were generous with giving extra towels and such.
--Dining, plenty of options and you can charge it to your room, much easier than waiting for your credit card to be run or change if you pay cash.  Plus if you sign up for the M-Life card you bank rewards points.
--Pantry is open 24-hours and while it is expensive and can prove to be a long wait during peak times, its pretty darn good.  
--Cravings buffet was terrible. We went for brunch on Saturday and the food was cold and bland.  The only plus was the self serve beverages, I was never thirsty.  
--Check-out, couldn't have been easier.  We received an email and clicked 'check out'.  Not sure if this would happen if you didn't book directly through the Mirage, but if you do, its way cool.  Only caveat is it doesn't allow you to check out online until 6 am.
--Terry Fator Theater, we went to the show and it was really good.  The seats in the theater are a little small and uncomfortable, but it works just fine for a 1.5 hour show.  Highly recommend going to see him.
--Secret Garden, admission is fair and the dolphins and lions\/tigers are awesome.  We watched the dolphin shows a couple times.  Definitely visit if you have the time.
--The casino itself is clean and there are plenty of gambling options.  We didn't spend a lot of time gambling, but when we did we had fun.  The cocktail servers didn't visit us frequently, perhaps because we were only having water.

Overall not great, not the worst, but definitely A-OK.

We are hosting a conference here at the hotel and I have been very pleased with the accommodations, service and hotel amenities. 

We are staying in one of the Tower Suites. It is comfortable, spacious and well appointed. The view of the strip is fantastic. The only downside is that the room does not have a coffee maker...although it pretty much has everything else. 

The bed is AMAZINGLY comfortable. I slept like a baby all night. We were there with our 4 year old daughter, so we made a great little bed on the couch for her which gave my husband and I some privacy. 

The service has been above and beyond. The staff is very well trained, eager to assist and goes beyond just being "helpful" to being of genuine service. The valets were especially great to deal with, making our stay convenient and comfortable as we travelled around town. 

The pool area is gorgeous and they have a nice area that is suitable for children. The Dolphin experience is quite a delight for the family. 

The only downside is that the hotel is a bit dated and very smelly in the lobby area. Unfortunately, you have to walk through the casino to get to the elevators which means inhaling old lady perfume and tons of cigarette smoke. Once you are through it though, the restaurant and store area is clean, fresh and nice. 

I love that they have a Starbuck's in the hotel and pretty much everything else you could want or need. The location is spectacular as we are in walking distance to many of the major hotels, including Caesar's Forum shops. I would gladly stay here again.

I didn't stay in this hotel but I did a lot of gambling here for my 21st birthday. I spent more time playing roulette than not. The decor and staff are FANTASTIC. The tram that goes back and forth to Treasure Island helped a lot...when drunk and trying to get back to go to bed. The Jim Beam is great!

I only stayed here once and wasn't actually in the room all that much.  Pretty much was downstairs trying to see the shows or out doing something.  I came in slept, shower and left didn't really get to "enjoy" the room and see how everything is, which is why it's only a 3 stars since I can't remember anything bad but I can't remember anything spectacular about it.

One thing I did remember was the free buffet though.  We were shown a different line which had like 4 people waiting instead of the one with 15-20 people and was let in quickly.  The food was alright, better than standard places you find outside but maybe because it's vegas, i left feeling it could've been so much more.

Dealers all have pissy attitudes. Wife and I were at the craps tables and both tables we went to had rude dealers. Left the first table because of it and went to the second table. After about 10 minutes and two dealer changes we left. The dealers at both tables made smart assed comments to the players and to each other. It wasn't fun banter. You have many choices in Vegas to spend your money. Dealers should be attentive to their customers and not smart asses. Played in many of the casinos on the strip. Was at the Wynn the night before and Aria two days ago. The dealers at both places were very professional and treated players as guests not like an inconvenience to their day. I won't go back.

Absolutely average average average

Small motel rooms, small motel bathrooms, small motel tub\/shower with 5'6" shower heads

They throw a $25. "resort fee" on top of the room price. Why not just charge $25. more for your room? 

Buy your $200. Cirque du Soleil tickets online and have the pleasure of the hotel forcing you to wait for 30 minutes in a jammed line to actually get your tickets

21st century and idiots are paying $200.\/ticket then waiting in line again to get the tickets. Ridiculous

On an up note, Cirque du Soleil, The Beatles, Love is a really wonderful show. Probably the best in Las Vegas now. Too bad The Mirage treats its ticket holders so poorly.

Stay anywhere else but see Love if you see any show at all. Well worth it

Below are my honest opinions based on my stay at this hotel. 

This hotel did not meet my expectations.  The check in line was extremely long, about 45 minutes to make it through. Once we got to the counter, the representative who helped us was stone cold and not welcoming at all.

The decor of the lobby and hallways were nice. However, once we got into our room we were again disappointed. The room was extremely small with one king bed and no sofa bed. The bathroom was so small that if you were sitting on the toilet, you could not close the door. The bed was Extremely uncomfortable because it was sagging in the middle. They need to change out the bed for sure.  We stayed there for a week and I had severe back pain pretty much the whole time. 

We had a volcano view and the view was pretty nice because we got to see the huge Ferris wheel.  
The pool had areas of hot and cold spots of varying temperatures so swimming was a little uncomfortable. The water was extremely cloudy as well and overall I did not enjoy the experience because of those issues.

Effective recently, all MGM properties are charging $10 per day for parking even if you are a guest at the hotel. Be prepared for that.

My overall experience at The Mirage was underwhelming and I would definitely not stay there again nor recommend this hotel and casino to my friends.

Yay for the Recession!!!

My room was only $95\/night. Total Sweeet.

I got a non-smoking w\/ a king size bed. The room was fairly pimp. One king size bed + 40" flat screen TV in front of it, a desk for your laptop or whatever, two drawers on the side of the bed.

Bathroom was clean and I got new soap + shampoo every day even though I barely used the ones from the day before. Some hotels don't replace them daily (aka Imperial Palace).

The food was pretty expensive downstairs. Everything usually came out to at least $20 per person. Even for one quesadilla + ice tea. Hamburgers + fries were $20+.

I ordered room service, some strawberries to be delievered in the morning. The total came to: strawberries + room service fee + tax + tip. Aw well.

I'd stay there again if it's cheap like this.

I always like to try different hotels when in Vegas. It has to be on the strip and convenience which is why I picked Mirage this time, 3rd time at Mirage. I love the location, and the many trees all around it. Love love palm trees. customer service at check in was friendly. I always get offered freebies but didnt this time at Mirage so I was disappointed. We wanted to check out at 1:00-2:00 since our flight is at 5:00 but they said $40 extra. :-( 
Also noticed a lot of workers in Mirage looks unhappy or just didnt have a happy cheerful face when we encountered them. wasnt an issue tho but just had a lil unexciting feeling. bed was too soft, not good for me. one major problem is that mirage does not have at least one decent casual dining resturants, even the upscale resturant doesnt seem popular. we didnt eat here but had to go elsewhere. :-( 
overall, dont mind to stay at Mirage just once more, maybe the suites room next time but that's all. the only restuarant I'd like to try at Mirage is the steakhouse. other then soft bed, unhappy faces, no good resturants and no freebies we didnt have any other problems here. :-P

3 1\/2 stars. Been here couple times last two years. It's a good location and since the Mirage doesn't have a "mall", being next to Caesars Forum Shops and across from the Venetian Shops is convenient for us shoppers. 

Rooms:  The rooms are fine, but was expecting a separate shower and soaking tub like many other casino hotel bathrooms. My other complaint was the room key seemed never to work and on my last visit, maintenance had to replace the battery for the door lock. Frustrating as heck. 

The wifi here is just horrible. We should get a refund from the daily resort fee. Coming here for a convention in this hotel severely limits your work efforts. 

Restaurants: Carnegie Deli. Only 24 hr place before Pantry opened late last year. Need to check it out Pantry when I am here next month. I think this location has better food than their NYC counterpart! Pastrami was just so good. Breakfast too. 

Heritage Steak: I really wanted to love this place as much as I love Craftsteak at MGM Grand. It was good and gave it 4 stars. Just didn't blew me away compare to Craftsteak. Now I did hang out a lot at their Heritage Steak lounge bar. Great bartenders. 

Cravings Buffet. Came here for dinner and all I ate was crab legs and roast beef\/ prime rib. Yum. Bonus was beer\/wine included with dinner. Negative was waiters don't refill your drinks for you. You have to go and get your own sodas, beer, wine. They only clear your plates. 

BLT Burger. Can't go wrong eating here! Glad there is a Starbucks!

Rhumbar. I must have came on an off night as I got one of the worst outdoor service. Last time I'll be there. I'll go somewhere else where it is more welcoming. Too bad too with its nice outdoor area. 

Beatles Love. Awesome show! Everyone should see it. 

Dolphin Habitat and Secret Garden. Didn't realize how close you get to see the dolphins! Pool. Decent but rather small pool compare to other pools. 

Will need to check out Terry Fator and maybe dine at Stack when I'm here next month for convention. 

Please upgrade the wifi speed here!!!

Caveat: I'm an Aria sort of girl...any time I stay at another hotel in Vegas, I end up comparing it to the Aria. 

I had low expectations for the Mirage, and I must admit that they were exceeded. 

The rooms are nice--not too small, well furnished, reasonably modern. And the nightstand drawer handles are perfect bottle openers!

My only complaints:
-No outlets near the bed (this is 2014, people)
-No sound insulation between room and hallway

In a perfect world, every Vegas hotel room would have a button,  la Aria, that turns off all the lights and closes the black out curtain with one fell press. I guess I can't really fault the Mirage for not having that, though.

The pool is nice, and there are decent food options. I could stay here again!

I loooove this casino!   The cocktail watresses are awesome and fast!  I was on a role with the wheel of fortune slots and triple diamonds!  My bf and I were there so long and late that we forgot it wasnt the hotel we were staying at.  So half drunk and tired we walked around the casino for a good 20 minutes wondering where the hell our room was. lol

I wasn't expecting much since a friend of a friend got us a comped room here last minute for the weekend.  

Free parking! Check in is at 3pm and be prepared to wait in line...check out is at 11am.

We must have stayed in one of the renovated rooms because it was nice!  Very clean and modernly decorated.  The room is laid out well enough that there is a desk with 2 chairs, and another upholstered chair next to the king size bed.  The bed was pretty comfortable too. Nice size flatscreen tv, but no HBO :( The bathroom was tiny, but nicely done, with a back lit mirror, subway glass mosaic tiles, and  granite counter top. Bathtub\/shower could have been nicer, but this was the standard room, so we were pleased.

 It is also a great location on the strip.  We will be back!

Some of these people complaining about pricing and supposed mold in room... First of all it's Vegas so we're ever u go it's expensive you should know that.. second of all I've stayed at the hotel numerous times and not 1time did I have complaints the staff was exceptional of course if you got snacks in the room you pay for then they warn you before not to touch unless you wanna pay a crap load of money at least they warn you..third of all people complaining about walking 10 mins to get coffee come on ITS VEGAS all you do is walk... Mirage has always been good to me when I stay there never encountered mold never encountered dirty rooms never encountered anything out of the ordinary it's irritating to hear people complain..

Nice rooms, liked the oasis swimming pool. Just found it frustrating that the pool is barely 41\/2 feet all over. Really you go there to be waist deep in water while drinking the day away. Other than that, great casino.

This place is just gorgeous. We love the dolphins and Lions in the back, as well as the volcano in the front. If you are heading to vegas, you should definitely put The Mirage at the top of your go-to list.

Just checked out after 4 days. Rooms are good. Pretty clean but gets super humid. Also bathrooms are horrid. Everything is so low and close to the ground. (I'm taller so it's a stretch) shower head was dirty and I wasn't super comfortable washing my hair.

Not a bad hotel.. not bad considering the only time we spent in the hotel was to sleep, shower, and change clothes. Didn't really do too much gambling\/clubbing\/eating at the hotel at all, so I can't really speak that. Next time I guess.. 

Our room had a pretty nice view of the strip. We could see the Wynn, Encore, Venetian, etc. from our room. So +1 star for that. 

The Bathroom was nice... double sink, stand in shower (water pressure was a little weak) and separate bath tub that I'll have to try the next time around.

Sucks that I didn't get to really walk around and explore the hotel more, but I'll try and do that next time. But from my experience there this time, I'll give The Mirage 3 stars. Might rate it better next time.

BTW.... the peeps that flag the Taxi's for you in valet, yeah - they fuckin BLOW!!!! Yea, almost forgot! F**K those assholes! Those people are very rude and do not understand the meaning of customer service! They can go to hell and Suck It! ...should knock a star off because of those fuckers!

The Mirage Hotel and Casino in las Vegas is probably on my list of one of the best hotels I have stayed at. When we checked-In, I inquired with the receptionist if there were any available Complementary upgrades. She told me there were none since it was the 4th of July weekend, however she instead gave us a two complementary day pass at their Spa and Salon. That was awesome!

We booked the resort tower room (regular king room) for 3 nights, we found our room to be very spacious. There was ample closet space for clothes and luggage, a receiving hall, a spacious work desk. Our view from the room was over looking the Venetian and Harrah's hotel.

The hotel is almost a city on its own, they have 4 different shows per night, 12 bars and lounges, 20 plus restaurants, snack bars and coffee shops. 

They also feature a Secret Garden and Dolphin habitat. The pool, although large always seemed packed. 

I was mesmerized by the volcano show (fire and water) with the music inspired by Zakir Hussein, it's not to be missed. I will definitely come back and stay at The Mirage in the future.

Sportsbook is pretty nice and they offer you a free drink with every bet. Was mad that the ticket take was confused on what horse I picked to win and therefore lost me my bet but I'll choose to overlook it this time since it was Superbowl Sunday and the place was a madhouse!
Also, you have to try their Rueben sandwich, AWESOME!!

I have stayed in a few Vegas resorts and this current trip, I was less than enamored with Mirage.  The check in process was slow and unorganized, the room decent but nothing to write home about (aged and needs some basic maintenance), the restaurants pricey and decent but not great, and the kicker.....gambling here is a drag.  I have become a recent fan of Planet Hollywood and some other casinos on the southern part of the strip due to personable dealers, reasonable rates, and service.  My experiences playing the tables at Mirage have yielded slow to no drink service, dealers with no personality and, if you have rewards points, it takes forever for them to take and process your card compared to other casinos.  All-in-all this hotel & casino experience is in a 1-2 range and that is after getting a promotional and smoking deal on the room rate.  I would rather pay a higher room rate and stay at Wynn, Palazzo, Venetian, PH, or Aria and there are numerous places I would rather gamble.

I love the Mirage.  The casino is always packed and full of energy.  It's in a great location on the strip and plays host to the famous volcano eruption every night.  It has a massive sports book and several great dining options from California Pizza Kitchen to the Heritage Steakhouse.  The pool area is great too.  I've stayed here several times over the years and always can't wait to get back.  Also, you don't have to go far for the Beatles Love, Terry Fator, or Boyz ll Men.

I recently stayed at The Mirage for my birthday. This was my first time going to Vegas and I was not 100% soled that I wanted to go. After all, I don't gamble. My ideal destination was to head to the Caribbean because I love the beach and the clear blue water. However my friend assured me that I would enjoy Vegas, that there was a lot more to do besides gambling,  and she picked out a hotel with a great pool. Well, I had a fabulous time! The pool was the best ever, and I felt like I was in the Caribbean with the palm tress and the waterfalls. It was so relaxing!!! Our hotel room was AWESOME, and the service was great! In short, I did  not want to leave Vegas but most of all, I did not want to leave The Mirage.

Attended the WSGT 2014 with a group of friends on Saturday. I have come to this event for several years to see the quality of food and wine going down while the price has increased from $200 to $225 per person. Attendees this year are downed to a few hundreds compare to a few years ago of well over a thousand. 
Most of the great Bordeaux wines such as the Lafite, Mouton and Latour have disappeared. The outstanding ones are the 2000 Pontet Canet and the 2004 Margaux but they run out of pour half way into the game. Will not come to this event again unless they make improvements.

Perfect for traveling with your dog ! No complaints! 

We thought long and hard before booking here. 
Sure, there are newer\/more luxurious hotels on the strip, but we were traveling with our 12 year old dog and read that the Mirage had a special dog lawn area, and we were sold. 

SO glad we stayed here!!!!!

Staff was SO sweet to our girl, I got to know the valet crew from taking her out to potty so much. 

Unfortunately it seems most of the hotel staff didn't even know they had a special dog lawn area, because it is SO lovely, large, and dare I say "serene" considering the location!!!! 

Poop bag dispensers and right on the short tram line (to treasure island) on the super hot hours we would just ride the air conditioned tram for 20 minutes or so so she could get some loving and stay cool also. 

TIP; The distance from your room to a potty area is pretty far, resulting in my dog "dropping a nugget" in the casino once or twice. Bring a bag with you to discreetly pick it up, OR bring a baby\/doggie stroller to zoom your pooch out.  

Super happy, super nice hotel. I am now noticing "some" harsh reviews on here. We had a normal room ie; not a suite etc and our room was SUPER clean!!! Housekeeping was perfect, room was super  tidy, and we are picky \/ well traveled world travelers. No smoke smell, nothing unclean etc; 
I am not saying the other reviewers are false but, who knows. Maybe people want a free vacation or something?!? 


Pool, parking and buffet were good!

Spent four nights at The Mirage this week. We stayed in a Tower Suite, which is two levels down from their top level room. The room was spacious, comfortable, modern and classy at the same time. So based on appearances, the room gets a 4.  The jaccuzzi tub, and shower were nice, but there was mold on the shower floor, so we showered with our flip flops on. The 55 in LED tv was great, but the connection was not consistent. I'm uncertain if the connectivity issues with the Wi-Fi were related to the poor tv signal, or the other way around, but those are issues that I think can be avoided, and should be responded to promptly. We did not have a remote in our room for the surround sound system. We made several patient calls, requested a replacement remote, and had to wait over four hours before a tech brought a universal remote that prevented us from using all of the features properly. Minus one star for not having that checked out before releasing the room. And minus another star for taking so long to partially resolve the issue. In the end, our issue was never fixed. Plus the tech stated that he would be back to sync the tv and soundbar, explain the exact problem and provide alternatives. Tech never returned. 

We didn't spend a lot of time in the room, and the parts that we used, we enjoyed thoroughly. I always feel a certain way about having services included in the cost associated with a visit, not being available due to negligence or follow through. Still deciding if I would go back or not.

Stayed there this weekend after not staying here for couple years.  This place has gone so down hill over the last couple years.  
1.  Don't cash a slot ticket at the cash machines located around the casino unless you want to be approached by a "working gal" moments after walking away.  The frequency of open solicitation requests gave a very unsafe feeling
2.  Don't expect the hotel bill to match reality.  Promotion credits are mishandled and aren't applied.  To try to resolve this matter, the MGM solution is just never answer the phone.

The Mirage hotel and casino is amazing!
I didn't stay here at this casino just casino hopping.
We had drinks snd fun here. 
I love the decorations and furniture in this casino.
I'm a fan because every was nice and pleasant.
I will return .


Gloria~

We only stayed one night cause we have free stay.   We were able to check in earlier than usual for $30.  Which we gladly paid.  The front desk lady was very helpful and friendly.   Valet is fast.  Some areas of hotel are under construction.   Rooms were ok.  Bathroom small and poor ventilation

Stayed here when I went on a family vacation to Vegas.  We were given a room with a view of the strip and an even more amazing view of the erupting volcano.  On top of that, they were having a promotion on their website that included 2 free buffets at Carvings buffet and 4 free admissions to Siegfried & Roy's Secret Garden & Dolphin Habitat... sweeet deal!

The hotel is centrally located on the strip between Treasure Island and Caesar's Palace.  They have a tram that takes you to TI if you're not up for the walk.

The rooms are newly renovated and very spacious with modern decor.  The beds were also very comfortable.  The bathrooms were on the small side, but I can deal.  Love the theme in the lobby and the giant fish tank by the front desk.

The hotel check-in attendant never welcomed us or even smiled at us.

The room was nicely decorated. The plasma TV and iPod player were nice too. However, the vanity mirror light didn't work and the shower light didn't work. The bathroom tile over the tub was broken also.

We enjoyed the BLT Burger and the Carnegie's chocolate mousse cake. However, most of their restaurants were overpriced.  We didn't like the food at B.B. King's restaurant. The live music was nice, but the food didn't taste like SOUL food to me. We walked across the street and enjoyed the Grand Lux Cafe at the Vienna hotel and some other restaurants instead.

I didn't like the fact that the hotel wanted to charge me for one band-aid. I feel that it should have been included in the $15 daily resort fee. The hotel also charged me for the in-room bar even though I never used it. It's a good thing that I checked out in person so that I could catch the error and have them correct it immediately.

We visited Bare pool on Monday for their Industry (locals) party. It was $100\/lounge chair (your F&B minimum) which we easily consumed in drink and food and that was reasonable compared to what we pay at Liquid and Moorea Beach. Artisan is cheaper, but Bare crowd is more diverse and people (at least on the Monday) tended to be in better "shape."
-We were hotel guests at the Mirage so we got in free before noon with no cover charge. No wait at the door when we strolled in at noon.
-Regardless of how old you look, you must have your ID to use a credit card or room charge. Otherwise, you have to pay in cash. Environment is very secure, so I had no concern about bringing my whole wallet in. There is no exception to the no ID rule -- no matter how much white hair you have!
-Environment\/Pool - intimate, but space is designed to foster energy and a party atmosphere so no complaints. Their upper level whirlpool has see-through plexiglass wall is a cool visual. If you want a lounge-chair, sofa-bed, etc you should get in during the first 1-2 hours as they did fill up promptly. They filled up the cabanas at a discount as the day wore on to get people in -- all seating was filled by 3:30.
-Crowd - on our Monday, definitely a healthy mix. More sedate from 11am - 1:30 when it really picked up and we got a good mix of 20s\/30 year-golds, lots of locals, few bodybuilders (men & women), some swingers (they were polite). After the bar had been open for a few rounds, about 6-10 women in the pool were topless. Nice mix of men and women -- lots of couples and single ladies\/men... healthy mix, not too guy heavy. Everyone was either chilling or partying to the DJ, very fun crowd and will return.

Compared to Liquid, Moorea and Artisan pool? IMHO: Liquid is more expensive and crowd a smidgen more snooty at times (and no topless allowed); Moorea appeared to us more intimate, F&B was higher on the day we visited, but an equally fun crowd. Artisan was definitely local and interesting swinger mix, but definitely a specialized environment you need to be looking for.
But Bare @ the Mirage had nice mix of a good DJ, prompt\/attentive service, nice\/clean pool and facilities and fun mix of crowd. Obviously you pay more for this pool trip but figure the $100-$200\/person bar tab is equal to a nice meal on the strip -- and this lasts all afternoon and has nice visuals to boot!

Had reservations for tomorrow but just came down with the flu... Canceled the night before but was told I'm getting billed for my two nights anyways ... 72 hr. Cancellation policy??? I have the flu... It gave me no notice  didn't want to spread my germs cost me 200.00$.  ???????? I was told if I go into my doctors office tomorrow and have the doctor send a note that they will not bill me. I feel like I'm in grammar school... Needing a note from my doctor.
I will get their note  
I hope they read mine ..... 
You guys suck and I'll never stay at the Mirage again!!!!!!!!!!

Got a fantastic deal here for New Years Eve weekend.

We got a resort queen room with two queen beds.
The beds were extremely comfortable, as well as the pillows.

I like that they had a 42 inch flat screen tv mounted on the wall, and had cable to watch the news, movies and other things.

I like that there is also a music box thing where you can hook up your phone to play music and it comes with an attached auxiliary cord.

And a small table with two chairs.
Although the room does not come with a fridge, you can request for one.
They only have the fridge that is already stocked with drinks that you have to pay for if you grab something. Along with snacks stocked in the room.

No microwave either.
And the bathroom is tiny compared to other hotels I've stayed at.

The cleaning people did not come at specific times, and one of the times they came, we asked if she could come back 30minutes later, but she never came back.

And another cleaning lady didn't mind cleaning the rooms while we were still there.

Overall, it was a clean and comfortable stay.
My favorite thing about mirage is that it's central on the strip and has shopping centers, food court, and everything you will need if you don't like to walk too far.

The Mirage is a great hotel if you are looking for a nice hotel, in the middle of the strip that doesn't break the bank.  I especially enjoy the Mirage pool and their newly renovated rooms.  The only downside is that their suites are in desperate need of renovation right now as well, and I think they are in the process of doing that, so perhaps my next visit will warrant 5 stars.  If you are looking for a great hotel to have a party (bachelor, bachelorette type thing), then Mirage suites are perfect as they are large and not too expensive.  Don't bother with the Siegrfried & Roy Gardens....for $15 it's a rip-off, however, the "be a trainer for the day with the dolpihns" package sounds cool (but not sure how much that is).  If you do stay at the Mirage, be sure to check out the Beatles LOVE show and BLT Burger.  Japonaise is also awesome. As for gambling....cross the street and play at Imperial Palace for looser slots and cheaper table games.  Good luck and have fun!

I had a good vacation experience with Mirage. The location relative to the strip is great as it is near center. The check in was seamless and I got the room on time. The hotel room decor is warm and all of the utilities worked. The toilet though, I had to flush many times to get things down but that's alright. I would definitely stay at the Mirage again.

What more could a Brit want from a Vegas hotel:

- The Beatles playing on a loop in the lobby (right next to a Beatles 'Love' shop, next door to the Beatles 'Love' show)
- A mini menagerie of animals INSIDE the grounds of the hotel
- A pool surrounded by waterfalls, with drinks on tap
- Superb on-strip location
- Huge, swish suites 

Cannot say enough great things about the Mirage! 

Brilliant breakfast buffets, awesome gift shops, two nightclubs on sight, ace slots, plenty of restaurants... would LOVE to stay there again. 

LOVE LOVE LOVE the Mirage!

The room was nice but there are too many negatives.  First the elevators to the room are way too far from front desk.i did not have anyone to help. There was no one at the front bell desk to help and the carpet made it very hard to take my case.the halls are noisy and the doors thin. The lines at coffee were very very long. Overall I would not recommend this place.

Went to Vegas on April 1st as My partner's birthday is on March first and mine is May first and we both thought it would be a fun way to celebrate. 

We arrived at the Mirage by taxi and were greeted by the doorman before getting in line to check in. the wait was standard, the line was fairly long (about 50 people) but went fast as the hotel had enough employees at check-in to accommodate everyone in a timely manner. 

Margo checked us in and was friendly, personable, and professional. She asked how my day was going and we started chatting while in the process of getting checked in. I mentioned to her that we were visiting Vegas for both of our birthdays and because my partner just turned 21. and she told us that she would send something up to the room for us for our birthdays (which we received later that afternoon)  she asked about my room reservation to confirm the type of room and then handed us our room keys and told us where to find the elevators while also mentioning that she had taken the liberty to give us a complimentary upgrade to a tower suite. She also instructed us that if there was anything the hotel could to make our trip a little better not to hesitate to ask as they wanted to make sure we were enjoying our stay. Awesome customer experience and she clearly understands top-notch customer service.

As far as the hotel goes, the amenities are on the high end of standard and the facilities are clean, the pool is nice and the nighttime volcano show is pretty cool, especially if you get to see it from your room. While this hotel is not luxury compared to some of the other much more expensive hotels on the strip, it is still very nice for a weekend getaway and the rooms are affordably priced. None the less I enjoyed my stay and will be back as I have plans to return in July

In terms of vegas hotels I would give the Mirage a 3.5 - 4 star rating however because of the high level of customer service I received and also the hotel in comparison to most non-vegas hotels, I decided to award this review 5 star.

I enjoyed my stay and will return as I have reservations booked for July.

Great stay at The Mirage Hotel and Casino

Ahhhhhhh! Finally got to our destination after a 5 hour drive.
We stayed down at the casino's for 4 hours.
Las Vegas has really changed, my last visit was 8 years ago.
The Casino and Club Jet at The Mirage were crazy busy when we arrived.
Our room was very nice, two queen beds, flat screen TV, great view of the strip.
We spent quite a few hours down at the pool and jacuzzi. They have great service down there and amazing drinks.
We all had a great time and plan to come back soon.

Me and my boyfriend definitely enjoyed our stay at the Mirage. The check in was quick and the person that checked us in was very polite. Once we got to the room we loved it, we stayed in the resort king. I thought I was going to need more space and nope it was perfect. The pool was awesome and the drinks were great. We also tried the room service for breakfast and it was also good and stopped by Samba and enjoyed some steak for dinner. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely come back!

We love this hotel. The rooms are big and clean! We got complementary champagne delivered to our room after check in which was awesome. They arranged a shuttle back to the airport and it was right on time at 6am. The casino is a typical Vegas casino. I didn't love the pizza at CPK, but my husband loved the tacos he got. The yogurt shop is awesome. The mirage shop was really nice and so convenient. The pool gets crowded really early but it's beautiful so that's understandable. The drinks at the pool are expensive but they're huge so they're worth it. We've stayed at many hotels in Vegas and the mirage is our fave by far.

Oh Mirage, you complete me.  Well, almost.  

My husband and I usually go to Vegas a couple times a year and last year the Mirage was one of two hotel we stayed at on the Strip.  We got a Tower Deluxe room with a view of the strip.  All I can say is yes, yes, yes!!!

The Tower Deluxe rooms have keyed private elevators that take you directly to the upper rooms.  This is really nice, since the hotel's regular elevators constantly have a wait.  The TD rooms boast a upgraded bathroom that includes marble double sinks, jetted tub and separate shower.  The travel shampoo\/shower gel\/lotion are all from Mirage's spa and the sink area also has a nice lighted magnifying mirror.  Additionally, there is a huge full size mirror outside the bathroom door so you can get a view of of of you :)  

The bedroom area had a King size bed with a fluffy comforter. It has nice closets on each side of the bed, complete with robes!  There are also nightstands on each side with a safe and a iPod dock (alarm clock).  Over by the window is the desk and on the opposite wall of the bed is a nice sized flat screen.  

I have to note too that the Mirage Volcano is a must see at least once when in Vegas.  It is free and happens every 15 minutes in the evening.  It is a spectacular show of fire balls dancing to drum beats and lava erupting to the music.  It was designed by the same people who did the Bellagio fountains. 

Their pool area is a series of pools and waterfalls and has a nice resort feel too it.  They also have the Secret Garden near the pool where you can see Dophins and the White Tigers (for a fee of course!).  

My only gripe with Mirage is the food on site.  While I do like to hit some nice restaurants while in Sin City, I need fast food from time to time - the Mirage just doesn't have it.  There is a deli on-site that is quite good, but my turkey sandwich set me back $15!!!!!  So if you want fast food you are out of lunch at the Mirage!  

Still, it was one of my best Vegas experiences.  No real complaints.  I give it 4.5 stars!

Worst. Hotel. Ever. It costs way too much for he low quality I got, they mixed up my order not once, not twice, THREE times and after I got the right food, it was still awful. One of their burritos gave me a stomach bug, they charged me for coming a few minutes early and there's a glitchy "complementary machine" that has overpriced junk food and $10 water bottles. That machine's glitches cost me another 200 bucks even though I didn't even touch it. Then there's the banquet which served me crappy kid's food in which the employees were the most cancerous, ignorant people I've ever seen. You had to travel through a casino full of smoking drunks to even get to your elevator. Besides the business of aspect, staying here was a waste of my time and money. This place is the worst. NEVER COME HERE. NEVER.

Oh Mirage, I love you. You popped my Vegas cherry and I will always remember how kind and gentle you were to me! :)

The bf and I arrived at the Mirage via the bus that waits infront of the airport. =) Check in was EASY BREEZY but the trek from the door to the elevator is sometimes a journey, especially when you're chocolate wasted. We requested for a room that was on a higher floor and was granted that wish. It had a FANTASTIC view of the volcano and the strip. The only down side was that it was a smoking room and smelled like my uncle's car. blek. But besides that it was a BEAUTIFUL ROOM. The bed was comfy and housekeeping came daily. hehe. The bathroom was a little bit of a let down because I expected something a little more swanky for Vegas. But whaatevers.
