The casinos allegedly pump in oxygen by that's just lore - plenty of people would still gamble if they took air out! The Mirage has one nice restaurant (which Vegas speak means your own famous chef or chef-inspired menu) and that's Portofino (read that review), and a number of smaller more casual restaurants (CPK, LVB burgers, Pantry), all of which always had lines (it always seemed like peak times). Some restaurants have you VIP treatment if you have a gold or platinum MLife casino card like the pantry. All waits were always under 30' for us. Mirage lowest tables starts $15 - they even had a $500 slot machine! The wait staff at the tables were quick to get your drinks. Our room key card for the tower floor rooms didn't work well and we had to have replacements brought up. The sunken bath tub is deep but not big- cannot share a bath- no jacuzzi. Also there is no free bottle of water or coffee - they want you to spend spend spend. The service was good but WATCH OUT because most of the hotels charge a resort fee (not negotiable) in addition to the tax! The Mirage was $32 plus a 12% tax. And you can't escape it even if you book online. All the major hotel casinos on the strip charge a resort fee - regardless if you don't use their wifi, gym, business center. So don't be fooled by the low rates because you'll need to add an additional $65-75\/night! Ouch!

I've long been a fan of The Mirage since it was THE place on The Strip.  Over the years, my wife and I have stayed there several times and enjoyed ourselves.  Our latest visit was good, but I noticed that The Mirage has become a second-tier hotel with a bit of fraying around the edges.  One particularly disappointing aspect was the pool.  I used to love the pool, but it has become an oasis of fat slobs and no longer employs hot cocktail servers.  When I say "fat slobs," I mean truly gross people, not talking average people.  I guess the cheap rooms have attracted a new crowd.  Next visit to Vegas, probably gonna look elsewhere...sorry Mirage, not bad, but not great.

I've stayed here three times, and I'll be back again. The casino is great, the staff is friendly, and it's extremely clean. It's not as big as some of the newer resorts, but I like that because it's easier to find your way around. However, my favorite thing about the Mirage is its location. It is right in the middle of the strip. It's easy to get to many casinos in the area, and less of a walk if you want to go to one end or the other. We recently stayed at Mandalay Bay which was nice, but it was very far from everything else. As far as the casino games, it would be nice to see more $5-10 Blackjack tables, but that seems to be the case everywhere on the strip. The wait staff comes around often when you're at the tables, so your next drink is never far away! Also, if you enjoy buffets, the Mirage has a great one!

Best hotel on the strip, and that's coming from a family with 3 kids between 6 and 12. We LOVE the pool here, and enjoyed the animals today too at the secret garden. Saw terry Fator, that was cool, because it was just downstairs. Ate at the Harrahs buffet across the street, and even saw a show at Harrahs, the Mac King comedy show which is definitely five star! 
Our food favorites inside the Mirage are The Carnegie deli, BLT, and Stack.

It's not super swanky or sexy but it is has a great location and i always seem to get awesome rates here! The rooms aren't anything fancy but covers the basics! Really big pool too if you aren't looking for a day party and would prefer to  have a chill day and just tan.

oh, if you're coming with a group and your plan is to pack as many people as possible in a room, this is not the right hotel for that.

I'm only staying here because I was told we had to for the volleyball tournament we are attending.  Since we have to be out of the hotel by 6am and breakfast is not included, I brought breakfast items to eat. No fridge but you can get one for an extra $25 per night yikes! Therefore people fill up their coolers with ice to keep their stuff cold.  I had to go to two other floors to find one with ice. No coffee maker and no microwave in the room.  I can stay at other hotels for half the price and get a mini fridge, microwave, coffee maker and free wifi included!  I'll have to see if I have anything good to say when I'm not as cranky!

We didn't stay in the Mirage's hotel but we did get to spend some time in their casino. The casino itself was well organized and they had some really unique slot machines. The atmosphere here was laid-back, and not once we're we harassed by the staff like at some of the other hotels.

In the end we wish we could have seen a show here, but the lobby was gorgeous, and we thoroughly enjoyed spending some time here.

Oh dear, what a beautiful place.

The rooms have been recently remodeled and they were amazing. Very plush, very minimal, very comfortable and clean.

The pool is pretty awesome, definitely a lounge pool. The depth doesn't exceed 3 ft. and there are chairs galore.

The staff there is very helpful and nice and I never had a problem with service. 

There was no volcano show though...It's being remodeled until November of this year. Probably a good time to go.

I do not have much love for the Mirage.  Actually, I have none.  

Booked the Love package.. so for the price, maybe I should  not complain, but the experience bordered on zero stars.

Checked in upon arrival - were told there was a room on the 2nd floor, at a corner, that was bigger, and had a great volcano view.  We said sure thanks- go up to the room, the guy must have meant view of the AC units and systems to power the whole hotel, because that is all we could see (and hear!).

We call down, they say oh that's weird, come down and we'll hold your bags and get you a better room, strip view, within two hours.  They say they will call our cell when it's ready so we do not have to sit around the Mirage.  We think, ok maybe this place is not so bad...

FOUR hours later we return, they say oh sorry, we forgot to call, and give us keys to a new room.  Girlfriend goes up to room to get the bell boy to bring our bags up, and I go to pick up the Love tickets now that I have an actual room and they can process it.

Stand at the Love counter for no less than 45 minutes while the guy seems to be on the phone processing our tickets, then talking to his manager.. and they inform me that the room number I gave is not my room.  WHAT?  I call girlfriend who is in the room, the room number I gave this guy, and she is watching TV and our bags are on their way.  They tell me that is it not my room, I should be in another room.  I say, well I am not moving, they say we have to as there are other people who have checked into the room we are in.  WHAT?  Isn't this why they have computer systems at hotels?

I go back AGAIN to the front desk, get a new room, girlfriend moves, and we have to reroute bags to this now THIRD room.  And Mirage offers us $50 to spend at the hotel, but not to be used for that stupid resort fee.  

We were so frustrated by dealing with the employees after wasting our entire day, we just did our best to enjoy the rest of our Vegas trip.  We will NEVER go back to Mirage.

We stayed at the Mirage hotel for two nights, and saw The Beatles LOVE show (which is amazing btw, especially if you're a Beatles fan). 
We really enjoyed our stay, the reason I gave it minus one star was because when we first arrived and went into the bathroom, there was a clump of hair on the shower wall. Gross, but not the end of the world. The other thing you need to watch out for are the items on the counter in which if you remove them, triggering a sensor, they will charge you, so just be careful. 
Large comfy bed (if you like a soft mattress), they only provide two sheets, so both nights we had to all down to house keeping for an extra blanket. Lots of storage and closet space. I loved the mirrors in the bathroom (they're perfect for getting ready to go out for the night, ladies!). 
Overall, good experience, and great location.

I come to Vegas on business one or two times in a year and I don't look forward to it. It's tough to work in this environment. In the past, this conference has usually been at Caesars. Always loud and smoky and it's getting a little rundown. Plus you can never figure out how to get out of the place  - traps you. This has been awesome. It's quiet at night. The service is great. MGM has really figured out customer service here. We'll done.

I have to say that I was VERY pleasantly surprised with the quality of our stay at Mirage. I'll admit, we have been spoiled by the likes of Wynn, Encore, Venetian, Palazzo, Vdara, etc, and I was somewhat skeptical about spending less for a room. I opted for a 1br suite which was VERY spacious, and very accommodating. The older age of the complex is not unnoticeable, however it did not detract from the overall stay. All aspects of our stay, from the dining options, the lounging options, to the wide array of room options was, as I mentioned, surprisingly awesome. Now that I have made the jump from the super high end locations mentioned earlier, to the Mirage, I have to say it will be very difficult for me to decide somewhere other than the Mirage due to the overall quality and value that I experienced.

Very disappointed.  No pillow cases on any of the pillows.  It took 7 hrs. for housekeeping to correct the problem.  I received a call from housekeeping at 3am about a refrigerator I didn't request.  We are still waiting for the sewing kit we asked for.   Poor service, not clean, and long lines.  We may not be back.

Stayed here last year; it was nice. We got a good view of the strip and a good view of the volcano :) The casino was okay, the walk from the room elevators to the check in counter or doors to the strip is way too far.
The room was comfortable, just wished the bathroom had 2 vanities.

If I only had to judge the Mirage by its remodeled rooms, it would definitely get 4 stars from me. However, I'm basing it on the entire experience and here's how it went.

We arrived well after the 3pm check in time. My friend had requested an upgrade for me but the gal who checked me in didn't mention it at all, nor did she say 'sorry we can't offer it to you' or anything to that effect. Just no mention. She did however mention the fact that it was our 10 yr anniversary and said she was giving us a bottle of complimentary champagne. Oh well, better than nothing right?

So we go up to the room and guess what? Housekeeping was IN the room cleaning up. I was super pissed now. I was exhausted and really just wanted to relax, but instead, I went back downstairs and had the gal give me another room. 

OK, so back up again and I called my friend who requested an upgrade for us and he informed me that he had arranged for the upgrade to a suite and for me to call back down to the front desk. So I called and found out that the suites only had one bed and we needed two, so we decided to just decline the offer and stay where we were.

About an hour in the room, we get a call from the front desk asking us if we were going to upgrade. Hubby was like "WTF? Don't they communicate amongst each other?". We had to tell them NO. Believe it or not, after a few more hours, some housekeeping manager comes to our room, knocks and then opens our door. When she saw us inside she was taken aback and then asked us "you're leaving tonight right?" I was like "NO, we JUST checked in today".

So I was really annoyed with this whole check-in process and even more so by the fact that they were all clueless. We did eventually get our complimentary champagne, but we weren't in the room and it was left outside when we returned later that night. Wasn't anything special -- something we'd never heard of .... we never drank it, brought it home still unopen.

Now to the room itself. I liked the large plasma tv in the room which accommodated our Wii. There is a mount for your iPod which is nice if you brought your's along. Bathrooms were much smaller than other hotels, but it was alright.... I don't spend a lot of time in there so it doesn't really matter to me. The beds were very comfortable and they had the nice quilt blankets which I like. I hate those polyester blankets with a passion and I don't stay in hotels which have those if I can help it.

There is a mini bar in the room but don't touch it at all costs. The gal told me at check in that it's weight sensored and if you touch it you'll be charged. Hubby looked at the menu -- $4 for a can of diet coke, $71 for the Hennessey and mind you, it's the little teenie bottle -- SHUDDUP! RIGHT?

The hotel itself shows its age. The young man said it felt "Hawaiian-ish" in the lobby which I guess is true. The casino was really boring. I spent 2 nights in there on the slots but since this is an older hotel, the casino itself isn't very big so everything is jam packed into this small space. I got bored pretty quickly, and even though I spent  2 nights there, it was only for a few hours

On our last night I called down to see if they could offer us an extra night at the same rate. The woman who picked up the phone was very curt and sounded impatient. She said "this is our rate" and that's that. I thought it was interesting how at a time like this, when occupancy rate is down and the entire economy of the country is in such shambles, that they'd rather have an empty room than fill it, and also, the display of such bad customer service is laughable.

The only thing I liked about this hotel was the room, but then hubby thought it was smaller than the other hotels we've stayed at on the strip but gives off the illusion that it was larger due to furniture placement. For me, I was more appalled at the customer service from check in to check out (which thankfully we did over the tv so I didn't have to deal with another moronic staff member) rather than the room itself. 

For the same price, you can get better service and better all around on the strip than the Mirage.

Great hotel.
The sleep quality and cleanliness are good. Everything anyone could possibly want to do is on site. WiFi IS free if you are staying at the hotel.
Upsild to a room that did not meet my needs. Room overwhelmed with smell of pot. Condescending front desk people. Manager and ass!!

Here for a convention. Hotel is doing a very good job handling the 1,500+ people in our group. The banquet service is very organized and check-in was quick. The rooms are nice and clean and our luggage was delivered to our rooms shortly after checking in.

Great place to stay casino was great food was great staff was good although didn't really have much interaction with them. Cocktail waitress could of came around more in the casino offering drinks. Room was beautiful we had the Volcano view room on the 21st floor room 78 great room just watch out touching items for sale in the room you will be charged for them even if you don't use them. But the front desk will fix it for you. Room service at 2:00 am was fast the food was amazing. Even seen someone famous walking around the casino. Not a place to take you family with small kids. A lot of working girls in the casino area dressed rather inappropriate. Over all a great place to stay.

I went to the secret garden with my grandson. He did the paint with the dolphins. He had the most amazing time. I also had the most amazing time watching him experience this. The lady was so patient kind and warm. I can't remember her name. She had red hair and was from Florida. My grandson asked her for her phone number. We purchased pictures and got some with the experience. We some how lost the photos and the painting. He was so upset. We looked everywhere and called everywhere many times and could not find them. I treasure ever moment I spend with my grandson he is amazing a strong happy boy who has been through more than most of us go through in a lifetime. I was beyond happy to watch him experience this and to have that memory with him although I was also crushed to lose the pictures and painting. One of my phone calls to the mirage trying to locate the photos and painting lead me to the concierge at the mirage. I  could not understand why I was transferred there how could they help me. I spoke with Abby or as we call her the angel Abby and without even asking Abby went to work to help us calling the places we had been and arranging another paint with the dolphin experience .She went above and beyond what anyone could expect like it was just the normal thing to do. I thank her for that. Words can't describe what that meant to me .  I cherish every moment with him and try to let him experience everything he wants to . I don't ever wanna say I should of especially when it comes to him. 
Thank you Abby and the mirage and secret garden for all working together to give us a redo . Not many places in vegas would go as far as you all did to make us non big spenders so happy

Wonderful rate for the room 
Meal at Fin was just ok stay away from the sauce noodles \/ beef broccoli Yum
Meal at BLT was great first time BLT med rare fabulous   stone ipa beer only in here
    Horrible the second time BLT
Caramelized onions ugh overdone bun \/ meat

Carnegies off the chart great!! The best Reuben I've ever ate !

Pantry Omelet blah ham & cheese 

No iPA good local beers in casino
Poker room dealers pleasant 
 Hotel room superb along w valet parking and bell hops. Nice vacation

Oh no the white lions are gone. I always remember seeing the white lion enclosure at the entrance to the Mirage once you get inside the casino. I don't know if they're gone for good or if they moved to another location in the casino. Instead of watching the lions scratch themselves and devour raw meat, there's a new, "hip" burger restaurant with a modest looking yet bored, snooty hostess. So that's the direction Vegas is going but c'mon, nothing beats white lions.

Years ago, the Mirage was the best place in Vegas. But now I see how the place has taken a step back. It still has great restaurant, one of the best sportsbooks in town, but you can see that it's still a little small and a little outdated. Overall, it's still a great place to stay and have a little fun. It's still in the middle of the Strip and that's always good. So there's probably more changes to happen at the Mirage for it to reclaim its former glory. A high, high recommendation.

I am updating my review since actually staying at the hotel\/Casino.

Checking in- We got in about 3am, only one other person was in line. We waited a good long while before someone else came to help us because the person checking people in was taking forever. I understand waiting a few minutes or so, but at 3am when all you want to do is go get settled, it was a little frustrating. 

Gaming- We all found the machines to be extremely tight. It made us not want to play at all. When you're playing the slots, and you get the bonus mini game and only win $4-$6 while you're on max bet... it kind of sets the tone for the rest of the games. This happened so many times it was not worth playing. There was not even a feeling of winning at all, not the slightest bit.  $8 ATM FEES! This made us not get more money out as well.. If we felt like we had the chance to win even a little bit, we might have. 

The room- Was clean, and bed bug free (thank you!). The maid service was very good. Actually organized the bathroom counter for us which we thought was thoughtful and a nice gesture. We could not hear the neighboring rooms which is always a plus, and we were not interrupted when we chose to sleep in. 

The food- Lots of restaurants available. We ate at a couple. 
 CPK- was good. The wait staff was friendly. Typical for this restaurant. I recommend the Tomato Soup-Amazing.
The Buffet- I was not impressed.. I wanted to be... but a lot of the food lacked flavor, the sushi was too dry, and the desert bar was lacking...There was nothing I tried that I wanted to eat a second time.
The cafe- Absolutely the worst service in the entire hotel\/casino. We stood outside waiting for a table while 3 people who worked there looked at us and just continued to walk around. I understand that it was 2am or so, but if you are open, then act like it. We then got seated and sat there for 10 minutes while again, waitresses made eye contact with us while we sat, yet no one came to help us. We got up and left.. without a single word from anyone that worked there. It was rude and not the way you should treat any customers.  

Aside from that, I might stay here again based solely on the rooms however I think I would try my luck at another Casino and not choose to eat at the Cafe at all.

It's surely not my first choice for hotel in Vegas. I have stayed in Mirage last June. The room was clean of course and modern. The view was nice. But the service sucks big time. My bf checked in and left me the key at the front desk. I got the key, walked hella far to the room and the key wouldn't work. So I called the front desk asking for someone to come up to open the door for me coz my bf was at a birthday party couldnt come back right away. I waited for freaking 20 mins still no one came. I called again and waited again another 15 mins still no answer for my quest. So i walked down to the front desk to get another key. I mentioned the wait at the front desk but she was just smiling and apologized. I should have been more bitchy to ask them to comp my room but oh well. Meanwhile there was a dirty cart of room service in front of my room's door and my bf didnt order room service. I did request twice for the cart to be taken away but they didnt clean up the mess until early the next morning. I would never stay here again.

Comfy bed, clean, and quite.  What more can you ask for?  How about a good view?  I upgraded for about $10 a night and it was well worth the money.  I would stay at the Mirage again which is something I can't say about all the hotels on the strip.

On our first trip to Vegas, we stayed at the Golden Nugget.  Very nice, but VERY far away from everything.  As we explored Vegas we came upon the Mirage and decided when we returned that we would definitely stay there.  We stayed in the "gold" elevator section.  Absolutely worth the few extra bucks.  The pool is incredible.  Buffet was "good".  It's central location on the strip is hard to surpass.   I prefer the Paris buffet, but if you don't feel like trekking, the Mirage one is not bad.   No matter how many big, knock your socks off casinos they add, the Mirage will always have a special place in my heart.

Out of the plethora of hotels on the Las Vegas Strip, The Mirage is one of the better ones because it has one of the best locations on the strip, it's more of a hotel for normal people in their early to mid 20s and I like Jet.  I've always had a good time here.

Their rooms were recently remodeled I believe and they are perfect for a group of girls because there's a lot of counter space in the bathroom and mirrors everywhere so you can get ready.  

It's a nice hotel without being extremely pricey.

I am in Vegas - ALL THE TIME - between working there about 2 mos each year to 4-5 weekend trips a year I believe I have stayed at every hotel on the strip except Trump. I have to say that when it is on my own dime I nearly always choose The Mirage. The rooms are great, nicely decorated, clean, comfy. Location is perfect as you are across from the Venetian\/Palazzo, and still easily walkable if you want to Wynn, Caesers, Bellagio, and City Center if you really want to.

The restaurants are great - particularly Japonais, but there could be a few more lunch options.

I really really really like the pool. While they don't have a "party pool" (Wet Republic, Marquee Dayclub, etc) it definitely has a fun atmosphere and lots of chairs for relaxing.

On value alone would be a 5, but had to knock it to a 4 as of course there are other hotels that just offer more opulence (Wynn, etc), but all in all I think it is the best value and you can't go wrong with The Mirage.

I like the Mirage because its the only place i made money this weekend in Vegas.  It wasnt like the movie where you hear "YOUR DEAD GRISWALD!" but i did get a lot of 6's.  Anyhow, the staff is very friendly, and the Beatles love lounge is pretty cool.  Ive never stayed here, only gambled, so ill update if i ever stay here...thats up to mgm marketing.

So this is long over due, but definitely well deserved and if I could give more stars I would.

November of last year on the weekend of the 19th, I went with my boyfriend and his parents to Las Vegas for his mom's birthday celebration. We stayed in two regular rooms on the 6th floor, which had a lovely view of the strip and the rooms were very nicely organized and clean. We stayed til Tuesday and during our stay, the hotel's staff was nothing but welcoming and provided great service.

When we left on Tuesday to return home, we thoroughly enjoyed our time spent there. A day after returning home, we received an email from the hotel asking if we left anything valuable. Assuming it was I , who may have been forgetful, I rummaged through my suitcase and tried to recall if I may have left something. 

They boyfriend then proceeded to ask his parents if they left anything, and that is when we realized his mom left her Chanel diamond bracelet. The hotel's lost and found personnel responded by saying one of the maids found the item in their room and returned it to the Lost & Found office. We were amazed at how kind and professional the Mirage Staff was with the incident. 

We are very grateful that whoever the individual was that found the bracelet was kind enough to return it. This isn't always the case, as the prior year, my boyfriend and I stayed at Caesar's Palace where he left his ipod touch, and on the way to the airport we contacted Lost & Found as well as the Room Service and Cleaning Staff, they replied that nothing was found. Although it was unrealistic to have that returned, I knew that someone who was cleaning up probably swooped it up. It's reassuring to know that The Mirage Hotel & Casino, have some great people working there.

The Mirage once was the finest casino hotel in Vegas.  Then was then and now is now. It is now a second tier bordering on third tier resort. 

Yes the pool is great, Sambos is one of the best restaurants on the strip and the rooms have been updated and are very nice...but  they Nickle and dime you everywhere.  

For example a $25 per day "resort fee" that gives nothing in return. Free Wifi at dial up speeds, an antiquated dungeon fitness center full of old equipment and a daily newspaper you have to pick up in the lobby. 

The coffee shop has been closed so the only 24 hour food is at the very overpriced deli-$19.00 turkey sandwiches. Really but you do get a free pickle. Lol. 
 
Next time I will spend a few more dollars and stay at the Wynn or Venetian. You pay more for the room but the overall amount is the same for a far better stay.

The good:
1.  Renovated room
2.  Awesome bed
3.  Central location on the strip
4.  Good pool.
5.  Gambling is decent with plenty of $10-15 blackjack tables.


The bad:
1.  Weak water pressure in shower
2.  Poorly draining tub
3.  Slow wi-fi
4.  Bad buffet

We just recently had our second stay at the Mirage (late August).

For the most part, my wife and I are huge fans of the mirage. This last trip, which I will base this review on, we stayed on the 26th floor, in a 1 Bedroom Suite. 

Facilities:
Huge fan of Mirage facilitates. A heck of a lot of great restaurants and decent places to drink. The casino floor is a bit smaller than other MGM Properties, but still has everything you would need. Portofino is an incredible place to eat, as is LV Burgers, Carnegie Deli and a few others. For drinks: Rumbar is AWESOME, super fun place. I use to really like Revolution last time we came, which was a retro club\/lounge playing off the Beatles Vibe. Unfortunately I don't think it was very popular - likely due to their extremely high prices and small dance floor, but was still fun. It's since been replaced by a Sports Bar. 

I find the elevators fairly convenient, and access to the pool and shops is fairly easy.

The Mirage, in my opinion, is the best located Resort on the strip. You're pretty much walking distance to everything North of Monte Carlo.  

The Mirage buffet, Cravings, is pretty awful (especially for the price) so beware of that.


Rooms:
Our suite was pretty amazing. At around 1,200 square feet with 3 televisions, a separate shower and Jacuzzi, walk-in closet, massive sectional couch and living room, huge kitchen, great view etc. we found it very worth the price. The rooms are getting a bit dated, but not enough to effect the quality of our stay. A few very minor hiccups, such as our neighbour connecting via Bluetooth to our soundbar in our room (awesome to have music blaring randomly at you first thing in the morning when it isn't yours) - simple fix, we just turned it off. Cable would randomly cut out at times, fridge was quite warm randomly, etc. But nothing major at all. Beds are always comfortable, and our suite was VERY quiet.


Service:
This is where Mirage suffers a bit, in my opinion. Our room got cleaned once, in a FOUR night stay. And the only reason it got cleaned on the last day is because I walked up to a cleaner (on two separate occasions) to ask, no... beg, her to clean our room and give us some fresh towels. When we arrived in our suite, there was the previous guests' leftover food still in the fridge and dirty glasses on the bar - yikes. Not what I expect when paying for a suite.

When checking out, we casually mentioned it to the Front Desk Manager as she checked us out. She said "that's no good" in a very casual (if not a... ditsy) voice, and continued on her way. We didn't want compensation, just wanted a simple apology. 

At Cravings Buffet, you are required to tip before entering. As soon as we sat down, a younger table busser walked straight up to us and said "they don't give us any of that tip you just left, so you'll have to leave extra for me - thanks". HUH? Sorry, you're unionized bud, I don't buy that lie for a second. 

We expect better treatment than that, especially given the cost of a large suite, and due to our MLife status. Many other service blunders that I could discuss, but I'll leave it at that! 


Pool:
Love the Mirage pool but gets overwhelmingly busy after about 10 a.m. most days. Last time we went for the private "Oasis" pool (~$60 per person per day). Would never do this again. The service was horrible, you're crammed right beside your neighbour, and no real value other than actually getting a dedicated lounger.

Overall, we will probably stay at the Mirage again. For a suite room, we find it's the best value and best location on the Strip.

Always enjoyed the comfy rooms, friendly service, and the central location to everything at the Mirage. For the limited amount of time we were here, we found the check-in to be fast and smooth, room amenities sufficient, and did I mention conveniently located to everything? 

Having tried a lot of dining options throughout the strip, I can't say that the food options here are that great, but since it's so close to everything, you can practically walk everywhere that you should visit. Of course, there are newer hotels, like Aria, Wynn or some other new places that one should visit as well, but The Mirage is a great value nonetheless and consider me a happy camper every time.

How the mighty have fallen. This is what happens when casinos become monopolized. I remember visiting the hotel when it first opened and staring gape-mouthed at the wonderment.  Now?  Well, the fixtures show their age, the tigers are gone, the carpet is stained and the entire building smells of LAMB (Their restaurant, BLT burger has this hideous lamb burger they make.) The rooms are VERY noisy as well. The walls might as well be made of hanging sheets.

The unforgivable part of my experience was the deplorable customer service. The walls are so thin that my spouse and I were woken at 5:45 a.m. with what sounded like dishes banging together for a long time . . . think carts full of dishes being stacked outside the door or mini-bars being restocked in adjoining rooms for at least 30 minutes.

I called and complained and sent an e-mail to customer service with zero satisfaction. No one cared at all.  They must be sick of these complaints because nobody offered any apology, assistance or assurance it wouldn't happen again. In fact, everyone I spoke with seemed very put out to have to speak with me. So I just didn't gamble there or any of the other properties that MGM Resorts owns.  Let me take a moment here to say that the new casinos on the strip are amazing and really know how to treat customers (I won't name them, but you'll be happy if you spend some time in the new casinos).

This would be enough of a crap sundae for anyone's trip to Vegas, but there's more. I was exhausted, unhappy and deflated from the morning fiasco and so decided to do something unheard of in Las Vegas, go to bed early.  It was 9-ish and I closed the curtains, turned off all the lights, and started counting sheep.  That's when the volcano went off.  Bloody hell.  My room was facing the volcano! It was the weekend.  That meant the volcano would go off until midnight.

I called the front desk, explained what had happened that morning, and asked them if there were any options available so I could get some sleep.  That's when I met the night manager.  This guy acted like an insignificant peon with a super-inflated ego.  He was angry from the start.  He initially assumed I was exaggerating in order to get a comp which was not my intent. After attempting to communicate with him further without success, I told him I would be reviewing my experience on Yelp and other sites and he insisted I had just THREATENED him.  Ridiculous!

I hung up on him and he aggressively called me back and insisted I called him a NAME! Amazing! He threatened to have security come up to my room immediately and have me kicked out of the hotel into the street with no compensation for the other nights I was supposed to stay. He said he was going to give my name and story to all the other managers and security so that they would know to kick me out as well if I continued to complain. Unbelievable! He really must hate his job to be so stunningly aggressive and insulting. 

The next day I spoke with his supervisor and explained what had happened, I was offered a comped dinner and a suite (which I did not take), but really?  No apology from this angry idiot? That's what I wanted. The night manager promised I would never be welcome at any of the MGM properties again . . . . that won't be a problem. I realize it might be easy to imagine that I was yelling at him or aggressive, and in turn, that is what triggered his elephant gun response. I wasn't and it wasn't

If you want to be treated this way, then I'd suggest you hire a dominatrix, just don't stay at The Mirage. As I stated before, the new casinos know how to treat customers and I'll be staying and gambling at those in future.

Been to Vegas many times but never stayed at The Mirage. It was recommended by family and friends and I was told that the rooms were newly renovated. Figured we would give it a try. We arrived early and requested early check in for a $30 fee. The room we were given had issues and we had to check back out and wait for another room to be ready. Finally getting our room, I will admit that I was happy with it. Nice sized room and a great view. Easy check in and easy check out. Concierge even helped us print our return flight tickets. Mirage is conveniently located on the strip and made it easy to get around. I will be back to The Mirage next visit to Las Vegas.

The Mirage is one of the better hotels in Las Vegas. I have frequented this hotel many times, but this was one of the first times after it's major remodel. 

We stayed at the Mirage during Thanksgiving weekend of 2012 and booked ourselves a Penthouse Suite at Level E for four nights. It was simply amazing. Marble floors and a plate with a variety of delectable cheeses and fruits greeted us as we entered the spacious suite. The curtains were automatic to reveal a beautiful Las Vegas Strip with a clear view of the volcano attraction in the front of the hotel. Every night, by the hour, I had a front row seat to such a thrilling and popular attraction. The tub served as a jacuzzi as well and it was very relaxing and enjoyable. The suite was relatively large and spacious, with many TVs scattered about. 

Guests at the Mirage Penthouse suites are also allowed in a private room near the entrance of the hotel, a place for guests to enjoy cheeses, drinks, and sofas to simply just relax. This VIP room was a great place to plan for future events during the day. Valet parking was quick every time and all the employees at the Mirage were quite helpful and kind. 

I would definitely come back again when I do have the chance.

Another unique casino in the middle of the Vegas strip. I've been to a couple of casinos in Vegas and the Mirage does not disappoint.  Even though I am still on my quest in experiencing all the casinos in Vegas, I cannot wait to come back to the Mirage.  The pool is awesome and the couple of restaurants and bars\/lounges they have feel different than other casinos and are good in their own right as well. 

The whole place feels modern and up-to-date.  Clean and prestige.  And the layout is not confusing and feels open and generous.

The rooms are decent. I spent my nights in the deluxe room (the normal one) and it's clean and modern.  Nothing special but also nothing that will give it a negative review.

don't waste your time anywhere else. If you stay in a five star resort you have already won. It never ceases to amaze me when my friends book at some off strip dump. And then complain about all the money they lost complain about crummy service complain about the food. Next time you go to Vegas or anywhere else for that matter don't scrimp on your room. It's a guaranteed win in this city. Mirage is where the best action is
I wasn't impressed.  The carpets and counters in my room were really dusty and dirty. Plus my "nonsmoking" room smelled like an ashtray. No coffee pot in the room was rough!!

My wife and I stayed here 4th of July weekend. We had a great time. If you decide to book a room here, look up their promotional deals beforehand. They also have a 10% military discount on rooms. We were on the 9th floor in a king with a strip\/pool view. They charge extra for the strip or pool view rooms so we just went with the regular room and lucked out. Room was clean and updated. The bed was super comfy. Bathroom was nice and clean but a little small. I'm not complaining. Be careful with the mini bar, if you take something out for more then 10 seconds it will charge to your room. My wife pulled out the $30 lollipop to look at it and it got charged to the room. We realized it right away so I called the front desk and they removed the charge right away. I'm sure it happens all the time. The pool was nice but extremely cold. Drinks are pricey but that's to be expected. The hotel lobby has a big beautiful fish tank behind the check in desk and there is also a jungle style waterfall as you walk to the guest elevators. If you're lucky, you can catch the outdoor volcano show which was awesome! We were across the street walking back from the venetian and we could feel the heat of the flames! The only thing I didn't like was the long walk from the check in desk to the guest elevators. It was a hike through the casino maze. Easy to get lost when you first get there but just follow the crowd and the signs and you'll be fine. All in all we enjoyed our stay and I'd stay there again. There is also a dolphin habitat and white tigers and lions. You have to pay to see them but its worth it if you're into that kind of thing. Good for kids. This hotel seemed kid friendly for those of you with kids. For those of you without kids, like us, the kids didn't bother us. They would run into the hot tub every now and again to warm up from the cold pool but then they'd run back to the pool. Didn't bother us at all. I recommend this hotel. Just remember that there is a $30 resort fee that gets added to your stay.

The dream of the eighties is alive in Vegas, and hardly anywhere more so than at the Mirage. While the rooms are good, the casino is kind of dank, and the hallways smell perpetually of bacon. I'm no fan of buffets and the one at the Mirage is not going to convince me to become one. However, the pool is pretty nice, in that Cancun kind of way, and the exterior holds up well, even after twenty-odd years. The staff is friendly enough, and the volcano show is worth seeing at least once. A solid place to stay for your 48 hours in Vegas.

2.75 stars for quality lack and overdue renovations.

Co--worker arrived early and was told room would not be ready until 3pm for check-in, staff's inability to accommodate was rather shocking.

Unacceptable room assignment - requested upper floor for quietness, still somehow managed to be assigned next door to room of drunk males clearly there for leisure. Co-worker experienced same issue on a separate floor, nearly a security concern.

Room furniture requires updating. In two recent visits, desk chair upholstery was peeling and other furniture visibly chipped. Conversely, bathrooms are done well, as is overall lighting.

Front desk seems under-staffed and can be rather inefficient, with lines unmanageably long due to long processing times per guest. Front desk area often appears chaotic and cluttered as a result of staff struggling to service guests efficiently.

Bellhop is inconsistent and understaffed at peak times, needs improvement.

Casino carpet is a complete disaster...causes near tripping in several places due to lack of evenness, as if carpet was simply thrown over poorly built flooring.

Overall, the entire experience was average. I would stay there again if the price was right. The best quality of the resort, by far, was the location. It was close to and within walking distance of most of the attractions we wanted to see. I also found the concierge to be very helpful in helping us navigate the bus system. The biggest downfall, which had a major impact on our experience with the hotel, was the noise. We found that the walls\/door were paper thin. You can only expect people to be loud and coming back to their room late\/early in the morning while in Vegas. But we could hear EVERYTHING happening in the hallway as if there wasn't even a door there. Therefore it was very difficult to sleep, day or night. This unfortunate issue very much impacted our overall experience with the resort.

Here is a breakdown on a few other things:

The room:
The bed was very comfortable but I thought it was strange that the bed didn't really have a blanket on it? There were also no extra blankets or pillows in the room. The bed had several layers of sheets which were tucked into the bed tightly. The thing that gave off the "age" of the room was that there were no outlets anywhere near the bed, so I couldn't charge my phone near the bed. There was a charging station near the desk. There was also an ipod docking station. As with most Vegas hotel rooms there was no coffee maker or mini fridge. There was a very stocked mini-bar with outrageous prices and an ice bucket--that's about it. The bathroom is very small. The only + about the bathroom was that it was well lit.
Casino\/Resort
We didn't gamble, shop or use the pool at the resort at all, so I cannot comment on it. The lobby, hallways, room etc were very clean and well kept. It did not have a strong cigarette smell but you could smell the perfume being pumped into the common areas.
We ate at the buffet (because we had 2 free passes) & we found it to be poor\/average. I remember the Luxor's buffet being better quality. We did not eat at any of the other restaurants since they all have sub-par reviews and there were so many excellent restaurants within walking distance at nearby resorts. When we checked in I asked about the Spa\/Salon & the staff person gave us a free 1 days pass to enjoy.
Spa\/Salon
Very clean, tranquil environment. Our free day pass granted us access to the sauna, steam room, hot\/cold tubs, and showers. When my husband and I arrived we found out they had separate spa(s) for women & men--which I found out later was because they are clothing optional. If you stay at the Mirage, I would recommend the Spa! Very relaxing and the staff were excellent.

Ahh Vegas... The Mirage was our home base during our 3 night Vegas vacation. The Mirage was very clean for any resort and once you add in the amount of traffic that the Mirage receives I'll say that it was super clean and maintained to a high standard. Everyone working at the resort was friendly and eager to help with anything no matter the time of day. I stayed in a room that overlooked the strip and every night at 8pm we were treated to the Mirage Volcano show right from our room. We only had one issue the entire time. We noticed that whomsoever was in the room before us got into the minibar and drank a ate small amounts of stuff and placed the items back like they were never opened. I called the front desk and they said not to worry. We had a great time but we wish the food could have been better. We went to the buffet and the pantry, both were kinda overpriced for what we enjoy in our meals. All in all I highly recommend checking out this resort. It was good enough for Clark Griswald and it was good enough for me lol.

This is our go-to hotel when staying in Vegas...mostly because of the location (close to Fashion Show Mall and Carnaval court). But stayed here again two weeks ago for the Mayweather fight and again, impressed with the service, cleanliness of our room, and available eateries. We love Carnegie...ate here 3x and always good stuff! The Pool is nice as well, love the waterfalls and just a laid back feeling there. Even took advantage of the spa this time and that alone was heaven!

Stayed here in a smoking room and it was great. The room was big and clean. Our windows opened which was great to let the breeze in. 

The casino is your average Vegas casino. A little dirty and a little trashier than the nicer hotels. 3 Card Poker table with $5 bets, which is great. 

Saw Cirque Du Soleil's Beatles Love and it was AMAZING. The show blew my mind (separate review) and the dcor of the entryway gets the attention of everyone. 

Did not have a chance to eat at any of the restaurants in the Mirage. 

I would probably only stay here again if there was a discount. It's about a B- hotel in Vegas standards.

Decent casino! Easy to navigate self-parking, awesome and gigantic aquarium behind the check in desk, line moved quickly. Garden area in lobby is nice, casino floor is organized and there is a lot of signage to find your way around.

Sigfried & Roy's Secret Garden and Dolphin Habitat looks amazing, but sadly they close at 6:30 with last admission at 5:30, which we just barely missed. Adult entry $15 seemed a little steep.

Revolution Lounge is Beatles-themed and small with pricey drinks (as expected in Vegas). Stack restaurant has tasty small bites.

Overall, casino has many dining and entertainment options and is well-located.
Had a lovely stay at the Mirage. Decent rooms, good food and restaurants, relaxing spa with an Amazing massage, Fun Times!
13 dolphins have died in 27 years here.  Kind of a lousy place to support.

THIS WAS THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN! The first room they gave us was dirty so we called downstairs and they gave us a different room. We get in the second room and it was just as dirty as the first one! The toilet was filthy as well as the shower. Management was called the second time and refused to be of any help. They send room service to clean the room again. Housekeeping recleaned the room again. We leave the room to go out for the day and come back to our room door ajar. Housekeeping left the room door opened! We had a purse in the open in the room! We called management and management stated that we the guest must have left it opened however the room was clean when we returned. Security has filed a report. Needless to say... we wont be staying here ever again!
Had a blast playing tourists! Rooms were great, and quite affordable!

Here on business so probably not  important guest. No tv remote in room. Was sleeping at 9:30 pm when maintenance woke me up with loud knock about a service call for shower I supposedly made. I said I didn't call you and sent him away  and checked and sure enough my shower was in parts. Called manager who said the guy would b right back. I shared I was sleeping and he said I could have put do not disturb sign up. I was like ok but then I wouldn't have a shower. 1.5 hours after being awakened I am still being forced to stay awake to wait for repair so I can shower before business meeting in am . I mean who assumes it is ok to not tell a guest there is broken shower in room when u check in and thinks isnok for guest to wait until wee hours of morning to get working shower for hotel room u r paying for. Not a good hotel for biz. I think showers are standard part of room you pay for ans no guest should be woken up and asked to stay up until midnight so they can have shower at 6 am in morning; maintenance showed up at 12:24 a.m (yes it is NOW AM the next day) and is working on it ...........so the mirage asked me to choose cleanliness - getting a shower head - over sleep for my biz trip - NOT OK - clearly not enough staff - again - who puts guest in a room without a shower ?seriously.

I have stayed at the Mirage many times over the years and am very upset by the way the hotel has gone down in quality. Once a top hotel that was sparkling clean filled with fresh flowers and helpful staff, the hotel is now run down and dirty and a shadow of its former self.

Cleanliness: 

The Mirage is less than clean in the public areas. The pool and pool area are filthy. The sidewalk badly needs power washing and the pool vacuuming. 

The casino carpet is worn and stained and needs replacing. 

The walkways in the hotel front are gum and cigarette covered and are disgusting. 

Lack of attention: 

The Internet never worked properly entire time of our stay. 

We had to ask for more towels every day. There were 2 of us in the room and they only left 2 towels every day. 


Overall our stay was not good.

The Las Vegas strip has so many beautiful hotels to choose from!  My friend and I were trying to decide between the Bellagio, Mirage and Venetian.  We chose the Mirage because the prices for the Bellagio that weekend were exceptionally high and I had stayed at the Venetian before and wanted to try something new.

I was very happy with many aspects of the hotel.  It was more beautiful than I remembered.  I love how the hotel looks from the outside.  The volcano, water and Beatles decorations are all very visually appealing.  The volcano eruptions at night are a lot of fun to watch.  The lobby and Atrium are also really cool to walk around.  The check in desk has a huge tropical fish tank all along the walls.

Beatles LOVE is performed right inside the hotel.  It is an absolutely phenomenal show and I recommend it to anybody who enjoys their music.  My friend and I ended up doing the dinner & show package at the Mirage, which got us a $55 meal at Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steakhouse and excellent seats at the show.  It was a great deal.

The hotel has dining options of all varieties.  Heritage Steakhouse is a delicious upscale restaurant.  They also have a Carnegie deli, Starbucks and a diner called The Pantry, for those looking for a quicker, less expensive meal.  They also have a BLT Burger, Cravings Buffet, a Japanese restaurant and a Brazilian steakhouse.  They also have a nightclub called 1 OAK that seemed very nice.  John Legend was hosting a party there during our stay.

The pool is gorgeous.  The setup is nice.  There are lots of comfortable chairs for suntanning that are strategically placed so that they can accommodate large crowds, without anybody getting in each other's way.  There is also a beach club called Bare attached to the pool. 

The rooms were nice and clean.  They overlooked the pool and the strip.  The beds were comfortable.  The customer service was excellent.  All of our requests were responded to promptly.

Although I loved most things about my experience at the Mirage, there were a few things that I found to be frustrating:

1.  I specifically requested an early check in.  They had told me they could accommodate it.  I arrived at 10:00 a.m.  They told me the room should be ready within 2 hours.  The room was not ready until 2:00 p.m.!  Luckily, Vegas is a fun place to walk around aimlessly.
2.  As with all Vegas hotels, patrons are allowed to smoke.  The Mirage Casino seemed to be extra clouded with smoke, compared to the other hotel casinos.  I saw a theory online that this is because the ceilings are low and the smoke tends to gather more densely.  As a non-smoker, I found this to be extremely unpleasant.
3.  The Dolphin Exhibit\/Secret Garden is very sad to walk through.  The accommodations for the animals are outdated and dingy. It is in desperate need of renovation.

Other than those three points, my stay was wonderful.  I would certainly stay at the Mirage again.  The value is excellent!

Came out here and I was able to score the two bedroom penthouse suite and I have to say it was...AWESOME! If you ever get a chance to come out and utilize the suites out here it is simply great.  Though I would recommend to set your expectations a little bit lower, the craps tables do not automatically recognize you when you walk up as Mr. Papagorgio.  I guess it all can't be perfect.

Stayed here pre-July 4th, during huge heat wave in Vegas.  Had a great experience, once again.
***PROS:
- Located in middle of the Strip, very convenient to almost everything
- Smaller than some other casino-hotels..easy to get around.  Pool is just a short walk from room elevators (unlike MGM Grand and others, where you have to walk 90 miles to the pool).
- ALL the employees we encountered-- cocktail servers, dealers, maids, check in, etc. were super friendly, nice, helpful, made us feel "at home".
- Great price for what we get there
- Plants\/trees on the grounds are so pretty.  Love the pool: no gimmicks like a floating river, just a nice pool, with beautiful grounds, and wonderful chilled water coming over the waterfalls, which made it so refreshing even though it was 118 degeees!!!
- Nice restaurants:  Calif. Pizza Kitchen has excellent pizza; Love the Burger joint, and also the Carnegie Deli (yum! sandwiches are HUGE!!).  
***CONS:
- Room was so very BIG, but bathroom was TINY! I wish they'd taken 3 or 4 feet off the huge, waste of space room, and made the bathroom bigger
- Hardly ever saw $5 craps.  So I didnt' play!  HATE the new automatic video craps machines.. air horn sounds, bells, yuck. Want the social interaction of playing craps at the tables.. but even at 10am on a Tuesday am-- no $5 tables.  And at night, the one $10 table had 90 people crowded around it (no space to join in), but two $25 tables were empty and quiet.  WHY? 
- Nice "casual" restaurants, but no really NICE, super restaurant.  But soon a new steakhouse to open, will that fill the bill?

Overall, very nice experience, made us happy.  Good choice for a place to stay.  Actually prefer it to Mandalay Bay, Bellagio and MGM.

Amazing experience - great service, even when things went awry (as things can at a large hotel\/resort).  Very caring employees who were very concerned with the well being of all their guests.  Would go back.

About a decade ago this hotel was the place to be, but now the tropical aura has grown tired and the luster has faded.  

I was unimpressed by the rooms and the prices.  The pool was closed during my visit at the start of the summer season.  Disappointing, since it's always a warm climate in Vegas.  

With the arrival of trendy restaurant Stack and the new Jet night club, Mirage seems to be trying to compete with the newer resorts on the strip.  

I do like the fact they house NY's famed Carnegie Deli here.  I simply adore those sandwiches.  It's great I don't have to fly across the country to satisfy that craving.  Which reminds me, Cravings, their buffet is very good.  

Come to Mirage for the peaceful Polynesian surroundings and the excellent food, but rest your head someplace else.

I've always wanted to stay here, and finally my man and I got to this past January for our 3rd anniversary. It is definitely a beautiful and very nice hotel. Its rooms are very clean and upscale, and the beds are comfortable. 

The gaming floor is expansive and easier to navigate than most. As a 1 cent slot machine player, I cannot attest to any other games, but their payout is great here. It's not as good as the Monte Carlo's, but what are you going to do? It's not as nice a hotel, therefore it has not as good payout.

I would definitely stay here again.

Hands down the worst front desk experience I have ever encountered. The Mirage has proved to me that they are completely unorganized and unable to accommodate to guests needs. 

I have booked rooms on numerous occasions across the strip and had no problem in doing so. This time around, I was helping my friend host a party at the Mirage's 2 bedroom hospitality suite (1700+ square feet). Knowing it was best to book the room early in regards to cost and availability, we reserved the room at least a month and a half prior to the arrival date which was 12\/29\/16. We already paid for the reservation, all we needed to do now was pay the remaining resort fee and taxes once we were able to check-in. 

On the day of, I get a call from a hotel representative named, JD, saying that our room will not be ready at check-in time (3 pm), but instead be able to check-in at 3:30-4pm. Honestly, that was not a big problem. Due to the inconvenience, he also offered to give us 2 standard rooms free of charge and $100 worth of food and beverage, but for this specific event we wanted to make sure the rooms were spacious enough for our guests and did not like the idea of separating our guests into two rooms. As a result, we declined that offer despite it being a generous one and settled for a later check-in time. 

Once we arrived at check-in on 12\/29\/16 around 4 p.m. everything was going as planned until the front desk representative (I believe her name was Vanna) told me that the room we reserved over a month and a half ago is no longer available. Do you understand the amount of inconvenience that was? What's the point of reserving the room in advance and being told the room is unavailable? She then offered us to downgrade from the 2 bedroom hospitality suite to a 1 bedroom penthouse suite with a reasonable discount and an additional queen bedroom, mind you the square footage on the penthouse suite was around 1200. That's a 500 square foot difference in comparison to the hospitality suite which was 1700+ square foot. Running out of time and options, we agreed to the 1 bedroom penthouse suite. Vanna then goes back there to talk to her manager about our agreement to inform us that the penthouse suite is no longer available as well. Are you serious? How unorganized can the Mirage be? Don't try to convince your guests about downgrading to find out that the downgrade was not available to even begin with. She then offered a second downgrade with 2 regular sized rooms that had a connecting door. Like I mentioned earlier, we needed a larger room to accommodate the size of our event. By this time, the square footage of the room has nearly been cut in half. My friend and I were not going to settle for 2 tiny rooms and asked for a full refund. 

Vanna briefly mentioned to us that the manager is saving the hospitality suites for those high-limit poker players (basically richer guests), I would assume it's because of the new year and they would want to bring in more money into the Mirage. Isn't that discrimination? Just because one guest has more money over another guest does not mean you treat and value them any differently. We reserved this hospitality suite in a timely manner, to have it be taken away from us because of richer guests? That's not how casinos should ever treat their guests. 

Although Vanna was very polite throughout the whole process and simply the messenger of the Mirage, the amount of inconvenience was extremely overwhelming. I understand that she is not the one to blame, but if anything blame the management for being unorganized by underestimating the amount of business they will have. Everything was so last minute, if they could have informed us that they were overbooked several days earlier it would have been more easier on us to find a different hotel room rather than scrambling around the Mirage's front desk area and furiously calling other casinos to see if they had any rooms available that same night. 

Overall, extremely dissatisfied in Mirage's ability to communicate with their guests about unexpected delays and room availability. As well as the discrimination towards accommodating guests with more money in comparison to the guests who reserved the room within a reasonable amount of time. Would not recommend to anyone wanting to reserve a room here in advance, to find out the room that you reserved will not be available to you upon arrival. Knowing that this would have happened, my friend and I could have saved a lot of money and precious time on a different hotel room.

Here for the casino. Lots of choices for slots, so that's good for anyone who wants variety. Chairs seem clean due to the pleathery fabric, unlike a lot of other casinos that have cloth chairs. Ambiance is good as well, not too dark but light enough to see the slot lights glow.

However, being one of the older casinos, the ceilings are low, which mean you can really smell all the cigarette smoke, unlike newer casinos with high ceilings. Another thing is that it took awhile to receive my winnings from the cashier, but I assume that is the case for all casinos. 

Although it's a minor point, I don't like casinos that have clubs near the entrance doors. It's a hassle getting through to the casino, and I get embarrassed by how ghetto I look compared to all the dressy club-goers.

Worst part has to be getting out of the parking lot. Getting out is very confusing and you could easily miss the exit lane. Also getting out takes time. There are two lanes to get into, but one lane to get out. This leads to long exit times even if there aren't many cars leaving at the same time.
Don't stay , I up graded and got a garbage room #24030. Mold in shower, garbage hotel!!!!!!!!

An excellent place to stay.  The best part is the bed, the nice comfy bed!  This bed is unforgettable, as my friends were staying in other hotels (Luxor and Rio) so I had a chance to compare.  This bed might possibly be better than my own bed, and that bed costs an arm, a leg and a liver :.)

There's a starbucks and buffet downstairs, which made it an amazing night.  

We stayed for 2 nights, the only reason I have it a 4 is because the person did not clean our room while we were gone.  However, you don't go to vegas to sleep...you go to have fun.  The Mirage is near the vicinity of the strip, so the convenience factor is awesome!  Bring your walking shoes ladies- if you want to explore.  However, if you are there to dance- make sure that you are not too drunk as I have seem intoxicated people slurring words and looking ashamed the next morning LOL

Have fun in Vegas!

Stayed here for 3 days over Labor Day weekend. We have had a really great time with excellent service. The pools here are fantastic. Great bars. Cravings is a great buffet. The only reason I gave it 3 stars and not 4 is bc the dolphin exhibit made me really sad. Location is great and close proximity to a lot.

Good hotel. People where very helpful, clean, fun. Got a great rate with my player card and though we'd try them out. Got a great "$20 trick" upgrade, 25th floor, "honeymoon suite". No view, but the view I'm looking for in Vegas is the stack of chips in my hand. Long taxi lines tho (TIP...walk next door to Cesar's, 7 minutes away, and get taxi from there. Will save you at least 15-20 minutes). Good hotel, great bar across from the check-in. My girl said "MMMMM, best Bloody Mary." Maybe it was, so it was from the feeling the night before left. Will be back to stay as soon as my comps come in!!!

Located in mid - strip I would say it's pretty convenient spot to stay if you want to explore the strip . Venetian is located right across the street and there's also a free tram that takes you to its sister hotel, treasure island . The rooms are clean there's also a volcano show at the entrance to the resort .

I expected a lot from The Mirage hotel, but was actually very disappointed. The place is huge and the elevators are split up which is nice, but my gosh the room.

First of all, our room was at THE VERY END of the hallway from the elevators. It felt like a mile walk to our room. Second, the room just wasn't that great for what we paid. The room was a decent size, but what got me was how small the bathroom was. It was tiny, only about one person can fit at a time. There was also no tub. I expected a big spacious bathroom but nope. Tiny. Even our room at Planet Hollywood was better, and so was the PH bathroom, and it was cheaper too.

Overall I was disappointed but maybe the nicer rooms are better.

This is my favorite place to stay because the location is perfect.  Love the tropical vibe.  Stayed Sunday-Tuesday of this week - a great time to go if you can swing it.  If splurging, you might want to spring for the Penthouses on Floors (A-E).  I chose the less expense suites on floors 24-25.  The problem with these suites are that they are situated next to the elevators.  The whirling of the elevator was tolerable but the banging of the cables made it very difficult to sleep.  The room's amenities were lovely and clean as usual.  Like all hotels in of this Corporation, parking is now $10 - I was surprised to see that.  Also, when checking in, if your room isn't available, come back and check periodically.  They had said they would page when the room was available.  I got the page at 5:54pm - check in is at 3pm.

For my first trip to Vegas, I stayed at the Mirage. I was very pleasantly surprised! We had a really nice room... newly renovated with a nice flat screen TV. (Although I will have to say that the bathroom was just OK.) And the had a gorgeous pool... too bad it was still too cold to lay out. One thing, though, is the pool\/hot tub was only open from 9 am- 4 pm. I thought that was kind of odd. And, I thought the location was perfect! It was close to many of the nice hotels and not too inconvenient to go anywhere on the strip. Plus, I love that in the casino they had a video roulette machine right when you walk downstairs... and it even had a double chair!

Stayed one night and couldn't stand the smell in the room + poor quality of the linens and towels+headboard was scratched a lot of place. Maybe due to wear out?  So I had to move out. They were very good abt let me leave for another hotel though. 
I was disappointed

OMG My favorite place to stay in Vegas! The rooms are beautiful, the buffet is huge, the pool area soo pretty, and the decor is rockin!! The spa is also wonderful...the best facial I have ever received!

Stood at the hotel for the first time last weekend and did not like it! Paid and extra $30 to check in earlier and didn't get into my room until about 11 p.m. When we got to our room the maid was still in the room cleaning! Also they charge for everything!! For a fridge, microwave, parking!! That's insane and the first I ever heard of that. They don't really have room service it's just delivery from a restaurant down stairs. The ONLY good thing was they took away $10 from food because coke cola machine charged me more than they should have.

But no I will not be staying at this hotel again!!!

My parents always get comped rooms at the Mirage, so I can't complain. The room is free. The rooms are nicer than most. The restaurants are all yummy. For some reason, all my relatives are really lucky here. So I 'm a fan!!!

I would recommend this hotel solely on the location. It is close to all the happenings.

Somehow, in six trips to Vegas, this was my first stop at the Mirage; we ate lunch next door at Treasure Island.  It's nothing to write home about, but we had a good time until the last hour.  We found $10 minimum pai gow tables at 1 pm on a Saturday.  They raised the mins to $25 around 5 pm, but of course we were grandfathered in.  

The whole time, the dealer alternated between Helen and Theresa.  We liked Helen, but Theresa was a bit bristly.  Then when we started to smoke cigars, she got really bitchy, stopping all banter, constantly telling us to hold them under the table, making annoyed body language, etc.  I hate cigarette smoke, so I understand, and we were as courteous as possible, but come on--you work in a casino.  Get over it.  Her sour attitude really killed the fun atmosphere that we had going.

Three other things:  
1.  They serve Glenlivet here, one of the rare casinos where you can get single-malt scotch on the main floor.  But three of us agreed that it had a strange aftertaste.  We decided that it was probably Glenlivet based on the nose and initial taste, but perhaps they don't clean their glasses well enough?
2.  They have handy shoulder-level shelves above the urinals in the men's room--to keep your drink nice and high and out of danger.
3.  The cigars were comped without a fuss, but they were labelled with the Mirage logo, so I don't know what brand they were.  They were okay, smooth but maybe a little bland.

I've stayed at the Mirage a couple of times now and I must say I love it.  No, it's not the Wynn or Palazzo but it doesn't have the Wynn or Palazzo prices either.  Here's a quick run down:

*Bare:  awesome, between a typical pool experience and a crazy encore beach club experience.  Crazy enough to be fun but chill enough at the same time.

*Regular Pool:  Solid, good size, nice foliage, drinks could be stronger.

*Casino:  Good, not great.  A little dark but does the trick.

*Shows:  All are beyond good.  Saw Love, Bill Burr, and Wayne Brady.  I'd recommend all in a heart beat.  I like that they nearly always have a great comedian performing.  

*Rooms:  I've stayed in Tower Suite and Tower Deluxe.  Tower Suite is baller and the Tower Deluxe is worth the upgrade.  Only difference in deluxe vs standard is the bathroom, but the double vanity and separate bath and shower make a huge difference, especially if you are with your lady.

*Volcano: First time up close and personal, it was quite the spectacle.  From our room we could hear the Bill Weir soundtrack and feel the explosions on the windows.

*Service:  This is where they separate themselves.  We had some major
issues on our first go round and their front desk manager Luis did everything he could to make things right.  I must say they train their management well, Luis couldn't have been more professional.  He invited my gf and I back out at a discounted rate and took great care of us.  He didn't have to but he arranged all our reservations while on our trip and even gave us a resort credit.  It made it so I didn't feel so bad donating my savings account to the craps table.  

All and all it was a fantastic trip, thanks Mirage.

We have stayed at many Vegas hotels, and I do have a few cons on this, but only like one... First the pro's, the last two times we stayed there this year we had a two bedroom suite, which was the most awesome, amazing room ever.  It will be hard for us to ever stay anywhere else, because this suite is so insanely amazing.  I wish I could of had every friend ever with me in there, the bathroom is bigger than a normal size room there.
The dealers in the casino have always been super friendly, especially at the craps table.
We finally saw LOVE when we were there in August, and it was the best show I have yet to see in Vegas, I am eager to see it again when I go back.
I am glad they finally put another breakfast spot to grab a decent breakfast, however they tend to be slow at the pantry, the last couple times we ate there it took longer than expected.  I LOVE stack, had it for the first time a couple years ago when I ran the 1\/2 and we make it is a regular spot every time we go back (the adult tator tots are yum)
The staff has always been so helpful from the a\/v guy who comes to the room, the bellhop, check in desk, m life desk, servers by the pool, and servers at each restaurant.  I also love how M Life has my vegas slots, makes playing on my ipad so much more fun.

My only con about the hotel is the pool area, yes it is gorgeous and beautiful, but I hate how they jam those chairs so close to each other, you have to climb on your neighbors chair, just to get on your chair.  I wish the special adult area (not bare) wasn't so much money, it is cheaper to go to bare then the special adult only area.   That is my only con of the entire hotel.. not to bad.   

see you soon.. most likely in the spring.  My husband and I plan on getting remarried in the summer! :)

For being over 20 years old, The Mirage is not a bad place to stay in Vegas.  Sure, you'll smell like a chain smoker when you immediately walk in, but I smelled like a chain smoker when I walked into the brand new Aria too.  It doesn't make a damn difference.

The location is impeccable.  The Venetian (with it's offspring hotels), Caesar's, TI, Wynn, Encore, Paris Paris, and Belagio are all around you.  

The rooms are renovated.  Mine had a walk in shower, new LCD HD TV, super comfortable bed, and great strip and poolside view.  In fact, my view featured the topless pool, which wasn't so bad at all.

There are many pools besides the topless one and they serve behemoth and fruity tropical drinks ready for you to spike even more.
The Mirage has a diner open all night, tattoo parlor, a booji club and bar, and a celebrity restaurant.

Unfortunately, they don't sell a bloody t-shirt featuring a magician and a tiger.  (Ooooh...to soon?)  I would have bought that, only if the money went to a wildlife organization.  

The corporate owners of The Mirage kept the place up.  It's a little below The Mandalay Bay but much higher than the MGM.

I was pleasantly surprised with my recent stay at the Mirage and would gladly stay at this hotel again.

LOVES:
1) LOCATION: Located on the strip, closer to the North end. As any of you regular Vegas goers know, location is everything!  For this particular Vegas trip the majority of our plans had us at the North end of the strip which made it convenient for us to get around by foot or taxi.  

2) FRONT DESK\/LOBBY AREA:  I love love love the pretty (and huge) aquarium situated right behind the front desk. It runs the length of the front desk area, so as you're waiting in the long line to check in or check out at least you've got a lovely view of the pretty aquarium to keep you entertained.  

3) ROOM RATES: I usually book MGM or the Gold Coast for Vegas trips because of their bargain rates, but when fellow Yelper Ingrid R told me about the good rates at the Mirage I checked it out. Our room rates for our stay were as follows: 
Fri 12\/21   $72
Sat 12\/22  $72
Sun 12\/23 $56
However, keep in mind as with any other hotel in Vegas the above room rates did not include the daily $25 resort fee nor the 12% room tax.  So including all the fees and taxes the entire stay came to $309. 

4) ROOMS: Although me and my boyfriend's room was all the way at the end of the hall, we scored a corner room that was slightly larger than our other friends' rooms and had better views because of the semi wraparound windows. My favorite part about the room was the abundance of mirrors they had, aside from the mirror in the bathroom. As soon as we walked in, I noticed a full length mirror to my left (absolute must have in any Vegas hotel room); the mirrored closet; and a rather large hanging mirror on the wall next to the bathroom door.  Regardless of who was in the bathroom and how long the bathroom was in use, the mirrors came in handy for the other one to still get ready.  Enough about the mirrors lol, the rest of the room was nice: simple modern decor; comfy bed; large flat screen tv; etc. Although the bathroom was pretty small compared to other hotels I've stayed at. 

5) BLT: You'll have to read my BLT review for more details, but what a great find and soooooo convenient!!! Good food & awesome shakes!!!  The group of us ended up eating here multiple times during our Vegas trip.  

Aside for the small bathroom in our room, there really isn't anything to dislike about the Mirage.  I'm not sure when our next trip to Vegas will be but I'm keeping the Mirage in my list of go-to hotels to stay at.

Three stars because of the lovely pool area and great girls who work hard to bring you your drinks. Good basic food in the hotel grounds. Our superior room look back over the pool to the strip and mountains - was clean, quiet and a good size.
Gaming tables need an overhaul and the volcano was being renovated when we were here.
Overall a good experience. I'd come back again, but might shop around for deals just for a comparison.

Went here for Super Bowl 2016 Party, Denver beat Carolina.  Watched from a private party area within the Sports Book.  Had a 1st class seat with table side service for 6 hours, got on a package deal that was comp'd to me others were paying $200 each for open bar and reserved seating in great seating area fine leather seats.  The Mirage has 1 of the better Sports Books in Vegas it is huge, the place was a mob scene all day long, but I had no issues as I had 1 of the best seats in the place and was treated with fantastic service the entire time.  Would definitely come here again for Super Bowl, in fact already thinking forward to next year! :)

This hotel is nasty!! There was hair all over my shower. used cup coasters, stained carpet, torn sheets, etc. etc. And we had one of the nicer rooms on the 24th floor. The wireless internet is a hit or miss and even when you get connected it is VERY slow.  The maid service is slow and very unprofessional. If you watch how they clean, you will be surprised   and disgusted as to what they consider sanitary and clean. For the same cost stay at Venetian or Wynn, Mirage's time has passed....

Thanks Jason G.!!!! :(

A solid 3 star hotel, room was nice, bathroom kind of sucked but I really loved the pool! Tropical, lots of shade if you looked for it and the pool area itself was pretty nice. For the price ($40\/night) we had a great time. Be aware that you will pay the $20 resort fee but I used the wifi and the pool so it was worth it to me.

Definitely not one of my favorite hotels, but definitely not the worst.

I stayed here recently for my company's convention that was held at the convention center here and being that everything was paid for through by our company, I guess I really can't do as much complaining as I'd like....though I am.

The Mirage Hotels seem to be more darker and dingy (casino wise) compared to the majority of the nicer hotels\/ casinos.
