I had visited this casino many times before however, this was my first time actually staying at the hotel.

The rooms are newly updated to a modern\/contemporary decor. The carpet in the hall ways however were horrendous and looked like something straight out of the 70s ugh...

The actual room I stayed in was ok, though there were more down falls then good. No little coffee maker (I love those things) there was a minimal amount of towels and worst off, I stayed there two nights and NOT ONCE did a maid come in and make our beds and refresh the room ...major downfall and to make it even worse THE WALLS WERE THIN....lets just say you can here EVERYTHING...which meant less sleep...ughh...

As for the convention center and rest of the shops? They seem to have a nice selection of shops..Blizz yogurt is a great little place to satisfy your sweet tooth as well as another popular candy shop close by and the rum bar is a chic, beautiful hip bar that's perfect for the night life. The actual shopping areas are cheerful, bright and appear to be well kept too.

The convention center that our event was taking place at was gorgeous I must say, the bathrooms were beautiful and extremely clean. The food that was catered to both our lunch in and dinner party that night were certainly nothing to write home about though. 

Overall, I would come here again to dine at the restaurants and maybe give someone a tour of the place who has not been here, but never would I stay here again.

I recently went to Vegas for a double whammo!  We had to be there for a wedding on Saturday August 15th and that's the same weekend as my Birthday, which was a great relief!  

I got a great deal from the Mirage and never had stayed there before.  I was a little concern because a few of our friends had told us it was an older hotel.  But since it was such a great deal I decided to stick to my guns and stay there for 3 nights.

We checked in on Thursday at 1:00pm and the check in was a breeze.  We walked from the Hotel Front Desk through a mini tropical garden to the elevators.  It was just breathtaking.  The garden was so beautiful and serene.  I was hoping by now that when I reached my room I would be happy with that as well.   I got to the elevator and got to the floor... The front desk girl gave me a room that was so far from the elevator I thought I needed a day just to hike to it.  In any case when I finally stepped in I was pleasantly surprise because:

1.  The room had a comtemporary chic look to it.  It was just so nice. 
2.  I quickly realized why she put me in that room, she gave me a view of the pool!

The room is a little bigger than other hotels and the mattress was so comfy I can't complain.  After settling in I went to the pool.  It was so nice.  It was a tropical paradise right in the desert.  It's not quite as fabulous as the Mandalay Beach but close enough.  It was a huge pool but of course like any Vegas pool in the summer it gets crowded by 10am.  

Service is great and is a breeze.  Check in and out are awesome no complaints.   I'll definitely be staying here again.

Not bad, the pool was really crowded though, we didn't get a lounge chair when we went in the afternoon, had to sit by the pool with our legs in it, 3ft deep with a waterfall, which was fun to get under. The room was fine, the view was nice. The lobby floor had lots of shops and restaurants. Nice location, close to everything. Nice grounds and they have tigers and a fake jungle.

just got back from Vegas for New Year's, so it's time to begin the barrage of reviews of my second time in Sin City.

Mirage is a pretty bitchin' hotel. it has a great location in the center of The Strip. rooms were a little classy, fairly large, and the beds were comfortable. not a fan of them automatically tacking on a $15\/day resort fee (which is soon going up to 20 or 25), but it's not overly expensive anyway. it also covers wifi, which is pretty cool.

the buffet I'll save for it's own review, but to summarize: jawesome.

The Sports Bar (yes, that's the name of it) has a sick deal, $10 for 32 ounces of beer. signed me the fuck up for that one.

the casino area is very nice and clean, doesn't smell of smoke like some other ones, and the games are varied. crowd is very varied here.

was kind of let down that the pool was closed, but it's winter anyway, so no biggie.

I would stay here again.

There's a reason Clark Griswold brought his family and it's because The Mirage is awesome. 

Regretfully we didnt stay here and that's the reason for the 4 star review, but I had zero problems with The Mirage. It's really a beautiful place with a great entry, well placed gaming and just a great overall design. We spent a lot of time playing a computerized roulette with a live wheel as well as blackjack. Now as with the rest of the city, there are a ton of automatic shufflers, single-decks and the amazingly stupid rule of having the dealer always hit on a soft 17. Mindboggling. 

Aside from that there's the Cirque show Beatles LOVE that I wish we had the money\/time to see, a few great restaurants and an excellent sports book. We probably spent the majority of our Vegas time here and it did not disappoint.

I went this past weekend to Vegas for a fraternity's installations. Their banquet was here and so we all stayed here. All the rooms we stayed in look about the same 2 queen sized beds and a relatively small bathroom imo.  BUT! huge flat screens and iHomes yay! 

My friend and I ended up getting our own room - quite a last minute decision at 2 a.m. I called the front desk from the room we were staying in and they picked up remarkably fast and were extremely helpful and courteous. I was informed that it would be $99 for the night. 
So we packed our stuff and headed down to the lobby. By the time I got down there, the price apparently went up to $209? But, the front desk attendant said that since I was told it would be $99 then it would be that price. Thank goodness! 

And there was also only smoking rooms left but she made a couple of phone calls and the room we got was AWESOME. So much bigger than the other room we were in AND there was strip view. We could only stay for one night though (and they sold out the next day apparently as well!) 

When we checked out, I ended up forgetting two things. First, my towel - but I realized I forgot this right away and I saw one of the housekeeping ladies who promptly helped me call security to get back into the room. HOWEVER, I realized when I checked into my next hotel, that I forgot two dresses in the closet. One of them I REALLY needed for that night. I was put in contact with housekeeping lost and found. 

And here is why they only get 4 stars - 
I called and I left my contact information and she said she would get someone to go up to the room to check for me. I know that there are many many rooms in the Mirage and I'm sure they're very busy. However, after an hour, I decided that I would call back because in the event that my dresses got stolen (hey sorry thinking worst scenario) I would need to be shopping PRONTO for a new one. Unfortunately, I kept getting the voicemail for the next 30 minutes. I was eventually transferred to the assistant manager, who was THE MOST UNHELPFUL PERSON in this ordeal. All he did was transfer me to house keeping lost and found which in turn led me BACK to the voicemail. I was pretty frustrated at this point but there was nothing I could do. 30 minutes later (and technically 3 hours later), I was finally called back. Then I went to the bell desk and picked up my dresses no problem. 

Overall, it was a great experience. I've stayed at The Mirage before and it's always been good.

Worst Las Vegas experience I have ever had.  Ruined my wife's birthday vacation.  Booked a room through players club promo and was promised a marginal room upgrade which they refused to honor.  Was given one of the worst rooms location wise in the hotel.  The room was disgusting - bed was unmade, trash on the floor, McDonalds cups and sandwich boxes everywhere.  No upgrades offered.  No understanding from hotel staff at all.  I have gambled and stayed here 5-6 times in the last 5 years and they treated me like a street bum.  Had to take crying wife out and book a room across the street at Palazzo (far nicer by the way).

Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else where they will appreciate you and your gamble.

Ok I"m giving 2 stars strictly because of the pool experience. The pool manager really needs to hear this because my experience wound up to be a very fun trip to the ER.

I love the Mirage--hotel, service, food, it's a great hotel. 

Now the pool---ok I go there and it's all fun, fine, fairly clean--I mean a bunch of drunks in the pool and you know some of them never, ever leave to use the bathroom. Welcome to a public pool. However, think about that last line.

I sure didn't.

See I shave because I have to prior to swimming. Well it appears that shaving can leave tiny nicks and tiny nicks is a welcome open door to----bacteria, germs, and all sorts of fun.

My vacation was great. Came home..noticed a bump on the hoo ha. Ok ingrown hair, whatevs.

Well that ingrown hair on the hoo ha turned into an abscess.

A STAPH-FILLED ABSCESS.

Do you know how difficult it is to sit, walk, do anything with an abscess on your hoo ha filled with staph pus? Well my gyn found out because that's where I had to go to get it fixed.

Day one---she just says "meh, it's an abscess. Soak and take antibiotics--cephlasporin. Ok so I do. Next day? It was the size of a walnut. I had to hobble my way back to the gyn where she looked at it and gasped "holy..... yea we need to lance that. That's not good."

Well this lancing at the hoo ha involved:

1. topical lidocane cream---did nothing. Pointless.
2. two huge injections all the way to the nerve where I proceeded to scream? Ever get jabbed in the hoo ha with a long needle? I don't recommend it.

So the lidocaine injection kicks in. Thank god I'm not in pain anymore. And she lances it and starts to squeeze for 10 FULL MINUTES STRAIGHT.

I see look of horror on her face and ask if it was "gross and a lot of stuff". She goes "well...there's a lot. Like A LOT, LOT AND GREEN."

Nothing like green pus near your hoo ha.

So I advise the pool manager to look up staph infections, which can be MRSA and can lead to sepsis and death. Do you think I wanted staph near my privates? Do you think I want MRSA infections near my privates? Do you think I wanted to DIE all because I went into your pool?

Like I said, I love the Mirage. But seriously, you need to re-look at your bather load vs chloriene and other chemicals ratio. I know it's difficult to keep up with the heat, bather load, and whatever is floating in that pool because the general rule is anyone in Vegas has everything and anything and they do NOT care what they're bringing into that pool.

Seriously, this review might be funny and all but a staph infection was not funny, amusing, nor safe to have. I'm not asking for a free ride or anything but you don't want bad press of a MRSA staph infection from YOUR establishment because you can't keep things clean.

So just letting you know, I went in July---you might want to drain and disinfect that pool because there are a couple hundreds of people running around with the same staph infection I got from there.

UPDATE: Guess what came back? And guess who has MRSA????

We ve been there one night in may. We arrived early in the morning so for an extra 30 $ we could come in straigh away in our room . that was really great because we were very tired.
Room was clean and bed really comfortable
Then the hotel is just beautiful and the swimming pool aswell.

Definitly will go back

Nice hotel for the most part but I wasn't wowed. I got my rooms for a deal $89\/night for Monday, Tuesday, and we decided not to stay the following night because the price jumped to $199 for Wednesday. I couldn't have imagined paying that much for the room we got and if I did I would have thrown a fit. Our room was missing some amenities (soap and hand towels)...no big deal, the furniture in our room was worn and chipped in some spots....whatever, I couldn't open our room door (it kept getting stuck and we had to push hard to get it open) but the worse was in the bathroom...the shower head sprayed horribly (hard water build up I assume) and I found black mold along the grout in the shower. 

The hotel has nice amenities but cleanliness is what I ultimately care about. I think the rooms can use a little more tender loving care and then they'll be perfect to charge almost $200 a night for. Maybe it was just my room but I still shouldn't have had those issues if I'm paying for a nice hotel.

Worst stay ever. Ruined the over all experience. Will never stay in mirage again.


Following issues to name a few

A) billing discrepancies 
B) TV issues
C) wifi never worked even after they charged resort fee
D) noisy room

Stayed there in July for a weekend

Confession: I am addicted to the MyVegas slots game. This game allows you to play online coins free of charge and turn them into real rewards. One of these rewards is a room at the Mirage. Guess who took advantage of this reward (hint: she's writing this review) I stayed Sunday night into Monday. Check in is at 3pm and check out is at 11am. I checked my bags in with the bell desk (which is outside) and then came back to check in at 3. The guy who checked me in was very nice and explained the resort fee and deposit of $100 which is refunded if you don't trash the place or use the minibar. I was given a room on the 15th floor with a nice view of the pool, and you could see part of the strip as well. The room was pretty standard...nothing too fancy, but it was nice and clean and the bed was comfy... which is basically all that matters in Vegas because I didn't come here to chill in the hotel lol.

Never again, Mirage. Never again. 

I'd say I've stayed here for at least 20 nights this year to date and have never had any major issues....until today. 

Today was different. 
Today housekeeping completely disregarded the "Please do not disturb, Privacy" sign on the door and came in to my room while my fianc and I were out. To some this might seem silly, but the fact is, we're paying quite a lot for the room and expect privacy to be honored. If a landlord came into a rental house unannounced, that would be a breach of contract. To us, this is just as bad. My personal belongings were all out in the open(since we didn't expect to have anyone come in) and I now have clothes thrown into chairs and on my suitcase that were purposefully placed on the once unmade bed. By the way, they didn't change the sheets, the same stains that were here upon arrival are there. Including the lipstick markings from what I can only hope was another couples fun. But it's Vegas, so ya know. It's all gross. 

Bottom line, the mirage doesn't honor privacy and to the manager, Nick, you need to work on your customer service. While you sit there thinking privacy is subjective and unimportant you are losing loyal guests. Had you thrown us a dinner at one of your restaurants or ANYTHING as an apology you would have made us feel like important guests. Sadly, this was not the case.
Wonderful place to stay!! Great location, good food, friendly staff and the price was right!

Me and my husband were excited to spend our anniversary in Las Vegas( The Mirage) but ended up disappointed in our hotel.  Front desk told us that they don't have a room with King size bed available, so we ended up with two queen size beds, ok fine;  but when we walked in the room , a musty smell welcome us, yuck and it gives me headache. I called front desk and told him the smell in our room, he sent the housekeeping with the spray. Seriously?! You will spray our room while we are inside. Housekeeping told us that spray will not work and the smell is really strong. So we have to packed our stuff and move to different room. What an inconvenience and waste of our time. 

Disappointed!

Mirage, I like you.  You're location is central and walkable to\/from everywhere.  Your rooms are clean.  Your service is nice.  And your ambience is new while still being old school strip.   Between the dolphin habitat for the kids and Bare pool lounge for the adults, there is something for everyone there.  The many choices of restaurants, shopping, lounges both there and close to them make the Mirage a solid choice for a Vegas weekend.

This is a great hotel for the price (only $100\/night!). Compared to some of the other newer hotels, it's looking a little tired. Everyone is friendly and helpful, the concierge definitely got used. I'm sure they were a little tired of us by the time we left, but they were so helpful in finding exactly what we were looking for, even if it was in other hotels.

The rooms were huge with great views. Be careful when you go near the mini fridge! Everything on there has a sensor and the maids check the sensors daily. If anything has been moved, you get charged. Unfortunately, that makes using the mini fridge as an actual fridge impossible. The maid told us we could call the front desk and get a real fridge brought up, but in the end it wasn't worth it.

The pool is very nice. Surprisingly, the pool wasn't that crowded. Everyone was tanning, with very few people swimming, which made playing in the waterfall pretty awesome. There are also several hot tubs hidden around the main pool. They are huge and claim to have a capacity of 15 people, but you could easily fit double that amount. I thought about going to their new topless pool Bare. I stopped by the tent, but they were playing "Big Pimpin'" loudly and there was a skeezy guy standing in front, so I decided to pass.

My only complaint with the actual hotel is the distance from my room to the elevator. There are 45 rooms on each wing on each floor. And of course I was the one who had to walk past all 44 rooms to get to the end. Generally I wouldn't have cared so much, except I was in tourist mode, walking everywhere and trying to fit everything in. By the end of the day I was exhausted and the hallway was so long. When you check in, ask for something close to the elevators.

Also, if you're really into the volcano out front, you need to be prepared: the volcano is being remodeled and won't reopen until October.

Was not happy with the Mirage. After waiting in line for 45 minutes in lime to check in with only 3 people in front of me. Then to be told an additional $52 dollar resort fee will be added for my three night stay. Are you kidding me. 

Then my Shower had a leak when I got out on my first day I fell and injured myself. Ruined my trip. The floor was covered with water. No matts or rugs.

The waiters are so slow, each time I was at the bar tables I would have to go to the counter to get a drink. Don't rely on the waiters.

I have been to Vegas on 4 occasions and have stayed at the Mirage for 2 of them.  It is the nicest of the hotels I have stayed at.   The layout is quite good, as is signage.   They have a super nice poker room, and a wide variety of poker games, and levels.   It is home to a very tasty 2\/5 NL holdem game daily.     Very solid dining options thoughout, especially the deli near the poker room and sports book.

The table games are decent, as are the dealers.   Catch the Danny Gans show downstairs if you enjoy impressionists.

Big fan of the Mirage, will stay again.

Our Home Away From Home in Las Vegas.

One of my go-to hotel to stay when I am in Vegas. It is located in the center of the strip and walking distance to its neighboring hotels.   Although it is a little of age and history, the hotel still manages to keep it comfortable and clean.  

My husband and I are always greeted with friendly staff at the check in desk.  Sometimes, they will give us upgrades which is always a plus.  Rooms are spacious and never had a problem. 

Casino floor is relatively smaller than other resorts and there are limited selections in slots and tables.  However, they still have the new slot games and are constantly upgrading their machines.  The table games are also limited but I love playing Pai Gow poker here.  My favorite dealer is John who always filled with great conversations and laughs.  This makes the game so much fun and time goes by really fast.

Carnegie and BLT is located near the exit toward the forum shop is a definite favorite.  Our tradition is to alway eat at BLT at least once.They have a milkshake called "nut job" which is nutella flavor with whipped cream and almonds on top. It is HEAVEN.

Mirage is part of MLife and getting their card to earn points for comps and free rooms is highly suggested if you are a frequent Vegas-goer

Although Mirage isn't considered a party place with the best club in the city, I still love staying and gambling here.

For me The Mirage was a great blend of value and quality accommodations.

Location: Excellent. In either direction you can get to great attractions across the strip including the forum shops. In The Mirage you have good dining options for almost everybody's price range. Although there is not a big chain coffee shop there is a Roasted Bean that will suit most peoples needs. The Carnigie Deli is worth a try and the burger joint right before leaving the hotel is a good bet for some good American grub.

Room: For the double queen room we shared the digs were pretty nice. The accommodations were clean and modern. The bathroom and tub were good sized and the furniture was comfortable. For the $$ I was very pleased.

The only knock I have with The Mirage was the pool scene. It didn't really impress and seemed to be lacking energy. Maybe we happen to be there on an off day but I was pretty bored.

Overall I'd definitely come back. For this Yelper it's got everything I need for a price I can afford.

Overpriced. You have to pay to park here even if you are a guest here. The floor wasn't so clean when I checked out my hotel room. I stepped on something squishy!! Also, they didn't provide many towels so when I asked for 2, they gave us 3! What? What happened to not wasting water and towels?
This hotel is in a decent location on the strip, but it doesn't have very great restaurants in the hotel itself. It's actually kind of small too compared to others, especially considering the price. The pool is pretty nice, although you'd burn if you didn't wear sunscreen since there is so little shade.
Overall, this was a meh experience. I have always wanted to stay here, but now, I probably wouldn't willingly come back
Highly pissed. I only have one day in Vegas to really walk the strip. But guess what am  right doing now... Waiting for them to fix the plumbing, the shower is clogged. So disappointed!

Did not stay here, but spent a lot of time here because we were at T.I. which is next door and they connect via tram.  Hung out at the Beatles' Revolution Lounge, saw LOVE, lost 50 bucks here and ate at Cravings.  Seems like a cool hotel and I'd like to check in and actually stay here once, my parents seem to like it a lot there.  

The pool though, amazing.  Huge area, waterfalls, all the goodies you could want let's say.  In a good spot on the strip so that if you want to shop you can walk, or hop on the Monorail from Harrah's right across the street to get to the other end of the strip by New York, New York and MGM.

This is not a 4.5 star hotel. This is just a dump. My room is gross, there are what seems to be spots of spilled drinks everywhere. This isn't an overexagarration, it was as if someone stood in the middle of the room and shook around some coffee with creamer and made it rain in coffee drops. They cleaned some areas but the entire bottom portion had drops of coffee drops and one cabinet was completely covered. I just don't understand what could've happened but it is vegas. Even still how could such obvious dirt be left behind?   I'm assuming the room has not been cleaned properly. My bedsheets have a couple of orange stains, probably old blood or ketchup. You can hear everything that's happening out in the hall. I was woken up by someone simply knocking to get inside their room and the door being answered with "what the fuck do you want?". I'm serious.  The room service is a joke. I paid close to 60 bucks for a burger and a salad which was delivered to me in a take out bag. Food was ok. The casino smells like stale cigarettes and cleaning products.  We checked out early and went home. This was the worst vegas trip I've ever had. Do yourself a favor...pay extra get a nice hotel and stay for one day less to save some $$. We went a cheaper route because we wanted to stay extra days and got screwed. If the room and ambiance are important for you don't stay here. If you just want a bed to crash well then there are cheaper options for that.
Bathrooms and we checked into a fucked-up overpriced about above-grade Act this is a honeymoon birthday trip so it wasn't really acceptable nothing good or to.show hope they see this

From 5\/09\/15
We walked around the Mirage for the Secret Garden exhibit, and it was nice. The Mirage is smack dabbed in the of the Vegas Strip and is breathtaking to look at from the outside with it's massive size, landscaping, water, etc. Inside, there is an atrium, shops, restaurants, shows, and of course gambling.

My family used to stay at the Mirage all the time before 2001.  The last time we stayed, we knew it was time to move on since:

1)  They still use actual keys (not card keys) to unlock hotel rooms.
2)  Everything in the room, from the bathroom to the bed is outdated.
3)  Seigfried and Roy don't perform anymore! :(

Despite all that, I still love Mirage.  It holds a special place in my heart just because it's always "been there for me", whether it's the nostalgic volcano show, a restroom I need to use (one right next to club Jet, after the escalators from the parking structure), or the V.I.P. room.  

Now the V.I.P. room is what I'm talking about.  You go in and there are basically couches and chairs for you to lounge in; and a bar with little snacks such are biscuits, cookies, and other desserts.  Refrigerated soda, juice, and water in bottles and cans are also available underneath the bar in the cabinets.  And all that for FREE.  That's what I'm talking about, living the good life :)

I have been using yelp for awhile now but this is the first I've reviewed. I hate that it's for a bad experience! After the long and tiring second day we were there, I came back to the hotel room so looking forward to munching on the 12 (yes 12 lol) to-go crab we brought back from earlier that day, only to find that housekeeping had thrown the bag away. We had to drive outside of the strip to that restaurant again to order some more. It was late and an inconvenience we really didn't want to deal with. That wasn't the only bag they threw out. Another one had chips, beef jerky, clean cups and napkins, snacks, whole avocados for the kids, etc., which were clearly NOT trash.  Both were set on the table neatly and we actually even cleaned up the room before we called housekeeping! The girl at the front desk offered a food n beverage credit, which barely covered for the food itself. I was quite upset btw but she was really nice so I didn't want to make things difficult for her. And then, there was an issue with our bill so that wasn't the end of it. The other 2 people and a manager I spoke to after, weren't very apologetic. They credited back the amount they shouldn't have even charged in the beginning and made it seem like they were solving all my issues and doing me a favor. They made me feel like I was wasting their time when it's actually the reverse. They also emailed me the bill without the actual bill folio attached so I had to request for it (normally not even an issue but I was thoroughly annoyed already arg!) We stayed at Mirage because there was a 1 night comped offer and location was good for the kids. I would have rather paid to not have to go through this.

Since there are 300+ reviews on the Mirage, I'll keep mine short and sweet. I stayed here for three nights a couple weeks ago. 

Pros: Large pool with plenty of chairs, home of Cravings (best buffet in LV), renovated and clean rooms, fast check-in, and is walking distance to Caesars, Venetian, and Palazoo. My advice is to skip breakfast at the hotel and walk over the Denny's across the street if you're looking to save a few bucks and eat decently. 

Cons: Slot machines are stingy, Sigfried's Garden isn't worth the price of admission.

Bottom Line: The Mirage is a renovated hotel with a great location. Be sure not to miss Cravings.I would certainly stay here again.

Why do people love this hotel so much? I had way more fun at the Hard Rock and the room was even newer for half the price.

Went here recently around NYE 2010 and had a decent time. The rooms are pretty big but the bathroom is tiny. I do appreciate the full length mirrors on both the closet door and wall - this is helpful when you're staying with 3 other girls and need to get ready at the same time.

I like the flat screen and the music channels, and convenient location on the strip; but even so, I'd rather stay at Treasure Island next door because at least they have 24 hr pho!

Wasn't the most gorgeous hotel I've ever stayed in, but it had a great location.  My friends really loved the pool and the setting around the pool.  The room was fine, but the downstairs was so crowded.  One good thing I would say was that the rooms were sound proof.  Getting ready with music on did not disturb anyone around us.  Also, when we asked for extra towels, they brought them very quickly.

This is a busy casino but very casual attire here.   We are here to see LOVE, 
The Beatles 
Cirque Du Soleil
Update to credit. One day after writing the review I received a credit to my bank account,  as promised.

In the beginning it was great. Then my key card stopped working completely the second day at the worst possible time. Locked out at 1am with only my cellphone and the useless key card in my damn pjs. I take the elevator and walk ALL THE WAY to the front desk and is DENIED a new key because my name isn't on it.. Yes, I understand there is security protocol but THIS IS JUST DAMN RIDICULOUS!! There are people already sleeping in my room and I CANNOT make ANY NOISE AT ALL (seriously..). I am turned away and have to go back all the way to my damn room for security to arrive to check id WHICH DOESN'T EVEN MAKE SENSE!! Why?? Cuz how would they still know that, that is my room??? He said that he only had to check my last name but my last name is one of the most common last names IN THE WORLD.. FUCKING IDIOTS!! After I show him my id I ask him if he'll bring me a damn new key card, his response? Have to call bell boy.. Well... How the hell can I if I CAN'T MAKE ANY NOISE IN MY ROOM???!! INCONVIENT AS SHIT!! I WILL NEVER STAY AT THE MIRAGE EVER AGAIN!!

Parts are new and some parts are old. I'd rsate the room cleanliness about a 4 (on a scale of 1 to 10). If you like residual pubic hair in the bathroom floor, carpet and bed  from previous guests, then you'll have a festival at The Mirage.
Carnegie Deli (for breakfast a la carte) seats about 20 people, so bring your patience with you.

We came here with a group of people for Halloween weekend.  Rooms were decent, beds were comfortable, and we were able to explore the Strip easily from the location. The boys spent quite a lot of time at the tables here and made some moolah.  Shops were decent but didn't buy anything.  

Check in process took a long time, but all in all it was a good stay.

This is a great hotel in an excellent location and everything is clean but there are a bunch of tiny little things that make it not perfect. 

1. The shower: the water is instantly hot and the bathroom is clean but the hotel room is like a sauna after someone takes a shower because there is no fan. 

2. The room doesn't have adequate light. Even with all the lights on it's not bright enough to read and it feels dark and depressing.

3. The bed is amazing! The location is the best on the strip and the staff are all very friendly and make you feel very welcome. There is some minor remodeling going on so it's on the road to improvement. When we come back to Vegas there is a 100% change we will stay here.  The pool is one of the best on the strip but get there right when they open if you want shade.

Update: 
this was a 5 star and I am knocking it down. We just ordered drinks on the casino floor. After 15 min she walked by and said "oh yeah I have to get you your drinks". It was more than a half hour total and nothing came. I asked a security guard what was up and he went to find someone. She was supposed to come back and see us. I had to snag her as she went by. She claimed she tried to get us our drinks but we weren't there. After a half hour we finally moved a few machines down but we were pretty much there the entire time. She offered to get us a drink again but I declined. I didn't want to sit there forever again. Then we couldn't find any other waitresses anywhere in the casino. You do want me to get drunk and spend too much money right? As if I wasn't irritated enough I caught her talking shit about us a few minutes later. I stuck my nose in and pointed out I was still standing right there. I am so pissed. What horrible customer service. I love the hotel and the spa but forget about gambling here again. What a shitty experience. 

In addition they never linked our parking to our room and we had no idea that we could use our room key with in an our privileges. They fixed it and gave us a credit but if I had known we could have gone in and out a bunch I would have used our car way more often. Annoying but I was going to let it go until stupid cocktail waitress pissed me off. Ugh. Not happy
----------------------


We have been really happy with our stay. Last time we stayed at New York New York and it was fun but this is definitely a step up. The rooms are very clean and modern and the whole hotel has a nice, classy vibe without feeling McMansiony. The buffet is ok but Cravings restaurant was really pretty good. It's open 24 hr. The gym is the best hotel gym I have ever experienced. They have almost everything my gym at home has plus they have filtered water and gym towels. This is definitely where I want to stay again next time we come.

PS: there's a huge fish tank behind the check in counter. They have a unicorn fish and a puffer
Two thumbs up for the location and the bed.  Super comfy bed, but didn't care about the noise from other hotel rooms.

In town for 1 night for work. Room was a great rate, and very nice. Bed sucked though. Unfortunately learned this the hard way after a night of sleeping in a heavily dented bed. The crappy sleep ruined my experience.

The hotel itself has really awesome offerings, eateries, and watering holes. Service is friendly.

aww i love this place!! got an amazing deal for my 21st birthday. we got two rooms that had the connecting door between them so me and my 7 other friends had a lot of fun!

the newly renovated rooms are awesome. they definitely modernized the mirage and did a great job updating all the furniture, decor, and quality of the rooms. the service was great and theyre pretty good about letting you check-in early as long as you ask nicely =)

the pool here is awesome too. its huge and we didnt have to get out there too early to find a good spot.  the waterfall is a lot of fun and definitely adds to the wow-factor of the pool.

ate at kokomo's for my birthday dinner, see my review on that, and also did quite a bit of gambling. they have a lott of roulette tables so if youre into that this is a good place to play since there's so many tables.  definitely one of my favorite hotels, but the rates have gone up a lot since my 21st birthday... you can pay like $30 more and get a room at the encore...but i still love the mirage because it does have a great location!

I was treated very poorly by staff. I was lied to about comps on my bill that I found later to not have been put on my room. The shower flooded in the room. We were woke up by construction in the room next door. I asked for towels at 6am and my wife was woke up at 9:30 when the towels finally showed up. I was threatened with security when I addressed the issue and had to run through the hotel back to my room on the 25th floor to warn my wife. When that situation was resolved we had to move rooms for a third time and I was left with a total of $300 in comps. When i checked later that night how much was left, it was discovered hat the manager never put in the credit and i was left with a large bill. I calmly stated that there was a mistake and I was again threatened with security. I will never spend money at any of the world wide MGM resorts again. The main reason, beyond the hastle, is because the manager at the Mirage, Emanuel, flat out told me he doesn't care about me. He just didn't want a scene in the lobby, which I wasn't going to cause. I have a family, spend good money in Vegas, and my wife and I do not deserve to be treated that way. I will stay at the Wynn next time where they have class.

This review is for the villas and lanais in rear of casino. Each has a private swimming pool in your private backyard. They are massive. You enter from the casino in an unmarked door to a serene hallway. Butlers. Private all powerful concierges. Every detail. While the Aria may be new and offer the Crystals for shopping and Barmasa and Ceasar's may have the Forum Shoppes and Nobu...this is the true Vegas sweet life. Tables of all limits. Accessible. Fun restaurants. Lots of action. Love this place.

The place is a dump! Water damaged room (The wallpaper and paint are peeling off of the walls in the corner), no towel rack in the bathroom (you can see where it once was - where it was ripped out of the wall), The headboard has cigarette burns in it, housekeeping is terrible, a dirty rubber glove was left on our countertop after they "cleaned" the room. Both my partner and I woke up every morning completely congested and could barely breathe from the the dust mites in the room. The soap and shampoo were not refilled after the room was cleaned. The hot water tap is either bowling or completely cold, no middle ground there. Internet service did not work all the time and was extremely slow when it did. The fire alarm went off with no explanation, I was told by security to keep an "ear and eye open" for what?? A FIRE! 

And this place has the nerve to charge for a resort fee!! And a parting fee!! The manager Diane I spoke to completely dismissed my concerns. I will Never stay at a MGM resort again. 

The only thing we wanted to do each morning is get out of this place as quickly as possible. Talk about a dream vacation! 

Thanks Diane for your professional help.

Save your money, avoid this place!

I made reservations for a suite 3 months prior with a down payment.  Checked in and of course the suite "was not available the first night".  The manager did partially comp us for the room and one pool cabana that I also had reserved and paid for.  We were a party of 20 with 8 rooms.  None of us will stay at The Mirage again.  Had my reservation been honored I would not be writing this review.

The stay at the Mirage pretty much ended our desire to go back to the new strip ever again. I waited several weeks to write this..I will keep it brief and to the point: 

Cost - way to much for the oldest newest hotel on the strip - the room was small and they have motion sensored AC so at night the AC will shut off. Two of the lights did not work and the drawer in the dresser was stuck shut and it took them three days to come fix it. The safe never worked, even though I asked to have it opened, repaired. 

Room service left one, yes one, wash cloth for the both of us to use - I had to keep requesting wash cloths and towels. To top it off they never once wiped off the counter in the bath rooms. I purposefully drew a smiley face on the counter with my finger..it was there five days later, along with all the glass rings, etc. 

They let everyone in for free into the clubs, give free drinks to the ladies to get them in, then it is ghetto look out. The two times I left to go to the rest room my wife was groped by some ass hat who would cop a feel then run off. 

Oh, and the topless pool..what a rip off. $250 on Saturday just to sit on a lounge chair. Then by noon the pool is full of 100 dudes staring at the only 5 women who should be topless in the first place. Then you have all the scammers who come in, then slip on a chair with paying, after you have dropped money to have your own chair. Then you have their staff running around "texting" on their phones...riiiigghhttt... 

No more comping drinks if you play video poker at the bar..getting a drink on the floor takes an act of congress. 

This stay was so disappointing I will be taking the time to write the company itself.

Mirage has become the hotel of choice for our guy's weekends.  Rooms have been well updated and has everything we need.  For the 2-3 hours we use them the beds are comfortable and the flat screen tv is great.  

I enjoy gambling in the casino.  All of the dealers have been enjoyable and do a nice job.  Drink service has always been solid.  The casino floor is easy to navigate.

It is easy to get through the Mirage and out to the strip quickly as well.  Harrah's, Casino Royale, TI, and the Caesar's Forum shops can be accessed in a short amount of time.  

Restaurants there we have tried are BLT Burger, CPK, and BB Kings.  Don't bother with BB Kings as I have reviewed.  BLT Burger has always been solid, and they have a fair amount of beers on tap.  

We will be back!!!

Cravings was excellent ! One of the best buffets in Vegas hands down. Prime Rib was melt in your mouth , roasted turkey and gravy delish! The Asian selections were vast and all very tasty. The buffet is set up with each station a different cuisine. Bbq, carving station, Asian, Italian, etc AND you get all you can drink beer and wine for $30! I will be back for sure

The Mirage is nice. I didn't stay here, but I came here recently for a concert and also played some. The place is kinda crowded though. The placement of tables and slots made me feel a little claustrophobic. 

I won a bit here, so I will be back!

I have stayed at The Mirage 3 times previously and always had a wonderful experience. Something must have changed in higher management because my experience this weekend was the exact opposite. 

We rented the Hospitality Suite to treat ourselves for my bachelorette party. When we got to the room, it was dark, dingy, outdated, the safe and TV were broken and there was a leak in the ceiling of one of the bathrooms. We called to let the front desk know so they could fix it while we were out at the spa - we came back about 4 hours later and none of it was fixed. We called again to have these fixed, and dealt with the engineering staff (who were friendly at least). They could not fix the tv and said we had no leak, we asked them to please come back and fix it while we were out at dinner, that we'd be gone at 8:30. When we got back to our room ready for bed at 11:30p, they were still there! And the TV still wasn't fixed! It's not about the TV, because quite frankly we wouldn't use it much anyway, its the fact that we were paying premium for a suite and spent all day (3 separate in-room visits) dealing with their maintenance staff. I called the front desk to insist that we not be charged the night for the suite, and I was put through to a 'manager' Diana who was absolutely repulsive to me on the phone. She had NONE of the facts correct about our experience (literally horrible communication over there), and instead of listening to me and believing me... she brazenly accused us of having "gentlemen in and out of the room" and that we should be charged for them. FIRST OF ALL the only gentlemen in our room were the mirage maintenance staff coming in and out all day dealing with this broken room. Secondly, even if we did have men in the room... it's absolutely none of this woman's business!!! I felt disgusted at this accusation and quite frankly unsafe - who were the 'gentlemen' coming in and out of our room??? They offered me $100 in food credit and said that was ample compensation for "a tv not working."

After this experience we were so distraught but decided to deal with it in the morning... but discovered that our bathroom was flooding from a leaking ceiling again!  Now it's 1:30a.. we called downstairs... again.. and said please just put us in a different room. Another manager came to our room with security and again, instead of listening to anything I had to say, sat me down on the bed like a child and waved his finger at me and said I cannot 'speak to his staff like that.' We were literally just 2 girls paying for a 'fancy' hotel room, trying to go to sleep! There wasn't anything illicit happening of any kind... and I was being treated like some kind of misbehaving child! I could not believe the way these people were talking to me. Luckily this manager (Adam I believe) saw that we were harmless and simply wanted to go to bed. Finally, the next morning, we were given a different room. 

The pool and the location are not worth the sl*t shaming and the grotesque lack of respect for a HIGH PAYING CUSTOMER. I will never stay here again and I will encourage all of you to do the same.

My review is torn. Decided to stay here for three nights during my last visit. The hotel rooms are really nice, with comfortable beds. The noise level that comes from the drunk idiots in the hallway not so dope. Maybe because I was on a smoking floor noise was worse but all and all I dont want to hear some dipshit girl crying about her room key at 4am. Second there is no "real cafe" in this place. The only place resembling a cafe isnt. Also, they should have more late night food open. Next, the casino floor is ok but I found most machines to be tighter than any other casino on the strip. The day time it is not a very inviting place for gambling. Drinks came rather slow while gambling also, and I was on the floor most of the night. I would have to say I think it is pretty tacky they have a bar that you CAN gamble at but does NOT comp drinks. Its a nice place but I wont be returning for a second stay.

I love walking into The Mirage, yes its an MGM property and yes, you will have to pay to park, but walking in you find the smell like your walking into a tropical island of Hawaii, They have polite and helpful staff. Also like the location its pretty much in the middle of the strop when you are walking on either side, also at least stay and walk the volcano outside, definable a worth seeing!
Terrible. Pool view room looks at roof. Venetian was 5 stars.Mirage less than 1. This is last stay at Mirage. Do yourself a favor and book another hotel. Any hotel would be better.

The Mirage is an older casino that is still nice but is a little bit dated.  The location is outstanding and the gaming good. The check in can be long and tedious and they add a "Resort Fee" to your bill.

**UPDATED**  I haven't even stayed yet and I am thrilled. I made a reservation yesterday online, but had to change dates today. When I called to make the change, it was hassle free and the customer service rep was friendly. I am THRILLED!

** I had a great time.  The accomidations were clean, modern and in great shape.  Hotel staff was a little lacking, but still a good experience.

Hot April day in Las Vegas, 90's.  Spending the day at the main Mirage pool to start  the celebration of daughter's 21st.  Can I please have a beer or cup of ice water ?  Pool service lacking.  Understaffed and the servers spend their time focused on the loud folks on the edge of the pool vs. us in the chairs.  Spent alot of time standing in line at the walk-up bar.  Nice use of vacation time, ya think ?

Rooms are more than adequate, restaurants are good.  Gambling sucks only cuz I lost last nite !  

Hire a few more servers at the pool and I would rate 4 stars.
Was much nicer than I remember, nice layout with lots of nice shops and restaurants; tigers and dolphins were nice, as was the huge aquarium behind check in.

Perfect location. Nice and clean room. The service could have been improved a little bit (long line waiting for check in, no smile at all), and it wont hurt to include in-room coffee. 

I am giving this place a between 3-4 stars.

We stayed at the Mirage this past weekend and I have to say I was very impressed. We were lucky to get some pretty decent-priced rooms, $104\/night, and the rooms were great! Newly-renovated, and nicely-decorated, the rooms were spacious and comfortable.

And the location on the strip - you just can't beat it! With the Venetian for Tao right across the street, and Casino Royale for some cheap craps, in between Caesar's Palace and Treasure Island, near the Bellagio, Wynn, and the mall, everything is nearby.

The buffet, Cravings, is pretty decent, too. They definitely have a vast selection, and quality is fair.

The club inside the Mirage, JET, is not so great according to my friends. Although the promoter hooked it up with wristbands and comp passes, my friends went there Both nights (Friday and Saturday) and they were not impressed, And they got in for free.

My fiancee and I were able to go to the Secret Garden and Dolphin Habitat. That was TOTALLY great! We got to see the dolphins (including the new baby), tigers (new baby, also!), and lions! The animals were very active, it was fun watching them interact with each other. It was like a very mini zoo in the hotel. Awesome!!

They also renovated the volcano in the front of the Mirage, but we never got a chance to see it erupt.

Also, we didn't get to experience the pools, since we went during the winter, but I'm excited to see what it's like during the summer!

Very disappointed and we won't be back! Cravings Buffet used to be a high end buffet that we didn't mind spending the money on! It has changed so much since we were last there 3 years ago. The food isn't half as good as it once was, limited food selections and we had to walk across the place to get our own drinks! 
We spent a few hours gambling and when we left, we were charged for parking! Not worth it!

The wife and I stayed here last year when we came out on our trip to get married. We got an upgraded room - Tower Deluxe - and it was amazing. the double sinks and jetted tub were great, especially on the day we got married since we needed as much room as we could get!

About the only thing we didn't like was that there was not really any cheap eating places. The restaurants were good, but all were mucho money and sometimes you just need a burger without going all out.

This a letter I sent to Management:

I was greatly disappointed with the way I was treated on a recent stay at your hotel. My
wife planned my 60th birthday celebration for me at the Mirage Hotel six months in
advance. We made specific request and were assured that you could accommodate
us.
We requested: Penthouse Suite, Best view of the Strip, No Smoking and close to
elevators.
Upon check-in, the Penthouse had a poor view of the strip (mostly highway) and was far
from elevator. We returned to the registration counter and requested another room with
the same criteria we were promised. We were assigned another Penthouse, however
upon entering the suite we were overpowered by the stench of cigarette smoke, clearly
not what we wanted. We once again returned to the registration and explained our
disappointment. We were assigned our third penthouse suite which had a view of the
strip but not a good one. (E-061) The suite could not have been further from the
elevators.
Buy this time I was very upset and quite frankly, tired of dealing with your staff. I
accepted the accommodations with contempt. I knew you were no where near full
occupancy, you could have done better.
I brought with me 40 other people all staying at the Mirage Hotel because of me. I
would have thought you would have treated me with more class and respect.
We have stayed at the Mirage in the past, however, I seriously doubt that you or any of
your sister hotels will be a part of my future.
Very Disappointed, former patron,

We just returned from a stay at the Mirage.  We were on the 8th floor in a standard room.  I booked online and did a package deal which involved a $50 credit at the Cravings Buffet (highly recommended) and a $60 credit at the Secret Garden (didn't use it).  This package was cheaper than booking the room on its own, so I was stoked.  

All of the restaurants at the Mirage are reasonably priced, which was a huge relief.  Cravings is well worth it for either breakfast or brunch. We also enjoyed BLT and the Patio Bar.   If you want up scale dining, you'll probably need to go somewhere else.

The rooms are nice.  They've recently been redone with a very modern look.  It came complete with an iHome which I thought that was awesome.  The bathroom was small.  Very small.  So small that you had to close the door to get in the shower.  All and all they did a good job with the update but a bigger bathroom would have made the complete package.  Loved the TV express check-out option as well.

I don't know if it was just our room but there was an awful odor.  I think it might have been some sort of vicious cleaning product.  It was the type of smell you get used to but totally uninviting none-the-less.

The pool was beautiful but the loungers are so crammed together, its ridiculous.  They literally couldn't fit another in there.  And totally BYOB.  I paid $9 for a water.  

All and all, I'd say the Mirage is a nice mid of the road Las Vegas hotel.  It's not the Bellagio or the Venetian but it's a hell of a lot nice than the Luxor or the Stratosphere.

The rooms are lush, the front desk is so well groomed that they ALMOST are snobby. lol

I loved sinking into my bed. Felt like  Featherbed AND amazing comfortable comforter and duvet.

I have to say that staying here the first half of my vegas stay I wish I stayed the whole time. The other hotel was lacking, but I have to dock a star for that almost snobby attitude the front desk has.

This hotel is always fantastic. We have stayed here five times now and it is just wonderful. Even if you don't get the strip view the other side has a great view of the pool and dolphins and you can still see the strip. If you get the volcano view its pretty cool because you get to see the volcano erupt from your room. The rooms are fantastic. We have stayed in the tower rooms and in the regular rooms and both are great. The only difference is the tower room you get to stay on the 24 or 25 floor and there are private elevators for the tower rooms. The other difference is the bathroom. The regular room has a bath\/shower combination and one sink. The tower room has double sinks and the bathroom is bigger. It also has a HUGE bathtub and separate stand alone shower. The room size is about the same though. The tower room has two smaller closets one on each side of the bed. The regular room has a regular size closet. So if you have the extra money I recommend the tower room, but the regular room is just as fun. The rooms have a huge TV and desk area with all the outlets and usb's you could ask for. There is a separate chair and the bed is so amazingly comfy. The staff is wonderful. From check in to bell service to everyone at the restaurants everything is just fantastic. They really treat their guests like valued customers. The hotel is just gorgeous. There is so much to do there. From the Cirque show LOVE which is all Beatles music and amazing, we have seen it twice. Terry Fator is incredible as well, we have seen him twice and I can't recommend him enough. They also have touring music groups and comedy as well. They also have the dolphin habitat and white lions which is so much fun. It's inexpensive to visit and so cool to see them feed and care for the dolphins and the white lions are such magnificent animals. They also have experiences you can pay extra for and swim with the dolphins or have them paint you a picture. The restaurants are out of this world. I highly recommend the Pantry. It is the best restaurant ever. It's open 24 hours and has breakfast all day. Their dinner is great too. We usually eat almost all of our meals there when we stay. You can also order take out and pick it up and take it back to the room. The service there is lovely as well and the breakfast is out of this world. Highly recommend the omelettes and the berry french toast. We also love the Carnegie Deli amazing cheesecake and sandwiches, and dessert at Heritage Steak House is fabulous. I also love the parlor lounge. They always have live entertainment. The grounds are luscious with all of the greenery and plants and flowers. It's an easy hotel to get around too. I don't love that they keep raising the resort fee. It was $32 when we stayed in Feb and now it is $35. They also charge for parking now. It is $10 a day for self parking and I think around $20 for valet. It is still way cheaper than most areas you vacation but it was really nice that Vegas didn't charge for parking. I am also not in love with the pool setting. It is huge and the chairs are so close together at busy times you are packed in like sardines. All and All though this is my favorite hotel that we have stayed at on the strip and I will continue to visit the Mirage whenever I can. I love that even though they are a huge hotel they still treat you like its a small boutique hotel.

We've been coming to this hotel for years and always enjoyed great service. The hotel has changed hands and now the service is piss-poor. There is spotty service at the pool, if any. Bring written confirmation of your reservation or they'll give you less than you booked. You can't change your length of stay without a penalty. Staff is often surly, just check out their new 24hr diner's receptionist. Everything closes earlier.  Expect a hassle of you deviate from the norm. God forbid you be disabled. Oh and that M-card thing? Useless unless you have bucks, in which case you don't need it anyway.
One of my favorite places to stay! The Love show is fabulous. So is the Brazilian restaraunt! Slots are fun!

First day here, they give me and my boyfriend a room that face not even close to the strip absolutely ruin my vacation.....there's no view at all even I kindly asked and there are not too many guests this week. Also I was stopped twice by the door man to see the room key. Room is so old shower is not strong at all.  So regret to stay here.... Not happy at all and will never come back.

Again, love love love M Life resorts.  Went to see CIrque de Soleil Beatles LOVE show. Got tickets for $125, second row and a concert, play, and circus in one definitely get your money's worth!

The lobby area for the show is very nice and colorful.  Mirage hotel is beautiful a bit big and you will get a little lost but every hotel on the strip is massive!

We stayed here for 5 days. 
Check in line was loooong but Brittany at the front desk was the sweetest and most helpful person I've ever dealt with at a hotel. Rooms were very clean and comfortable and supplied us with soap and lotion. 
I hate how they display tempting overpriced snacks on your counter ($14 bag of nuts, $10 water..yeah) hoping you will consume them in a drunken stupor. If you'd like a fridge it'll cost you $25 day. Mandatory $40\/day 'resort fee' on top of advertised room price is BS. And don't even open the mini bar!
Everything is extremely expensive. At the conveneience store located in the lobby we bought 2 single serve juices, travel toothpaste and gum... $28.  :0 The Pantry was our favorite place to eat...delicious pancakes and breakfast potatoes and the chicken alfredo pasta was perfect. Carnegie deli is a must: pastrami on rye was the best we've ever had....just like being in NYC.

Our least favorite place to eat within The Mirage was Heritage Steak. After dropping $380 we left disappointed. The steaks were mediocre but cost no less than $50 each. The seafood tower for 2 ($70) was pretty bad. The mussels in a weird sauce, lobster scooped out, mixed with a another strange sauce and pressed back into the shell... just make it straight up seafood! I would rather have had more shrimp,  crab leg and shellfish in its original shell. It should speak for itself. They didn't even give us drawn butter, just more odd spicy sauces. We couldn't ask for butter because our server never came back until she gave us the check.

The casino was fun but very smoky. My eyes were sore and red from the fumes by the 3rd day.

I can only image this announcement being made down the street at Circus Circus...... 

"for all you high rollers on the penny slots, come on down to the Mirage where you can pretend to be a high roller there too!" 

When this was under the Wynn umbrella, it used to have class and an understated elegance but now MGM has ruined the place. Sorry but really nothing special about the gaming floor, the restaurants and when the entry to The Beatles Love is the highlight, it's time to find another casino. 

The rooms? Marginal for the LV Strip and the same people you see in the casino are the same by the pool which is enough to get me closing my eyes. 

Can you guess that I'll skip here next time???
Why 5 stars?  I love their mobile check-in!!! The easiest process ever.  Clean rooms.  Easy access all around from parking to check-in to room to eating to exit to strip.

We recently stayed here for my husband and my unofficial honey moon. We got our room for a very good deal from the My Vegas game. Unfortunately the room was subpar. It smelled of mold and was very cramped. We requested the handicap room and it didn't even have room for the wheel chair. Will not be back.

I absolutely LOVE Vegas... I have been there 5 times since I turned 21 and I'm 25 now! I was excited to try this side of the strip. It was so close, I just loved walking out and the street was right there.

However, this hotel is good but the customer service? Is a BIG FAT ZERO. We left some things in the room ( I know, whoops our bad) but we didn't receive a call or anything after the fact they found two dress shirts and pants and put them in lost and found (we also had 3 swimsuits in the room left behind--some how, NEVER FOUND)... I don't know but MAYBE our information was attached to the room or something--just a guess... Out of courtesy they could have emailed, called, or w\/e but didn't. We finally called after we came back from our full vacation and they only found the 2 shirts and pants and want to charge an arm and a leg for shipping. It's clothes for goodness sakes! We paid it... but because of no courtesy call\/email, we will never be returning to Mirage again.

You're better than some hotels on the strip but If you don't have good customer service, I have no interest in staying with you.

The Mirage is definitely one of the "older" places to stay on the Strip, but I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel and its prices.  The hotel is a huge labyrinth (as to be expected), but it has all of the necessities - a decent pool (and, of course, a topless pool too), a CPK, a deli, a few clubs, etc.  

The rooms were pretty decent - relatively spacious though the bathrooms are a little old.  My friends stayed in the suites which were huge with tons of space - highly recommended for bachelorette parties!

Gage Hueftile is the worst manager I've ever seen run a front desk. Please don't be under the illusion that if you ask to speak to a manager at the Mirage Hotel that they care about customer satisfaction. This guy should never have been promoted to a manager position. We booked rooms through the Mirage, we requested king size beds and reserved wth our credit card. When we got here they had us down for two queens. We showed them our reservation and they said that we only made a request. It wasn't guaranteed. We said, do you have king size beds, they said yes, we said great, that's what we want, they then proceeded to try and charge us an additional $10 a night per room. Since we thought we had reserved king size beds in the first place, they should have made an accommodation for us. The manager was a jerk and we will never stay here again. With all of the great choices in Vegas, don't make the mistake we did. Go somewhere that appreciates your business

I seriously have no complaints about this place! Our check in was supposed to be at 3pm but we arrived at 12:00pm and early check in wasn't a problem.I stayed for one night with my boyfriend for his 21st birthday. We told the front desk girl that we were here for a special occasion and slipped her a $20 bill. 

She upgraded us to the Tower Deluxe Room and sent up a complementary bottle of champagne. There were jacuzzi jets in the bathtub and a king sized bed. They also do room service check ups late at night like around midnight just to make sure we have enough towels etc. The cleaning lady gave us chocolates when we opened the door. Awesome! The overall feel of the hotel is not so bad either. The decorations and plants in the lobby look extravagant and there are lounges and bars to hang out at downstairs even though we didn't go exploring too much. Overall, I recommend this hotel if you're looking for a very nice place for a cheap price!

Pros:
-Good service
-Complementary upgrades
-Located in the middle of the strip
-Early Check-in

Cons:
None

This is my favorite hotel on the strip.  I've stayed at over 20 different hotels and just love it here the most.  The hotel is in the middle of the strip so location is key.  

Hotel itself is very nice.  They just recently did alot of remodeling and I love the changes.  Got rid of the old revolution lounge and added another bar on top of that.

Rooms are great! Always clean and updated.  My favorite room is the hospitality suite.  SUPER huge and a *quick tip* always ask the front desk if there are upgrades available when you check in.  I've been able to get huge suites for only an extra $75-$100 a night!!

Dealers, concierge, front desk staff, etc are the best!  One of the things my wife enjoys is just sitting at the tables and partaking in l convo w the dealers.  They're amazing.  

Food is great too.  They have everything from the simple basic mid range to exquisite meal.  Try the Brooklyn filet at stack.  Oh and order pizza for room service...to die for!!!

Make your next visit here!!!

This hotel isn't bad at all.  I've seen many a times of the Griswolds in Vegas, and it was interesting to see everything in person.  The aquarium behind the front desk was so cool!  I was mesmerized for a good while. 

The carpeting in the halls looked new, impressive.  It seemed like they were going for an asian-esque feel to the hotel. We had two adjoining rooms.  The rooms were tiny!  They each had 2 queen beds, with little walking room.  I loved the decor though.  It was very modern and chic. Each room had it's own plasma and a small table crushed up against the side.  The bathrooms were bleh.  The showers had curtains instead of the usual doors you see at most other hotels.  I can't really complain, we didn't spend much time in our room.

We had a crappy view since our room was at the back end of the hotel.  No cool volcano view.

Their white tigers are so beautiful. And HUGE.  They draw huge crowds, but I managed to snag a spot by the window to look at one of the tiger's face up close.  

I hate gambling, so I very very rarely gamble.  I was walking through the casino and decided to spend a few bucks on their dollar slots.  Yeah, lost that in under a minute.  Never again!

Anyone watch E!? Kim Vo has his own salon here!  I actually saw him walking around during the day.  It was the same weekend Britney was staying here.  

Their valet area is cool.  On hot days, they have water misting from the top to keep the waiting crowds from dehydrating. I thought that was a nice touch.  This hotel is cool, but I don't think it would be one of my top choices if I were to ever plan a trip to Vegas.

I love this hotel.
Very clean, not to big like the big hostels.
They have adult pool(topples....)and love show is the best!!!
Overall great vacation if you don't gamble!!!

Although me and my girl were only here for literally 24 hours for the Canelo v Angulo fight this weekend, I couldn't have been happier with my decision to stay at the Mirage.  We had the king suite on the 25th floor.  Very nice room.  I was glad i paid that extra money to cancel my reservation at the ballys and get this one.  This is my mom's favorite vegas hotel and casino and it's been around a while now in comparison to some of the newer and hipper joints, but it holds its own all these years later.  I recommend it to anyone whose going to vegas.  I don't go too often to Vegas, only fourth time in 8 years...but if you see that the rooms at the Cosmo, Aria, Wynn, Bellagio, Venetian are much pricier, definitley book yourself this room and save the extra dough for gambling, drinks, clubs, buffets!

The mirage is exactly what it should be, its just ok. Nothing spectacular, nothing amazing just dead on ok. With that I should also say its not bad either. The range of restaurants, the shows, the lounges are all cool. 

Even when I'm not staying at the mirage I make it a point to either come here and gamble, or have a drink or hit up the buffet. The buffet is one of my favorites. And i always make a drink stop at japonias  lounge. To be honest I'm always hot on the roulette tables as well. It never fails. Which a great thing.

Now to the rooms. Rooms are ok. Fair size. Fairly clean. Drapes and blankets are most def out of date. In fact the entire hotel needs an upgrade slash face lift. Haven't got a chance to check out the pool. But I hear it's really nice. Check in service was ok. The aquarium behind check in is really neat. Also the hotel is dead center of the strip. Everything is walking distance. I'd probably stay here again. And quite possibly get a suite next time. I hear they are some of the best. Price range, well it's kinda pricy for an old hotel. But there's always coupon codes floating around online. So in the end it's not too bad.

Hadn't been to the Mirage in quite a while...but with a Convention located at the hotel, duty called.  I was pleasantly surprised by the detail and decor of the room.  Rather than having to dig under the deck to plug in my computer, there is a power strip at deck level...bravo!  Free wifi.  Nice.  The lobby, casino area is comparatively small and getting about quite easy.  

Everytime I go to Vegas I long for the 1986 days when Heinekin was a buck, food was under $10 and the rooms under $50 and you loss your ass gambling.  Now?  Room $100, drinks $10 and dinner at one of the nicer restaurants, $75.  I stayed 3 days, ate and drank in relative moderation, and still forked over $1,000.  There seems to be a line for everything...oh yeah....except the relatively empty casino tables.

Mirage has an excellent location close walking distance to Venetian, Paris, Ceasars and some of the seedier spots where you can grab a bite for $10.  

I may long for days gone by, but that is true for many things and although Vegas is pricey, where else can you bet on a Lakers game and then play a little pot limit poker with the local sharks? See you soon LV.

This place sucks

With so many places to stay in Las Vegas Why would anyone stay at the Mirage? My wife had a conference at the Mirage so we were stuck there.

As my daughter and I were walking through the casino (the only way to get to the elevators fron the front) one of the casino bosses rather rudely informed me that kids aren't allowed in the casino.

Our daughter was looking forward to swimming in the pool unfortunately there wasn't any water in it. The Jacuzzi was cold with cigar butts and ashes around the edge. Great for a kid.  

When we got out vehicle from the Valet we found that they broke part of the door handle. Now every time I go to open the drivers side door the trim falls off and we're reminded the lousy care we received. 

Of course they won't take responsibility for the damages.

Las Vegas as a whole is a bit of a let down, just a bunch of drunken squank. I fail to see the appeal of Las Vegas. I guess you got to be drunk the appreciate it.
I liked the revolution lounge the most! The vibe is pretty decent and the crowd is pretty young which I like. This place is pretty clean and doesn't really smell bad. I'd want to stay here!

Appena si arriva nella hall la prima cosa che risalta all'occhio  la fila di persone in attesa per il check in: un cordoncino a serpente con almeno 30 persone in fila. I motivi sono due: poco personale e stanze non disponibili.
Quest'ultima  la cosa peggiore che ci si pu aspettare di trovare! Nel mio caso, arrivati in albergo a mezzogiorno, dopo aver effettuato quasi 20 minuti di fila ci viene detto che la camera che avevamo prenotato da ben 2 mesi non era disponibile perch la dovevano ancora pulire e non si sapeva quando sarebbe stata pronta. Dopo circa due ore di attesa un giro per il casin dell'hotel e altri 30 minuti di fila, mi viene di nuovo detto che la camera non era ancora disponibile ma che nel frattempo mi davano le chiavi elettroniche cos che quando avrebbero saputo quale stanza darmi mi sarebbe arrivato un sms senza dover fare nuovamente la fila, non senza aver preso 200$ dalla mia carta di credito come cauzione.
Alle 6 di sera ormai spazientito torno al bell desk e, dopo una furiosa chiacchierata mi danno finalmente la stanza.
Salito in camera la prima cosa che ho notato  stata la sporcizia: polvere sui mobili, moquette sporca, pezzetti di carta a terra... E meno male che dovevano pulirla!
Nella stanza c' anche un bellissimo frigo bar stracolmo di cose di ogni tipo su cui campeggia un avviso: quello che viene rimosso (diciamo sollevato) anche per pochi secondi viene considerato acquistato dal sistema elettronico e quindi vi verr scalato dal conto della cauzione.
La stanza, situata nell'area nord dell'edificio, risulta molto rumorosa perch al piano terra ci sono i motori dei condizionatori che fanno un rumore infernale e danno fastidio anche se ci si trova 15 piani pi sopra.
Esperienza non proprio positiva, mi aspettavo di meglio.

We got a pretty juicy deal so for the money, this hotel was alright.  We're big Mandalay and Arria fans, so it's tough for this older hotel to compete.  It's in a great location, middle of the strip.  We did the early check in for $30 at 10:30 - well worth is as we didn't have to wait long to check in.  We got a pass for the pool and went back at 11. We were able to get chairs at the pool, but it would have been tough after 10 am on Saturday. The pool area is really nice - great shade\/sun areas and nice big pool. 

Typical Vegas - it was pretty smoky in the casino (Mandalay and Arria don't seem that smokey?) and BB King's and Cravings are pretty good for breakfast.  

The rooms have been upgraded well.  Be aware that if they give you a "mountain view" room you'll be looking out onto the roof.  It's ok though - we weren't looking for a view this time. The bed was comfy, but the walls and doors are thin - I could hear our neighbor peeing next door and lots of noise in the hall.  

Teeny bathroom, which didn't bother me as much as the nasty shower head - for the love of God.  Upgrade those things!

Service was quick and friendly.  We'd stay here again if we got another sweet deal.

Concierge was super helpful for booking shows and helping us check out + front desk check in was quick and easy.
Bathroom in our room was alright - well stocked with things but there was some mold around the edge of the bathtub and in the ceiling. Bathtub was fairly small and I really wish it had been a little bit bigger.
No fridge is a downside - why aren't there refrigerators standard in the room??
The bed we had in the standard room was very comfortable and I can't complain at all about it.
The casino was fairly nice and well cleaned, wish it was a bit brighter but not a big deal. 
The Cravings buffet is really awful, it's 100 percent not worth the price for cold food that isn't well made to begin with.
Overall a fairly cheap option on the strip considering it's easy to access any part of the strip or a bus to visit downtown LV.
I was disappointed to experience that the Mirage is now charging for parking. With all the ways I pay Vegas as a consumer, this will detour me toward other venues like downtown, mesquite, or Reno.

[Warning: Review from the POV of a hotel snob]

Oh, The Mirage.

You comp'd me a three night stay. Upgraded me to a strip-view room gratis. Lured me here with your 50K slot tournament, and even threw in some FreePlay.

But I had to dock a star...I just had to.

Don't get me wrong. For a mid-tier, 20 year old hotel-resort, you're still alright.

But I don't know. Some things about the last visit just weren't right.

Being a bit of a light sleeper, I couldn't help but lie awake at the drone of strip traffic that I could hear all the way up from my 20th floor room with the window SHUT. There was the sporadic ambulance or police siren firing off in high decibels that cut through the air so loud that I may just have well been sleeping at a Motel 6 adjacent to the Las Vegas Fire Department. Double pane window glass may have been a good option prior to the recent room remodeling? Uh. YA. I was so wasted, but couldn't even pass out because of it!

Let's also get to the thinness of the walls. No, there was no moaning or pounding of the wall from the headboard from the room next to mine, but EVERY TIME someone down the hall shut their room door, I could could hear it like a shotgun going off. THAT loud. Oh, and if it happened to be the neighbors next door, I felt the room SHAKE! (I remember thinking...okay I must have imagined that).

Oh yeah, but that's not the worst.

What I finally concluded (after the 11th or so time that it happened) to be the aging plumbing and pipe system, every time someone in a room within close proximity to mine had the water running (shower or sink), a HIGH-PITCHED jack-hammering construction-type sound would growl on for a few minutes at a time. It would start up, then stop, start up then stop. At first I almost believed that there was a construction crew doing demolition in the room next to mine ("Are they still remodeling the rooms? I thought they finished doing that...")

DAMN it! I am nauseated from binge drinking all night...the FEW hours I'm ACTUALLY IN THE ROOM and I FINALLY wanting to get some zzzz's and I have to deal with all of THIS BS???

ALSO -- the blinds and curtains do a poor job of completely shutting out the light in the morning. Beams of soleil leaked their way into my guest room during my most critical moments of attempting to rest my mind and body (more specifically, LIVER and legs). Way to go. Not.

So what did we learn today?

The Mirage guests should not be light sleepers. If you are, bring earplugs. And a night-mask for the early morning-photophobics.

I just arrived at the Mirage only to find out that my reservation has been cancelled. The hotel manager himself even admitted that when credit card information provided through booking.com is rejected, there is NO NOTIFICATION to customers of this happening. I don't know whose fault it is that this happened, but this is absolutely ridiculous.
