The manager also was entirely nonchalant and cold about the entire situation, which is not the way to treat a customer who has literally just been screwed over by whatever system\/process your company has in place. It was only when I reasoned with him that I had not gone over my credit card limit in months, challenged him to try making a test payment of $1 on my credit card, shown him the prereservation email from Mirage themselves (which I received YESTERDAY), showed him the confirmation from booking.com, and had been on hold with booking.com forever that he finally conceded to "overriding my cancellation", like he is doing me a favor when in fact he SHOULD HAVE DONE THAT FROM THE START. 

NEVER RETURNING TO THIS PLACE. Wouldn't even want to give them my money this weekend if it weren't for the fact that we would be stranded with no place to stay after traveling 8 hours from the east coast and arriving at midnight.

P.S. the manager admitted as well that he has already turned 3 other reservations down tonight alone and that he would make an exception for us. The reason for this negative post is to highlight the fact that this problem can severely impact people in the future if The Mirage continues to not fix this issue (like call or email someone before they arrive?!?)

My husband and I come to Vegas a few times a year, and the Mirage offers the best overall experience.  Clean and comfortable rooms, efficient and delicious room service.  The Mirage pool is the best for 20 and 30 somethings to come have drinks, get some sun, and have a good time together.  It's never overcrowded or bombarded with kids like some of the other hotel pools.  Staff is always friendly and helpful.  Casino is always putting off good energy, but not over the top.   Our only complaint has been that the bathrooms in the standard rooms are a bit mundane for Vegas, but the upgraded room bathrooms are worth the extra price.  It's become our go-to hotel!

The Mirage is a fun and layered casino who's layout and access on the strip isn't annoying. There are several outdoor lounges and international themed bars. There is also a HUGE fishtank by Bank nightclub which is special. I can't review the lodging or shows yet, just the hang-out entertainment factor. Pretty pretty good!

I've stayed at The Mirage a number of times and have always had an amazing time. 

One of the nicest things about staying at The Mirage is the location. The hotel is located in the absolute heart of the strip. Across the street are the Palazzo and Venetian, next door is Caesar's, and you aren't far at all from The Wynn. 

The rooms have all been recently upgraded to suites. The new layouts are huge step up from the dated rooms that they used to rent out. The beds are really comfortable and the rooms have a great modern feel including flat screens in every one. 

During the summer the two pools at Mirage are a great place to spend the day. Bare is the adult version of the pool and is significantly smaller and more private. It's a topless pool that caters to a 20's and 30's crowd where the alcohol is always flowing. The main pool is less party oriented, but still really fun. The pool serves the best frozen drinks on the planet, they are the ultimate hang over cure. 

The Mirage is a great place to stay in the heart of the strip if you don't want to shell out the money for Belagio or the Wynn.

We do not stay here, but always spend time in the casino and shops.  I passed through my Beatles phase many moons ago, and reluctantly bought tickets to LOVE - oh wow - it was so amazing.  I notice my smackdown of The Secret Garden got deleted, but let others discover and complain - not my problem.  I tried.  Still a lovely hotel and a place to spend time.

We stayed at the Mirage with a large group of business associates for a convention. In all we had 8 rooms. The hotel has excellent restaurants although the service in the steakhouse between the cafe and buffet is hideous.

The rooms are pleasant and a fair size for Las Vegas. We had a strip-view room which was excellent especially since we could watch the "volcano" from above. The rooms are not large enough to have a business meeting with more than 2 people.

The room furnishings were comfortable, the bell hops were fabulous, the valet was good and fairly priced, in-room internet access about average cost for the area ($11 for 24 hours), rooms were quiet, water pressure in the shower a little weak.

There are plenty of interesting things to do in the hotel if you have children although Vegas is not exactly family friendly - especially if you have very young children. The lush cool interior of the lobby and casino areas is very soothing after being out on the strip during summer.

If you are looking for a mid-range hotel with reasonable prices but by no means a low-budget hotel you should be happy at the Mirage. Even during conventions when the hotel is very busy the staff tried to accommodate all of our requests, which were many since we had 8 rooms. Overall it was a very pleasant stay for a reasonable price.

    * Liked -- Convenience to activities, views of the strip
    * Disliked -- Weak water pressure in shower.

Had an invite to come here for a comped holiday weekend and we took it.
Checked into a nicely decorated, clean room not so far from the elevator. Made getting around the property quick and easy.

I really liked this place. Service was friendly and professional in each and every department that we encountered.

Saw the Beatles "Love" Cirque Soliel show which was pretty cool.

Casino was bustling, drink service was timely, tables were a good mix all around.

We also had a great driver from the Aria that took us back to the airport from the Mirage. I forgot his name unfortunately. An ex-Service member from San Diego.


Thanks to Sonny M. for making it happen. We'll be back.

Cheers to all

Nasty and unorganized!! 

This place is a joke. I started in a regular room with a dirty, broken shower curtain. They moved me to another room where they miscommunicated and had maintenance going on where we were then brought to a 3rd room, which was a downgrade from both of the other rooms. To try to compensate they brought us to a 4th upgrade room overbearing of cigarette smoke AND also undergoing maintenance. When we called to move to the 5th room we were not apologized to but told to "wait patiently". FINALLY we were greeted by a hotel manager who had little to nothing to say and no apology. Aren't you suppose to be the head of hospitality and at least pretend to be apologetic and accommodating?! This apparently happens way too much and he's used to their gross rooms, rude staff, and unorganized establishment. 

This places management needs to get their staff in check. They are rude and unorganized and the establishment is rundown. They should be jumping with smiles and hospitality to keep people coming.

Gustavo in Security is my savior!!  He went on a scavenger hunt for the phone I lost near the cabanas--  he stayed on the phone with me while I called my cell repeatedly until he found it.  Thank you, you truly saved me!!  
As for my room, everything was fantastic, service very responsive to any request, had laundry done, late night room service pizza, everything was top notch.  Prime placement on the strip, awesome restaurants and the game tables were lively- just a fun atmosphere all around.  
Got a cabana by the pool for the day Saturday-  HIGHLY RECOMMEND - talk about living the good life.  Thank you Mirage teams for an unforgettable vacation!

Ive been to vegas plenty of times. ive stayed the the luxor, planet hollywood, montecarlo, the venetian, caesars palace, and flamingo. I never had a bad experice but at the mirage as soon as i walked in the door to my room was open maybe the maids left it open. we had no toiletries. all we had was shampoo and conditioner not even bar soap to wash our hands, plus there was a wet towel hanging by the door and one of the towels had dry blood stains on it. aside from that the tv wasnt working and a technician had to be sent.

Had a great past 3 days and nights in our suite at this amazing hotel. Our host Sunny was awesome and helped make our Batchelor party become a success. The only problem we had was when we were leaving and the bell hopper got mad because we gave them a $8 tip. When we called the front desk asked for 1 person 2 carts. As he and his buddy walked away ( the 2 older white guy he mumbled some stuff that was inappropriate ) he is lucky I had to get everyone back home or I would've went back to the supervisor and complain. Other than that the sports book, table games, pool atmosphere was awesome.

Great value- rooms are almost free if you go in the heat of the summer.  Great mid-strip location.  Nicely remodeled rooms with wide screen HD TVs and comfy beds.  One of the better poker rooms in vegas, particularly if you play limit HE (10-20 or 20-40 on weekends).  A variety of good food potions- I usually stick to BLT Burger, KPC, and Japonais.  Avoid the buffet though.

To be honest it was overall nice.  We got in and upgraded to a suite.  

However, our main reason for staying here was a pit stop on a road trip.  The room is so close to the elevators that I am unable to sleep.  It's pretty bad.  I can hear the elevators go up and down, constant clunking\/ banging noises.... 

The whole reason for being here was to get a goodnight sleep, which didn't happen.

It's awful.  I won't stay at another MGM location again for this.

I'm extra salty because or original room may have been fine, and I allowed myself to be talked into a suite that has the sound pollution of a boiler room. 

1\/10

Ahhhhh the Mirage.. The first Mega Resort in Las Vegas (1989) the mirage to me is allot like Ceaser's Palace.. It's been up for awhile but never loses its taste..they try to make it as modern as possible through the times & for the better.. The show's here are really great i once saw Kevin James and Ray Ramano here awhile back..not real big on buffets but the Mirage is still 1 of the best hands down....

We upgraded upon arrival.  They gave us a suite with cum stained furniture and non- workable TVs.  The Mirage used to be my go to place but now will stay away until they clean up there act.  Customer service was next to non existent.  Management is not watching or don't care anymore. To bad cause it used to be a great Vegas stop. But that is now just a memory.
Beautiful hotel! I loved the casino and the lobby. The pool area was also very nice.  The club was ok. I wouldn't go back to that one again, but I got in free since I was a guest there.

Hotel is great. Just stay away from the Buffet. In the past it was a good Buffet. Now, it is one of the worst in Las Vegas. My wife and I ate there at the beginning of lunch and almost all of the food was over cooked. Chicken was so over cooked that it was inedible.

Mirage is an amazing place to stay!  It is centrally located on the strip, so you can walk anywhere, to the Monorail etc.  If you are a romantic, and want to not leave the hotel, that is a possibility too.  I found a fantastic web rate online at the hotel website, saw the Ron White show on Friday night, and took the elevator to the room after grabbing a late night dinner.   Suggest you invest in a limo ride from the airport with Presidential limosine for a hassle free stay!  No need for a rental car unless you plan to drive out to Hoover Dam (definately worth a day trip).   Don't miss Fremont Street for atleast one evening.  I arrived Friday evening, met the limo driver at the baggage carosel, was dropped at the Mirage, checked in, picked up my show tickets, went to my room on the 21st floor enjoyed a strip view, ordered eggs benedict from room service, then showered and relaxed until the 9:30 pm seating for the comedy show (Ron White is coming back, don't miss him)!  Only down side was the LONG WALK through the casino to the hotel elevators, and LONG WALK to the room from the elevator.  I checked out from the room using the remote on the TV and avoided the long line at the lobby desk.  Rooms are updated.  Hotel guests have priority access at JET Nightclub (worth it on Saturdya night).  I would recommend this hotel to friends, and definately would stay here again.

Love the Mirage.The staff is very pleasant and helpful.Room clean and very nice.The only negative I have it that we had 3 large tvs in the room we were at and they worked intermittedly,they did send some one up to fix it but they never got fixed.They just never woked long enough to watch a movie.Apparently this is a problem as several vacationeers were saying the same thing about the TV and internet.Fix the tvs and this would be a 5 star rating..

Too much noise from the hallway. At ALL hours of the night. Trust me. This place has potential with decor, location, pricing,(minus resort fees) and comfort. But the noise was unacceptable. We were woken up with everyone strolling in at all hours of the night and morning shouting epic things like: " WWWOOOHOOO VEGAASSS BABY" !!"
That's cute, the first 4 or 5 times, but seriously at 4 or 5 am, it starts to get old.

Resort fees for anyone that is interested, is what makes your deal on priceline\/internet go south. 
Vegas adds resort fees. Which they say is for 
'using the resort and getting the paper"etc. 
We never got a paper, or used the "gym" and had to pay. 
Mandatory fee.
 But seriously if I am getting charged $25 a day extra I better get a paper at my door or something. I never did. 
So, to me, the resort fee is a scam that you have to factor in while reserving a place in Vegas. This is apparently the "norm" in Vegas so be aware as your planning. I am sad, I didn't even get a deal on the new dolphin show.

If your gaming in their casino, well expect rude insensitive a-holes to neglect you. It was like a desert when it came to getting a drink while gambling. I spent quite a bit and nearly died of thirst.
When I did get a drink,  I sat at the bar and they pre-fix the pouring spout to a 2 count (vs 4 count) and say they "can't control it" on the comped drinks.

The best deal was the giant cocktail for $20 we got before the LOVE show, in the love amphitheater . It was strong, good, and huge! The Love show was awesome. It made up for so much disappointment in the resort.

The bottom line in pricing: We paid for 2 nights ( Wed and Thurs.) and the 9:00 show with good seats, according to the web sites 'Love package" $358. According to their rep, that fee included taxes. Final bill in reality, was actually $448, with resort fees and other taxes that they "apparently did not include". Well, that is what the manager said when i questioned the price difference.

BEST hotel in Las vegas , has the best food and the best accommodations.  Everyone is very friendly. I love the pool it is very exotic.  It has alot to do and I have won 2 times at their casino. Every time I come to vegas I make sure I stay at the mirage.

We (my girlfriend and I) stayed here from 1st - 4th of 2015.  It was my first time to Vegas and I was pretty excited.  We booked our flights, hotel, excursions packages all through Southwest Vacation.
Upon arrival, we were not able to check into the hotel.  We were told that our reservation was not on file and that we need to call SW to clarify.  After 2hr of being on hold with SW, we were told that our reservation was sent to Mirage Whole Sale Department on the 11th of December and that Mirage failed to upload our information into their system.  We requested SW to resend our reservation and within 10min, we were able to check into our room.  
We were very disappointed and upset at the situation and requested to speak with a Manager at the front desk to see who had dropped the ball and caused such inconvenience for us.  After talking with the Manager (Nick) he told us that due to us booking through SW and that SW have not pay for the room reservation, therefore Mirage cannot hold the room for us.  The Manager basically pointed the finger at SW and stated that SW was the one to blamed.
I called SW back to clarify the situation.  The representative from SW stated that Mirage is on a direct pay with SW and that once a confirmation was sent, payment was also made at the same time.  Furthermore, a representative from Mirage Whole Sale Department stated that they had a glitch in the computer system when the confirmation was sent on the 11th of December and was not able to upload it into their system.  Basically, instead of fixing the glitch and enter our reservation, Mirage ignored the problem and therefore causing us the inconvenience of our time. 
I called the Call Center for Mirage and asked to be transfer to the Whole Sale Department.  I was told by a Supervisor at the Call Center (Kimberly) that it was lunch time and no one at the Whole Sale Center was answering the phone.  She'd assured me that she will keep trying and will get back with me within 30min.  An hour goes by, then a day... up until today, I still have not receive any call back from Kimberly or any representative from Mirage on this matter.
I've heard so much positive feedback from relatives and friends about this hotel, that's why we chose to stay here.  Unfortunately, I felt that Mirage don't really care about their customer's time or experience.  Management would say anything to dismiss the problem or a complaining customer, supervisor would make empty promises to get a customer off the phone, etc.  Being that this was my first time in Vegas and due to such bad customer service provided by one of the biggest name in Vegas, I would not suggest anyone to stay here nor any other hotel under the MGM umbrella.

We've been staying here for over 20 years and it still doesn't disappoint.  I'm frustrated with the nickel\/dime upcharges they've developed though.  You want the better pool with less kids: $50 per person.  You want a guaranteed early check in: $30.  In the past they perked you on loyalty. Now it's strictly points based on casino play and dollars spent.  The good news is they now give points for entertainment and food dollars in  all of their hotels.

Still a solid choice.  Impressive (but packed) pool.  Pretty good deals from the M Life gambling card but don't fear using hotels.com.  My son used that and got an awesome room.  They offered a special: $81 room rate WITH $75 food\/beverage credit.  Happening now. 

Concierge tended to be more personable & helpful to the older adults in the group & more rude to the younger 20 somethings.  If they are in the mood, ask for some freebies to clubs, etc.  They have several to offer. 

Check their website for incredible suite prices & bring some friends. The spa offers a $28 break from the crowds. The deli has monster sandwiches (that come with an equally large price) but sharing is recommended.

Just returned from Las Vegas and attended my sisters wedding at The Little White Wedding Chapel.  I stayed at the Mirage and had a great time.  I booked through SW Airlines vacation packages and got a great deal.  The room in the Mirage is very nice and the service is excellent.  The only thing I don't like about the casinos is smelling like cigarett and cigar smoke...yuck.  Stay at the Mirage, you won't be disappointed!

Awesome place... beautiful rooms... the pool area seemed awesome but we were there for only 3 days and there was so much to see... the service was great and the stay was great, I got the player club card and was comped a free breakfast buffet, the day we left, so I have to go back beore it expires... haha!

I love it and I want to go back!

I usually don't stay here and upon check in I was reminded why. I am staying three nights with my wife. In addition to room fees and taxes they also are charging my card a $300 security deposit ($100 for each night). I also did not get a room with a king size bed eventhough I requested it when I made my reservation, three months prior. I asked for it but they said not available unless I paid an additional fee. There was no mention of this when I made the reservation. I asked to speak to a manager to get an explanation. He was extremely rude. Basically told me if I didn't like it I could leave. I got his name but am not disclosing in this review. If a manager at mirage would like his name they can send me email. 

Bottom line is I will avoid staying at the mirage in the future.

No hotel on the strip will ever get more than 3 stars for me...unless it spectacular...which no hotel in Vegas has been...ever. 
I came here for work. 

1. Hotel is relatively clean (it's Las Vegas...I am not expecting pristine) 
-with that being said one of our people got a really bad case of bed bugs. They did however give him a penthouse....to comp for the bugginess. 

2. The pool area is ok...but the pool doesn't feel really sanitary...it felt slimey in the pool?  And the water never looked clear...I only stayed in the water to cool off, since it was 108 degrees. All the chairs are smooshed together way to close. 

3. The people who work there are relatively nice, but the line to check in is way too long without enough people to man the line. I think I turned 80 while I was waiting. 

4. The location on the strip is nice, it is in the middle of everything so you have options on shopping and restaurants etc...

5. The bathroom is for munchkins...very small...I guess I am used to the nice bathrooms and rooms at Caesars or any other hotels I've stayed at. 

6. What large hotel doesn't have automatic doors? I had 2pieces of luggage and had to open the door and get my luggage in at the same time. There were Zero door people to open a door for you...horrible...horrible....did I mention it was a million degrees outside? 

My one big beef with my stay is that I came in from an evening and wanted to take a shower it was 100 am and being in the 100's temprature-wise-I wanted to take a shower considering I was sticky and hot....the only issue they turned off the water until 430 am...but didn't bother telling anyone to make a long story short they took me to 2 other rooms that had no water...I was so disgusted I gave up and called the front desk manager who was a tool-and then I talked to a real manager who gave me $150 credit for meals at the Mirage...which was ok but I want to bed totally disgusting. 

I would not come here again nor would I recommend it to others ever. 
It's just a blah hotel.

The staff here were extremely nice! They front desk allowed is to check in at 11am when check in is usually 1-3 pm depending what hotel it is and how generous they are.
Called the front desk a couple of times for general information and they were glad to help out! Very cheerful attitudes.
House keeping left our room spectacular each morning!
Had a great experience here and will definitely return to this hotel next time I'm in town, which will probably be next week!

P.s.
The gambling machines were very lucky!

Rooms were a little old, definitely not up to Vegas standards, but we got a great deal on the room. There is a resort fee charged, which is a little ridiculous because the Mirage does not feel like a resort. We went and sat in the Chinese restaurant and didn't get any service for 10 minutes, so ended up leaving the restaurant to go to a different one outside of the hotel. We had a great time at the casino - the waitresses weren't super attentive, but we still got served. The overall property seems a little old, but we still had a great time.

The room was great very very comfortable king bed, flat screen TV, clean bath room, strong shower. The only thing I did not like about the room was the fridge full of there stuff and keyed so that if you move it you bought it, that's a joke right? 
The staff was great except for one a-hole at the m-life desk. 
I lost a few $$$ at the blackjack table and did not get any M-Life credit due to I was only betting $20 at a time and not $25 well live and learn. 
I would stay here again in the future I just know now what they should have told me before.

We stayed at the Mirage for one night. This was our first time in Las Vegas.  The staff was great, very helpful and professional.  Lots of restaurants to pick from and a casino. The pool is awesome, surrounded by palm trees and waterfalls. The kids loved the waterfalls.  We loved the poolside service.  Could have sat in the pool and drank all weekend.  The room was very nice.  We don't have any complaints!! Wish we could go back right now!

Best part of the hotel is definitely the location. Pool is beautiful, but can get crowded even in October! Enjoyed the volcano show outside.
Enjoyed having Starbucks and California Pizza Kitchen in the hotel. Walgreen's is across the street, next to The Venetian.

It's the usual big hotel with no warmth. The room was clean. Great shower, but the tub has rust and poor caulking (a shame for the price they charge each room). Wifi connection is pathetic. There is a resort fee $25+tax daily charge that basically covers wifi (did I mention poor connection!), business office and  pool use.  These are usually amenities included at other hotels!!!

Front desk and concierge definitely NOT warm or hospitable. We found the housekeeping and luggage assistance staff way more helpful!
Now that we have learned to use the bus route on the strip, we won't stay here again. $8 bus ticket for 24 hour pass -- good for any of the busses!
I stayed here a few weeks ago, and it was nice! Nice spacious room and stylish design. Good gambling. Can't complain!
Kinda disappointed with pool staff and concierge not helpful at all. Don't think I would stay at this property again Ailey because of the customer service.

Meh.. This place has gone downhill. Not used to paying for parking in Vegas. Hope this isn't the new norm throughout the strip. I understand they did some renovation to this place but you don't have to make us pay for it through parking charges. I don't smoke but not having smoking allowed in the sports book area is dumb. This is Vegas, you can smoke almost anywhere. We were checked into a room that smelled like cigarettes and they couldn't transfer us to another room on the same floor because they were sold out. We were staying on floor 20 which used to be a smoking floor but the fact that they checked us in to a room that smelled like cigarettes without doing anything about it was uncool. Had to call front desk twice to get them to bring some spray for the smell. Baccarat is only available for high rollers. I'm staying at Caesars next time.

This buffet at mirage is like a real mirage . You come all hungry paying 30 bucks but you find nothing tasty or interesting . I think I was served leftover turkey from last year's thanksgiving. The only reason I give one star is for the white rice. Everything else sucked !

So I went to Vegas for the second time this year, I know I'm addicted. I did the hotel hopping thing. I stayed at 4 Queens the first night, Mandalay Bay the second, The MGM Grand intermittently, and at the Mirage Last. I must say that I am not impressed with this hotel AT ALL. I have so many things to yelp about that I am going to make a list. For EACH PART OF THE ROOM.

BATHROOM:
*Toilet would take two flushes to flush everything down. Gross!
*Bathroom fans did not defog mirrors after showering or get rid of unpleasant smells. What is the point in a fan then?
*Shower head was weak. It took me 3 washes to get all my conditioner out of my hair.
*The toilet lid kept slamming everytime my boyfriend tried to pee. Need I say more?

BED:
*The bedcover looked like it was made out of a 70's couch.
*The bedsheets were itchy and smelled like baby butt. (You know like that cloth diaper service?)
*I got tons of little red bumps on my skin from the sheets. Bed Bugs? I don't wanna know. All I know is that I felt super self conscious about my skin at the pool after that. 

NOISE:
*Doors on this floor slam, hardcore, even if you just let it swing shut. Get some hydraulic springs for the damn doors!
*When other people's doors near ours slam, it rattled our door. Loudly. At all hours of the night and morning. 
*Their little renovation project woke us up early every morning, and kept us up. Do you know how awful it is when someone is hammering in the room above you when you just went to bed four hours earlier and you have a  raging hangover? Not cool AT ALL.
*Someone's alarm in the bedroom next to us went off at the same hour every morning. I don't think anyone was staying there, but it would not shut off! It went off for like an hour, no exaggeration. 

I need to get one of those renovated rooms you yelpers talk about IF I decide to stay there ever again.

So what did I like about the room? Well, the only thing I liked about the room was the fact that it had marble floors in the entryway and a little vanity table and chair to get ready in. 

The room was not the only thing that bothered me, either. I understand why that the pathway from the parking garage goes through the casino before you can get to your room, but must it go through the lobby, the casino, the atrium, another casino, to the elevators and then to the room? By the time I had hauled my luggage (which is not light at all) through all the casino, the crowds of annoying people trying to take pictures where everyone else HAS to walk, and all those other places previously mentioned, I was pissed.

Oh and the pool is not that great as cool as it looks. You rarely get a lounge chair in the sun, and people hog the few there are. Its a small pool, with only one jacuzzi. And the water is cold. I got a great lounge chair next to the walkway where everyone could see my little mirage rash if they wanted. How irritating.

 Oh and the worst part? I paid more per night for this hotel than I did to stay at Mandalay Bay. Ouch.

And yeah the Volcano doesn't work. Sweet. One star for the vanity table and one star for the aquarium behind the Check-In counter.

Hotel was defintely a bargain.  Locked up a rate for 5 nights including the weekend at an average of $85 a night.  Upon entering the hotel, we see an area with tropical trees in front and the checkin area on the right.  The checkin area had a huge fish tank.  We arrived early, so our rooms werent available yet.  We dropped our bags with the bellhop and off we went to lunch.  After lunch, we received a call from the front desk telling us our rooms were ready.  We head up to our rooms and wait for our bags to be brought up to us.  The Mirage has recently gone thru renovation, and the room looked very nice. While waiting on for my bag, i decided to lay on the bed.  The bed is the most comfortable bed i had ever slept on.  I slept really well every night.  The room was nice size, but the bathrooms were a bit small but it didnt really matter to me as i wasn't in the room that much.  I liked the pool as it was really big and had a waterfall.  Didnt get to check out bare as the regular pool was good enough for me.  Overall, the hotel was enjoyable stay and would recommend.

The Casino is okay but don't expect any perks or above and beyond service. You have to pay to access almost everything in this resort. It's quite annoying. The staff provides sub par service (casino floor, pool, front desk). The only exception was the bartender at the Pantry. Older man, hilarious, talkative.. The rooms are okay. The bed was a little too firm for my taste. The shower head was water comes out so hard it feels like needles attacking you. TV seemed small. We had a credit for the buffet and accidentally forgot to give them our room number for the free buffet option and they wouldn't accommodate us. We paid 4x that credit during our stay at their restaurants and they couldn't budge $60? Club bouncers are on a serious power trip. We won't be back.

This was my first trip to Las Vegas and decided to stay at The Mirage and glad that I chose this hotel for this stay. Seeing it over the years in film\/media and advertisement I knew I wanted to select this location. Check-In process was easy; however, I was booked in a double queen\/non-smoking - but - when she pulled the reservation I was in a king\/smoking optional room. She gave me the option for another location (lower floor and not as great a view) as she didn't know why I was assigned that room; however, she told me the room was on the suite level and had a great view of the pool and the strip and if I went to the room and if it was to "smokey" she would ensure I would be able to change. So I stuck with it and was happy - the room didn't smell like smoke at all - great views of both the pool and strip; however, the view is slightly obstructed because of the Beatles Love advertisement over the windows. Hotel staff were very friendly which I was impressed by as in my home location hotel staff is hit or miss. The public areas, restaurants, etc were very clean and enjoyed the smell (as some vegas hotels just smelled awful to me). I also didn't like on the morning of check-out.... we got approved for a late check out of noon vs paying for a 3PM\/6PM option; however, 11AM the housekeeping was knocking, turning the handle, keying in. I opened the door and the man just said "just wanted to make sure you were awake" - I didn't like that. Otherwise, I had a fantastic stay and would recommend this location to anyone.
Room is nice enough. pool is great, would be nice if there were designated smoking areas.. Got a bit annoying. Aannnddd the room came with a free used condom... Score!!!!

Location matters in Vegas. If you plan on partying at XS, Lavo, Tao, Pure, etc, there is no better location for the money in Vegas. Assuming you're not paying Palazzo, Wynn or Caesars prices, this place is a killer value ! 

Rooms: The decor was AWFUL. The hallways are a serene black, red, and beige palette. You walk into the room and you're accosted with hot pink and purple. EVERYWHERE. The art, the drapes, the bed, the chair.. all neon pink and purple. Honestly I think it's a sad attempt at making sure people don't stay in their rooms and instead gamble.. Who knows. Either way the designers should be shot. The bathroom sucked. It was built in '89 so I can't really fault them for missing the huge bathroom trend, but wow.. it was tiny. Single sink, no robes, itty bitty bathtub. Definitely not a bathroom 2 people can comfortably get ready in at once! Beds are quite important to me and I actually loved the bed. I slept really well and was super comfy. It is the *cushy* bed type, so if you crave a hard bed, look elsewhere. 

The pool was actually really nice. I could almost ignore the strip in the background pretend I was in Hawaii. As a tip - buy the beers at the gift shop right by the pool for $4 and tote them in (or hell, go to Walgreens if you're feeling uber frugal). Make sure to get the Bud bottles that are aluminum, *not* the glass bottles.. you'll stick out! The same bottles go for $7 at the pool. 

Overall it's a 3.5 star, but I'm rounding up ! These guys were the first mega-resort in Vegas and I have to give the Mirage props for that. Anytime you can get this place at a significant discount to the luxury properties nearby, it's worth it! This is not a luxury property (imo), but it's great for people looking to spend most nights club hopping and days sitting by the pool. This isn't the kind of place you'd want to lounge around in your room!

There's a certain level of trust you place in hotels to provide reasonably safe and clean accommodations, but I feel the Mirage breached this trust with us on Thanksgiving weekend. At first glance, our room on the 21st floor seemed fine. After a long day, I was pretty tired and decided to call it a night, but my husband was going to meet up with our friend who was staying at the same hotel. I laid down on the bed and was checking my phone when I felt some itchiness on my leg. I really didn't think anything of it, but when I looked down, I saw a little bug moving across the sheets. I quickly jumped off the bed to investigate closer. I wasn't alarmed just yet and went to get a tissue to remove it, but then I noticed another bug of a darker color move in the upper right hand portion of the bed. I promptly took photos of both bugs and quickly called the front desk and used my cell to call my husband because I was completely alarmed at this point and just wanted to pack up and move.

They were able to move us to another room on the 2nd floor. I was so scared at this point as I had heard of BED BUGS, but never experienced them until this stay and I wouldn't wish this on anyone. They're very insidious and aside from skin bites and inflammation, they can easily burrow themselves into your luggage and clothes and then infect your home. I then called down to the front desk again to speak to the night manager and he said they have closed our previous room and a company would come by to inspect it at 7am the next morning. I asked if there was any way they could confirm with us if they were bed bugs so we would know how to proceed. He said most of the time, it's something else, not bed bugs, but assured he would contact us after the inspection was complete.

By 10:30 the next morning after a very sleepless night, we still hadn't heard anything, but were more than ready to check out. I called the front desk again and asked to speak to the manager regarding our previous room. She placed me on hold and then said he was on the phone with the company, but they would go ahead and comp us our night stay. In all honesty, I felt this was the least they could do and I would have gladly paid double to avoid this entire ordeal. I informed her we were ready to check out, but hadn't heard the results of the inspection and wanted to know so we would know how to proceed. She said she understood and would let us know as soon as possible. I told her we would be in Las Vegas for the rest of the day and she could call or text me anytime and then confirmed all my contact information. 

My husband and I arrived home late Sunday night and left our luggage and shoes outside to avoid any possibility of infecting our home. In the dark of night, we unpacked our belongings outside and promptly put all our clothes in a hot wash a couple of times. As we hadn't heard anything from the hotel, we weren't sure what to do, but I had spent the rest of the day in Las Vegas researching bed bugs on my iphone and how we can try to prevent bringing them into our home. Suffice it to say, it was very difficult to enjoy our last day there.  

I called to speak to the manager again the next morning and said that no one had reached out to us regarding the inspection and we just needed to know as our luggage was still outside. She said that as they waived the cost of our stay, there was nothing more their department could do, but she would immediately send an email to Risk Management. I then told her I was very concerned and scared about bringing bed bugs into our home and was there anyone who could tell us the test results so we would know how to respond further. She put me on hold and placed some calls and was able to confirm the room tested positive for bed bugs. She said normally they would offer to launder our clothing for us, but I said we were already putting our clothes through the hottest wash we could and our luggage was outside of our house, but I would be throwing them away as well as some of our fabric shoes.

The hotel offered another stay and credits, but this has been such a frustrating and traumatic experience and I told them I don't think I would ever be comfortable there again. They then offered a partial reimbursement for the luggage that we had to throw away, but it didn't cover the full cost of what we had lost. My husband and I decided just to absorb the cost of our luggage ourselves so that we could share our very difficult experience at the Mirage with others and caution them to be vigilant to avoid a situation like ours. It's a week later and we're still dealing with the bites and itchiness, working on replacing our luggage, laundering the clothes we had in them again and throwing away anything else that can spread the infestation. This was such a sad and disappointing conclusion to our Thanksgiving weekend and we hope it doesn't ever happen to anyone else.

Stayed in a 2 bedroom penthouse with an incredible view. The room was awesome, expensive but well worth the price. Great experience. A few things that got under my skin were I added guests names to my room at the front desk and everytime I called, they would call me by the other guests last name instead of mine. Last time I checked, the bill was in my name so it's respectful to use the right name. Also the parking situation needs to be fixed asap. I was already warned that mgm resorts charged, but I had pearl membership and wouldn't be. But the stupid machine would not read my card correctly. The first few times in and out of the parking lot, I had no problems. I even went to get a reprint twice. But the lady I dealt with the last few nights I was there was rude as hell and was telling me that I needed to fix my card asap. No no, you listen here. I have my pearl players card and did what I needed to do. Now if your machines aren't reading my card correctly, that's your problem. The other attendants just wrote down my player card number and let me through... This piece of work decides to tell me what I need to do because she Cleary had no idea what she was doing. She wouldn't let me through and kept me waiting over 5 minutes each time I got up to her because my card wasn't being read by the machine. She calls someone and they tell her to evenually let me through but I was in a hurry and stayed 5 nights and having to deal with that the last few days when I was already tired and annoyed for getting two replacement cards already and then having her tell me I need to fix it, no lady. I paid over $3k for a penthouse suite, AND I have a pearl players card, gold now after my trip... figure it out and make it easy for the  customer to do business with you. Not sit there and make them wait and make other cars wait and argue Who's right and wrong. All the other attendants let me through but this one red headed lady was just a piece of work. I wish I had gotten her name but man was she something. Other than that.... I had a magical time. I hope they get rid of her because she took away some of that magic.

I loved staying at The Mirage! It was a pretty nice hotel and you got the most bang for your buck for being on the strip. It was pretty affordable compared to the other hotels (less than $230\/night during summer weekends including taxes and resort fees) and you received free Wi-Fi, it was central to the main attractions of the strip, and had a great buffet. This was for a room for 4 people. 

You can't store anything in the fridge so if you bring food\/drinks, I would recommend bringing a cooler. They stock the fridge with items for purchase to get you to spend more. 

They also have those $22 tall (2 feet) margaritas! I've seen them as high as $40 at other hotels. And if you save the cup you get $5 off :)

Always a great time in Vegas!

Stayed at the Mirage again after having done so numerous times in past years. Everything was amazing as usual! The front desk manager named Fatima took extra special care of us, very professional and really went out of her way to ensure we were satisfied with our stay! Aside from being a beautiful Resort, that Mirage also has some of the best dining options in Vegas. Don't miss the Carnegie Deli! And the Beatles Love is an amazing show, true it's no Siegfried and Roy but it's a great replacement!

rooms - yeah, it is true that the rooms are kind of dated, but the mirage is currently going through a major renovation.  we stayed in a suite adjacent to the elevator and it was HUGE.  as you walk in, you have a large living room with wet bar.  to the left, you have the master bedroom that has a tv that disappears and rises out of the end table at the foot of the bed.  the bathroom was as bigger than the master bedroom.  off to the right from the living room was another bedroom with two queen beds and another shower\/bath.  the view is great!  we could see the palazzo, venetian and the rest of the strip looking down towards caesars

spa\/gym - unlike the bellagio, the mirage was nice enough to include free passes to the spa\/gym for us since we stayed in the suite.  the spa and gym were recently renovated and are A+ quality!  the sauna and jacuzzi area is my favorite.  this area includes a dry sauna, steam, sauna, and jacuzzi.  the jacuzzi can accommodate at least 15 people.  the dry sauna is standard.  the steam sauna is the BEST!  it is dimly lit with "mood" music.  the is also one of the few steam saunas that have ice cold towels available.  the steam sauna experience is totally different if you have the ice cold towel over your head to maintain your head temperature as the rest of your body is exposed to the hot steam

gambling - lady luck and i meet here whenever i go to vegas :).  there are ampe double deck blackjack tables located near the high limit room.  two thumbs up for that.  the high limit room is a lot of fun.  friday\/saturday night blackjack minimums run $100 to $300 per hand.  drinks are top shelf.  another set of thumbs up!

For the most part the biggest gamble I'll take is a road side taco stand. Just not a betting girl.

But our company has had a few outings here. None of them were Siegfried and Roy though. But I did get to see that show once. I remember whispering to my boss, "This can't end well in time." Huh. I'm sorry but white tigers were not meant to live around tourists in Old Navy shorts and crappy flip flops.

I prefer The Venetian. Where the biggest gamble you can take is hitting on 16. The Mirage needs a facelift. Badly. But I give them kudos on the room-service. It's actually quite good.

Stayed here for a weekend in February.

The location is pretty great, being adjacent to the Forum and some of the other major hotels.  However, I felt like everything was more expensive than it needed to be.  It made me feel like I needed to be a little tighter with my money when it came to gambling.

Drinks are about $10 a piece or more, which is pretty on par with everywhere else in Vegas.  I don't think you can get a meal for under $35-40 a person.  It just all adds up pretty fast.  You can't even get a decent deal on rooms any more; for what you get - a pretty standard room and very little atmosphere - they are a little on the spendy side.

Also, we asked for a non-smoking room and unfortunately, the room absolutely reeked of smoke.  We called the front desk and housekeeping attempted to take care of it, but I think it was in the bathroom fan.  As soon as we turned the fan back on the smell came right back.
Good value to be in strip- but it's really a 3star.. Towels Rock hard. Rooms are fine just not as nice as the nicer strip hotels.

The Mirage was a wonderful hotel!  The location was absolutely perfect!  It was on the side of the Strip that I felt safest and was located by some cheap eats as well.  Right across the street was a 24 hour Walgreens which we visited every night, there was a Denny's and also a McDonalds.  The staff was friendly, the room was very clean.  I loved the Volcano every night.  It was one of the coolest things I've ever experienced.  They had restaurants inside which we didn't dine at. Overall a great experience!  I'd highly recommend it and would love to visit again!

I absolutely love The Mirage. I have stayed here numerous times and I always come back. I have stayed at tons of hotels up and down the Vegas strip, some were good, some were alright, but unless you pay a hefty amount what you get in return is questionable. Mirage has combined that high end-luxury feel to their rooms, without the insane price points. They recently renovated their rooms and hallways and everything is basically brand new.

I have paid max $360 a night and have always been delivered a clean and comfortable room. No joke, their beds make you feel like you're sleeping on a cloud all night. I appreciate that they have a lot of options for dining with all sorts of different cuisine at different price points. As a coffee addict, I love that they have a Starbucks in their lobby. They have a few nice lounges where you can grab a drink. I have always had great interactions with people working at The Mirage, the list can go on. I also highly recommend checking out their Beatles Cirque show. Not for everyone, but if you are a Beatles fan, then you will really enjoy this show.

I love the location; right in the middle of the strip near all the hustle and bustle. Everything is a quick taxi ride away. The demographic is more of an older crowd and families, but that doesn't bother me since there is plenty to do around the hotel.

If you are looking for a great place to stay without overpaying The Mirage is the place for you.

Stayed on a 2 comp night M Life with $50 resort credit which was great minus the excessive resort fee & parking.  The resort fee would make sense during summer for pool but not in January.  I stayed here last year & thought it was nice enough so I was optimistic to return.  I feel hotel has aged too much in that time.  Our room on 14th floor was dingy.  Looked like carpet hadn't been vacuumed.  The 2 chairs were dirty.  The shower curtain hadn't been changed & was there was a bunch of hair\/dirt on it.  Shower didn't drain.  The air conditioning wasn't working well so our room was too toasty. And the bed was not comfortable. The housekeepers made the beds daily, brought fresh towels  & that was nice to come back to after 7-8 miles walks up & down strip but don't think they vacuumed or cleaned much.  Hopefully Mirage hotel gets updated soon bc it reminds me of the shabby places across the street which I avoid.  The casino is nice.  The food is good at Carnegie but SO overpriced.  The location is PERFECT! I'll do MGM, Aria or Caesars next time for similar price as I think the room would be better.

Very pretty entrances with waterfalls, rocks, and greenery. The place looks pretty average and kind of gave me that 90's feel. It was pretty nice walking by the glass dome. Probably not my top choice for resorts.

Very nice hotel in a great location! We were only there for one night as part of a cross-country road trip, so I'll admit I didn't get to experience everything that the hotel has to offer. But I did check out the casino, and that was fun. Best casino in that general area. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated, you can tell that the place has been remodeled recently. Overall a great place to stay in Vegas.

Love this hotel! It is HUGE but definitely one of the cleanest and nicest hotels on the strip! Doesn't have that yucky smoke smell and the staff are great! Rooms are beautiful and the buffet is amazing!

The Mirage was beautiful. I loved that this was my home base while visiting. The beds were comfortable and the room was clean. Casino, pool, food choices, and staff were all stellar! It was a nice calm oasis to recover in before heading out onto the crazy strip.

My only issue is room size. Everything seemed so cramped, most standard rooms I've stayed in on The Strip have had bathrooms 2-3x larger, and a great deal more space in the room itself. The price of The Mirage can get a little pricey, so I was expecting just as much space. A little disappointing, but wouldn't stop me from staying there again because it was a great place overall.

This is one of my favorite places to stay.

It smells good, its VERY clean, and your ears don't hurt from the sound of slot machines like the Bellagio.

The rooms are wonderfully decorated with a big 42" panel tv on the wall, and all the connectors on the desk for the business traveller. It was very cool hooking up the laptop to a vga port on the desk and watching netflix in my room as if it were pay perview.

My ONLY gripe is the room I am staying in, the water pressure sucks..

I have to say the Mirage is my friend when it comes to playing the slot machines. I mean I didn't hit a huge jackpot or anything, but I'd at least walk away with enough for a nice dinner for two or a spa treatment.  

Anyway, the last time I was here was two years ago, and with the addition of the beatles show, boy it's gone through alot of changes. It doesn't feel outdated anymore with all the new restaurants, bars, shops. And from what I saw they renovated their spa! Me thinks the next time I come here, I'm going to have to check out the spa since it's right across the street from the venetian and their spa blows (i've made the choice to always stay at the venetian now when i'm in town)

Oh, during the day, you have to check out the secret garden and the dolphin habitat. very nice change of pace from the craziness of the casino!

This place is so low class. We got there with our reservation and they couldn't find it they went back and forth with their manager, taking our paper work. Very unprofessional. We can see the charge on our credit card. What the heck. Such a terrible Experience.

Enjoyed my stay, especially since the room was comped and we got a great view of the pool. Room decor is nice. The hotel is starting to look a little aged, but still a fun place to gamble and drink. The hotel pool is really nice, especially with the waterfalls!  They have a CPK on site and the prices are comparable to other CPK's (not jacked up like most Vegas restaurants).  Also, more than enough taxis, unlike other older hotels where you're waiting forever to get one. Location is great!

Stayed here for 3 days and had a pretty good experience. We were able to get a good credit when we booked our room which was great. The pool was the best part of our stay, but wish there was a little more shade or some umbrellas. It had a good selection of places to eat and coffee shops. Now the Starbucks was outrageous in prices. I would not go back because they charge 4 dollars for a donut. Insane. This is all to be expected when staying at any hotel in Vegas.  Now, would I stay here again? Hmmmmm if I was able to get another large food credit yes, otherwise I would not stay at this hotel. There is other hotels that I have stayed at which were the same price and newer. It all depends on what you like though. I guess I'm more of a city center person in Vegas. A major plus was all the staff here was very friendly

This is the third hotel I've stayed in while in Vegas. On this particular occasion, my boyfriend and I decided to escape reality for a day and be tourist in our own city. We stayed in a penthouse and everything was clean, organized, and very spacious. Maids and services were very attentive. The best part was the view of the strip at night from our room.

Room was clean.  No refrigerator or coffee maker in the room.  Restaurants could use customer service training. 
Casino personnel very friendly.
Close to everything, walking distance to pharmacies, food, and shows.

What can I say here. My Fiancee and I stayed here for 4 nights this past weekend. It was a good experience after we just finished difficult times at school. From the moment we got there it was just an amazing experience. The check-in staff was very friendly. They got through the lines very quickly, and answered all the questions we had. The house keeping staff always made the room up nice, and were so nice when you would pass them in the halls. The valet was always quick to bring our car around. The most we waited was around like 5 minutes to get our car. The room was super nice. It had a 42" flat screen to watch TV on. The bathroom was clean, and ready to go. The only bad thing was that the tub didnt drain very well. I would definitely recommend The Mirage to anyone. Its almost in the middle of the strip, and provides a great value for the money you spend.

Came here and stayed here for one night on a weekend trip.  The rooms are definitely a lot nicer with the renovation.
Having said that I will NEVER EVER play here or step foot in this casino again.
The dealers were rude and curt with you. I was accused of lying when the dealer had clearly made a mistake.  She looked at me like I was a criminal rather than a guest at the hotel. The pit bosses were a little better but they didn't seem to have any power over the dealers.  The cocktail waitresses were also rude and just downright unpleasant.  
Giving them 2 stars is being extremely generous as I value service and atmosphere when I am at a casino\/hotel.  The only reason I gave them two stars is because the rooms were a decent upgrade from what they were before.
If you want a decent room but really bad service then mirage might be an option for you.

Had a great stay here this past week.  Got a great deal with airfare via Southwest Vacations. Keep in mind there is a $29 resort fee per night and room taxes on top of the cost of the room. Overall a great deal with what we paid.  The rooms are spacious and clean. Only minor complaint was the shower head.  I know it seems like it shouldn't be a big deal but you have to put in nicer ones for the quality of hotel you are.  We enjoyed the pool and had a great dinner downstairs at the restaurant Stack which I reviewed separately.  Located in a very central location on the strip and walking distance from all other major hotels and attractions.  I wouldn't mind staying here again on another good deal.

I've gone to Las Vegas and stayed at this hotel twice. It's casino is beautiful, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the swimming pool is huge and amazing with a waterfall. Also, the erupting volcano is really neat. It's in a great location too.

Love the Mirage. It is not a massive casino by any means, but is very clean and nice. It is centrally located on the strip, which is a major plus. The beds are super soft and comfy. The Pantry restaurant is one of our favorite places for breakfast. They also have a BLT restaurant that we like. My husband and I would definitely recommend.

Sep 2013 
Room was comped for 4 out of 6 night so I did not mind staying here. 
Clean room. Good service 
Buffet sucked 

We went out to vegas for the 1st week of football betting. The hotel was packed.

I'd have to say that so far our experience with this place is NOT acceptable... We booked an entire week for our honeymoon , and upon arrival have had nothing but bs... We have been more welcome, and appreciated at other places we have visited while here in Vegas. Even being an Mlife member, has done nothing for us here at the mirage. Yea, it's clean, yea it has a nice atmosphere, but that has nothing to do with the employee's attitudes,  or the way they run this place. We have watched people that are only here a day or two be more welcome, then ourselves. What good is a honeymoon at a place like this if you don't even feel appreciated or welcome?!? We will be spending our time at other locations, and just sleeping here,.. Next time we will be staying some where other than here, so that we actually feel like we are worth something. AWESOME honeymoon! Thanks mirage!!!!

While I did find faults with The Mirage, overall, it gets a solid 4 stars.

I spent 5 days here for a conference. I ate, walked and drank here here's a brief breakdown:

-The Room: for the price, you're getting a decent room. Stocked mini bar, robes, above average decor, flat screen, iPod dock alarm clock, rockstar bathroom. Lovely view of the parking lot.

-Eats: In the hotel, your options for sit-down are several. Stack, Japonis, Samba, Carnegie, CPK and more. Up side, just about everything is great. Down side is, your options for take away or lighter fare (in price and quantity) are very slim. For example, while working all weekend, we wanted to grab something to take back into the convention and the simplest thing we could get was $16 sandwiches from the Carnegie. Don't get me wrong, I love them, but if I was here on a vacation with someone and planned on staying in the hotel, even lunch is an ordeal. Be prepared.

Drinks: There's at least one big cup frozen drink shack. The burger joint makes boozey milkshakes. Revolution Lounge will drain your wallet to look at girls dolled up in 60's garb. King Ink is good as a lounge area but when they flip the switch to the full on nightclub, I need to evacuate. Overall: not bad.

Everyone we encountered hat worked at the hotel was awesome. Even though it's on the higher end of the scale, you are not looked down on like in some hotels, no matter what you look like.

So, overall, really good and I liked it. Im not saying they should put a food court in here or anything, but maybe something just a little more accessible  in terms of snacking would be good..

I was so disappointed with my stay. My wife and I chose this hotel even though our friends stayed at the MGM. This was a weekend stay for us.. The hotel is nice however their standard room was worse than a motel 6.. We checked in on Friday night and the room was really hot so we turned on the air before heading out to do some sight seeing and getting a bite to eat.  We got back to the room which by now was nice and cool and we turned in for the night. During the night the room began to get really hot and muggy.. The air had shut off.. I turned it back on and went back to sleep. Needless to say it didn't last long. The next day (Saturday), our only full day, we spent time in the room as the technician worked on it.. When I asked about another room I was told they only switch if the technician can't fix it. The technician got it working and left a nice gift.. Five screws on the floor near the air conditioning unit.. So not happy.. This was my 2nd time to Vegas and my wife's first time. It wasn't the best impression. So not like the Venetian.. We can watch the Volcano action from across the street next time.

I really have no complaints about the Mirage.... for the price, location, and the amenities offered, it was great stay.  I originally booked planet hollywood, but after reading some not so great reviews, and wanting to try a new area of the strip, I decided to go with the Mirage.

Tried the CPK & the "Cravings" buffet inside twice....  Don't get me wrong, the buffet wasn't out of this world, but for having ALL YOU CAN DRINK house beer & wine, it was def solid... I even sat there for like 2-3 hours taking my time just drinking lol, and accidentally indulged on some breakfast beer mixed with OJ .... hey , its vegas lol.

All & All, smaller hotel, huge pool, solid stay.  Wish I got to see the Beatles Cirq, but the Warriors ended up making it to game 7, so we watched that instead at the Sportsbook , and that was a pretty good time too, lots of screens and volume!

For the price & location, the Mirage will def have another visit from me, however I am still open to checking out other fancier options from time to time.

Pros: Very friendly staff, great buffet, great location on the strip. 

Where improvement is needed: The hotel, especially housekeeping, needs to do a better job of inspecting the rooms. When I got to my room, the carpet wasn't swept, the time on the alarm clock was wrong, there was a light coat of dust on the surfaces and a light bulb in one of the lights was burnt out. (In all fairness, when I called housekeeping and told them about this, they fixed it right away.) My king size bed was concave on one side and the WiFi reception was not good at all, especially for being part of a $25\/day "resort fee".

Certainly not a bad experience, but it didn't live up to the 4 star rating either.
...and the hotel's response from Lori P. doesn't even address the foul-mouthed lifeguard using the F word in front of families.  Downgrade from 2 stars to 1 star.  Bye bye. You really lack class.

One of the 'good' hotels on the strip when it comes to fun cool things to see and do.  The interior garden is tropical and there are little nooks to get lost in... sit and think...and then move on with your coffee before another army of kids come rolling off a sight seeing tour truck. 
They have a starbucks here , from what I was told, but I never found it.

In most cities The Mirage would stand out, but aside from its central location there is really not much 'special' about this property on Las Vegas Boulevard.  Certainly a fine hotel and cheaper than some depending on deals and discounts, but bargain travelers can stay cheaper and luxury travelers would likely be let down.
I loved my stay here,  comfortable beds and pillows. Friendly service and we had a great view of the strip.

WE spent a few hours on the Mirage floor before seeing the Beatles Love. Service was quick and there were plenty of options to choose from. 

Navigating around the Mirage was easy, and there were tons of dining and cocktail options.

I won a little bit on the floor here, and I would come back before another trip to see Love.

The Mirage is pretty hard to beat when it comes to bang for your buck. It has a central location on the strip and is across the street from a monorail stop (Harrah's). 1OAK is standard amongst competing Vegas nightlife, nothing to seek out unless you are into the guest host\/performer(if they have one). The rooms are decorated in a modern aesthetic. The wifi included in the resort fee can be spotty in certain rooms. On my most recent stay at the Mirage I decided to finally check out the Tiger and Dolphin Habitat. The animals appeared well cared for and the place was clean. As my friend and I walked through to see the tigers we  came upon Siegfried visiting the cats. He was so warm and friendly. He spoke with us about the individual tigers and even took pictures with us. I can't say I was around for the Vegas heyday,  but I have talked Tiger with Siegfried!

I'd like to start off by saying that I looked at Yelp to help me with choosing where to stay after my hideous experience at the Luxor this past April.  As I went through all the reviews, it was looking as if Mirage was my best bet.  So, I went for it.  I reserved a deluxe room with a strip view, hoping for the best.  We get there, it takes us less than 8 minutes to check-in, went to our room and was surprised to find that we had a great view of the pool area and the strip.   The room was very modern.  It had wi-fi, a flat screen TV, fabulous bed and everything we could ask for.  The Mirage is also situated in the heart of the Strip.  The Forum Shops at  Caesar's is right next door, the Monorail is across the street at Harrah's, free tram from the Bellagio, etc.  One of the best parts of our trip was the Mirage staff.  They were all helpful, courteous and seemed genuinely concerned with our hotel experience.  The concierge, Brandon, was fantastic in going above and beyond with helping us find the perfect seats for the shows we wanted to see.  To make the trip even better, I won money at the slots, had great drinks at The Rhumbar and great breakfasts while watching The World Cup matches at BB King's.  The combination of wonderful hospitality, beautiful surroundings and central location make The Mirage my go-to hotel for now.  I can't wait to go back!

As a platinum Mlife member, my husband always gets offers from the casinos that include some pretty sweet accommodations. I really wasn't expecting The Mirage to be as awesome as it turned out to be after staying at the Aria skysuites penthouse and the NyNy penthouse this trip. 

We stayed in one of their newly renovated penthouse suites.  The space, the decor and the ambiance really made our stay there super special. It had a full size bar area when you first came in, as well as a large living room and separate dining room. It would defiantly be suitable for entertaining. 

The seperate bedroom was also large and featured a TV that rose up ( and would also go back down ) from the console at the foot of the king size bed. Blackout curtains on the large windows were great for sleeping during the day ! 

The bathroom was also a huge seperate area that had a large glass shower seperate from the jacuzzi tub. The vanity had lots of drawers and a double sink. It also had a TV and a seperate large closet area as well as a make up area in the back by the actual seperate bathroom that had both toilet and bidet. 

Housekeeping was always really friendly and did a fantastic job. All of the staff was really cool to us. The VIP lounge was one of the better ones, and the wine they had was top notch. They even arraigned for a limo to take us to Delano, where we were checking into, right after.

The casino is big and is usually fairly busy. They have quite a few dining options. The location is very central on the strip. Walking distance to Fashion Show mall ! I went in to the Mirage with lower expectations, but was very pleasantly surprised !

Whenever I'm in Las Vegas, which is at least twice a year, I hotel hop.  I enjoy checking into a hotel for a part of my stay, checking out, then checking into another hotel for the duration.

A few weeks ago I decided to stay at the Mirage after I had checked out of one of my favorite hotels on the strip, Mandalay Bay.  I've stayed in many other MGM\/ Mirage hotels and I was looking forward to staying at the Mirage for the first time. 

My stay was very disappointing. There were several inconveniences and annoyances.  Beginning with my room---  

First off,  the television did not work, so I had to call down to get it repaired.  After the runaround between housekeeping and maintenance someone got to it the following day while I was out and it did get fixed.  Secondly, housekeeping did not completely clean the bathroom as I found a used washcloth tucked under the bathroom sink area.  Thirdly, after my shower and right before I had to leave my room, I discovered that  the hairdryer did not work properly.  There was no time to call down for another dryer to be delivered because of the time crunch, so I was forced to wing it for the evening.  Lastly, housekeeping forgot to clear off the previous guest's alarm clock settings which went off and woke me at 5:30 AM.  After remedying that, about thirty minutes later  housekeeping made a lot of noise out in the hallway causing the guest next door to go out into the hall and kindly ask them to keep the noise down. 

Drink service in the casino slot area was extremely poor to non-existent. It was almost like hitting the jackpot when I finally got a waitress to take an order. Very frustrating. 

On the upside, the beds are the best! It was pure luxury sinking into all those pillows and fluff!  You can't beat the location of the hotel.

Yes, I always wanted to try out the Mirage for years and it was very frustrating to be so disappointed.

Will not stay here again. 1995 called - they want their decor back. This place is in desperate need of remodel\/renovation. Curtains do not match, I wish I had taken a photo because it looked ridiculous.  The bed was not horrible, but not great either. My biggest gripe is their so-called "soaking tub" which conjures up images of bubbles and jets and relaxation, right? Wrong, it's a bathtub - absolutely no different than the one I have at home. Call it what it is. Noise level is off the charts, heard the neighbors coming and going all night. Oh, and on top of the $35 nightly resort fee, valet parking is $20 dollars a day. This apparently is for all MGM properties. Can anyone say GREED? So basically, not only am I paying 200 bucks a night for a Motel 6 status room, but I've got to pay 55 dollars on top of the to park and use the wi-fi. Absolutely ridiculous. The pool was nice, the pool bar was a joke, and although the bartender was very nice and jovial, he made me a drink that tasted like cough syrup after he realized he didn't have the ingredients to make me what I wanted. They do have a 21 and over area if you'd like to avoid children, but guess what? Yup, more fees! $55 PER PERSON just to get some peace and quiet and not have to deal with ten year old little boys in the hot tub trying to rip out the railing to enter\/exit, despite the prominent sign which states "children must be supervised." Needless to say, we will never stay here again, but millions of people every year will, and MGM will continue to make hand over fist off of hard working people just trying to get away for a few days. Pathetic.

Not bad for the my first time in Vegas. Very family friendly environment and decent sized furnished rooms although my bathroom mirror light did trip the breaker for some odd reason the first night. I was able to fix it myself without calling the hotel. The bartenders don't skimp on the drinks by the pool and security was extremely tolerant about helping me get back to my room after I had a little too much to drink.

I always wanted to stay at The Mirage, and I finally did on my last visit.  It's not the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in, but it's still pretty nice.  The regular rooms are a very decent size, are modernly decorated, have nice beds, all the TV\/WiFi stuff, a big bathroom and an acceptable shower -- all things I look for in a hotel that I'm paying over $100 on a Tuesday night in April (aka, more than a lot of other hotels in the area). 

I LOVED their pool.  

The bars here were also cool - I really liked the look of Revolution; The Beatles bar that is in the casino, but we didn't have a chance to check it out. 

We did brunch at their in-casino buffet, and it was just okay too.

I like the Mirage because they offer great rooms for a decent price.  The pool is nice, not that many shady options in 115 degree weather but overall the pool is still nice.  The gambling tables are not outrageous for non-baller types like me.  

However, the casino is definitely old compared to others on the strip (but to be honest, it has a great charm to it compared to other older casinos AND it doesn't smell like cigarettes like other older hotels on the strip).  The property is still well-kept.  The rooms and the decor are still stylish.  

I also prefer the Mirage because of the location.  It neighbors the Venetian and Caesar's Palace, and most of my cab rides seem to be around the $12-15 range.  

Will I come back again?  Yes, but I might try newer hotel next time.  Somewhere with better restaurants and a nicer pool.

it is a nice hotel, the rooms are good size, but not amazing, valet was fast, it needs a pool for kids or at least an area form the main pool.
Bars and restaurants look good, casino too, they have a little store inside thats 24 hours, nice decorations

Very nice hotel. Lots of stuff to do.
I like the dolphins. At nights the volvano spectacle is pretty cool.
Food is a bid expensive. $36.- for a club sandwich and coke

The Mirage is a beautiful property that sadly smells like smoke everywhere and has an incredibly incompetent front desk. They mistakenly charged me hundreds of dollars and when I brought it to their attention, the only thing they did was tell me over and over how they would refund it in 5-10 days. That I just had to accept it. I had asked explicitly when I checked in about how my card would be used and they just lied to me. I'll never stay there again.

We ordered mai tai's from Jamie at the lobby bar. 
They were the greatest. A must do at the Mirage.

Just checked out this morning after a 4 night stay.  This is a solid hotel but next time I will stay elsewhere, probably the Bellagio.  The standard rooms are spacious but as others have said here, the bathrooms are TINY.  Closet is very small, too.  The bathrooms are about 5' wide (just wide enough for double sinks) and about 8-9' long.  Tub is just a standard crappy tub with a curved shower bar.  There are nicer bathrooms in low end Marriotts.  The beds were comfy and it's a plus that they had two queens in a room and not doubles.  

Overall the hotel and casino feel a little run down and the clientele leaves a bit to be desired.  I think the Mirage's best days are over.
Great hotel room....downstairs by the hotel lobby it kind of smelled but the room was clean and nice

I have stayed at the Mirage once several years ago, so this review will be for the casino.  I enjoy coming to the Mirage.  From the moment I see the fish tanks behind check in and the  atrium, I feel good to be there.

The casino is not the friendliest to navigate when you're heading to the back to the Terry Fator Theatre, but after being there many times, there are short cuts to avoid the people who are slow, gawking, tipsy or a combination of those things.

It's a short walk outside to the volcano and once you're in the back, you can visit the Secret Garden of Siegfried and Roy or you can just watch the people at the pools nearest that area.

ZERO, BIG ZERO starts! Well upon check out I would have given this place 5 stars but after checking out and a day later I was charged over $1500.00 from the minibar. For one night. Yes. There is something rotten in Vegas, at the Mirage. It is not even feasible for me to comprehend this arbitrary charge. When requesting assistance with researching this, the front desk people were (and still are) very...extremely rude. They didn't care. I know I didn't touch, move or shift any items; the Mirage front desk folk argue with me. 
It's a scam. By researching the net, I found out that the folk running the minibar contents don't actually inventory the contents right after the previous person checks out or someone comes to the room wipes out the minibar then demands another room bc "they didn't like the room" for x, y, or z reason. 
So if you've been charged an odd awkward outrageously $$$$$$$ for a minibar, the aforementioned reasons are most likely the case.

I've stayed in Vegas every other year for the past 11 years (bc I love the energy and shows) and I've never had a thing like this happen. A history into my accounts will show I have never used a minibar in a hotel whether it's a stay in Fargo, ND or Las Vegas, NV.

I'm plainly pissed. It's irresponsible on the part of the Mirage to not investigate this. I'm insulated. If you look at my bank acct, you'll see I'm not made of $. 
Beware! The Mirage is just that...a mirage.

I enjoyed my stay at the Mirage. One reason is I like the way the casino floor is laid out and I like to stay where I like to play. I enjoy the buffet here, numerous restaurants at various price points and service levels are generally high. Room service was fast and efficient even at 2 or 3 in the morning.  I will say that their call center must be run by retarded monkeys since they managed to mess up everything about the 2 rooms I booked. However the front desk staff did a great job of correcting the problems and comping us for the inconvenience so I especially want to point out the great job Relita did in helping us.

Additionally there are two good dance clubs Jet and Revolution, an outdoor bar and a good quiet bar by the sports book. Most in the party won so that is another plus but one that can't be counted on in the future.

The hotel has a great outdoor pool, an indoor adult pool and the dolphin experience where you can swim with dolphins. You can also go through the tiger compound still there from Siegfried and Roy. The gym as mentioned needs a serious upgrade but then it is Vegas you have to check the healthy lifestyle for a few days.

I would definately stay here again as it offers better value than some of the surrounding resorts and it's central location makes cruising the strip easy.

Extremely unhappy with the service, they need people who hear what you want and not just mess everything up. From the moment we checked in all they did was mess up our rooms, did not help one bit. I would never recommend this place. I'm a very unhappy customer.
