I had stayed at The Cosmopolitan Hotel the last time I was in Vegas, which was stunning, but Mirage was a great mid range option.

I was initially worried it would be more of an older crowd - and while there were definitely a lot of middle-aged people staying there, there were also quite a few younger groups around late 20s early 30s for Bachelor parties, birthday parties, etc. 

The service was great, and the hotel was easy to navigate - it didn't take half an hour to exit the casino or a long time to wait for elevators at all (unlike the Cosmo). 

We got an Air Canada vacation package which included flights and hotel, and this hotel is a perfect option for those who are looking for a centrally located, clean, decent hotel at a reasonable price. 

Definitely recommend this!

In all my trips to Vegas, last week was the first time I stayed here. I came with the fams, and my mom had a free room voucher she wanted to use, so alas we ended up here. 

Considering we got a free room, registration felt it was necessary to give us a room on the 16th floor with a view of some buildings and part of the pool. the view was whatever to me, but you see access to certain floors are divided among 4 sets of elevators. Access to floors 9-16 were assigned on one of them. If you don't see where I'm getting at, picture this:

Our room is the last floor accessible going up and down. It doesn't help when you're going up and there's others in the elevator that are getting out on floors 9-15. It also doesn't help when going down that there's a stop on every floor going 15-9. It wasn't like that all the time, but 2 to 3 stops in each direction guaranteed. FML.

Besides that, my other annoyance with the Mirage is the volcano show. After hearing about the improvements and watching it at night, I was thoroughly disappointed. Its one of those "That's it?!" moments. 

Now onto the good stuff. $5 minimum craps tables for most of the day up until midnight. Jet is a fun nightclub to go to. Apparently I heard Aubrey O'Day from Danity Kane was supposed to be there on Friday night to celebrate her birthday, but I left for home that evening. They did a lot of interior remodeling for their rooms to make it look modern and stuff, almost Ikea status. Well not really, because there's a catalog in the room that tells you exactly what came from where and where to buy that stuff should you feel like copying the room. I'm pretty sure the beds were pillowtops too. 

I do enjoy their buffet Cravings, but I was kinda turned off from trying it last week because the food wasn't that great. Maybe because it was a weekday lunch menu. Whenever I see Japonais I chuckle to myself over a name like that for a restaurant. Location is key alone the strip, and the Mirage is in the middle of it all. Short walks to Wynn\/Encore, Caesar's, Venetian\/Palazzo, and the Fashion Show Mall. There's also a walkway that will lead you to a crosswalk to Harrah's, the side where McDonald's and Chipotle are. Sweet. 

Mirage has been around for a long time, and after all this time, it still doesn't disappoint. I'd stay here again.

This was my first experience staying in Vegas AND my husband and I brought our TWO KIDS with.  So this is definitely a family focused review.

The hotel was GREAT! VERY clean and everyone was very friendly.  It is in a great location on the strip.  We were able to walk EVERYWHERE from here.  They had valet which was friendly and quick.  We flew into vegas and rented a car so that we could drive to Cali a few days later so I was able to walk or drive anywhere.  The nearest big chain department store was about 15 minutes away or so.  

We went because my husband had a convention across the street.  I am so glad we stayed at the Mirage though.  It had everything we needed (EXCEPT a refrigerator).  I'm so used to normal hotels versus Vegas hotels.  Of course the outside entertainment was loud.  We stayed in a room that faced the volcano.  We could hear it go off time to time and eventually we got used to it.  It wasn't a bother.  The kids got a kick out of it.  

Because there was no refrigerator, I did not want to spend $10 (or whatever it was) on a bottle of water each time so the kids and I often took the elevators downstairs to the Starbucks.  I'd get a coffee and the kids would get milk.  We had some aluminum cups for the kids which was a life saver to keep their drinks cold through nap.  I also noticed there weren't many kid channels on the TV.  I know, I know, not a normal Vegas complaint so it's probably irrelevant to anyone reading.  

We didn't see any nighttime shows while in Vegas but we did do the Sigfried and Roy's Secret Garden exhibit.  They had 3 white tiger cubs at the time- a few months old by the time we visited- so the kids got a kick out of that.  They had lions and other animals too.  Mr. Sigfried himself walked around and greeted the guests.  I thought that was super nice.  Right next to the secret garden is a beautiful aquarium where we were able to catch 2 different dolphin shows.   You do pass a topless pool to get to the aquarium\/secret garden but it wasn't open when we visited in December so that didn't bother me.  

One night my husband and I took turns going to the casino to play a little.  Neither of us are gamblers but the many machines I tinkered around with worked and I had no issues (besides losing).  

There is a parking structure accessible to the hotel.  If you have a stroller or a wheelchair, you have to exit the structure on the main floor and walk outside to get into the lobby\/casino.  If you don't have a wheelchair\/stroller you can cross a bridge and head right into the casino.  Not too big of a deal since the weather is always gorgeous.

We walked the strip for dinner a few nights before giving the buffet a try (I'm not a buffet person).  But let me tell you, the buffet was AMAZING! I wish we did buffets every night.  They're nothing like buffets anywhere else.  And it's much MORE cost-effective when traveling with small kids.  They had every style of food I could think of at different stations- Italian, BBQ, Mexican, etc.  I'm not even a food person and writing this right now, I wish I was there again.

I had walked about the forum and now found myself in the Mirage as darkness replaced night.  It was all a blur but I must admit that I was seduced by the hedonistic architecture of the many restaurants in the Mirage.  Of all the areas of Vegas I visited, the Mirage had the most electric atmosphere.  It was the 4th inning of Game 1 of the World Series and everybody was checking everybody out here.

It's a sexy environment to say the least.  Although I only journeyed through the Mirage on my way to the Rialto Bridge and Doge of the Venetian across the street, I was permanently seduced by this place.

It's like being seduced by hell.  For some reason the album cover of Black Sabbath's "Sabbath Bloody Sabbath" comes to mind or Berlioz's Symphonie Fantastique.

valet

daily guest: $15 (0-4 hrs) & $20 (over 4 hours)
hotel guest: $20 every day 
free: mlife gold & above 

pearl is for self park free 


mirage volcano hours 
friday-saturday (7, 8, & 9 pm)
sunday-thursday (7 & 8 pm)

We a got a good deal on the room and throughly enjoyed it.  We had the basic room with 2 queen beds, nice flat screen TV, great view, no mold, very comfortable bed, very clean.  The kids enjoyed being in the middle of the strip- not to far from any of the entertainment.  The hotel is about as nice as you can get and still have fun with the kids.  The carnegie deli and self serve yogurt were a big hit with the kids.   The sandwiches in the deli were great, but huge- I'm talking about a pound of pastrami on the plate with two pieces of bread.  You have to eat it with a fork.  Nice atmosphere throughout the hotel.  I would be happy to stay here again.

What a horrible experience! Upon arriving at the hotel, our suite wasn't available until the next day. They offered to put us in a regular room until the suite was available. However, the regular room wasn't ready and they were going to contact us when it was. At 6 pm we still haven't received a call for our room. We went to the front desk to ask and the room had been ready. The manager of course wasnt helpful. I am only giving a one star to the hotel. The casino and restaurants are good.

Stayed from 6-27 to 7-2 2014. Have stayed many times and it has always been GREAT! Love this place. We are poker players and we really like the feel of the poker room. The rooms are top notch as always. Only thing I didn't really like was the room service. took 1 1\/2 hours to get 1 item. but oh well. Will be back for sure! I miss it already

We milled around in the Mirage on Mon 2\/22\/11 waiting for Yelp Night at Jet to start. 

I played the penny slots trying to win the BMW that was spinning around on a lazy susan above my head. No luck there. 

I went back into King Ink. It was soooo different at night. I left.

I went onto Jet with the rest of my friends. 

I'd return I guess. It's a-ok with me.

We've stayed at The Mirage twice in the last two years and we absolutely love this hotel.

I've spent many hours researching great places to stay in Las Vegas, and this one strikes me as one of the best "bang for your buck" places on the strip. It has clean rooms, super comfortable beds, nice decor, and IMO it's located on the best part of the Strip (Caesar's, TI, Paris, and Bellagio are all nearby).

The Mirage Volcano is my second favorite free show (behind Bellagio Fountains) and the Beatles LOVE show is one of the coolest things I've ever seen. The buffet is also one of the best in town.

All around, this hotel is awesome for the price. You can also score some great deals if you google it.
Though the smell of cigarettes is everywhere, I enjoyed my stay at the Mirage. The room was very nice and hotel staff were friendly.

My Wife and I stayed in the Mirage, and were very disappointed with it. We were woken up, to water in the walls. Called the front desk and they sent an engineer up, when he came up the noise stopped. He said there are no pipes behind this wall, as the sink sits right behind it to the bathroom. The noise started up again, and I recorded it. We told them our room has been hot all day and night, he changes the filter and was like it's fixed. The filter wasn't even dirty and our room is 76 degrees. We walk outside our room and the hall way is freezing as we sweat in our room.

This is my second time here. The first time was 10 years ago. However this visit was nothing like the first. First off we check in and they give us two keys. Go up to the room and keys don't work. Had to try the keys 10 times before they worked. After getting in room notice the room had rust all over. Keys were a problem the whole trip they stopped working all together. My husband had to go down there to get new ones and was told he couldn't because he was not on the room. After they asked me at check in what his name was so they could add him to the room. So when I want down there to complain all they did was give me two new keys and knock of one night of resort fee a whole $35. Keys continued to be a problem husband went down there only to be told you just have to make it work. Whatever that means. The next day complained again about keys to someone different and got two more keys still that didn't open on first try. The pool is nice but there is no shade. If you want shade that will cost you another $65 per person for an area with shade. When went to print boarding passes computer was down and when went to staff they told me they couldn't help me. This was so ridiculous you charge me a resort fee for things that don't even work properly. There are many more hotels on the strip that are just as nice if not better for same price. I will be using one of those next time. Staff was rude and didn't care about the problems we had.

Decided to stay at The Mirage for the first time because I had tickets to Aces of Comedy show starting Kathy Griffin at the Terry Fator Theatre in the hotel.  Arrived on Sat at 3:30 pm & already a long line for check in & no upgraded rooms were ready.  This is one of those hotels where lots of people share or have a party in their room.  The king room was adequate & superficially clean.  I had to call housekeeping to get robes.  The bathroom fan was very loud & didn't remove any steam so the entire room gets hot after a shower.  No shower cap so bring your own.  The resort fee is only to cover the internet.

Had dinner reservations for 4 at Fin in the hotel before the show.  The food was very good but our waiter was useless, pour your own water, ask to have plates & glasses removed when finished.   He didn't understand the differences between wine even though it was on their menu & needed help from other staff to finally get a bottle of wine from the adjacent steak house because everything we wanted on the Fin menu was sold out. 

There is nothing but the night club open after midnight in this hotel on a Saturday.  I wanted a cocktail & snack after the show.  The lobby bar was the only place open and could only provide a cocktail but no food. 

No idea if there is room service for breakfast because the menu pages were missing from the room binder.  There is no newspaper at the door as part of the resort fee so have to ask for one.  Later in the day, I  had to call Housekeeping and ask to replace the wash clothes & hand towels that were taken during the clean.  

The only positive about The Mirage was a very comfortable bed & easy, fast on-line checkout.  

I would NEVER stay at this hotel again or recommend it to anyone.

I will always have a soft spot in my heart for the Mirage. My parents have been staying here for eons so the smell of the place reminds me of days gone by. That being said, they really have changed a lot of the venues inside the hotel and the remodeling suits them. Not only have there been additions of new restaurants like stack and japonoise, but they have also revamped the lounges and overall look of the casino. (it was looking a bit dated and still is by the snack bar area....) 
Now they have added things they really needed like an extra coffee bar, the first one by the pool always had a big line. It is much more pleasurable to come here now that they have made it more hip and up to date.

I am here for a conference and ended up having to switch hotels because the front desk staff couldn't get me a room to check in to, though I had one reserved as a conference sponsor. I ended up having to book the Cosmo with no refund for my non-existent room at the Mirage (pun?!?) 

The front desk manager must have either had a very bad morning or he doesn't belong in hospitality. I'm sure making some changes there would increase the hotel's rating here.

For all the Strip hotels in this price range, this is probably my favorite hotel to book on the strip.  It's central, updated, and accommodating. The rooms are spacious and I've always gotten higher floors.  Pool is great.  This is one of the best value Strip hotels.  Comes with free WiFi.

First time staying here in over 15+ years!

They've remodeled quite a bit and are in the process of remodeling the rooms.

The rooms have an updated look... but with all the money they still have smallish TV's (40"?)  Service from everyone was great... front desk, maid, concierge, etc.

Only gripes are the little details in the room were overlooked... loose faucet handles, disgusting bath mat, moldy looking grout between bath tiles... these really kept me from giving it 4 or 5 stars.  I appreciate the remodel and the overall look, but the little things bring it down!

The restaurants in the hotel were pretty good. Buffet was not the best but a great price, BLT burger was great, CPK was pricy but delicious, overall can't complain.

There were plenty of tables to gamble at throughout the day... with mostly $10 blackjack and as low as $5 for some of the gimmicky games like 3 card poker or let it ride.  Cocktail waitresses were super friendly but a bit slow on the drink orders.

Stayed here for a conference, wouldn't be my first choice on the strip but it's not a bad one either.  Give it a shot!

First time in Vegas ( for my 40th) so first time at the mirage . Nice hotel , clean rooms . Really nice pool that's huge ! Only complaint is some guy walked in our room . He had a room key . Our room was locked we were inside had just gotten back from the pool . I heard the door start to open and some guy starts walking in he said is this so and so room ? I said no ! Who are you ? He said sorry and left . We called to the desk and explained what happened they said they would give us a new set of keys . The fact is what if we weren't in our room  ? And the guy walked in and stole shit ? We at least could have been given a discount on the room or a dining credit .

Complaint

I was playing pai gow poker at The Mirage Las Vegas.

I banked, everybody was betting the same amount. I lost to the dealer, and she immediately put my chips into her rack. (she should have left it out on the table for the end total) Then after she placed my cards in front of her, I won one from a player, three other players are pushes. She hands me the one Bet from the player and asked for commission. I gave her the commission but then afterwards I realized that I basically did not win anything for that round. Minus one and Plus one equals zero. but the dealer charged me commission.

I told the dealer there is no commission because I did not win anything. She disagreed. She was stubborn and ignorant, slim Asian woman in her mid-20s.

So I called the floor supervisor and she was incompetent too. She was unable to comprehend what I was trying to express. She had no idea what I was talking about, I do not know how she holds the position of floor supervisor. I drew a diagram of what happened and showed it to her she still did not know anything. All she said was that if you win you have to pay commission. I said I know, but I did not win anything that round because the dealer put my loss chips into her tray, she just kept repeating herself that if you win you have to pay commission.

This floor person who does not have the mental capacity to understand the situation. 
So This floor person goes on the break, and I told another supervisor what happened. That supervisor immediately went and asked the dealer what she did. The dealer told her, and then the floor person made her give me back my commission.

This was our first time staying in Vegas and we stayed at the Mirage during our 3-night visit. The front desk staff at check-in were very welcoming and friendly as well as the housekeeping staff. The hotel and rooms were very nice and clean and the beds were actually really comfortable. The only complaint I have is that you can hear EVERYTHING in the hallway, it can get pretty loud. Other than that, everything was awesome and we would stay here again in the future.

This is probably one of the worst of the main resorts on the strip next to Harrah's I was surprised to find out the casino didn't smell like cigar ash, that's right because the cigar ash was only diluted by the smell of the urinal smelling water pumping throughout the place, aside from that very typical palm tree themed resort it's supposed to be Polynesian or something I couldn't tell, apparently  management at this place is under the impression that adding a couple palm trees and shaggy plants  make it that if it wasn't made first I would say this hotels just a cheap rip off of the Mandalay Bay. Would. Not. Return. Ever.

10 Reasons NOT to stay at The Mirage Hotel:

The Mirage needs some serious management training and leadership skills in customer service. I was staying there for the Digital Auto Dealer Conference in early Oct 2011. Here are the "low lights" of my stay:
1. Called ahead to ask for early check in. I was told no problem. When I got there, they actually laughed at me and said "no chance."
2. I had to stow my bags with the bellman so I went to the "Bell Desk" to do that and they acted like I was bothering them and then pointed that I should go outside to do that.
3. Once in my room, I called the bell desk several times to retrieve my bags, getting an automated attendant and COMMERCIALS! while I was waiting for someone to pick up. It took 4 tries to get someone on the phone and once I did, Cynthia laughed at me when I told her the substandard experience I had just received. I actually asked her, "Are you laughing at me?" but she didn't reply.
4. Whenever you call any dept in the hotel, they don't know your name. They ask you every time to state your name, making me feel unimportant.
5. Most every hotel these days has an in-room coffeemaker. Mine didn't so I called room service. I like to have hot water in the mornings so I asked about it and they said I would have to order hot water from room service! Really???
6. I did like they said, I ordered hot water from room service and guess what?  It tasted and smelled like coffee!
7. There was no shower cap (I know this is a small one but to those of us with long hair, it's a big deal).
8. The rooms are dirty, they need a makeover.  Appalling.
9. After I checked out I had time before my flight so I asked where in the hotel could I work for a few hours without any cigarette smoke (since I am allergic).  I was told the only place in the hotel where there is no smoking was Starbucks.  Thank you Starbucks for being the only bright spot in my stay at the Mirage.
10. I had to visit the ladies' room during my Starbucks stay and had to walk far into the casino to get there.  When I did, there was no toilet paper in ANY of the stalls.
With that, I called a taxi and left for the airport early.  DO NOT stay at the Mirage Hotel.  Run away and never come back!

I just returned from a 5-night stay at The Mirage.  I'm only writing a review because this is my second time staying in Las Vegas (the first was last year at The Flamingo) and I now feel I have enough information to truly review and compare a Las Vegas hotel.

First, I've wanted to stay at The Mirage since last year when I first walked in to view it.  It seemed like a really nice place, gave you that "tropical vacation" feel and it's not too huge (like Caesars Palace) so it won't take you an hour to walk to the lobby.  When we first arrived we were allowed an early check-in at no extra cost since some rooms were available.  The dude that checked us in had ZERO personality.  I asked for a room close to the elevator and he completely ignored me.  But all in all check-in went well and painless, there was no line when we arrived.  We were given a room on the 17th floor.  The moment I walked in to that room and looked around it took less then 30 seconds and we were calling the front desk for a different room.  This room was awful!!!!  The bathroom was smaller than my bedroom closet and the view was horrendous....oh gawd, the freeway and roof, yum, exactly what I don't want to wake up to.  I know in Vegas you spend very little time in your room, but this view was godawful and definitely not what I wanted to see when I woke up.  So after a bit of complaining to the front desk we were given an upgrade (at $20 a night extra) to a room on the 24th floor overlooking the pool.  This was THE BEST $100 I spent!  The room was fabulous!!  Huge bathroom, double sink, deep jetted tub (which I used 3 nights), separate shower, 2 closets, and the view was amazing!!  We could see the strip, The Rio and Palms, the pool area including the dolphins, and the sunset, it was totally fabulous!  I highly recommend the 24th floor.  And another awesome thing was that the elevator was only used for the 24th and 25th floor, how sweet is that?  We rarely had to share it.  The only drawback, and I've read this on many reviews including those of other hotels, was that the lighting is very dim in the room.  I'm guessing they don't use anything higher than a 20-watt bulb, so be prepared for that.  However the bathroom lighting was great.  The bed was fabulous, very comfy, and the AC was OK if you put it to 50 degrees.  The windows in the room open and that was really cool, I was able to get some awesome pictures of our view.  The housekeeping is so-so, I guess it depends on who cleans it.  One day we returned and our shower and tub were obviously not touched, the next day it was spotless and the floor was vacuumed.  DO NOT touch anything in the refrigerator in your room as it is weighed and you will be charged (unless you want it).  We ended up with a Sugar Factory lollipop because we lifted it up, you own it when you remove it. 

The line for the taxi was horrendous!  And I mean it was about an hour long wait, totally ridiculous!  Take the tram to TI and use their taxi line, it's a shorter wait.  We went through the Secret Garden and that was nice, but I couldn't help but feel sad for the dolphins because some of them didn't really move around and they seemed bored which disturbed me a little bit, nobody was interacting with them.  The big cats were cool though, they just slept as cats always do.  The pool was unbelievably crowded!  We ended up paying for the private area (not the Bare Lounge) and later on after a little bit of complaining they credited us for that.  Rhumbar is fabulous, a must to visit and get a drink.  And the hotel isn't that large so it's easy to get from place to place in a short amount of time.  The buffet is OK, too many meat choices, but I loved the salad bar since they toss them for you.

Overall The Mirage is OK, I would stay here again (on the 24th or 25th floor overlooking the pool).   I gave this hotel 4-stars because the check-in was a breeze, the room change was painless, the credit they gave us for the pool area was super cool, the casino itself is nice and the dealers we met were very friendly and interactive, most of the hotel employess are super nice (except for the a-hole waiter at Carnegie Deli who obviously hated his job, but I don't think he was a "Mirage" empoyee so I'm letting this one slide) and the location is excellent!  But I cannot give this review 5 stars because the hotel is old and slightly dingy and needs some upgrading, our room key gave us trouble in the elevator (you need to use your room key to get to your floor in the 24-25 elevators) and it took them 2 days to fix the key problem, and that taxi line was simply unacceptable.

The rooms are standard Vegas rooms for being on the strip. Even though you can smoke in the casino it doesn't reek of smoke which is good. There aren't many retail shops which is ok depending on what a person preference is. The thing that makes me give this casino 3 stars instead of 4 is that there are no legit food places to eat at other than the high end restaurants that start around $20 a plate. It's unfortunate to have to leave the hotel for something quick and convenient which doesn't end up being quick and convenient at all.

I've stayed in many big Hotels in Las Vegas. The Mirage was right up there. Great rooms, awesome pool, decent gambling, nice drinks, good atmosphere. We will definitely be back. Anyone that says mirage isnt competitive with the others is misinformed.

New this year, online check in and check out with easy keys. Best stay ever in Vegas!!!  

Great experience, awesome staff, we'll be back

We forgot my daughter's iPad in our room. I called and was transferred to lost and found. Lost and found was able to send housekeeping with security personnel to try and locate my lost item. I was contacted within 20 minutes to tell me that they found it. My information was taken and an email was sent with the link to complete the shipping and handling of $25. I received the package in three business days nicely bubble wrapped and boxed. Thank you Mirage staff for the seamless effort in returning our iPad.
Didnt stay here just gambed. The buffet was pretty good. But all the buffets are the same. Machines are pretty tight during the day around five they loosen up. Good luck!

Probably not itching to book at the Mirage again. 

The main issue I had was the room smelled when I checked-in. The source of the smell was from the restroom- it smelled like dirty gym socks that had been placed in a juicer. I called the front desk to get this issue addressed- the phone operator seemed a bit unapologetic about this nuisance. After saying she would have someone look into the issue, an hour had passed and no one had come to the room. I called the front desk again and a different rep had an entirely different tone than the first employee- she apologized for the inconvenience and was able to waive our resort fees. Although the defogging (basically making the room smell good again) meant we had to stay out of the room for two hours, it was worth it (then again, to distract time, we ended up gambling = losing).

The response time of the TV was painfully slow. Channel surfing was at a crawl. The only other inconvenience of the weekend was the tram connecting Mirage to Treasure Island was down for a brief period and it was when we were needing it on our walk home from a long night out.

A plus of the hotel is that I got a room overlooking the pool and the dolphin exhibit. those dolphins are so smart!

Mirage 6th floor
Stayed 3 nights 4 days

Not that impressed.
Room is small, old & musty.
2nd, 3rd & 4th day they had construction going on around our room. Constant drilling, hammering & circular saw. Really? Who books a room and has construction going on all around the room? We called front desk & they wanted to comp me 2 days. Nope! Won't take it. My room is payed in full by my company. Offered us $50 credit for anything we wanted on hotel property. No dice! Tried to use that towards breakfast at The Pantry next morning. Waitress said they had no recored of that credit. SMH. Wife took breakfast bill to front desk and squared it all out. We should be able to charge up to $50 in credit to our room. 

Update: tried to charge drinks to our room from the Ruhmbar. Nope!!!!! You'll have to talk to the front desk.

House keeping timing is spotty at best. Just leave for the whole day, who knows when they'll get to turning your bed.

The Pantry has a great breakfast. BLT burger places was good for a burger & fries.

Bed was comfy.
Bathrooms are really small. The hair dryer trips the breaker and turns the light & fan off. Push red button to see the light!

The AC unit seems to have a humidifier with it. Kept room nice and cold. But notice when we slept with it on, the room was damp.

Our LCD TV kept going dark. Then light. & on the last night, cable goes out.

No fridge for your own items. 

No coffee maker (not a big deal for us).

The rooms are out dated & in need of updating.

Over all I wouldn't recommend this place to friend, family or foe.

The wife and I just got back from our 10 year anniversary trip, Thursday through Sunday, we stay here every time that we come to Vegas and still really enjoy the Mirage. We booked our Tower Suite back in April for our trip and when we checked in I asked for either a pool, strip or volcano view but they told me that they were all sold out, even though we checked in at 1:00PM on Thursday and I'm pretty sure there were still plenty of people that still had to check in that day, so we got stuck with what they call ," A beautiful mountain view," which is actually a freeway view. So we get to our room and there is a big crack in one of the windows, about four feet long. It made my wife very uncomfortable being in that room so I went down to the front desk to tell them that my wife doesn't feel comfortable staying in that room but they said the best they can do is change our room the next day. So Friday comes along and still no other view room available just the freeway, but we change rooms and the bubbles in the tub in our new room don't work. It took four calls and 3 1\/2 hours for someone to finally come up and fix it. All in all we still enjoy the Mirage and will continue to stay here. The pool is immaculate, very beautiful and relaxing, we enjoy the Paradise Cafe for lunch. Down side about the pool though is the new large drink cups, they use to have the nice plastic souvenir cups but they switched to these smaller cheap flimsy cups, and for $27 a drink you would think they could afford to have the nice ones still.  My opinion about them saying they had no view rooms that I wanted available is that we booked the One Bedroom Tower Suite at such an amazing price is that they figured we should have the crappy view and give the better view to the other people who paid more, because they say that rooms are not assigned until you check in, so if we checked in at 1:00 PM I'm pretty sure not all strip, volcano and pool view would have been taken. One more thing,  it is very stupid to have your view ruined by the Beatles banner that covers all the top floors which are the suites, you get nice big floor to ceiling windows and you can't see very well out the window because of it, so disappointing. The one star is solely for them not being able to accommodate our room change when I know they had other rooms available, even after they became aware of the big cracked window and we still had to wait until the next day. And the package we booked says $50 dining credit + VIEW ROOM UPGRADE. They also didn't apply the $50 credit until I looked at the bill and saw that it was not on there. It was just very disappointing, it was our Ten year wedding anniversary, we stay at the Mirage every time that we go to Vegas and they couldn't accommodate us, it really put a damper and a slow start to our celebration.

I've stayed at The Mirage every year for the past few years for a work conference and overall, it's always been a great experience! It's centrally located on The Strip, has a lot of great restaurants and bars, has an epic pool that doesn't get too crowded but has a nice waterfall you can swim under, and is reasonably priced. It's an MGM Hotel too so if you're an MLife member, you can get discounted show tickets to Terry Fator, Boyz II Men, Beatles LOVE, etc. and rooms here!

Even though The Mirage has been around for a while, they've definitely kept it updated with modern technology and all the rooms are spacious and well-decorated. Also, this place is HUGE: 26 floors with over 100 rooms per floor, a casino floor with an insane amount of slot machines and tables, and an expansive property that includes dolphin and tiger habitats. If you're lucky enough, you might even catch the volcano erupt from your room!

The hotel is not new so if you are looking for fancy room , this is not for you. We are here for aws conf and we stay until end of week. The room view is to pool and strip which is so good at night.
Rooms furniture is old and i think walls are thin. So when other  close the door of their room you can clearly hear it. If you are sensitive to noise and sound do not stay here.
Our room costs 200 dollars in average per night which I believe is expensive for it but maybe it was for conf.
The bathing sets are not goid quality so bring your own sets.
Good thing is location whuch is in center and plenty of food options around

I don't know why this casino only has 3.5 stars! We had a staycation at The Mirage to celebrate my husband's 30th birthday, and we enjoyed every moment. First, the registration line, amidst being 4 lengths long, moved very fast and the employees running registration were friendly, personable and an all around joy.

Since we were local, they waived the resort fee (WHAT?!?) and then sent my husband a small dessert plate with a three different pastries since it was his birthday! The pool? Clean, open until 8 (much later than other pools on the Strip), great vibe, delicious drinks and a 21+ pool which we love.

The Mirage doesn't smell like smoke all the time, has a lot of different table games and slot machines, and I loved the layout of the entire casino. The food options in The Mirage are not lacking in the yummy factor. Carnegie Deli makes every taste bud in my mouth water with their corned beef, and their pastrami omelette is happiness. I loved that omelette because it wasn't greasy at all and had the perfect amount of pastrami in it to make me feel like I was eating breakfast at their NY location. My parents split their sandwich, and I would suggest you do too because it is larger than the size of your head! STK Burger? I've never had anything at this restaurant that was mediocre. They are GF friendly, and during the winter their chili makes me feel like I'm at home wrapped up in my blanket watching movies with my hubby on the couch. Every burger my husband has eaten makes that man smile like he is the king of the world. You will not be disappointed!

Between the location of The Mirage on the Strip, the cleanliness, the customer service, the food and the overall environment, you can't go wrong at The Mirage.

From Friday, August 4th to Monday, August 7th my friend and I stayed at The Mirage in order to celebrate my "Dirty 30". This was my first time "doing Vegas" and I had a blast! My friend and I stayed in a double room together. My friend booked the room in her name and thank God for the Mobile Check In otherwise we would have probably waited 30 + minutes to check in as the line was horrendous!  

Our room was really nice and clean. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable - even the housekeeping staff spoke to us as we were walking down the hall to our room. I would definitely stay at The Mirage again in the near future.

My husband and I recently this week stayed at the Mirage for our 3 year wedding anniversary. From the moment we checked in until we left we were amazed by the great customer service all of employees showed from check in to house cleaning. When we first checked in the gentleman was awesome and gave us an upgrade view and $50.00 food credit to out awesome reservation on the 25th tower suite. I will recommend this hotel to anyone. The best in Las Vegas!!!

Very nice and fancy hotel but horrible service. 
I used the valet parking for less then a min, I  changed my  mind and wanted to go somewhere else, they refused to give my car keys back till I'll pay them $13.00 THEY EVEN DIDN'T PARK MY CAR!

I have stayed at almost every hotel on the strip at some point in time and the Mirage (in terms of the hotel rooms) is one of my favorites.  The staff both at the front desk and housekeeping are always friendly and welcoming.  The hotel itself is very pretty, and they keep the common areas very clean.  The rooms are nice, clean and the sleep quality in terms of the bed are great.  The rooms have mini-bars, and I found that the beer in them was cheaper than buying them at the bar downstairs.  The thing that I really loved was that I could crank down the AC (I get super hot) and it would actually make the room nice and cold.  Some hotels seem to have that regulated even though you think you are cranking it way down.

There were only two negatives for me, both of which I can get past.  1.  you can hear everything out in the hallways, as there is a gap at the bottom of the door and I mean EVERYTHING.  2.  The slots are tight.  I had to leave the hotel Casino to win (after dumping a nice chunk of change in their machines over four days.

We have stayed here three times.  The sportsbook is one of the better ones in Vegas.  The buffet is decent.  BLT is has a good beer selection and very tasty burgers.  Stack and Heritage are top end restaurants.  There are minimal bar seats where you can play some video poker and get a drink, being a small negative.  The casino floor is expansive, Overall the rooms are comfortable and well furnished.  They are a bit loud if your neighbors are in full party mode.  

The best experience is that we are Mlife members and showed up on December 30th, a day early for the New Year Eve\/Day party and were offered a ridiculous upgrade for a regularly priced room.  

Thank you Stevie.  She made a quick call and then said, we have one penthouse still open and we are going to upgrade you to it.  The suite was other-worldly and such a treat.  We thank Stevie and the Mirage for the hospitality.  We will be back.

Pros:  excellent room service food, great bed, good, strong shower, quick helpful valet, prompt service.

Cons: room had insufficient light, ac barely worked set at 60, tv broke twice, mini bar broke and beeped, plugs loose and unusable, maids turned up ac so room hot when returned, only 3 towels provided, maids forgot to restock shampoo, no shelf space in bathroom, long wait for check in and not one bench, gift shop inaccessible for dsabled, restaurants closed early with no notice, buffet said brunch but I was treated like crazy for wanting a waffle, "it's lunch".

Try somewhere else.

The renovated rooms are gorgeous, and smell like some kind of aromatherapy infusion rather than the usual grandpa cigar stank. The mirage is indeed having an identity crisis, as the dated Siegfried and Roy  tropical theme clashes with the new Beatles-LOVE Cirque du Mod theme, although it is not nearly as bad as the Treasure Island Pirates vs. Strippers identity crisis.
We went in July for the $77\/night special (make sure you ask for a renovated room!) and were able to get right up close to see the baby white tigers in the secret garden (so cuuuute!) We decided against Jet Nightclub due to the high volume of tweekers in line, but the Revolution Lounge was pretty nice.No cover, club\/DJ on weekdays, and they even had a free punk show there the second night. It's pretty cool to see a big shot casino lounge hosting acts like that. Another plus: Casino elevators are close to the action. The volcano was closed for renovation when we were there though...hopefully it won't be covered with a mural of the cover of Sgt Pepper or anything like that . Then I will have to stop staying here-haha!

We loved our vacation! The Mirage was still very nice after all these years and now its a great deal - we got an email offer of two free buffets for every day of our stay! The buffet was fun with unlimited beer and wine, the beds super comfortable and a gorgeous marble bathroom, the pool huge with bays and waterfalls, the cool couches in the sportsbook, and the front desk which still features a giant aquarium which even has its own TV channel!  We love the classic evening volcano show and enjoyed being close to the Casino Royale's $1 Michelobs and The 5 O'Clock Somewhere bar's crazy 5 - 6pm happy hour at the Flamingo.

Had a great stay here, I was nervous because I hadn't been here before but it was great. Check in was quick and easy. I got a complimentary upgrade and a strip view for being an Mlife member. Room was clean, bed was comfortable, huge bathroom. It was also nice to have the express elevator to the 25th floor. I will definitely be coming back to stay here. I also liked the buffet.... And checkout was easy too. I just texted and filled out the information on the link, simple.

I am a Vegas Vet and have stayed just about everywhere, and I have to say I dig the Mirage.  It's an oldie but goodie.  All rooms have been recently renovated with earthy colors and flat screens.  No floor to ceiling windows here, but they do crack open.  (just an odd observation)  Top things to do if you stay here: go see LOVE & go to the pool.  The pool grounds are amazing and the pool itself is gigantic.  My only gripe is that hotel guests cannot rent cabanas.  They are reserved for high rollers. Oh and get there early (like when the doors open) if you want a good spot with 2 chairs together.  Otherwise you have to scope out people who are ready to leave and run before someone else gets there before you.  Overall the Mirage is super comfy, in a great location, and reasonably priced.
I like this place. The rooms are nice. The bed is super comfy. Its my second time here and Im not disappointed. In my opinion: Good value for money!

This is a review for the TOWER SUITES at the Mirage.  I was fortunate enough to get a couple of nights at the Mirage for a very low Players price after the Holidays.  Upon Check-In I spoke to one of the Managers who offered an upgrade at a nominal fee for both the Tower Suites or The Penthouse Suites.  The manager was very honest and said the layout is EXACTLY the same just a different color scheme and that I should stick to the Tower Suite.  After I tipped her, we were off to check out the room.

There are 3 elevators with key access to the 26-30th floors labled A-D.  I wasn't expecting much as the Mirage is a bit older than the more modern hotels but was pleasantly surprised.  Very spacious 1 bedroom 1300 sq ft. with a 60" Plasma, dinning area, wet bar, huge bathroom with separate shower and Jacuzzi Tub.  

The decor was modern and ample to my liking with a striking view of the strip floor to ceiling tinted windows.  If you look at the Mirage, the dark gold large window at the top of the hotel are all the suites. 

Very comfortable arrangements and much quieter as you'd expect.  As with all the suites there is a door bell and a button to push for privacy not a door hanger.  There are 3 TVs, one rising out of the foot of the bed, one in the bathroom 42", and the 60" in the living area.  Very large sofa with built in chase loungers and enough room for at least 6 people to hang out comfortably.

There is no comparison to the regular rooms as the suites are 1st class and worth an upgrade if offered.  I was comped but after speaking to the manager they will "release" a suite to VIP members for $50 and $80-120 for the Penthouse per night on top of what you're paying for the regular room.

Going to a suite from a regular room is like going from flying economy to first class.  The attention to detail was outstanding, color scheme was modern and nice, the service in the Towers was outstanding.

I don't think I can find a single bad thing to say!  We got a great deal, something like $80 a night in July.  Did the $20 trick and was enjoying a strip-view room at 1PM on Saturday.

Restaurants were great (Japonais: pricey but tasty.  New burger joint:  AWESOME!).  The pool was perfect, although in July it was just too damn hot for us to stay outside.

Spent enough time in the casino to get the $10 dealers to know me by name.  Even won enough money to pay for tattoo at Vince Neil Ink (see separate review). 

Location is perfect.  Right across from Venetian, TI, even a Mickey D's and Chipotle is right there.  Take a walk down to O'Sheas for some cheap craps and Beirut ("beer pong").

We even did the corny Tiger and Dolphin tour.  Only regret is not checking out Bare on Monday, but like I said it was too damn hot.

The Mirage is friggin' awesome.  Makes you feel almost like a rockstar without emptying your bank account.  We're headed back this spring for sho.

This is quickly becoming my favorite hotel in Vegas.  I am not the 'go out to a club type of hoe'.  I am more like the, 'I just want to sit here, in the lounge next to the club, and quietly bob my head to the music with a resting bitch face so the f*ck boys dont bother with me'.

Then this hotel also has, The Beatles Love, BLT Burger, Sugar Factory, and if I get really buzzed, Rhumbar (Hookah) bar outside!!

Maybe I am just easily pleased?  I think its more about your friends and company you keep that makes it a fun time.

Wish I could give them 0 stars. Got a suite with my buddy and while up to the room, got harassed by a black woman who did not identify herself. She asked what room I was in. When I wouldn't tell her she got mouthy with me, then followed me around and called seven security officers upstairs on me. I'm a local and the staff here is extremely unprofessional. I will not return here and will deter all of my friends and family from here.

This is a solid nice-but-not-top-end hotel room in Vegas This place is huge! The rooms are clean and not too theme-y, if you don't like that. The service here is pretty quick. Two things to beware of: hallways are long and can be confusing because they all look the same. Also, the doors are very heavy but don't always close properly. Make sure your door is all the way shut before you leave or sleep!

Building looks beautiful. Parking wasn't that bad in the parking garage. There is a bridge to cross from the parking garage to the casino. The registration was down the escalator to the left. Line was typical with a lot of guest checking in. 

The lady who checked us in was very nice. She answered all our questions and directed us to the right direction. The architecture was amazing. Really enjoyed walking through the forest.

Entering the room was pretty luxury. Looks like nice clean sheets and had an amazing view.

No complaints here. Hotel was great and the hospitality was an A+!

Thanks

The one star is for POOR customer service. I booked a room for four nights well in advance of a convention I had to attend. Upon arrival on Monday I stated that I wished to check out Thursday instead of Friday, one less night. To my surprise, I was told that was not an option due to contractual obligations, etc. The front desk stated they'd have someone from sales call me, which they never did, and I had to pay for the additional night. 
While I understand obligations, I was not part of the contractual agreement with the convention, and this would've been a non-issue at most any other hotel I do business with. Further, with three nights notice I don't believe The Mirage would've had any issue booking this room for someone else at a higher rate! Gotta call BS on this one and their explanation.
The rooms are fair compared to other LV strip locations. In the future, I'll stick with places like The Wynn, The Cosmopolitan, The Aria. 
Unless I absolutely have to due to work, etc., I will not stay at The Mirage again.

I had an exceptional stay with very friendly staff and I felt very safe in my hotel. I just wish i could always get great deals so that I could stay here more often. My only complaint was how far the parking structure is from the elevators to the rooms. You have to walk through the entire casino with your luggage to the other side of the hotel to reach the elevators. It was really annoying and as a guest it's also annoying to run into other guests and their luggage when walking through the casino. Other than that I'd like to recognize Jae I believe was her name the young lady who was helping a newer employee check us in. She was really friendly and made the process smooth and as quick as possible! Definitely recommending and I can't wait for my next stay!

Stayed here for The Aesthetic Show conference taking place in May 2010 and the rooms were spotless (and very reasonably priced! I believe I paid around $69 a night!). Very modern deco and the Mirage website photos actually match exactly what the rooms look like, which is always nice. Tip: If you book a room directly off their website, they offer 20% off tickets to see LOVE (at least, they used to in 2010, not sure if that is still the case). I had absolutely no problems with this hotel and enjoyed every second. Great restaurants, too - try Japonais! Revolution is very pricey (I think water was like $7 but was a great time - no cover for ladies and lots of eye candy:)
Wonderful pool, clean facility, lovely environment. excellent experience.

Your eyes don't deceive you...The Mirage is truly an oasis in scorching Las Vegas.

The location of The Mirage is quite convenient on the strip, putting it in the center of all the hub-bub of the city that never sleeps. The hotel itself is teeming with activity with restaurants and shops galore so you'll never be bored no matter what time it is.

My room was beautifully designed with a large closet with mirrored doors, a bathroom with a big, lighted mirror and a magnifying mirror that swings from the wall, two Queen sized beds with plump pillows and a heavy comforter, and spacious wooden drawers. 

The bathroom is a bit on the tiny side, but there were plenty of towels of various sizes. The shower head produced a strong stream of water and the sink was incredibly spacious. Amenities were a-plenty and I liked how there was a ventilation system in the bathroom as well. The bed was comfortable enough that I could sleep through the whole night, although I wish there were more outlets closer to the bed to make for easy charging. There are, however, more outlets near the mini desk so it's not too big of a problem.

The biggest issue I had was the unreliable wifi. Sometimes, it wouldn't connect at all and when it did, the signal would pop in and out. But since I was in Las Vegas, it wasn't like I was going to stay inside my room and use the wifi a lot anyway.

Even though my stay was quite short in The Mirage, I was very pleased with the room. It had everything I needed and the employees of the hotel were more than ready to help the minute I called. Definitely a hotel I would book again!
As a local I do not recommend this place. Typical tourist trap!

Was just there Feb 11th through the 14th. Had the standard room on the 22nd floor. Clean and comfortable. Had a view of the strip and the pool. I got the room online for $70.00 per night, Wed. through Friday, and only chose the standard room. So I'm not sure if they gave me a pool view for no additional charge or not. But my two year old loved being able to look out and see the pool. Had a great time here. No outside noise in the room. Wife was happy with dinner and breakfast ordered through room service. I was way stoked with the steak dinner at Kokomos. This was the second time we stayed here. Looks like there will be a third.

Very good stay. A friend and I each had a one bedroom tower suite for 3 nights in October. The only concern I had before arriving was that the Mirage, being 20 years old, might be a little dated; however, the entire property seemed to be very well maintained and updated. With the 10% AAA discount the rooms were $160.00 per night, which seemed to us a very good deal relative to the other hotel-casinos for similar rooms. At check in we requested and got strip view rooms, and tipped the front desk agent.  The weather in Las Vegas was the best I'd experienced there- about 75 in the day time and mid 60's at night. We only ate at one food outlet, the Cravings buffet, and the food was excellent. Would highly recommend the Mirage. Tip: If you book directly with the Mirage, either by phone or on their web page, keep checking every so often and if you find the price has decreased you can rebook at the lower rate. We did this three times.

Thank you Mirage for being overbooked this week, as a result I got to enjoy a lovely penthouse suite. Words cannot express how grateful I am as this room was SO great! Very updated, spotless clean, most comfortable bed I have ever slept in (if I could ship one of these to my apartment, I would), MASSIVE, amazing, etc. Got a great deal on Priceline as it was a weekday stay. In addition to my room luck, this hotel has sooo many great bars, restaurants, shops, and gambling to choose from. It's very modern and has a very fun environment. The pool, surrounded by palm trees, is a gorgeous sight as well. One of the most fun casinos I've stayed in on the strip and best bang for your buck (even without the penthouse!). I was here on business but I hope to come back and stay here for pleasure!

I hadn't been here in a few years and I missed it. I checked out of the palms hotel and went right to the mirage and it was a breath of fresh air. The staff was great, our room was ready early.  The room was beautiful, great view of the volcano. The pool staff was great. The only thing that I missed is that the pool area was smaller than I remembered and I missed seeing the lions on display. The guys at the dolphin bar Trevor and Daniel were super nice, accommodating and talked to us as we ate and drank in the pool area. I know that sounds normal, but trust me in vegas employees are busy. I would go visit them again. I appreciated them making us feel welcomed. :)

Wish we could give them more stars, I really do. We have stayed here 3 times in a year, for all of our stays. I am writing this review in our room as we speak. It started out with us in a one bedroom suite, which we usually love. However, it has proved us wrong. We first got into our room, our two tvs and the soundbar did not work. We actually noticed our soundbar was playing in the adjacent room. Upon waiting almost an hour to fix this (when we were told 5-10 minutes) I called back for the third time (only because we needed to rest after our long flight here) they finally came. Now my husband and I are sitting in the whirlpool tub that will not hold water. Even if we push the drain down, it still drains. Such a shame when we book a suite.  Our one year anniversary here is still causing us problems (we stayed here for our wedding). 


I want to write yet again, that while we contacted this management, as indicated below, we never got a reply on our last email and it has been a couple weeks. They clearly do not care about their loyalty customers.

Had occasion to stay here recently due to a having an evening planned there. First of all, this place is showing its age a bit. The Front Desk staff were OK, a little rushed and not too friendly. Getting to your room here is a hassle. I'm a bit resentful of being forced to drag our bag through the entire casino to get to the elevators. I'm also resentful of paying $252.00 for an old room and getting shanked for a $25.00 "resort fee". This is just a straight rip off, a "because we can F*ck You" fee.

I hope they fired the idiotic valet driver that almost ran me over just to beat a red light, and ended up smashing into another hotel guest's Hyundai. 

Disregarding the fact that they hired a psycho maniac driver, I can't complain too much about The Mirage. Rooms are offered at a decent price, but have been noticeably steeper than what they were in the past. The exotic gardens located at the main entrance make a great photo op. Every dining venue in this building is a tasteful experience and not one to be missed. I especially recommend Japonais, Kokomo, & Samba. And last, but not least, there's a considerable amount of tables scattered amongst the casino grounds. I've seen the basic black jack limits start from $5-15, so it's not a bad place to start off if you're a small gambler. It's a shame they don't pay out for quad aces in the poker room. I've hit some of my biggest winning  pots here, yet no extra cash for the rare obtainable hands. 

Based on a great location on the strip and being close to all the nearby hot spots, I'd recommend staying here. Just remember to look carefully before crossing the street...

I played MyVegas (facebook app game) enough to snag this awesome Tower Suite Room in the Mirage Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas for 1 night. I can't remember how many loyalty points it took, but it is no longer available for purchase and has been that way for 6 months or more. I doubt they have any plans on bringing it back since it was so easy to achieve, which makes them lose out on a crap ton of money since everyone was going for that free room reward.

Now, I also had a 2 night room reward for the Deluxe King at Mirage through MyVegas. Our whole plan was to try and get the tower suite for all 3 nights that we would be there. It was close to our anniversary, but we never did any $20 or $50 trick to get an upgrade for free. The guy at check-in said excuse me, but I'll have to go make a call behind closed doors once we asked if we could have it for our entire time there. After about 5+ minutes, he comes back and says we can give you the room 2 extra nights for $100 per night. I figured it would be $50 extra per night, but my husband wanted the room, so he gave in and said yes, we'll take it. Much to my surprise, the extra $200 was well worth it. This room is the nicest and biggest room I have ever stayed in period. It's 1200 sq feet, which is bigger than most apartments and some houses!! I wished my downstairs area was as big as this place was.

It was really great to have that big area since we were there with some friends. We can't very well mingle in a deluxe king room and drink booze before heading out to the strip comfortably. I didn't take pics of the separate bathroom, but it had a bidet in it. And you bet your sweet ass I used it! I had never seen or used one before, so I had to give it a whirl.

The beds were comfortable, maybe a little too plush for my husband, but he likes his beds firm.

Having a separate powder area for us girls to get ready was nice. Although, we kind of blocked the bathroom, since it's RIGHT THERE.

The bathtub was big enough for my husband and I to sit in it together. There's never big enough tubs for us both to sit comfortably. I wanted to take it home with me!!

The couch was not at all comfortable. It's not cushion-y at all and was more like sitting on boards. I guess that wasn't too much of a deal breaker because we weren't there to sit on the couch. We mainly hung out by the wet bar and when we weren't there, we were out on the strip.

The water pressure was also great. There's one thing I've noticed about Las Vegas hotels, and that seems to be weak water pressure in most hotels. Not so at the Mirage! I can actually get the soap off my body and out of my hair without staying in there for 30 minutes.

Overall, the MyVegas redemption was an easy process. And getting the tower suite for $200 all 3 nights came out to about $66.66 per night, which is one hell of a deal! This room normally goes for $400 per night. Now when I go back to Vegas, I am going to be comparing all of my future rooms to this one and I have a feeling it won't even be in the same ballpark.

Thank you to MyVegas and Mirage for making our stay pleasant!

Spent 5 days here for a business conference. It just happened to be the weekend of St Pats Day plus NCAA Mens BBall Tourney, Crazy. So packed every minute of the day..but fun! Rooms were nice. Central location. Pool was very good.

The check in procedure was smooth. We were asked if we wanted to upgrade to a Volcano view for $15\/night, we declined.  Once in our very modest 2nd floor room we opened the curtains to behold our Vegas view and discovered a view of rooftop garbage.  Plastic water bottles, beer bottles, TV remotes, A\/C units with hanging doors. We realize that the 2nd floor is not the best view, but, it should also not be the worst view. We contacted the on duty manager, Mario, and he upgraded us to the 12th floor. Same view, but 10 floors over the garbage. The bathroom was disappointing. I thought I was in a Motel 6. I expected a more "resort" like facility. When I sat on the toilet, and the door was open, it could not be shut as it hit my legs. All other aspects of the Mirage were acceptable. The location on the Strip was good. Directly across from McDonald's and Walgreens.  Prices more in line with the real world. If you order a Reuben sandwich from Carnegies deli, for 2 people, just order 1. It's HUGE and it cost $25\/sandwich. C'mon man!!  The pool area is relatively close to the elevators, unlike MGM.  I understand this is Vegas but the pool drinks were outrageous.  Would we stay here again?  Doubtful. The MGM and Mandalay Bay were definitely more Spa-like.

Booked room in July confirmation does not verify if the room is one or two beds but picture clearly shows two beds on reservation picture that was on my email and will not give rollaway unless I pay $40 a night for a roll away.  Happen to a few of my friends here when they checked in and either got a $15  rollaway bed even some of our friends got 2 rooms and $100 credit.  But now I'm stuck with my two kids sleeping on the ground.  Horrible customer service.  Not welling to help.  Feel helpless.

Overall it's been pretty disappointing.. paid a lot for an older hotel that appears to be focused on the wrong stuff... check in took forever... room is dated... staff not very friendly, casino smells from the decades of smoking.. (Burns my eyes and throat just walking thru it).. can't get drinks while gambling...or at least takes way longer to find a server to get you one than other casinos.. pools closed... not a great experience.... had to leave the Mirage property to have a good time... Vegas is always fun.. but will be my last visit to the mirage... .

After 9 years, I finally got to visit one of my favorite places again... Vegas! My friend and I stayed at the mirage for three nights and four days and we were extremely pleased with how smoothly everything went. Check in and check out were a breeze and the lines went quickly both times, the service was great and the staff was friendly, and the hotel itself was beautiful inside. I love the indoor atrium feel with the tall trees and waterfalls. The mirage also has one of the best pools on the strip. We stayed in a standard room with two queen beds and were impressed with its size. It was very spacious and clean. The beds were also pretty comfortable. I would definitely stay at the mirage again next time I came to visit Las Vegas!

We checked in on Friday and checked out on Sunday.  The room was clean and nice. LOVED the bedding, pillows etc. SOUND PROOF we slept like zombies as couldn't hear a peep from any of the adjoining rooms. Nice place to put away your things dressers, closet space plentiful. Didn't appreciate the Wi-Fi though. Dined at the Burger place, Samba's LOVED it! Great food, prices and service the little semi-circle bar was cute and the bartender made drinks that knocked us off our stools ta boot. Left Japonais as they were a little negligent in the service dept. Went to LOVE by Circque de Soleil and it was fab! It's a haul to the elevators though and we didn't have time for the pool but it looked very inviting. Overall very nice stay could use more attention to service in the restaurants by the hostesses and the servers. Loved the location as well.

We've just come back from here. The weird thing about Las Vegas is I never really feel "rested" when I get home. Its usually like, OMG....how many times did I hit that ATM? 

We spent a couple great days at their pool. The strawberry daiquiris served poolside are highly recommended! 

Over all is a nice place. The flowers are beautiful, hundreds of orchids. In fact, I was wondering how they kept them looking so fresh! Well, we saw them switching them out on the morning we left! Good trick. 

The restaurants were all good, although we drank more that actually consumed during this trip. Stack was a great place for ap's, and of course Carriage Deli (the real one in NY is better, duh). 

The one down side of the rooms is the doors. They are really heavy and tend to SLAM shut all hours of the night.

Excellent customer service and very attentive staff. Sam, the manager who checked us in was the best. She was so efficient, helpful, and extremely empathetic and friendly. Our stay here was beautiful. Highly recommended.

The Mirage hotel is one of my favorite hotels on the strip. Why? Well, first of all due to the nice atmosphere in the casino area and the pool. The palms, the water falls and the whole theme itself, is right up my alley. 

The regular rooms are nice and spacious. The bathroom is ok, could have been better. But, for a good rate, I don't complain. We had a lovely strip view also. 

I like the pool here because it is large and all the green plants that are neatly put up. 

Located close to good shopping, eating and nice pubs, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to my friends. A great bonus is the Beatles show that is a MUST SEE. 

And, if waiting for check in is a problem, perhaps Vegas is not the place for you? We waited 5 minutes this time and service was great. 

The Mirage, Wynn and Aria are my Vegas favorites for sure.
I love this hotel.  The facilities and amenities are great and the staff has always taken care of (I'm not a high roller or anything like that).

First time at The Mirage. Absolutely loved it. Top-quality customer service. The ONLY reason why I'm giving it 4 stars is because the casino ate my money! But what should one expect? 

FYI: The restaurants inside The Mirage were fantastic and the pool was spot on.

This is not my first time here in Vegas, but this is the first time in Mirage and not having a good experience. First, they assigned the last room beside the emergency exit door. Second, you can't put anything in the fridge even bottled water because if u open it, it will charge your credit card even u didn't touch anything in the mini bar. So I asked for an ice bucket. They told me they will bill me for the delivery. So I said fine. What do they expect me to do, go to the ice cubes dispenser all the time just to keep my bottled water cold!? This is sucks!

I'm completely sold on the Mirage. I really am. I've stayed at many hotels in Vegas and this by far takes it. For the price you pay it's definitely worth it. The hotel is clean, smells good (not too bad on smokey side like other hotels) and the rooms are decent size (bathroom is a little small but manageable). My girlfriends were able to score us a room on the 22nd floor facing the volcano and we were super pleased with that. The only issue I really found with the room was the temperature. It was on the wonky side but once again still manageable. The windows open which was a big help! We didn't get to visit the pool so maybe next time but all in all the property was great. Not to mention the location, it's literally near everything you want to do. I think we took one cab and walked the rest of the time. 

I cannot wait to stay here again and seriously for the price we paid I can't complain!

Resort fee $30 a day? REALLY? Thanks Expedia! Everything is overpriced to begin with. And the machines suk.
.

Standard rooms are updated, but decor is already feeling a little dated. And the room is much too small and hard to move around in thanks to the built-in desk. Plus they have surprisingly tiny bathrooms. But they do have great views of the Strip. 
My favorite amenity at the Mirage is the large pool area, heated year round, open 9am till 6pm. It has beautiful landscaping with plenty of palm trees and greenery, waterfalls, a grotto, and privacy hedges around their two hot tubs. 
Part of my family did the dolphin encounter, said it was good fun but it's hella pricey.
Hotel has some fun activities, most cost an extra pretty penny. Volcano is free and pretty cool. We never ate here so I can't comment on the food options. But standard room is just too small and cramped.

This is my first time writing a review but I had to mention what a terrible experience we had during the last week of December 2012. We waited for close to an hour to check in, thanks to the long line of foreign tourists, just to hear that our room was not ready and we would have to wait another hour. There was really no place to lounge around with our luggage until then, but we managed to find a tiny bench. After an hour I called the front desk, simply to be informed that our room was still not ready! I had to yell at three different people at the front desk to finally get the room I requested when making my reservation (two queen beds). All in all, it was an exhausting experience. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy.

This is the hotel my parents stay at when they are in town.  So that means I go here a lot.  I really like the flow of the casino flow.  Its not really confusing like some many other casinos.  Their restaurants are very good: Cravings Buffet, STK Burgers, Carnegie's Deli, etc...  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  Plus they are the home of the cirque du soleil show, LOVE.  If you like the beatles, go watch this show.

Caveat: CONVENTION SPACE REVIEW

As a resort\/casino, a place to play, eat, and see shows? 4-star, enjoyable. It's a solid place for that.

This review, however, is based on my experience while at the Mario Barth's Biggest Tattoo Show on Earth held at the Mirage over the weekend. (Ooooh, another caveat: THIS IS NOT A SHOW REVIEW.)

*****

Still with me? OK, here's the short and sweet:

So, (a) you have the Terry Fator theater close by, with some concessions, a business area, etc. Add to this that (b) the convention center is hosting a tattoo convention, a service that is -  what, 75%+ the time? - a cash transaction...

And you have no ATMs close by. Not close to the theater. Not close to the concessions. Not close to the box office. You have to go all the way out to the LOVE! theater to find an ATM. Worse yet, (c) your convention staff didn't know that. If there was anything closer, no one I know or talked to could find it or point it out. #vendingfail

I hopped on the locals' special and signed up ahead of time to get free tickets. Without pre-registration, it cost locals $10. Overall, no biggie. But then, at the door, not only did no one check my ticket until I practically forced it under her nose, she didn't give me or my friend any sort of wrist band. Why is this important? While they do offer hand stamps for exit and re-entry (see aforementioned ATM fail), I was still hassled a couple times by Mirage security about not having a wrist band and why couldn't I produce my ticket? Thankfully I had the email confirmation on my phone and ID to correspond to the email.

$6 beers and $12 cocktails? Really? Even in a casino on the strip that's a bit ludicrous, especially because I am not sitting somewhere being served and\/or offered food, etc.

Loved the show, generally like the Mirage, but the convention setup, handling, conveniences (and lack thereof)? Meh, truly disappointed; I've had better.

i was going to book this hotel until i saw they have captive dolphins.  this is extremely cruel and distasteful.  thousands of dolphins are killed for the few they select to be put in these small pools in japan.  the pools are very small.  dolphins need 50 miles for a normal habitat. this is like us being asked to live in a bath tub.  the trainers have to give them tums for their stomachs because they are so stressed.  please put them back where they belong and remember every dolphin that gets selected `1000s are slaughtered.  please watch the cove and you will understand this.

Computers were down upon check-in....we were there for one night and waited in line for 
almost two hours while they passed out water which infuriated those around me. People want 
something more than water when they have to wait in line for hours to check in. Ridiculous. 
Waiting so long made it impossible to have our anniversary dinner prior to the Love show. 
After checking in, we really needing a drink, the bar we went to displayed Corzo tequila on 
the shelf. We ordered Corzo and Cointreau margaritas......the waitress came back to tell us 
that the Corzo was new and has not been priced ( why in the world would it be displayed???) 
and then went on to tell us our choices. After picking a different tequila she then told us they 
were out of Cointreau.....on a Thursday evening at 6pm? We left and found another place that 
had decent tequila choices yet when we chose to use the comp that was offered the manager 
attempted to refuse it. We were late for the show, I gave him what was owed beyond the 
comp and left.  After the Love show ( which was fabulous) we went to Jet. After one drink ( 
which was served in PLASTIC!!!) we asked for a glass of water and the waiter told us we could 
purchase a bottle of water......really??? We asked the other bartender and we were given water 
with no ice.  I was told, at the front desk that a manager would give me call. They took my 
number and it's been several days. I have yet to hear from anyone. I cannot in good faith 
recommend the Mirage to anyone I know.......

We booked rooms at the Mirage because of the pool. And we only used the pool once near the end of a day to lounge among the cans of empty alcohol and trash. This place is like old carpet - fraying and dirty. 

We were first assigned to a room with a beautiful view of piles of take-out-trash on a rooftop. I kid you not - scores of people had thrown their 1\/2 eaten take out food - I saw wings, fries, slop, green stuff, half in and out of styrofoam containers. No one had cleaned it up. I just felt so revolted. 

We changed rooms and the next room had a broken toilet that they 'fixed' but didn't fix, and so it remained nonfunctional. It would only flush 1 out of every 3 or 4 times. This was starting to get on my nerves. Who can let it go on the can when it might not flush?

Then we moved again and it was okay, but there was other stuff too - slow service, this and that, bla bla bla. I don't know, I couldn't deal with all this and deferred everything my friends like usual. Thank you, crew, for putting up with me at my worst behavior. Next time, we'll be staying some place else.

Mirage is a good solid Vegas hotel and works for my Family.  We've tried a few others. It's in a good location.  Go on the tram, you're in TI and next to TI is the Mall.  Cross the street and there's Harrah's, Venetian, McDonald's, and Walgreens.  Go the other direction and you are right next to Ceasar's.  These are Vegas blocks, the lengths of hotels, but faster than getting in your car and driving over, and definitely cheaper than a taxi.  

Their pool closes at 6 pm, but it's more shaded than Trump, Aria, and Venetian.  

We order food to go from Carnegie Deli & BLT and enjoy it in our room. Cravings Buffet is a little more expensive  than TI and Harrah's, but good for a buffet.  They also have a Starbucks, another coffee place with pastries, and a frozen yogurt place.  

Our rooms have always been clean.  There's a small counter space\/shelf along half the wall, with drawers underneath, a flat screen tv set on top, and a table\/desk.   On the side is a mid-size dresser with a lamp, dresser is big enough for a coffee machine and miscellaneous.   

They are also part of mlife players club.

Sorry, but I just had to drop our favorite hotel down in the ratings due to one simple issue-WIFI. They charge a "resort fee" that includes wifi, but the wifi is very subpar. c'mon it is 2015, upgrade the gear, at least for the PAYING guests.
Otherwise, we like just about everything else about this hotel. The service is efficient and professional and it is located at our favorite part of the Strip. We like the pool and activities associated with it.
Now, UPGRADE the wifi!

I came here for a work trip. Needless to say the walls are paper thin and I could hear everything. Including the Bachelor Party down the hall at 4AM screaming to each other at opposite ends of the hallway. 

I've been to Vegas 5+ times for work trips and wouldn't recommend this hotel for any business related purpose. You won't sleep, pillows are super uncomfortable, and I heard my neighbors in the adjoining room the entire week. 

The location was so-so, I prefer to be closer to the action and this place is a bit further down the strip than I prefer. 

If you have a work trip and need a venue - look at The Aria, The Cosmopolitan or the Four Seasons.

If I was coming here to Vegas to party with my girlfriends, I still wouldn't stay there.

I havent stayed in very many casinos along the strip, prior to The Mirage, I have only stayed at NY NY and The Venetian (which are both amazing hotels btw!) My stay here at the mirage was awesome!! We stayed in a penthouse suite!! They have private elevators for the suites in which you need a key card to go up to the suite.The room was amazing!!
