My experience at the Mirage was not that great.  The room was not that big and the view they gave me stunk for being a player cards, well I guess M-life member now.  Not trying to say that I am a high roller, but I spend a good amount of money at the casino.

Located in between Treasure Island and Caesars palace and across from Venetian, the location of the Mirage is very convenient to the strip and other main hotel casinos and shopping areas.  Their rooms are renovated and beds are clean and comfy.  It's quite comfortable if you plan to stay here.  It also is the prime location of Oak night club,  The Beatles Cirque de Soleil and Boys II Men just to name a few.  I wouldn't mind coming back here.  It's not fancy, but it's rooms are clean, modern, and comfy.  Great stay!



update: just left my room at 9AM and came back right now at 2PM. I'm a little surprised my room hasn't been touched by housekeeping yet. Beds still not done and restroom still has wet towels where I left them. Not a good thing.

As with most MGM Resort Casinos, Mirage has some of the tightest slots on the strip. If you are a slot player, you definitely want to stay away from the Mlife family of Las Vegas Casinos. They make up for it by offering generous comps of three night stays, including weekends. Our main reason for visiting was for the Terry Fator show. I expected it to be cheesy, but it was surprisingly amusing and entertaining. I would certainly not have paid full price to see the show, but the tickets were a comp, then it is worth the price of admission (that seems like a back-handed compliment huh?). Let me be fair, the reason that I did not rate the Mirage with one star was because of the show.

Whenever I feel like taking a trip to Las Vegas I stay at the Mirage. Once you walk in you feel like a high roller. At the check in the person at the desk is friendly and they have a giant fish tank for decoration. You then walk through the casino and to the elevator. No matter if you get a cheap room or a penthouse you will feel like royalty. On the ground floor they have a Rolex store,  a BJ's, a bar, and a good looking casino. Your also in the center of the strip which puts you in the center of the Vegas nightlife. If you want to come to Vegas and are willing to spend a bit I'd recommend the Mirage.

120 bucks for a penthouse suite!  stayed here for 3 nights and it was 3 nights that i did not regret.  the suite was HUGE!!  service was quick and speedy.  only gripe i have against this place is because the elevators are at the back end of the entrance. you have to walk pretty far just to get there, through all the people smoking and gambling.  i wish they put the elevators closer to the front desk as it would eliminate a lot of walking.

Wow we're in Vegas for the W.S.O.P. We went over to play a poker tournament at the mirage They want to charge you for parking now $13 to $20 ARE YOU KIDDING ME Last time we play there. Good luck on your new money grubbing idea.

I've decide to visit mirage with my friend. I've parked at the garage and my friend was running late. So I was waiting for her for 10 !!!minutes sitting in the car when I had security banging in my window. I pushed it down by asking how can I help him. He told me I can't be sitting in my car ,either I'm going inside to hotel or I have to leave parking lot. I reply to him by saying that I've got my parking ticket that I'm paying for the time I'm parked at this garage and I'll take my time exact how much I need to get out from the car . His answer was that I gotta wait for my friend at the bridge outside the garage which I said you are not gonna decide for me where I'm gonna wait for my friend. He said I have to get out from parking lot now otherwise my car is getting towed immediately. There is no way I'll be ever bringing my business to this place...

This hotel has a great central location on the strip which is super convenient. The parking structure is really easy to find and has great access to the hotel itself. Check in took quite awhile (I love the aquarium in the check in area though), but check out was super easy. Our room was pretty up to date and spacious. I love how easy this casino is to navigate compared to some of the others on the strip. The prices of the tables were a bit high and a little unwarranted due to the age of this casino, I feel, but I suppose what do you expect at prime time on the strip no matter the age of the place. The staff we encountered were all courteous and helpful. 

I was not a huge fan of the pool only because of the number of KIDS everywhere! Holy hell! I don't know when vegas turned into such a freaking family vacation spot but WTF?! Totally kills the vibe to see kids at the pool, restaurants, just everywhere!!! Leave the damn kids at home or go to Disneyland, people! 

Mirage has decent food places, but certainly not THE best you'll find on the strip. Overall this was a decent place to stay, but next time we are going to try a more youthful, modern hotel.

Nice rooms. Friendly staff especially the front desk. This was my first time ever staying at the Mirage.  The pool was nice--little shade, except in the morning.  Security at night to go up the elevators. Hotel guests still have to pay to see the dolphins.

The Mirage is a great place to stay on the strip and the rooms are nice,clean and comfy. The only downside was it took forever to check in because they didn't seem to have the proper amount of staff to handle the amount of people wanting to check in. Also the casino area is really dark and has a seedy gloomy feel to it. Other than that no complaints, I would definatly stay here again, get a burger at Carnegie deli, amazing nom nom nom

This is the first time I've stayed at this hotel. I've actually stayed at most of the surrounding hotels before (The Venetian, Palazzo, Bellagio & Caesar's), and so I can tell you that The Mirage is definitely the best bang for your buck! I heard they recently renovated their rooms and so everything is very contemporary and doesn't look aged at all. The furniture was comfortable and clean. In comparison to the hotels that I've stayed at, the only downfall in their rooms are the bathrooms because they are so tiny! I'm used to a his\/her sink, a full shower and bath tub. I know, beggars can't be choosers but we are talking about Vegas here! 

I utilized the housekeeping & room services frequently and their normal turnaround time was 45 minutes. Room service food was impeccable! I highly recommend just about anything on the menu. I also went to their pool every day I was in Vegas, and I must admit that this is the reason why I would come back! It's just as entertaining and friendly as any pool party that's being advertised, plus no cover! AND they have plenty of space for large parties. 

There really is a lot more to say about this hotel, but if it isn't already obvious, I think it's worth your stay!

Very disappointing stay.  First, we went to CPK & couldn't get drinks because the bar was broken. Then, the fan in our bathroom was incredibly noisy and the TV broke.  Then, they shut off the water from 11pm to 5am.  When it came on - there must have been something in those pipes because had bad allergies from it.  If it hadn't been for the engineer fixing the TV so fast & the great massage I got at the spa, this stay would have been a complete loss!  Enough places there that I will definitely be staying somewhere else in the future!

For this Vegas virgin no more, I must say my trip to Sin City was all that I expected and a million times more!! 

And choosing the Mirage to spend four glorious nights in was the right choice. From booking six months in advance, to check in, to check out and everything in between, I was constantly happy with the service of the hotel, the quality of the accommodations, and the overall experience. 

We snagged one of their 24-hour sales early last year for an October 2010 booking, and ended up paying less than $90 a night. 

The rooms are classy, very modern, very clean, and spacious. 

We were on the 12th floor with a Volcano view room, and were able to catch the backside of the Volcano show whenever we were in our room in between doing the Vegas thing.

My Mirage highlights include: Watching and rooting on my San Francisco Giants to win game one of the 2010 World Series in the Mirage Sports Bar, much grubbing on California Pizza Kitchen, and riding the same $100 on the roulette table for an entire hour!

I would definitely stay at the Mirage again!

One of the prettiest hotels on the strip of Las Vegas!  Wow, the decor is beautiful!  Pretty pricey, but you get what you pay for!!  Mirage is located in the smack middle of the strip, a great location if you are going to be out and about, easy access to get home. Lots of stuff to do in the Mirage, bars are great, food is awesome and the night club is so fun!

I forgot to write a review of this place when I came back from my trip, which was almost a year ago, but here goes anything.

Good hotel and my friend got a good rate.

To the housekeeping ladies:  I sincerely apologize for the horrendous mess I made in the bathroom the last night of our stay.  I guarantee you that the pain that you went though cleaning that mess up was nowhere close to the pain I endured when I was making that mess.  I'm surprised i held it in stumbling through the hotel.  It sure did make for a good story.  I never thought it was possible to urinate, shoot diarrhea, and vomit at the same time.
Sitting in our room right now, So glad we paid that resort fee for a room that stinks of vomit!
An Oldie, but still a Goodie. Love the indoor jungle theme, tropical plants and exotic flowers. Nice spa with great service!

After being bombarded with college kids on spring break at the MGM hotel and pool, the Mirage was a very nice retreat with a more refined crowd.  Classy, slower paced atmosphere makes it comfortable.  Parking is easy and casino is smaller and less crowded.

Decide to cancel our reservation at the Aria last month and try the Mirage instead. We reached Vegas late the night of December 6th and found that we got a double bed even though we had asked for a king during reservation. A quick call to the Mlife counter and we were whisked away to another room with a king bed and a great view of the strip on one of the higher floors.
Gambling was fun at the Mirage and we spent almost 90 percent of our gambling time there. The dealers were friendly and people at the table were fun. This was our first time staying so far up north on the strip and we really liked it. Usually, we stay at Mandalay Bay which is on the southern tip of the strip or at the Aria, which is more centrally located.
We always make it a point to go BLT Burger regardless of where we stay on the strip and we have never been disappointed. This time was no exception either. Their burgers are awesome and I love their Knight Rider shake.

We tried out Stack for dinner one night and it was not bad at all. The ambiance is good and the food was pretty decent.

Oh, and the best part, Mlife comped off our entire stay when we checked out (except for my wife's spa bill), which was very nice of them. Probably their way of compensating us for all our gambling losses for the trip! :)
Great location and rooms are really nice. My only concern is that the walls do not isolate from noise, I woke up several times during the night by people walking and talking in the hallway.
Do not stay here.   I stay Caesars  and fantastic.   Waited hours and hours for a room.  Terrible service clearly need a lesson on customer service.  Hotel is ok

Yes, they did add the face lift to the room - however, the bathroom remain small and the room just doesn't have the taste of luxury.  I think the only reason you'd stay here is for the proximity to the rest of the strip.  We stayed here this trip only because the comedy festival was at Caesar's Palace and noway in hell I was going to stay there.  A quick 10 min walk was all it took each night back and forth.  No worries about getting a cab after the mob scene of 3000 leaves each show.

My biggest complain about the room - it's dirty!!  Yes, it's 100% bad housekeeping!!  The first day we walked in, there was lint all over the carpet.  So much so the husband actually thought it was part of the carpet.  The only way we found out it wasn't was 'coz the next day, they actually vacuumed!!  Ridiculous!  The second day, I found a strand of LONG hair in the toilet.  I don't have long hair and the husband certainly doesn't.  YUK!!  

At least it was a free room for us but I certainly wouldn't go back.

If you enjoy less than mediocre customer service, incompetent, cold-hearted and insulting staff then this is the place for you!


Let me begin by saying they really make every effort to have you walk through their casino to get to the elevators.  After the inconsiderate 15 mile obstacle to get to our room, the first thing my husband noticed was the queen size bed, although he reserved a king size room...eh, oh well.  I thought the room itself was actually decent looking.  The furnishings were not too bad despite the fluorescent orange decorative pillow which looked like it had been chewed on by a dog.


After an enjoyable Saturday night in Vegas, I awoke very early Sunday morning to noise and lots of it.  Doors shutting, housekeeping carts trotting down the hallway, and you can actually hear the guests in the next room, but the ultimate offender was the housekeeper who walked right into our room!


I called the front desk and complained to the manager, Mario.  He explained there was an error between systems and they presumed our room was empty.  He then tried to compensate by offering my husband and me breakfast.  I'm sure to him it seemed like a nice gesture, but to us it felt like a slap in the face!  "Oops, we saw you exposed so here are some pancakes!  We hope you feel better!"  We refused his offer and tried to go about our day.


Along our way home I called The Mirage to complain once again.  This time I spoke with another manager who was even more incompetent than the previous manager.  Not only was she RUDE, but she demonstrated deplorable lack of management and customer service!  The Mirage needs to seriously rethink who they hire as "managers."  I couldn't help but shake my head and feel insulted by this woman's attitude and remarks.


Still feeling insulted by the rude manager and bothered by the housekeeper walking in on me, I called The Mirage once again Monday morning.  This time I spoke with Mike, another "manager" who seemed to express remorse and offered a voucher for a free nights stay during our next visit...or so I thought.  It has been 2 days and I have yet to receive my voucher via email as promised.  Not that it matters anyways because that was the first AND THE VERY LAST time I visit The Mirage!


BTW, the 1 star rating is for the nice aquarium by the front desk, otherwise I would give The Mirage a negative rating if possible!

It's over and I'm not going to miss you Mirage. This was my fifth and final stay. There are just too many resorts on the strip begging for business that will provide better service for their customers.

I expect toilet paper, soap, a shower with a functional drain and a working iron when I check into a room at a strip resort. I didn't get that this time at the Mirage. Not only did the iron leak brown fluid all over my shirt, the ironing board was all bent up as if it had been in a fight.

Anyone can have a bad day so I called housekeeping and was assured someone would be right up to make things right. Six hours later I still had no toilet paper, no soap, a clogged drain, a leaking iron and wobbly ironing board. Riding the elevator down to the casino just to use the restrooms is not fun.

"I'm sorry we didn't meet your expectations" isn't enough. Apologies from management are like youknowwhats; everyone has one. Why bother thanking me for bringing the issues to your attention? I shouldn't be doing your job. No discount for my troubles? No upgrade? See ya!

The Mirage has changed. It is now like the once beautiful stripper who is still working on her feet. She has aged. Get past the palm trees, the flowers and volcano and she has ten times the pancake on her face and is now slingng plates at Denny's.

I can't believe I even wanted to stay here! We get all checked in and confirmed, then we get to our room and it's two separate beds, instead of one king they confirmed! Then when we call to change it, they give us a room with the correct bed size, but a WORSE view!! I was so upset because you think they would be more accommodating and upgrade is if they didn't have our room available! Definitely not professional for this acclaimed and renowned hotel. I am so disappointed!
Older hotel, but still well kept.  Great deals to be had here.  Still close to many of the other spots.  Plus how much time are you actually spending inside of your hotel?

The Mirage is enormous with an immaculate pool surrounded by greenery. The two bedroom tower suite was comfortable for five people with extra space to have other people stay. The suite came with plenty of large flat-screen TVs, a bar, large seating area for up to 7-8 people, dining table for four and iPod docks. 

The hotel has tons of kid-friendly activities, including the exploding volcano, which is good to watch to stay warm while waiting for valet, and the dolphin habitat.

As for dining options, there is a big range, from the Carnegie Delicatessen to celebrity chef Laurent Tourondel's BLT Burger, and also James Beard Award Winning Chef Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak. I would recommended reservations for any restaurant in the property. It's easy and you don't have to wait for a table. 

There are a few cons to the Mirage. Check-in can be slow unless you are invited to the Mlife check-in counter (mostly gold, platinum and noir Mlife members). Needless to say, make sure to factor time to check-in. Also, as with few other hotels, the elevators for the suites are not near the check-in area, rather you have to trek through part of the casino, definitely not attractive while carrying luggage so it's best to have baggage assistance. 

The bottom line, the Mirage is an 
elder statesman among the Strip's mega resorts. It relies less on thematics and a booze-fueled party scene for its appeal, opting instead to emphasize comfortable, well-designed rooms, an enormous pool, diverse dining options, and attentive service. Attractions, from a giant volcano to Cirque du Soleil's "Love" to a wildlife sanctuary, are aimed at a multigenerational clientele. Best part is that the Mirage is central location to the strip.

Don't waste your money. First of all the valet is really rude as now they are outsourcing and you have to pay $18 a night for parking. As you enter the place there is the smell of oldness in the place. The rooms are ok but you can hear EVERYTHING. The walls are so thin and there is a huge gap under the door so anything happens you can hear it. Don't get a room close to the elevator as u can hear the elevators. Food at pantry is not so good or at the buffet. If you come to enjoy Vegas, don't bother at this place. Once we were leaving it took us 30 min for us to get our car. Wish I stayed at Wynn.

just returned from my stay this weekend. i thought the hotel was very unorganized. i got locked out of my room 'cause the the night lock\/ hatch got stuck on the door without anyone being in the room. i called the front desk all day to get my luggage out of my room which had to be done asap since they gave me the wrong rooms the night before (i booked 2) and i had to switch rooms. they didn't understand what the problem was with the hatch and assumed i couldn't get in my room 'cause i already approved the room switch however the key still worked but the hatch was obviously not letting the door open all the way. even room service employee was trying to figure out what was up with my room door and how the the hatch was on. she said i should call the front desk 'cause she had to clean it. when i finally got through to the front desk for some reason instead of sending maintenance they sent security. finally i saw a maintenance man walking the hallway and told him the problem and he fixed it in seconds. even checked the room and said it was probably haunted. and the room switches, i waited all day for them. they kept saying theyll be ready in an hour, then half an hour, then half an hour later they would be ready in another half hour. i basically just wasted my whole friday on room switches and waiting for someone to fix my room door so i can collect my stuff. it was kinda disappointing because i've stayed here before and really liked my experience. don't think ill return to this hotel. i have had way better experiences at other mlife hotels. 

The rooms were clean and there was a lot to do within the casino during my stay. in addition, my previous experience was really good which is why i decided to give 3 stars. I don't know why I was having so much bad luck this time around.

Absolutely wonderful hotel.....great location, prices, ambiance, restaurant selection......

Spending the weekend with 8 dudes from grade school and high school.  Priceless. 

I'll give you your precious fifth star, Mr. mirage, if you add a coffee maker to my room. The morning herd is tiresome.

We stayed at the Mirage few months ago and we had a great experience there. We arrived a little early before check in (at 1 PM) and they more than accommodated us by checking us in early and providing a free upgrade. Our room was nice and spacious. The bathroom was also very clean. There was also a box full complimentary toiletries in our bathroom (toothbrush, floss, etc.)

We went down to the pool and we were able to find a spot easily to relax. One of the other things that I liked was that the casino didn't smell as smoky as other casinos. I think it might have been because of the greenery throughout the lobby. Make sure to sign up for a M Life card for rewards and free comps (depending on whether you gamble).

Overall, a great experience and I will come back here again.

This hotel is extremely dangerous.  The hotel security staff is untrained and hotel management doesn't care about their hotel guest safety.  Had backpack stolen at pool and security guards were unable to use a phone and couldn't spell my name which has three letters. It took them 40 minutes to respond and could have cared less.  Hotel manager a made promises to correct the situation but failed to keep his word. Don't stay at this hotel if you are concerned with safety. The hotel security is made up of unprofessional keystone cops and seniors.  This is a very dangerous hotel.

i got married here on june 22nd 2012 at the mirage at the pool waterfall in the evening! It was amazing and perfect. the wedding was not to long or short the only mistake they made was not telling us that the photographer was included but all photos were not and hitting us with a hefty 1,500 bill so we could have our photos after we just paid 4,000 dollars for a wedding. so that was very shady. so if u get married here don't read the fine print because it was no where in our contract ask lots of questions.
This is our favorite hotel in Las Vegas, it is directly located at the strip and the rooms are clean and nice. You have also a casino as well as a shop and restaurant in the hotel.

Fr 14 $ Eintritt kann man hier Siegfried & Roy's Secret Garden besuchen, wo die weien Tiger und Delphine anzuschauen sind.

Imposant ist auch der Eingang des Hotels im Urwaldstyle.

I have been to The Mirage many times over the last couple of years. I usually have discounted rooms through my Mlife players card. For the prices I get with my Mlife account, the rooms are great. I don't know if I'd pay the full price (when they are sometimes $200+ a night) for the rooms though. The location is great, the rooms are modern and very nice but a bit small for the standard rooms. The beds are very comfy. The TVs are perfect size for the room and come with more than enough channels to keep you entertained. There has only been once that I've had an issue with the hotel - it was with housekeeping - and the front desk manager fixed the problem right away and made me feel appreciated. The Mirage is my go-to hotel in Vegas. I am here anywhere between 8-10 times a year and I have stayed all over the strip - from hotels like Bally's, Aria, Treasure Island, Palazzo, etc. and the Mirage has the right mixture of comfort and price to keep me coming back.

I totally enjoyed staying here, the rooms are clean & mordernly deocarated. The jungle decor was serene. The volcano & entertainment show are fun. The casino is easy to get around. The location on the strip is wonderfully located in the middle of everything. The service was pleasant, I was offered lots of help and attention. The shops are decently priced & had so much so many awesome seletctions; I got such cute boots at Paradiso. 
I hear there is dolphin training there & I can't wait to try it out my next stay. 
Japonais was yummy. BLT Burger was had horrible fries, the burgers werent special I don't reccomend, room service tasted way better, California Pizza Kitchen was it's regular ok self, & the Deli place that is sorta like Max's was delicious with big servings sandwich's. 

I was pleased with my stay overall :) & I'd go back here for sure!

It really can't be beat for the price. The room was clean, modern and large. My only gripe was that there was half empty bottles from the previous guest left in the mini bar and not cleaned out. A bit gross but then I'm an insane neat freak. 

I would recommend staying here, keep some money in your pocket to lose downstairs. :)

I stayed here a couple of times and visited the hotel a number of times. The rooms are decent but no frills. Soon I am sure they are due for another renovation as you can tell the rooms have wear and tear. They seem to have a lot of restaruants on premise but none of them are especially exciting.  I do like the center atrium when you walk in.  All and all not the most fabulous hotel in vegas but definitely decent. Room prices are very reasonable.  Good central location on the strip. Easy access to just about anything.

Vegas is not the first place I think of when I want to take a long weekend. You have to be in the right mood. BUT, I had to be here for work earlier in the week, and thought I'd extend my stay into the weekend.

My conference was at the Renaissance which is off the strip, so my husband & I switched over to the Mirage. 

Last time we were in Vegas we stayed at the Venetian which had beautiful rooms, but LOUD slamming doors at all hours of the night. No thank you. 

The Mirage does have a resort fee which includes wireless internet, gym access, and other things you shouldn't really have to pay extra for. But, it's only $15 and there are worse things.

The rooms are recently remodeled and pretty nice. Our room overlooked the dome & strip. They have a lot of restaurants ranging from the relatively cheap Carnegie Deli & BLT Burger, to the pricier Stack (among others) which we tried & was very good. 

I was happy with the poker room which runs $1\/2 all day & night. They keep the cocktails coming, never a bad thing. (Side note: there was the most annoying cocktail waitress though...her voice was like nails on a chalkboard. I wish Yelp allowed me to upload sound so you could hear what I had to endure).

I think it's actually 4.5 stars, but I'm feeling generous today. Definitely worth the price if you're looking for a great hotel that won't break the bank.

Beautiful hotel, but the staff was so unhelpful! Why weren't we told at check-in about the M Life card that gave us discounts to most of the hotel's services not to mention the Beatles Love Show? How about the inter-hotel monorail? Would have been nice to know about it before we walked in 106 degree weather to see the sights all week. Either the staff is not well trained or just simply don't know guest perks themselves.
Excellent service all round, especially the front desk, rooms are great particularly for an older hotel, bang in the middle of the Strip action, great value.

Nice, clean, spacious and updated rooms, and a very affordable hotel by Las Vegas standards. The lobby and casino area are darker and more smoky than most these days, which my healthy lungs disliked, but the games were cheap and we made plenty of friends around the blackjack table. The smoky smell did not carry upstairs into the non-smoking rooms, so that was appreciated.
Good bars & restaurants inside with limited wait times (Revolution, Japonais, The Roasted Bean, Samba). 1OAK was fun too, even for non-clubbers like me.

This place sucks! Not only are we staying here, we've thrown hundreds in these stupid machines and not one waitress has come by to take our order. Will not be coming here again. I've been to other casinos where they serve drinks and don't think twice about it.. This place sucks balls.. JA

I walked for miles to get here.  I could see it and couldn't wait to get in.  I was in the desert, and was dying of thirst.  As soon as I approached this place it disappeared! It really was a Mirage :(

This was the worst hotel stay that I have ever experienced. Congratulations, Mirage, you have managed to create a once-in-a-lifetime experience that I'll never forget. Things couldn't have been worse than this.

The money-grubbing Mirage unapologetically stole $50 from my wife and I. Here's what happened: We bought a few groceries for our stay: milk, sodas, etc. We removed a few things from the fridge to make room for what we bought. (Who hasn't done that in a hotel?) We put the items we removed on top of the fridge in plain view so housekeeping could see that we didn't consume them and charge us for it. The items we took out were the things that didn't require refrigeration - mostly the hard liquor. (How ironic is that? We thought we were showing consideration to the hotel as we didn't want to spoil anything refrigerated). When we were ready to check out we put all the items back unused.

When we did the express checkout we saw that we were charged for everything we took out of the fridge. Apparently there's a sensor inside that records everything you remove and charges it to your room right away. So even if you take something out to read the label if you're only considering purchasing it - guess what? - you just bought it.

We ended up having to check out the old-fashioned way via the desk clerk so we could explain that we didn't consume anything from the fridge. She wouldn't give our money back so we escalated our concern to a manager. This manager was rude, abrupt, uncaring, unempathetic and just plain insufferable. He condescendingly explained that there is a sign in the room that says the fridge is not for personal use. (Previous reviews have mentioned this manager too or at least somebody who fits that description. Maybe they're all that way)?

If there is a sign, we didn't see it. All I saw around that fridge was a price list for the items inside. The desk clerk should tell people at check in to not store personal items inside. If there is a sign it is obviously an elusive, small print piece of paper tucked away somewhere out of sight.

They agreed to not charge us for the items we took out but they still charged us a $50 "restocking" fee. Restocking? WE DIDN'T TAKE ANYTHING!!!!!! They didn't even have to put the things back in - we did it ourselves. Is the Mirage really that desperate for cash? At least the panhandlers in Vegas's seedier neighbourhoods don't stick their hands in my pockets and take money out.

My sister-in-law and her husband were staying in another room while we were here and the fridge in their room was locked. This inconsistency between rooms alone should have negated them from charging us $50.

It is bad enough that this happened but the rude and condescending behavior of the manager was inexcusable and unprofessional. I am not a spoiled, self-entitled tourist that wants to be catered to and pampered. It takes a lot to make me say that I will never stay at a certain hotel again. But guess what? I'm never staying here again and that includes other MGM Resorts International properties.

The Mirage obviously just considers you a number as opposed to a valued guest. They are not committed to providing a valuable customer experience that could make you want to come back. In a way it makes sense as this was the first Vegas hotel to be built by Wall Street with junk bonds. It doesn't get much more impersonal than that does it?

This is an example of a major corporate chain bullying their paying customers because "they can." The positive take away from this is that there is nowhere to go but up from here. It can never be this bad again.

If anything I said has resonated with any Yelpers, please share this review on your favourite social media platform. Word must get out about this petty sort of corporate thievery.

* Update - The Mirage's damage control person has posted a comment to my review below. Notice there's no attempt to reach out and make things right nor is there any comment regarding the unacceptable behavior of the manager we spoke with. This implies that the hotel condones that sort of conduct. There was no offer made to verify if there was a sign displayed in our particular room. It's simply a defensive statement regarding their policy of punishing people who fail to go over the fine print with a magnifying glass. Lori, you were not in this room and you don't know where (or if) there was a sign posted. Thanks for towing the company line and continuing to make the Mirage look like the bottom-feeding, penny-pinching scammers they are.

Their self parking lot is a bit scary  I almost had anxiety attack. I thought my car was going to roll down. You have to break your car on a hill in order to grab a ticket (pretty scary). We stayed one night, our room was decent. The pillows were so worn out, I did expect a very stuffed pillow considering Mirage is 5 star hotel they definitely need to upgrade their pillow because it's not comfortable for our neck, I had to use 3 pillow because they were so low on cotton. 
Thank you The Mirage for teaching us this very important lesson on sensor SNACK BAR I never knew sensor snack bar existed. We got a little carry away and took the drinks out and touched the snacks, I think I had over 10 drinks placed out on the table. We didn't open. 
My brother live in vegas and told us about the sensor snacks bar. We got so worried because we touched and also used their fridge for our own bottle drinks. I called their front desk explaining what happen and we didn't open any drinks. She told me it was $350 charged on my account but she will void if i put everything back. The next day I did self check out on the tv and noticed no charges I thought the problem was solved turns out it wasn't. I checked my credit card transaction and noticed $295 charges on Mirage. Why this happen??? Was the housekeeper stole the snacks and charge us. Aren't they suppose to check the snack bar obviously they didn't do their job. When I called to ask why $295 charge on my card the person that took my call got annoyed and hang up. The second time I called everything was resolved.
Their sensor snack bar is a scam because what if the employee who clean the room ate the snacks or more vile because you left the room dirty. Btw we left the room very clean. The charge made to my account was the next day we already checked out.

The mirage is a cool hotel with a cool pool and we booked rooms for our entire family of 12 people.  When we got there we didn't get our room until 3, 330 which a lot of other hotels we stay at here, let us do early check in but not here.  The 2 bartenders at the dolphin bar were cool too(didn't get their names).  Seemed a little dirtier than when we stayed not too long ago ie tooth paste on wood in bathroom and restrooms in lobby. Not sure if we will stay here again.
Great stay, short lines. good service, nice restauants.  Would return and recommend.

Pros: 

Clean rooms.
Won over $200 playing slot machines. ^_^
Lots of restaurants, bars, lounges, shows, things to do within the hotel itself.

Cons:
Guest Elevators are a FAR walk from the check-in counter.  Even FARTHER from self-parking.  Having to wheel your luggage through the lobby and then the entire casino, on carpet, is NOT FUN.  

I stayed here on two occasions.  First time was in a suite and the room was simply amazing.  Second time I stayed in a deluxe room.  The room itself was fine, however the BIGGEST CON with this room (located on the 12th floor) was the NOISE.  You could hear every little freaking thing in the hall, which I assume means anyone passing by could hear every little thing coming from the room.  It's not so bad during the day, but having obnoxious drunk kids screaming and yelling as they walk down the halls sucks.  I think that is enough for me to never stay in this type of room again.  I don't remember the suites having this problem.  There was also a HUGE gap under the door, which also probably contributed to this problem.  If I had not stayed prior to my current stay, I probably wouldn't come back.

Hell, I still probably won't come back because the suites are not cheap.
4 stars for the suites and things to do within the hotel.
3 stars for crappy deluxe room and ever other con about this hotel.

I love Mirage and the Mirage loves me. It is my go to hotel when staying in Vegas. If I could move in I would that's how much I love it here. Best restaurants on the strip, fantastic pool, great rooms, never tire of the Volcano show and as for the overall beauty and grounds can't be beat. Sure you can break the bank and stay at the big shot strip hotels but Mirage never disappoints or lets me down. Don't worry Mirage I'll be back in another couple of months to see ya.
A classic! Always enjoy staying here. Great location and customer service. The renovations are beauriful!

When you're in Vegas and when you're drunk, EVERYTHING is awesome in your point of view! But even from a sober person's perspective, the mirage is awesome!

We stayed in a huge suite that had two bedrooms, a kitchen and a living room. Sadly, by night one, we trashed the place due to water fights, chip and pretzel fight's, and shots getting spilled, shoes and clothes thrown being tossed around. You should have seen the look on the cleaning ladies face when she opened the door to our room. She looked like she had died! (We tipped her NICELY though).

The decor is is  really nice because you feel like you are in a little zoo. Even though the whole time I was here, I was in our suite I really enjoyed this place. I wish it had a food court like the Venetian did, but since it's in the middle of the strip, food is conveniently close by.

I would definitely stay here again if I had the choice.

I love the Mirage.  I'm sorry that they started charging an unnecessary parking charge about a year or so ago. Why?  Is this New York? No.  We are in the middle of a desert...you are making enough off the tables, rooms and dining...parking charge of 30+ a day? Ridiculous.

This silly expense will color my future Vegas accommodation decisions.

Location is good, rooms are ok, my expectations were much higher compared  it to other hotels in the strip. We had breakfast at the Carnegie deli..wrong decision... service and food are below average. . Food is expensive not worth it for your money.  We had a breakfast with a bagel. .we ask the cream cheese and the waitress respond it that will be $2.99 more..for a Cream cheese?.

I've been coming to Vegas with my family for a while now and I've never had a problem with checking in. The check in time was at 3 pm we called in advance at 12 to see if the room would be ready and they told us everything is fine. We get there and check in and they tell us we have to wait for an hour. We were like okay that's fine. We went to eat for the time being and its already posted 2 1\/2 hours!? 

We got the 2 bedroom penthouse which was beautiful and was perfect for the 4 of us. We asked the maids to come and clean our room before we left and they said okay. We come back to our room and nothing was touched. 

Other than that, mirage is a good location and we walked majority of the time and the dining was good.

I wish you could give half ratings on this website. I'd give this hotel a 3.5

After visiting vegas a few times, I finally decided to try out The Mirage. For the most part everything was GREAT! Checked-in with a girl behind the desk. Her name was Ashley. SUPER SWEET GIRL!! She took off our resort fee of $56 for choosing to stay at the hotel. I had asked for a room with a view when I booked this hotel and got what I asked for. Room service is great!! (overpriced but you expect that in every hotel). The staff were very prompt and friendly. LOVE the hotel's atmosphere. The pool is a good size and there is a lot of room to spread out with your group. Food and drink service around the pool as well. VERY CLEAN considering all the drunk people everywhere with their beer bottles and whatnot.

 I only really have two complaints about the hotel.
1. ROOMS- The rooms aren't as big as the pictures perceived them to be. The air conditioner was also in an awkward spot in the room, which left most of the room very warm. I wasn't expecting anything HUGE in terms of size, but I was expecting a little more space to move around. The bathroom was also a little on the small side. My biggest problem with the room was the door. IT ONLY HAD A DEAD BOLT. Most doors that I'm aware of have both a door lock and dead bolt lock. I think if they took the time to update the rooms, this hotel would be outstanding.

2. RUDE GIRL WORKING AT REVOLUTION- I didn't get her name, but she had what most girls would call a "constant bitch face". Didn't spend anytime in revolution but had asked her for directions, I was very unimpressed with her bitchy attitude, I reported her at check-out. SORRY YOU HATE YOUR JOB SO MUCH HONEY

That being said, if I were to stay here again, id probably go for a bigger room.

Pros: location and very friendly staff
Cons:
Have to go against the crowds in the dark, cave-like casino to get to the guest elevators.
Room is old
Small bathroom with makeup mirror mounted at four feet. Hope you're short.
Iron gushed water
Bathroom fan sounded like a leaf blower
Tv didn't work
No coffeemaker, wait in line 20 minutes at the coffee bar
Mini fridge noisy
Room smelled of disinfectant
$29 breakfast buffet
$25 resort fee for what?

The Mirage is typical Las Vegas, glitzy and garish but in a good way.  I stayed there for one night on a recent trip but be forewarned the casino doesn't have any Wizard Of Oz slots (what no flying monkey bonus?)  The food is uber expensive in the hotel but the rooms are nicely redecorated with sort of a Laugh In retro feel and are pretty comfortable. My room had a lovely view of the parking structure and was at the end of the very long hallway, it was a trek to just get to the elevator from the room.  The went to the  revolution bar where i paid a pretty penny for a Jameson on the rocks but it was cheaper then losing all my playing video poker just to get a "free drink" 

After check in there is a very long and i mean LONG walk to the hotel elevators so get a bellmen to help you if you have any luggage at all its worth the tip.  The hotel staff was very  friendly all except for the valet, cranky is the word i would use. I had luggage and they basically  just park your car and get your car they wont help you with your bags ... at all... or maybe  the tramp i got just wouldn't help me. bitch i got tip money! 

overall it was just dandy there especially because i pricelined the room  and got a great  deal if i had paid rack rates i might not have been as happy.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Mirage, the front desk check-in was smooth and we were able to get into our room early :)  The concierge was awesome in letting us change our VIP pool tickets to a different day as the weather in Vegas that day was "chilly".  The rooms were really comfy and the items in the Mini Fridge were perfect for me (but add more mixers like cranberry juice :) Thank you for a memorable stay!

Update: As I mentioned before, I have to give credit where it is due. The mirage has been very diligent on working with us on the issues we had during our stay. It is very nice to see a business empathize with its customers. Jessica has been very gracious when working with us and very professional. She has put our faith in the Mirage given her excellent customer service skills. Thank you!

Had a great stay here a few days before Christmas. It's the best hotel I've stayed in so far. The front desk workers are really nice and helpful. I stayed in a 2 queen beds room, it had a beautiful view of their pool and was pretty spacious and up to date. I love their selection of snacks and drinks in the mini fridge. The casino was ok, I only saw 1 waitress working (around 1am) and she didn't go around much... Had to follow her and ask for a drink lol. I also wasn't able to check out through my tv but their great customer service makes up for it. You also have to put down a $100 deposit with a credit card when you check in but they reimburse it when you check out.

We stayed for 5 nights in August and it was wonderful. We had excellent service and our room was strip view and very relaxing. They were doing some construction on our floor, but that's to be expected in August! We are at the breakfast place downstairs twice and it was good, but pricey. Skip that and go to the coffee shop next to the pool- they have great sandwiches and fruit! Also- the pool was the reason for our stay! While crowded, it was so relaxing and nice !!! Especially to cool off from the August heat !!! And, casino has 2 Kitty Glitter slot machines, which is a plus for me.

So we finally stayed at the Mirage.  Was I impressed?  

With the exception of the front desk and valet staff, no.  

The updated room was nice.  It was clean.  The bed was very, very comfy and the linens were good.  Maybe I just can't get past the lack of floor-to-ceiling windows.  Maybe I like a separate tub.  Maybe the attempt at a retro-but-new style is not my brand of vodka.  Maybe I am a picky bitch, which is the most likely explanation.



The pools are beautful.  More crowded than most, wall-to-wall lounge chairs and kids all over the damn place.  Not even close to relaxing.  Never again.



Having said all that, the front desk staff WAS exceptional and accomodating.  But even that can't hold a candle to Julie the valet.  She addressed us by name the second day of our stay.  Yes, we tip well.  But imagine how many people are in and out of the Mirage in a 24 hour period.  IMAGINE.  And the smiling, friendly valet called us by name.  As we exited the car, so no ticket to refer to.  It was a rental car, nothing that would stand out.  Astonishing.  She impressed me more than ANYTHING ELSE at the Mirage.  



The location is GREAT.  And, you know, it's THE MIRAGE.  So it deserves our respect for still being beautiful and cool.  The volcano is great. The music in the casino is very good.  It's well kept.  I can't find any real fault here that isn't based on my own taste and maybe-too-high standards.  So, stay, if you get a deal.  It's clean, for sure.  It does the job.



So, the takeaway:  I still have a warm fuzzy place in my heart for the Mirage because I have won big here on occasions that stick in my mind. (See previous reviews of the casino only, if you care)  But I will not stay there again.  Also, it's not like we paid to stay there, or anywhere in LV, so cost is not any sort of a factor.  It's a beautiful, fragrant, very crowded, noisy place that has one or two great features.  Casino - yes.  Hotel - No.

They saved themselves a 1 star hatchet job by comping my room (and  I don't even gamble!). I had no wifi and repeated calls did not remedy until late the next day when a maintenance finally guy came by, opened a hidden panel and flicked a switch to reset it.  I needed keep my work inbox clear and being unable to do so without getting dressed and going out was not acceptable as I prefer to work in my underwear.

Otherwise a decent hotel, with a good breakfast buffet though, being Vegas, you had to take the maze thru the nasty smelling casino to get anywhere. Whatever they use to mask the smells of cigarettes and desperation creates an subtle but sickeningly saccharine smell.  

Oh yea, good volcano.

I surprised my wife last year by taking her to see LOVE at the Mirage and we loved the atmosphere of this hotel so much, we agreed that it would be our next stay for my birthday. 

Fast forward to this past weekend... we checked in on Sunday and were given our room key for a non-smoking king on the 9th floor. The guy who checked us in was either fairly new or had no personality, because he didn't really talk to us at all or even say happy birthday when I checked in! The room itself was very clean... only complaints were that the bathroom was a little small, the shower pressure sucked, and there was no mini fridge for us to put our stuff that we brought in. 

My major complaint? We checked out yesterday at noon and it wasn't until about 7 PM that we realized we had left our iPad charger behind the nightstand where the hotel phone was on the right. I remember it specifically being there because I had just charged my wife's phone there the night before and it was the only location that had a plug near the bed. 

I called last night and spoke with Maria at lost and found, who said she would send somebody to check. An hour later after not hearing back, I called back and spoke to Kevin who said she left for the night, and that I should call back tomorrow morning so somebody else can help me. I spoke with Gustavo this morning who finally sent somebody to go look for it... and they're claiming nothing was found. I hate to think that somebody stole something, but I know 100% that since the charger wasn't in either of our bags, that it was left there in the exact spot it was just at less than 8 hours prior. 

Lesson learned, and I would triple check your room before you leave...

PROS: Nice location (right in the middle of the strip), newly remodeled rooms which is always a plus, friendly staff, and good restaurants inside hotel (Carnegie Deli rocks!).
CONS: The mini fridge has no room for you to put your own things because everything in it is on a sensor so it knows when things are moved so they charge you for it. Also was extremely bummed out that you now have to pay $15 dollars a person to see the white tigers! It used to be free, they should really do something for their guests that pay to stay at their hotel to see the tigers for free. I know I know its Vegas and really I shouldn't be worrying about $15 dollars but I cant help it. :) 
Very nice, cant give it more stars cause I really got bummed out about the whole tiger thing, sorry can't let it go.
Also side note: I read another review about the remote and they all work like the need new batteries, pretty sure so that you don't want to take the remote home with you . FYI

another trip to the Mirage, and as always it was great.  The staff are all very very friendly and will help you with your requests, and the VIP room is great.  I gamble a fair amount, but nowhere near a high roller, and they treat me quite well, with food,room, and gambling comps, that amount to about a 3k value, as I stay in a 2 bath suite.  Either way the rooms are nice, great beds, and a nice variety of food places to eat.   I will keep going back, as I just got back yesterday.  Love ya Mirage

Already VERY NOT satisfied with the service and my room and I just walked in.

I requested high floor and a view, when I got there, the receptionist told me my crappy room was the only one available (if you're going to bullshit, are least look at my reservation and the line behind me).

2ndly, i understand it's the holidays and you probably dont wanna be here. But at least sound like you're willing to deal with me for a few minutes more. I'm not going to name names but watch that attitude. 

3rd, the hallway smells kind of gross.

4th, for the amount of money I paid for this room, at least give me a CLEAN room and with toothbrushes and paste! I asked for extra towels and it's been 45 mins now, I am still waiting. (Yes, I paused while writing) and not mentioning my fken view is the back of the hotel where the AC tube units are. I could have spent A LOT less money for a cleaner AND with view room. I feel being lied\/con-ed by this stupid so-called 4-starred hotel. 

5th, the bed is just okay. Not that comfy, and especially the uncleanness of it makes me feel very uncomfortable.

6. The complimentary wifi is laggy, but useable. 

7. Called front desk for assistant but waited 25-30 for someone to answer. I gave up waiting.

8. No instructions on how to use certain things in the room and no menu on TV channels\/etc.

9. I paid 310 with a deal including tax and everything. Upon checking in, it charged me 320+ instead. Not that I care about the extra 10$ but it's the principal. 

This is only a 2-star worth hotel to me. Probably one of the worse. If not, the worst for the amount I paid.

If you want a shitty room staffed by awful people, go for it. Want a mean, shitty 'manager'? Stay here. Want a dated, old school shitty room for hundreds of dollars? The Mirage is your jam. Only stay here if you want no poker, no service, and offensive staff. You'll love it!

From a gambling student's perspective, this place is awesomely awesome. 

I went to the Mirage to gamble away the last $30 in my pocket. Do you know how long that lasted me? 6 hours. Where else can you play for 6 hours on 30 dollars? No where! I wasn't even playing slots.. I played Pai Gow. 

So that's my suggestion: bring $30, a sense of urgent desperation, and grab yourself a seat at the Pai Gow tables. SO FUN! 

P.S. Gambling runs in my blood

DISCLAIMER:  Reservation and booking were made thru expedia.com  My request for a one room with two queen beds was fulfilled by the hotel.  Now, on to the review:

This ain't no desert MIRAGE.

As one of the mega resorts on the Las Vegas strip, there is no shortage of food, drinks, gambling, and fun at the Mirage.  My family and I stayed for two nights earlier this month, and although our stay was short, it was definitely comfortable and satisfactory.

CHECK-IN:  A bit of a debacle.  We arrived at 10 minutes before the start of check-in time only to be told that the computers were down and to return at 330pm.  That arrangement actually worked out since we were starving and wanted to get a bite to eat.  We grabbed a late lunch at Pantry, the resort's 24 hour restaurant, and were able to relax a bit after the flight and cab ride.  It turns out the computers weren't yet fixed (at 330pm) and check-in was being administered via an ancient method:  pen and paper.  I filled out my guest info and the kind girl at the check-in desk was extremely apologetic about the downed computer system, which apparently was affecting all MGM properties that afternoon.  She was very thorough, and after answering all my questions she sent us on our way to the guest elevators.

Amenities of our ROOM included:

*Two Queen beds (which were quite comfortable btw)

*Flat screen television

*Guest room safe

*Desk area with chair

*"Free wifi and internet" (this service is actually included in the daily resort fee)

*Snacks and drinks for purchase

Our room, which looked to be recently renovated, was kept clean and tidy throughout our stay, and overall very adequate and satisfactory for our short visit in Las Vegas.

We had the opportunity to dine at Pantry, the hotel's 24 hour restaurant, as well as having drinks at Rhumbar and Tom Colicchio's Heritage Steak.  Good service at the restaurant and both bars.  Drinks were typical Vegas prices.  

SERVICE:  I'd like to commend the staff that were stationed at various points near the check-in desk, as they were extremely apologetic for the computer snafu, as well as being helpful on what to do, providing forms to fill out, and directing guests to various check-in stations.  As I've already stated, the female staff member that assisted with my check-in was polite, friendly, courteous, and answered all my questions about the hotel (as I was a first-time guest at the property).

Lastly, I found the location of the hotel to be very beneficial as it is centrally located on the Las Vegas strip.  I appreciated the convenience of being able to walk next door to the Forum Shops as well as across the street to the Venetian and Palazzo hotels.  

BOTTOM LINE:  A satisfactory two night stay at the Mirage Hotel.  Polite and helpful customer service as well as the central location are two factors I appreciated for sure.  I would definitely consider a future stay at this hotel.

Rooms were clean and it looked new. You could hear other rooms though - especially when they came from a long night (or mornings\/afternoons - this is Vegas). 
Lobby staff were friendly. Crowd here's fun.

I have passed through the centrally located Mirage on many occasions over the past 12 years.  It has been renovated in recent years, and has new restaurants and clubs.

My review is based on one night that was spent in Villa One in the year 2000.  Yes, this review is 11 years old, but worth the wait.

As you may know, there are a handful of very special villas and another handful of lanais that are reserved as special accommodations for high-rollers and special guests.  They do not advertise these room types on the site, nor do they allow guests to pay for them under most circumstances.  If you have seen 'Vegas Vacation', one of the lanais were used as the high-roller suite provided to Nick Papagorgio.  The villas at the Mirage are said to have paid for the entire construction of the Bellagio!!

So, my friend wanted to throw a big party in Las Vegas, and needed a special space that could accommodate a live band, approximately 30-40 guests, and a full bar with catered food.  The event was set to take place at The Venetian, but they backed out at the last minute after learning about the live band that was set to perform in the room.  So, the race was on and it was up to me to save the day.  Apparently, I was the only one with a Black card.

As I began calling around to find a venue, I was looking out the window of our Venetian suite at The Mirage tower across the way.  Why not call them first?  They are right across the street!  So, I called.  The nice woman who answered decided to transfer me to a casino host named Matt Sacca.  Matt is very cool, and still works as a host in Vegas at Green Valley if I am not mistaken.

Anyway, Matt said he could hook us up with a villa and that our party sounded fun.  After all, it was only one night.  The negotiated room rate was $10,000 plus catering, full bar with wait staff, PA system rental and setup, and miscellaneous taxes and fees.  The room rate ended up being a small portion of the total bill.

I could go on and on about that night.  There is too much to write here as Yelp limits the space.  Suffice it to say, I learned a few things that night.  Some key lessons include:

1.  If you want to spend all of the money you have in Las Vegas without gambling, they have made it very simple for you.  Catered food, bar service, and a private butler can easily set you back $10K+.  A PA system is about $5K a night.  I did not ask about the lion rental.

2.  If skinny dipping occurs in your private pool, the butler will fish out the bathing suits and return them to you in plastic bags the next day.  Don't worry, he wears white gloves.

3.  Nudity, extreme public intoxication, and Rascal scooter wheelie competitions are frowned upon in the casino.  However, the Rascal is a good instrument for earning quick cash.

4.  If you want a return invitation, none of the above will help you.  Spend your money at the casino tables if you want anything comped.

5.  Do something this stupid at least once in your life, given the chance.  Make your friend with the cashola really happy, and spend the airlines miles earned to take a relaxing vacation.  You will need recovery time after the Vegas madness.

I will never forget that night, and that is a good thing because I just realized I completely taped over the video footage taken.  Probably a good thing!  How long is the statute of limitations in Nevada anyway?

The Mirage is still a very nice property. This was one of the ones that was fairly new when I moved here in 1991. The Volcano has been a popular free attraction for years- you can actually feel the heat as you drive by on Las Vegas Boulevard and it's even warmer when you're there in person. I've been to the Secret Garden- pretty neat, actually; would recommend it. Price is $15.00. There is an island feel with the registration area against a beautiful aquarium and with the large scale atrium. Years later, the property grounds are still very nice. I still have old pictures of the property from when our friends and family visited from out of town- at the atrium, the statues of Siegfried and Roy. 

As far as amenities, there are two pools- Bare & the Mirage Pool, Kim Vo Salon, the Spa, the Sports Bar, Rhumbar, Jet, Beattles Lounge, BB King's Blues Club, King Ink, fine dining: Japonais, Fin, Stack, Samba Brazilian, Onda, Kokomo's, casual dining: The Roasted Bean, California Pizza Kitchen, Carnegie Deli, BLT Burger, Paradise Cafe, Cravings, & Blizz (fro yo and desserts). Also does wedding receptions BTW.

The sojourn at The Mirage was satisfying. I would stay here again, next time in Las Vegas.

Staff
- Very friendly and informative and ready to help. I appreciated every interaction from the room cleaners, to the security staff, to the concierge and check-in, to the restaurant wait staff.

Rooms
- The bed is sooo comfy! After a hard day of pleasure, the average Vegas visitor can rejuvenate well, and even sleep through play time! 
- Being a big fresh air fan, I am so thrilled that the windows actually open to let in plenty of air! Every room has central air too, if you are into that sort of thing. 
- Three AV sockets for the split heads of left, right stereo sound, and Video, in case you want to stream from your own device and watch from the big-screen. 
- Watch out for the stocked in-room snack bar. Their trays have weight sensors so if you move them, you bought them for marked-up prices. Same goes for that fridge, in case you were thinking about taking out their snacks and storing your leftovers.

Amenities
- The pool is huge, with waterfall, heated to a comfortable temperature, not heavily chlorinated. However, it is only open from 9AM to 6PM.
- The jacuzzi is nicely nestled under shady trees and is very large too, with strong jets. Again, only open from 9AM to 6PM.
- The volcano show is over-the-top! Fire, rumbles, percussive orchestration, lights, smoldering vapors, fountains of water. 

Food options
- The full cuisine and price range and more across the street. I particularly liked the the split-pea barley soup at CPK at the Lobby level.

Location
Centralized on The Strip. Good!

Appearance
My only critique is that the interior design is a bit dated. I think they could improve on immersing the visitor into a more specific and consistent fantastical vision. It's not clear what identity they are going for, as compared to their themed hotel\/casino counterparts on The Strip. I suppose it could be a jungle and safari theme if they wanted to aim for that, in line with their trademark volcano. The theater and conference room area looks more like a hesitant Roman style. The elevator area seems contemporary minimal, as do the hotel room halls. The name, The Mirage, suggests something you'd see in a desert, which would look more like an oasis rather than anything so lush as the tropics, volcanoes, and islands. Miragers, if you could work on that, then you got the five stars!
Super clean and nice room. The receptionist was friendly and helpful. It'd be 5 stars if they didn't charge for self parking like other places.

Worst hotel front desk staff ever. The front desk person promised us a room with 2 queen beds. We got up and saw the room just had a single bed. When I complained I was told I'm mistaken and the front desk would never say that. Then I got another 10 minutes of attitude from the person on the phone. If you don't know what you can promise and what not then why do it?

I don't know if there is enough space to describe what a disaster this property and its staff have been!

We stayed at the Mirage because my wife was attending a business conference at the hotel. We decided to make it a small family vacation at the same time. The plan was that I would entertain the little ones while my wife was attending her conference - but the Mirage staff seemed dead set on making sure that that did not happen!

First, we requested that my name be added to the account so that I could charge to the room. Never happened! We also left a credit card on file for charges - but in front of dozens of guests the buffet cashier refused to charge to the room since we were showing as cash only. After a very lengthy delay while the cashier called the front desk - while a line formed behind us and people began to look at us as if we were unable to pay for a meal - we were put on the line with a front desk manager who supposedly fixed the problems so that we could charge to the room and I specifically could as well. While this was going on, my wife simply asked the cashier if we could just use our credit card to pay she rudely dismissed my wife and  continued to discuss the "problem" with the front desk. While my wife was on the phone with the front desk manager, some other customers waiting began to complain about the wait, to which the cashier replied, "I am sorry, but this is not my problem, this is THEIR problem." referring to us.

After this nightmare passed, we hoped we could have a enjoyable stay - again, the Mirage had other plans.

On the next day, our room keys ceased to work. Luckily, our eldest son was in the room and was able to let us in. I put off going back down to the front desk until the next morning. When I did go down, they refused to renew the keys because my name was no where on the account - despite the fact we had been told TWICE already that this had been corrected! The Mirage's resolution? Pull my wife out of her conference to authorize renewal of the keys!! If she could not contact them or come to the front desk, then me and my kids would not be able to leave the room because we could not get back in. Or at least, it would totally be up to security whether or not they wanted to let us in.

Additionally, in a interesting twist of logic, the front desk told me that if security let me in and saw that my children and personal items were in the room, the front desk would not even take security's word that I was authorized access to the room!

Honestly, the Mirage is the poster child for all that's gone wrong with Las Vegas over the past few years. We've been coming almost annually for conferences and seen the slow, sad drop in customer service and overall quality - at least at the MGM Resorts of which we were once loyal customers.  I don't think that's the case anymore!

First, 3 associates at check in at 5:00.  Over 1 hour to get through check in line. WTF kind of service is this?

Hotel rooms are old, nothing more than a motel 6 quality, yet you are paying premium Vegas luxory prices.  At best 7 foot ceilings, a blast from the past Hotel.  Bath tub was full of black something, disgusting, carpets good and crunchy.  

The only good thing about Mirage, the location is central so you can get to real resorts and regualar food from your Mirage Motel 6 which offers nothing.  

Time to implode this thing and build a real resort.  It is over 25 years old, with shoddy maintenance at best.  

We travel to Vegas regularly at least 3 times per year.  This is the worst hotel ever we have stayed at.  For the same price, head to a real resort.  Afterall they do charge the $33 per day resort fee, for what I have no clue, as this place is not a resort by any stretch.

This place was the joint back in a 2009 trip to Vegas. Stayed here one night but it was such a fun atmosphere. It is now still generating attention but one of the definite older casinos. I was here last year in June 2013, just to go to 1oak nightclub. Sean Paul the reggae artist performed that night and did put on a good show.  The Volcano is the main attraction here. It is set in a lagoon with palm trees and waterfalls.  The volcano does erupt and smoke and fire extend 100 feet into the sky. Every hour on the hour you get to are the show.  It is usually always a crowd in the streets and across the street to see. I recommend you see this once if you just happen to be right there of course.

Nice interior.  I didn't stay here but we came by for the World Cup Finals match between Germany and Argentina.  They had a $35 all you can eat\/drink promotional going on.  Unlimited Jack and Coke, beer, AND FOOD??  Ridiculous!!!

There are many more beautiful, new, luxurious & expensive hotels on the strip...but, The Mirage was the Perfect location for us!  It was our first trip to Vegas & our goal was to try and see every hotel On Our List during a 5 day stay. ......... we walked & used taxis back & forth between the hotels. We had such a BLAST & were able to get a Great Experience from all the hotels we wanted to see!   We were like a bunch of giddy  little kids having the time of our lives!...Ya know how it is..... ya NEVER Forget your First Time in Vegas! ! ! !...Just wish I'd been there @ the same time "Ryan "Alcatraz" W" was showing off his skills in the Rascal Scooter Wheelie Competition! That's hilarious! ! ! !.....Actually that izzzz "Highly Frowned Upon" @ The Mirage!   ha!   ha!   ha!   ha!......oh well....  

The interior @ The Mirage is tropical & very nice! I Love the Huge aquarium behind the front desk!  Great first impression! Our room was beautifully decorated & very comfy! The pool was really pretty & had lots of little private places to get away from the crowds if ya want to. We ate @ the Carnegie Deli & Cravings while we were there....both places were really good. Our most Memorable Meal was @  Valentino's  @ The Venetian..WOW! 

Overall, I will stay @ The Mirage again. I like the location & it's not too pricey....No complaints. The staff was very accommodating.

A little on the pricey side, but they do say you get what you pay for. Here, you pay for an extremely clean hotel & rooms, the most excellent customer service from the entire staff & an array of superb dining options. We always stay here and are never disappointed. It's located in the center of the strip to make those famous long Las Vegas Strip walks slightly more bearable! Way to go Mirage! Keep up the great work! You'll always be our preferred hotel!
Love the Hotel  and its location.  I check in on August 19th and they upgrade my room, Their Suite was so beautiful and very spacious. Will return there next year!

The Mirage is in a great location, right on the strip. It has the Beatles LOVE show as well as the Revolution Lounge and the nightclub Jet. 

Our room had an Asian theme with pink and purple colors which just screamed girly. Large flat screen on the wall and a bunch of fun oddly shaped pillows, which hurt quite a bit during a pillow fight.

There is a lot to do and see at the Mirage. They have two different pools with one being the Bare pool - topless ladies encouraged. The Bare pool is significantly smaller than the regular pool. Being a guest at the Mirage means men can have easy access to the pool (otherwise it can be very difficult)

Room service was yummy and filling. Loaded potato skins are delicious but I wish there was a little more variety and sandwich choices.

The casino is a good size, much like you would find on any on the Strip. Overall, good choice for a fun time in Vegas.

The price was good for the strip and the location was centrally located. The free valet was a nice relief. The staff was friendly and the room was clean.

Definitely pay the extra money to upgrade and get a view of the strip and volcano from your room if you have the option!

This review is for the pool.  Man, is it huge.  Didn't take us terribly long to get chairs, even though it was a holiday weekend.  Lots of people in their 20s and 30s.  and a 32 oz tasty frozen boozy beverage was only $12.75 (not a bad price by Vegas standards).  Pretty waterfall area, bridges, and if you want to be seen--much of you to be seen-there is Bare, the topless part (which we didn't go to).

M-LIFE MEMBERS BEWARE!!!!!!!!  My fianc is a M-life member and we decided to stay at The Mirage because they said they would "take care of us." We spent more than $4000 dollars playing and they said we only spent a total of $800!!!!! The Pitt bosses don't even pay attention to you. They take your card 30 minutes after you've been sitting there and then don't acknowledged you the rest of the time. They don't come back around to see if you put more money down they don't check anything. The place does not care about you at all just wants your money and it is not worth it at all!!!! Plus our air conditioning in our room didn't work and the bathroom lights wouldn't turn on!!! If your going to pay take your money somewhere else where you are actually appreciated!!!!!

First time at the Mirage and it was alot better than I thought it would be. 
The only real fault I found with this place were the food options were super limited. There wasn't a great variety and everything was way pricey. Planet Hollywood is still the better option in my opion. They have a ton of food\/drink locations with comparable rooms at a nearly identical price. Mirage was good, but there are better on the strip.

I stayed here recently with my family. We had a wonderful suite with a great view of the Strip. Housekeeping was quite fine. We had excellent meals on the main floor. I had a massage at the spa with Desiree, whom I would recommend; I've had a slight sciatica problem for months and she helped settle it down a bit.  

Check in and check it took some time, but it was a very busy place. I'd have to say that the city was the busiest I'd seen it since the 2008 financial debacle.

I see a lot of complaints. All I can say is that given the level of the crowds, I thought everything went quite well.

Although it is centrally located and has the cool imitation-volcano in the front, I left with mixed feelings for a couple reasons:

Even though I requested a Strip-side view of the volcano, I got a room on the back-side near the elevators.  The walls were paper-thin, and hallway traffic (including screaming and shouting from passing guests) could be heard off-and-on all evening.  However, I will confess that the view was still decent and the decor in the room was nice.  But, the hotel was still overshadowed by the lack of solitude in the rooms and the jacuzzi (as of 2\/20\/11) was far from being adequately heated.  Plus, the hotel attempted to charge me for the entire mini-bar in the room.  Evidently, there are sensors on the mini-bar that detected when I removed items to refrigerate my own.  However, there was no warning present on the mini-bar, and it caused unneeded hassle.

What a great experience I just had at the mirage!!!!! Jon at the front desk is amazing!!!! He completely went above and beyond and has made our Vegas weekend into an epic voyage!!!! Thank you so much Jon your kindness is much appreciated!!

Worst customer service and welcome o have ever experienced but now I'm here so they get my business because they know I'm here for a conference! The lack of enthusiasm or concern for me during the check in process has now placed a terrible taste in my mouth! I've never literally seen a check in representative saunter into the back to ask a question -as if my question was not worth her time!

great value people .  center strip.. many things to do inside the casino.. or right outside.  i suggest the pantry next to the elevators for all meals... and great happy hour specials at night.  
we booked the private oasis at the pool... and boy are we glad we did.  it is an added cost... but worth it.  no hunting for places to sunbathe. the spot is reserved and has a private pool area with shade if you want it.  recommend this hotel.
Very disappointed with the drinks and service the Center Bar offers. First and last time coming here, two drinks were 35 dollars!

The only reason I am giving them 1 star is because there Valet staff are thieves and very very rude, they stole chips from out of my car, when I came back and asked them about it they simply told me to park some where else and not to park valet... I wish I knew there name so I could put it on here....

Vaaaallllllcaaaaaannnooooo!!!!!

Check out that fish tank!!  DAMN!!

What the heck?  No Siegfried & Roy??!!

White tigers?  How much bleach do they use to keep them so white???

Da rrrooommmss....ahhhhh.....pleasant, comfort, quiet......nice....

Nice package really, of course the last time I stayed here Siegfried and Roy were still work'n.  The NY NY hotel was still being finished and the Desert Inn was still standing.

The first time my parents went to Vegas they stayed in the Mirage and sent me back a lot of postcards and bought me a super tacky shirt. Thus the Mirage to me signifies Vegas, so I was really glad to stay in this classic hotel.

This was also the first hotel resort or resort casino or whatever they want to call it that I went into, so now it's really been cemented in my brain as Vegas. Just walking into the lobby of this hotel for the first time, my god. It's astounding and such an assault on all of your senses. Disney for adults doesn't even begin to describe it.

Prices here are reasonable, and it's a pretty good location. The room was really nice, too, and very comfortable. All the staff were great. I loved two of the restaurants here, Cravings and Stack. Loved the aquarium, heh.

One thing I did not love is the layout of the hotel. It's shaped like a Y and the elevator bank is right at the base. Our room was allllllllllllllllllllll the way down one of the arms, so the long walk was annoying. Other than that, great hotel to stay in. I'd recommend it. Yeah there are flashier places, but the Mirage is an icon and pretty reasonable prices. Oh, try not to get a room by the volcano or you will be up all night. Not that you wouldn't be anyway. This is Vegas, after all.

$100 on black.  







Damn.  








The rush was worth every penny.

I'm loving The Mirage's new 'Stay Well Rooms' !! The whole floor has humidifiers, including every room. The room has aromatherapy, different ambience filters for lighting based on mood preference, an app with a Deepak Chopra guided meditation, a PLANT EXTRACT natural memory foam mattress & MORE  ... seriously impressed!!

We ended up here late at night wanting to play blackjack.  We got our wish at a $5 table in the back by the Beatles show entrance.  Our dealer was great and was patient with some slow learners.  We broke even after playing for about an hour and all in all, it was a fun time.  Quicker drink service here than at most other casinos.
