The waterfalls are gorgeous and make for great pictures, there is a LOT of sun with not much blocking from the building or trees, and the bar by the pool has a great variety of frozen alcoholic beverages for somewhat reasonable Vegas prices. 

They also have the adult pool - BARE - aka, let your boobies get some sun. Pretty young and attractive crowd, much better music playing and definitely a wild atmosphere. We got in for free, but I definitely wouldn't pay $10 to get in here as a lady to have all the boys see my tatas. This was definitely crowded, so actual swimming wasn't an option, just standing in the pool with all the beautiful tan, drunk people.

The property: Lots to do here. Good variety of restaurants. We ate at BLT Burger (see my yelp review for that establishment), a coffee caf that had good breakfast options and Starbucks. There is also STACK - a great steakhouse that I've had the pleasure of eating at before. Good variety of quality, price and food options to choose from. 

We also enjoyed the Siegfried and Roy Secret Garden, which was where they keep all of their adorable lil dolphin friends and white tiger kitty cat friends. Tip - if you're staying here make sure to tell them and show your room key, you'll get a 5 dollar discount on admission. Lots of cute animals and great picture opportunities, plus nice to have something additional to do close by during the day when your head hurts from the night before. 

JET is also here - great nightclub, fun environment. No line or cover fee for us so WIN. 

I've seen LOVE here by Cirque - great show and a fun Beatles themed lounge right outside. Great picture opps right outside the theater on the rainbow road!

Overall, I highly recommend the Mirage! Location was great - right in the middle of the strip. I give it four stars only because it's a bit older, so it doesn't have the swanky, high class dcor of places like Encore, Bellagio, Cosmopolitan.

They have great summer deals and it's really worth it if you can stay here for under $100 a night! 

For the full review and pics go to http:\/\/www.kats9lives.com\/2008\/09\/so-much-better.html

The pool there is AWESOME! It's breath-takingly beautiful and I just feel relaxed looking at it.  Tonight my pal was telling me about the wonderful food she had at Japonaise.  Got to go back to get some of that!

I will tell you why I liked the Mirage... We stayed in a Suite at the Luxor on the weekend and switched over here on the weekdays.  OMG! The Luxor Suites is CRAP! A RIP OFF! I was in disbelief at how much we paid for such a horridly ugly room that lacked a good AC unit.  The room was tiny and dim unlike the Mirage.  I stayed at the Venetian before the Luxor.  It seriously was falling from grace! I would rather stay at a cheap motel then spend 3x to 4x as much on a lame suite.

The Mirage was a blessing after the Luxor.  I loved the room's decor.  It was clean and refreshing.  I can't stop raving about them.  Sure it's no Venetian, but for the price... HECK YAH! I will take it any day for the price I got.  

Only thing I have to say that sucked was they are still under construction and every morning we would hear them drilling.  Of course it woke us up early, so big minus! But other than that... great! ^_^

The Mirage on the strip gets stars for its location and its laid back atmosphere. We were a rowdy large group and didnt experience any issues with that. The Hospitality suite worked very well for our needs and they were really accommodating getting all our rooms on the same floor.

I dropped a star from my preemptive review because I wasn't impressed with the value or some of the service however. We booked 3 rooms and a suite and I know its a mid-level hotel...you'd think the customer service would be high for that kind of spending but I really felt like the concierge was rude over simple inquiries and that having to call for housekeeping twice was unexpected.The ice machine broke, there was hardware falling off the walls in our master bedroom, the upkeep wasnt great, the 20$ resort fee per room per night was a rip off,  I was also annoyed to find them offering free show tickets and the like on facebook but we were never offered anything of the sort despite our four night stay with several rooms. 

There was also a fiasco with the payment. I sent in a credit card authorization form ahead of time to have them charge our rooms in full before arrival.This was so they wouldn't put holds on that card during my stay.  They didn't process the card before I arrived. Upon check in I provided the same card again, explaining that the form was already completed and my concern that the card would be charged twice or the amounts due would be held twice...they assured me it wouldn't.But, of course It was. They processed the form AND then held the same amounts again on the card. Then the card was flagged for fraud as banks do. It didnt really put me in a jam but? they need better communication between departments. 

We do this trip every year and I dont think I will be booking with them. BUT we WILL go to BARE pool again for sure and the restaurants ( except the Deli, horrible service) were good. We really enjoyed BLT burger and the buffet.

Stayed here for 2 nights, the day we arrived at the reception there was a lady with well I'd say worst attitude ever! She was not willing to help, we reserved 2 rooms 1 with king bed and 1 with 2 queens, ppl staying in the room with separate beds were not willing to share a bed! Anyway the lady with attitude said they are out of 2 bed rooms! And this is what it is and you don't have a choice! She also said they don't have non smoking rooms available anymore, so we had to choice but to go with a smoking room, I ask for an extra bed at no charge as they were not able to provide the room reserved and she wouldn't give us and sh said she can not provide that, after about half an hour discussing and no her trying to convince me that she is HELPING me by providing 2 KING bed rooms at SMOKING SMELLY level, I asked to talk to her manager he came and provided the king bed rooms also added an extra single bed at no charge.
-Then we came upstairs, the hallway and rooms are really smelly, we all are non smokers and it's impossible to tolerate the smell, we asked the housekeeping to come and bring their air freshening machine to our room, they came but it still smells bad. 
-no complimentary  water is provided in this hotel, you need to pay 8$ for a 2$ bottle of water which is the usual in all hotels but common not even 1 bottle of drinking water?
-The fridge is completely full you can not use it at all, my mom tried to put a small box inside(there was a small tiny bit opening on top level) and she accidentally moved a Pringle chips and we are charged for that as I'm seeing online right now. It's just horrible at least keep a small spot open for ppl if they need to put something in the fridge.
-and at the end no tooth paste in the bathroom!

Luckily Walgreens is just across the street but common if you are charging for a 4 star (Idont know where the stars came from) hotel at least provide the basic stuff! My husband used to come here every year but I'm not coming back ever!
Fantastic Hotel.  Lots of things to do for children.  I highly recommend the dolphin and lion attraction.  Watched Boyz II Men and overall enjoyed the experience.

The Mirage is a lovely hotel. It's beautiful on the inside and the rooms are nicely decorated. The only complaint I had about my room was that it was hot and it took awhile to cool down when first arriving. Otherwise, the rooms were comfy.They have the secret garden and the dolphin habitat which I loved. They also have the volcano.  

Very affordable hotel. I would stay here again!!

There are extremely mixed reviews of almost all Vegas hotels, and I just figured out why:  (other than the brand spanking new Wynn) they have vastly different room classes for the same price, so everyone gets a different experience and Yelp cognitive dissonance ensues:  how can y'all be SO WRONG?

I like the Mirage for its Asian lounge near the entrance, the Dr. Seuss-like exterior of Samba, the Revolution lounge (and "LOVE"), and  good location.  

OTOH, there was much construction going on at a fabulously leisurely pace, so I was treated to the sight of 200 feet of glass fragments and mechanical guts where the moving sidewalk was for the whole time I was there.  That and randomly awful smells inside and outside, and a broken volcano.  

As a kicker, the room I had was really, really ordinary.  Like: Holiday Inn ordinary.  If I had it to do over again, I'd answer the "two queens or king size bed?" question with, "Whatever has been remodeled most recently."  Because they have some swank-ass rooms to be sure, and you might score one.  It's Vegas:  take a gamble.

Sjour familial  5 au Mirage. Bien que nous ayons pris soin de demander via notre agence de voyage d'avoir deux chambres communicantes, la consigne n'avait visiblement pas t transmise. Aprs quelques minutes de discussion, l'htesse d'accueil a fini par nous trouver deux chambres mitoyennes, communicantes. Quelques minutes de plus ont permis de ngocier les $40 de supplment que ce genre de chambre prvoit thoriquement.
A part ce menu dsagrment, les chambres sont spacieuses et propres, et l'hotel est trs agrable. Tout est en supplment bien sr, mais comme partout  Vegas.
La piscine est grande et joliment paysage. Les enfants l'ont adore. Il y a suffisamment de transats pour que chacun puisse faire une petite sieste au soleil.
Nous ne sommes pas all voir les tigres blancs, ni les dauphins (cher et beaucoup de monde).
Le spectacle du Volcan commence le soir  7:00 pm, mais allez-y plutt quand la nuit est bien noire. Les effets sont plus impressionnants.

We just came back from a weekend in Vegas. This was our second time staying at the Mirage. Let me just start out by saying the first time was way better than this time. We came with a big group, and pretty much all stayed on the same floor. 

This weekend we stayed on the 17th floor in a resort standard room. The first time we came we stayed in the tower rooms....big difference! The tower rooms were a lot nicer, and have a bigger bathroom.The standard room looked a little worn down. The bathroom was smaller and the room didn't look as upgraded. 

The front desk was very accommodating with our room. The guy at the mobile check-in went above and beyond to try to get me connecting rooms on a specific floor. The only downside was that I couldn't check in early, which was kind of a bummer. We requested housekeeping early in the morning because we were going to get ready for a wedding that afternoon and needed the rooms cleaned early. We left to get breakfast and walk around a little. By 12:45, my room was cleaned and beds were made.

The pool is beautiful, and crowded! Get there early if you want a prime location. The pool doesn't allow you to bring in outside food or drink, which to me seems a little ridiculous. Regardless, I brought in my bag of hot cheetos and water. No one said anything to me once inside. 

We will probably come back to stay at the Mirage. It's a very convenient location, with a Walgreens and McDonalds across the street.

The Mirage is perfectly located and reasonably priced! This time around we got a Tower Suite and it was gorgeous. Huge flat screen TV in the living room, one in each room and one in the master bathroom. Wet bar, ice maker, iHome and a very nice view of the mountains. SWEET!! Or as we were saying SUITE! ;)

 No hotel is perfect though and this one had its moments. The casino is large and the staff was very helpful when we wanted to learn craps. The pool is huge but hard to find seating in. I love the little store by the elevators. Perfect for a midnight snack, aspirin or whatever else you think you might need.

I think I saw a bed bug as I was checking out but was in such a rush to get to the airport didn't have time to speak to the front desk about it. There was rust all over the drain looked disgusting.

Overall ok room for a short stay.

We spent 4 nights here for a much needed getaway. while the value was "Okay" and the facilities were nice, it was the concierge service that was exceptional. Keith Rexroth was a pro. He went above and beyond the bar in helping us out. I have traveled extensively and have never had someone who was so focused on not only customer service but also just doing everything he could to make sure that we were having a great time. Keith became that friend that is there to help when ever needed. I would say that the tiger and dolphin exhibit should be complimentary for guests.

We went to see free volcano eruption at 9 pm. Chinese protesters on street blasting recording about harvesting organs in China. Kinda weird! Once the volcano started they were gone. Volcano was cool with fire & smoke. Homeless lethargic people lay on the street at night. Very crowded but Saturday night. Good show. Lasted about 10 minutes.

I'm in Vegas on a business trip and staying at the mirage. I'll preface with the fact that I work in this industry and very critical. 

First, my check in experience is not what I'm a accustom to and the front desk agents need more training. There were 4 agents....2 we're not doing anything, 1 seemed new (which is fine) as he was asking lots of questions, 1 was slow but the agent I received was turning and burning. However,  using abbreviated verbiage and slang. 

Once I got to the room, the glasses were dirty. The sheets were not tucked in all the way, the hangers were torn up. I could go on but overall it had great ambiance and quite inviting. There is a lot of purple in the room. 

I ordered room service and it took approximately 43 mins when they quoted 45 so right on time. 

We'll see how the rest of the stay is.
This place is a bit better than okay. I ate at Samba while I stayed there. The food was not that great and neither was the service. The wait staff in the casino area is great.

Stayed here for 4 nights during Christmas holiday. Service has been bad for the last couple of visits.  There were a few dissatisfied  customers yelling at the front desk when we checked in & security guards were near by.  Hint hint.. 

We waited for a good 15minutes & got our 2 rooms and went up the floors with all of our bags in toll & "SURPRISE!!!'. There were people already occupied in both rooms!  Took another trip to the front desk to get it right.

We have been staying here for several years each time we are in Vegas as a VIP guest.  VIP service room is only for 'black card' holders & my grown kid went in to get a bottle of water & they questioned his guest status & asked for room# just for a bottle of water!!! Free drinks on the casino floor?!.  

Buffet is always the same old food.  Bad waitress that needs to be retired! Our plates were piling up & I asked the waitress to please collect our plates, but got the cold shoulder & instead had to ask another waitress.  Spoke to the floor manager who basically gave an excuse to how busy they were.  Manager who didn't know how to manage & just stand around & chat all day!

Will give another casino a try.  Treasure Island has been calling.

Where do I even begin this hotel is amazing I was expecting nice but not this nice we valet the car even tho you have to pay now it's just more convenient to me and then we went to check in which was nice with the giant fish tank behind the check in desk. They upgraded us to a strip view room which was so nice defiantly my new favorite hotel. The pool was so relaxing especially with the water fall, go early tho it does get crowded. We ate at lvb burger and pantry in the hotel which were to great restaurants. The casino is big and nice especially when your winning on the roulette table lol over this hotel is awesome the shops the food the room, everything

These guys are the best, take your patronage here, 5 star, the I-15 was closed due to accident (sat for a hour) and we missed most of our show -- these guys happily re-accommodated us  -- no questions where we go next time

We stayed at the Mirage on our recent trip to Vegas. Overall we had a very positive experience. There were maybe a few things we would have changed, but for the most part it was a good trip.

What did we like?  First of all, the pool area was very nice. A lot of space in the water, busy chairs around the pool but that is to be expected. The hot tub by the dolphin bar and was usually wide open. Pool towels were readily available and plenty of places to put them away. The waitstaff was friendly and generally available.

MLife fit our "like" category. We were able to gain a lot of points by charging to our room at any of the MGM properties, which also simplified the payment process. Clearing our card with a points card we like to use allowed for a double dip. It worked well for them as well because we tended to stick to those properties.

The room -- from the size to the view and the efficiency of the elevators, this was a win all around. Our king bed room had extra space, a decent closet, and a lot of drawer space. Good size bathroom and shower as well. I stayed at the Grand a while back and the room was tiny in comparison. We had a nice view looking south at the pool and the strip, and the shape of the hotel likely affords nice views to the majority of rooms. The multiple elevator lobbies worked well also -- we rarely needed to wait and only once chose not to use a down elevator due to it being packed when arriving at our floor. 

The things I would tweak?  First off, how about a smoking section around the pool?  I get the Vegas is the one place the vilified smoker can attend and feel like they gain equal treatment, but with a beautiful tropical feel, couldn't we have the smoke symbols come up from one section only?  Let them marinate in their foul smell together while the rest of us marinate in the sun. 

Some of the pricing was tough to stomach. $15 for 16 ounce pool mixed drinks is excessive, but what really caught my eye was a $5 basic coffee in the pantry restaurant that featured breakfast. That seems almost unfair to those that require the black stuff to kickstart their day. 

The location is fairly central in a general sense but a bit separated from the other MLife properties that are nicely grouped further south. 

For the most part, the downsides were just "part of Vegas", and not a big deal, but a smoking section at the pool seems doable and common sense.

Bottom line, we'd stay here again no questions asked. I'd just get my coffee elsewhere and use Walgreens or CVS for some of the other drink needs (soda or water).

Stayed at the mirage this past weekend for edc and had a great experience here. Rooms were neat and well organized, and we had plenty of complimentary toiletries for the little things we accidentally forgot to pack.

My girl checked us into our room and was given a strip view deluxe room. The lady who was checking us in was totally sweet and offered us water and directed us to where our room was on a map of the hotel. Throughout our stay the maid service employees were extremely accommodating to us when we asked for extra towels, toilet paper, and other items. The only downfall I would say was that we had to call the front desk each day when we wanted our room cleaned and serviced. They forgot about us one day, but immediately fixed the problem when we called about it. 

Overall, I would stay in this hotel again. Yes, there are better hotels on the strip to stay at, but for the price and what we got. I was satisfied.

This review is for the north valet. When I got to the valley today I asked where it was the secret garden at. The tall thin Caucasian man working at valet proceeded to tell me rudely the secret garden is closed already and I told him well I called and she said that the admissions are open at six still until 7 PM.  The valet proceeded to tell me while somebody came the other day and it was 6 PM and it was already closed but with a very rude tone. I told him want to OK I will still try. He did not give me directions either like I asked in the first place. Also the way he was talking to me and made me feel like he didn't even want me to come in the casino at all. So my two-year-old daughter and I went inside and got directions from another employee. Since I had to stop and ask somebody where it was that it took me more time to get back there by the time we got there it was 603 in the last in admissions were at 6 PM sharp. It was a little upsetting but it's OK we went to go eat some frozen yogurt. So he went back to the valet and of course it's the same rude guy and then I was telling the bus help who is right next to him about my experience and he just had his back turned to me and did not once even attempt talk to me. At the at least he could've said I'm sorry that happened to miss ot well at your local right you can come back something. I did not get his name either since his back was turned to me. And when I gave my receipt to get to the girl in the valet window her hair was so long she had covered up her name tag by the way she didn't even say hi to me once. She was actually on the phone the entire time which she seems to be like a personal call. I was just so upset with the whole entire situation. I don't understand this type of customer service. I guess this is why they are in the Mirage and not the Cosmo or any of the other high-end hotels I guess you get what you pay for. It is unfortunate the valet had to be so rude to me I would've gave him a good tip. I don't think I will be back to Moroge for a long time after this treatment. And may just be the valet but it represents the company as a whole. #badforbusiness #iwouldntstayhereifiwasatourist
Good location, but still prefer the newer hotels... although it's hard to beat getting hooked up with a 25th floor suite with a view of the strip!

Regretfully stayed at the hotel for sons graduation. If negative numbers could be given they would be tops. 
I had three rooms I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. They should pay for people to stay at this hotel. I feel like I threw my money out at this hotel. 

The valet is horrible and rude.  This was brought to the attention of the management and they could not correct the issues. They have no interest in making it easier for me and want you to wait in line and not call ahead.  Bathroom had mold and smelled in two of the three hotels. 

There are so many choices to stay in Las Vegas and I would suggest any other hotel. The Mirage is not worth the money. I could stay at a 100 dollar a night hotel and would get superior value than what I received.  
They provided some credits but the were insulting and I would have preferred never to have stayed at this hotel and will not stay there again 


Run from this pace.

If you are looking for a mediocre Vegas hotel, with dumpy customer service, you found your spot.  Stop there if you don't want to read a rant.

Could not get into our suite until 2.5 hours after checkin time.

Then we get in and it reeks of smoke.  Call down to the front desk, but they are sold out of new rooms, so all they do is put a "purifier" in and spray some air freshener.  We return a couple hours later and the place still smells like a 60's bowling alley.  I then go down to the front desk and they ask me exactly what I would like them to do....as if it is my problem and not theirs.  All they do is offer to switch rooms for us the following night.

I return the next morning and they say they will text\/call me about getting a new room that night.  No texts, no calls, and no new room.  No surpris at this point.

I return home and send an email to customer service and I get a call back saying they are very sorry and would like to offer a friends and family discount on my next visit.  Like they were not willing to rectify the issue for the weekend ruined, but would love to offer me an opportunity to spend more money at their casino and restaurants.  Yeah, not going to return there.

I am not sure if this is just an isolated ed series of unfortunate events, a Mirage issue, or a problem with MGM in general, but I am not chancing another stay there.  It is one thing if you screw up, but not doing anything about it is even worse.  Stay somewhere else.

Great location on the strip. A lot of choices for food\/restaurants. There's always room at the black jack tables, decent minimums of $10. Conference center was conveniently located near casino and elevators. Perfect location for a conference. Oh yeah, the pool is great too!

This is a totally do-able hotel.  middle of the strip, middle of the road budget, and people of average attractiveness.

the pool had a nice oasis set up (very green with a waterfall and little rafts you can rent) but the chlorine tank exploded in the middle of the afternoon, forcing everyone to evacuate.  the unfortunate pool attendees that day were compensated with free entrance to the bellagio and treasure island pools, so i thought the staff handled that debacle pretty well.  the next day, we went to Bare instead of the regular pool, which was a good call and something i would recommend to anyone who is looking for a bit more of a party atmosphere.

heres the deal with the music throughout the premises...  i think that the mirage was built in the 90s and im pretty sure the soundtrack hasnt changed since.  i get the nostalgia \/ ironic value of listening to rod stewart and "safety dance" but after a while you feel as though you are in a time warp.  not a good one.  

the rooms are decent, kind of standard for vegas strip rooms, ie "modern" decor and cheesy abstract paintings from target or ikea.  on the last night of the trip we upgraded to the penthouse suite which was totally guady and off the hook.  1,600 square feet of gold glitzy decoration and totally useless and showy pieces of furniture, plus a bathroom the size of an average studio apartment.  the cost?  $400, split between 4 people... not bad.

Its not like how it used to be anymore.  I loved this place 8,10 years ago. But everything went so bad now a days.  I especially frustrated how the front desk deal with the situation when I had issues with the rooms.
Original when we check in, we were placed in the lowest possible floor with a shxitty bath room that is worst than my own house (and I am suppose to be there for a  vacation), we upgraded our room for $20\/nite for a higher level with a bigger bath room, the room is pretty much the same but it had the stand up shower, which is where the whole mess starts.  We played all night after checking  in until noon, went backup to the room, was going to take a shower and rest up, only to find that the shower head was stuck to an angle that water will keep shooting my face and it is not adjustable, and the whole water pipe chock and shake.  We did not feel comfortable with it and requested for someone to come up to look at it and they said they will send someone up right away. I called back since no one show up after 20 min, they told me that I will just have to wait because the tech guy maybe busy and I explained my situation and pushed her to get a ETA for about another 15min.  I then waited for another 30min and called back.  I don't know if it was just the coincidence (you be the judge), after I identify myself to the front desk and I am starting to get frustrated about the situation, I was being hung up.  I called back 4 times, every time I heard someone picked up the phone and just hung up.  At the 5th try, finally someone picked up the phone with greeting but did not give me her name (they usually would tell you their name in the greeting).  I asked to talk to a super visor and I was put on hold for another 10-15min.  The original gal that I spoke with then picked up the phone and told me she talked to the manager and there is nothing they can do about it but only waiving my upgrade fee and give me a pass down to the salon and take a shower.  I was really getting shocked at this point (partially because I didn't not have sleep the whole night),  I rejected her offer and requested to have a room change because its not convenient and odd for both my wife and I to go down to just take a shower and the salon.  I then talked to the manager and he is just repeating what the original gal said without a sign of trying to resolve the issue.  They just keep telling me nothing they can do about it, the only additional option he offered was downgrade me back to the lowest level room.  He mentioned about they had already waived my upgrade fee sounded it like I cant afford that $20,  He kept telling me that there is no room available and nothing they can do about it.  Instead of them trying to solve the problem, I have to suggest options to switch to another MGM resort on the strip if they are out of room, I then was on hold for another 15min and he came back to mentioned that everything is sold out.  Honestly, that is totally BS.  hotel always have room on reserve for situation like this and even tho it is all booked, you can still switch me out, and have someone look at the room (if no one can come up right away), and used it for the next guest.  With more than 1.5 hour wait for the whole situation, he then came back and told me they actually have a room all cleaned and available to switch me out.  
Even after I switched out to the new room, the shower head direction was still the same, at least the pipe didn't keep chocking like the original room.  (But the entrance light gets can't stay on and the shower door can't be fully shut) but I did not want to waste the time anymore to deal with them. The whole situation made my anniversary very unpleasant.

if you are just looking for a place to stay and not going to be in the room much and don't mind the water keep shooting your face then my complaint will not be your concern.  Other wise I would stay out staying here.  

** The lowest you can get the shower head to is that the water would be jetting out water to the top half of the glass of the shower stall.  I have to basically stick to the glass and wall in order to take my shower (I am 5'8).

1) Bad Front desk customer service experience ( I have their names)
2) Room is not well maintained.  (shower head, shower door, entry light)

I stayed at the Mirage again with my child on Chirstmas vacation.  This time I was kind of worried because it was my first time to visit Vegas with a kid, but actually we enjoyed it.  I chose Mirage.  They have small amusement places for children, and mine really loved them, entrance fee was about $40 per person though.
It's convenient to go shopping and dinner.  We enjoyed shows on Strip too.  We added buffet breakfast at Mirage without extra charge on Expedia.  You can find the deal sometimes.  There were variety of foods such as Asian, American, and Mexican and tiny desserts were also enjoyable for small children.   
They allowed us to check out at noon because my child started napping in the room. If you go to Vegas with kids because they're excited to ride on an airplane like mine, I recommend Mirage.  They have kids' drinks, food, and amenities at the shop right next to the elevators, so there was no need to go outside to get milk, small donuts I liked much, or fresh fruits.  Here is one of the real kids friendly hotels in Vegas.

Stayed in a beautiful 2 bedroom suite! Amazing view, great VIP service. Staff was friendly. Had a great time. I took my children this time so I didn't get to 'do' Vegas so we stuck to the pool frozen yogurt shop, sugar factory, and room service.  I would definitely suggest staying here in a suite. The only thing was there was a party going on in one of the suites and there was house music bumping Til about 5 am but it's Vegas what are you gonna do? So I didn't feel the slightest bit guilty when my 6 month old woke up screaming like an eagle! payback, right?! Anyway, Great service, view, restaurants looked great but again I had the kids and their palates are not refined like this momma so no way was I going to take them to a fancy schmansy place to eat. All in all great time. Be back soon to have some adult fun!

Even though the Mirage is under construction in many areas, there were some definite perks to staying here.  
Perks: 
1) Great entertainment. (Jet, Revolution, Love) And we got to do it all for free since we're ladies.  I definitely recommend getting the free PINK vodka drinks.  They are tasty and give a shot of caffeine so you can hang with the Vegas crowd.
2) Well decorated room.  We stayed in a suite for a bachelorette party and it was 3 times the size of my apartment, I wish I could move in forever.  The decor was modern and clean.  Very nice.
3) Great location.  Near the Ceasar's Palace, Bellagio, Venetian, Wynn.  It's right on the best part of the strip.

Drawbacks:
1) It stank.  The air was not clean smelling like the Bellagio's air.  It had a mildewy stench I blamed on the construction.  It was really bad in the room area.  Seriously, I wanted to upchuck every time I went back upstairs.  And it wasn't all the PINK vodkas either. 

Even if you're not staying at the Mirage, it's a notable place to visit for the entertainment.

This review is for the Mirage as a hotel, not any of its restaurants or other businesses. It would probably be four stars elsewhere...but 3 stars for Vegas.

I have stayed at the Mirage once a year for up to a week for over 20 years. They do a good job keeping up the hotel, adding modern elements, refreshing the decor.

The rooms are standard sized and the beds are soft and comfortable. Bathrooms feature marble counters and tiles but the shower\/tub is standard to any mid-level hotel (and can show their age). There is a useful desk with outlets, a nice love seat for relaxing (not at the desk) and plenty of drawers for storage.

Overall, it's a nice hotel and I enjoy staying there when I need to be mid-Strip.

There are some areas where the Mirage falls short. Lines for check in and check out can be ridiculously long and most of the clerks at the desk seem like they hate their job. Most of the restaurants are overpriced. There are virtually no options (other than leaving the hotel) if you want to eat breakfast before midday.

Not all the swimming pools are open year-round and, in fact, the big pool is often closed. Be sure to inquire if you're making a non-summer reservation.

Last time we were in Vegas we stayed here and the room is just that, a room. Nothing to write home about, good or bad. 

However, I will NEVER stay here again and that is between me and the Lobby Lounge "Manager" who, while being obstinate, she didn't seem to care one bit about us or our issue.

Not only will I never stay here again, I will never spend one single 'Canadian' penny at this property again. Oh, and I also tell people about my Mirage experience and warn them to avoid what happened to us and to go somewhere else.

PM me if you truly want to know in order to avoid the same pitfall...

I used to stay at TI.  The last few visits we have moved around.  Mirage has been my favorite so far.  Nice rooms, good restaurant selection, good gaming, ok price. excellent location.  Our room looked out over the volcano show, which was cool.  Actually were in the room once during the show.

If you want to live it up in Vegas without Bellagio costs, try the Mirage.

Disappointment: the brass mermaids that Rusty stares at in Vegas Vacation have been removed.  My nephew once violated one of these and I could not get the camera to work.  Shame to miss out on that, especially now that they are gone.

I had a terrible experience there and I WILL NOT EVER go back to this hotel. This hotel DOES NOT deserve  4 stars! 
This is my fault! I had heard from several friends that this is not a clean hotel and the  management is not good, but I didn't listen!
 
The rooms are not cleaned properly! Here is my experience. We had two rooms and each room had its own problem. One bathroom was full of hair around the bathtub and on the wall and stain on the counter while my room had an issue with dirty sheets. Upon arrival I found out that there were a whole bunch of black spots on the sheet so I called and asked the sheets to be changed and they came and changed the sheets. So I went out at night and came back late exhausted to find out that right bellow my pillow there were nasty looking redish spots! and torn sheets.... I was so mad and I called and since it would take a long time to change the sheets by a maid, I just got a sheet and covered the stain. The next day, I went down and talked to the manager and they promised to have an inspector checking the room and take care of the matter. Well, the sent an inspector....
So, the next night, I went out with my friends and came back to find out the sheet was NOT changed! Are you serious???????!!!!! The inspector checked the room! How is that possible???? I had to do the same thing again and called for clean sheets...

I was furious! Thank God we were checking out from that hotel the next day! They tried to compensate by giving free lunch at the their buffet, but no way I will come back to this hotel....
Worst hotel service ever!!!!!!! Even if your check in the hotel you have to pay for parking and the parking attendance has the worst service ever ...... I don't recommend this hotel to any body!!!

The mirage is a great hotel. All of the room are spacious and clean. BUT their check-in process needs work. To check in after 3 and not have your room ready until after 6...i frankly find unacceptable.  That shows they are understaffed and if I am paying 200 a night, 16 hours for a room seems ridiculous. Other than that, the rooms are really nice and upgraded. The pool is also very relaxing and the bars poolside have a nice eminence. What I love about this hotel is the location.  Right next to Caesars...across the street from bellagio and Harrahs. Can't beat that!

This hotel needs to work on their communication skills and customer service.  They have thee worst fees ever.  I've never checked into a hotel and had to pay for my whole stay plus a deposit until I came here.  That's like going to a restaurant and paying for your meal before you receive your food.  Well maybe The Mirage is like a fast food restaurant instead a 5 star restaurant.  If I knew I was going to get fast food service from them I would have never stayed.

Came to Mirage for Revolution Sundays with a couple of friends.  I'm not really crazy about the casino itself.  Came here before to watch Beatles Love and also for Revolution, Bare pool and Jet Nightclub, however, have not had the chance to stay here.  I do enjoy the atrium-type area in the front of the casino.  Just proves the fantasy-reality that Vegas does so well!

All in all, this place is OK. I will say that it's in a prime location on the strip.  Always busy around that area, however, my rating has a comparison of other casinos on the strip.  Unfortunately, it's hard for me to distinguish Mirage by itself, especially in a town where casinos erect every 5 minutes.

I stayed at the Mirage last week and I have to say I absolutely loved it!!!!  The rooms have all been re-done and they are really clean and quiet.  My only complaint is how far the elevators are from the front of the casino - its at least a 5 minute walk.
Was a nice place but needs some luv, very crowded with what looked like Circus Circus over flow. Waited 40 minutes for my car at Valet! WTF??????

I'm here  and can't wait to leave. I took the room through my usual hotel loyalty program and feel disappointed. (Hyatt - we will be having words about this). Nothing about this place is "luxurious" or anything like the idea it attempts to project. It's incredibly crowded - a total barn - full of people meandering through the mazelike lobby. Like all MGM hotels, you need a map to get to the guest elevators - (through the gaming floor of course) - so unnecessarily Vegas. Like the first thing I want to experience in a $300 hotel room is the ceaseless ding of slot machines and the second hand cigar smoke of some idiot living out his high roller fantasy.

Niiiice.

I had to park in the oversize lot - (the self parking is only 6'10" high) - took multiple trips to get a "pass" and then waited in 106 degree heat for a shuttle (yes it was that far away).

My first room smelt of smoke doused with deodorizer to "mask" the smell. (Tip for hotels - it doesn't) Its on the second floor with a view of the vast expanse of roof that apparently covers the acres of gaming tables -  and various air conditioning units. (This is a little north of three hundred bucks for the room as a reminder).

If I want a nice view of a warehouse roof I can stay in south LA.

Changed rooms - now I have a view of the mountains and a higher view of the roofs. 

I have been at The Mirage for about an hour and a half by this stage.

The rooms have very low ceilings, and while they try to look updated, they also seem tired. Like a motel room with nicer curtains (to disguise the peeling paint on the window) and sateen bolsters on the beds. I can touch the ceiling with my feet on the ground in the bedroom area - and its a good 9" taller than the tiled area in front of the bathroom. For a Vegas hotel - tiny bathrooms and again no feeling of space or luxury - too much caulk and dirt in the grout. To be precise - I can't fit two fingers sideways between the door as it opens and the toilet - that's cramped.

I thought the pool would be nice and spacious form the website. What was I thinking? The whole area is just a disaster - a tepid waist deep blob of chlorine surrounded by sunbeds wedged together allowing a thin area on the perimeter for circulation. At 5pm it was packed with wet sloppy towels ( are those beds occupied or abandoned?) and the ceaseless thump of Ibiza dance mixes of top 40 tracks through the landscaping lends a feel of imagined glamour to the younger people there. I say imagined because this place feels more like a Walmart than a Mediterranean island.

Nothing about this place is exciting or glamorous. It's an incredibly crowded expanse of hideousness. People stand in long lines to eat buffet dinners or hamburgers. If you want a clear litmus, they dispense yard glasses of frozen cocktails INSIDE the hotel. Classy. I guess someone in food and beverage looked at the tacky action on the strip and thought "why don't we offer that inside?" So there you go. There will be a higher percentage of people guzzling giant frozen alcosodas than almost any other hotel you can stay at. 

This place is a relic - run by a corporation from a spreadsheet. I hate it, but there are clearly enough people who think this is a fine time. Good luck to them.

For me - the name says it all.

It's interesting to me that I have been going to Las Vegas for the better part of 25 years and I have never stayed at the Mirage.  Since I am an M Life Member and they had an interesting offer, I decided to try it since we were coming out for the Journey concert at The Joint.  The location is great.  It's within walking distance of the Venetian, shops and other attractions like Linq.  You would need to take a taxi though if you are looking to go to say the Bellagio and are dressed up for the evening because it's more of a hike to those hotels.  

I was actually pleasantly surprised at the rooms at the hotel.  The rooms were clean, spacious and I thought were more than adequate for your typical Las Vegas room.  I have been in the casino and the hotel several times so I was familiar with the layout although it's irritating that you have to navigate the entire casino to get to your room elevators.  For comparison purposes, I like the Cosmopolitan better in that regard because they completely separate the two entities. 

Room service is where this hotel really shines in my opinion.  I thought the quality was excellent and there was enough food to feed a small army which anyone who has experienced the typical "Midget-sized," plates at some hotels would appreciate.  They also comped some of the things we purchased due to our M-Life status which was nice.  The staff were courteous and very engaging as well.  

I would most likely stay here again.

Beautiful hotel. I love admiring the garden and the white tigers. I came here with a friend on a spontaneous trip sophomore year of college for the first time as an "adult" and we only paid about $100 for a room that night, which ain't bad for Vegas, especially without a reservation! The whole experience was such a rush! I bought an overpriced toothbrush at the gift shop and had a wonderful time.

Me and my wife absolutely loved our stay at the Mirage! Our new favorite overall stay on the strip! Beautiful palm trees and flowers in the glass domed foyer. Absolutely stunning to see and be around! We loved the pool as our number one pool in Las Vegas. Location is awesome as well. There are many other places very close to there for a quick bite to eat. Good selection of restaurants in the Mirage too. Another great thing about the Mirage is the Casino itself. We enjoy the layout of the casino floor and how so many of the friendly staff were in a such good mood and always so helpful to us. Good clean restrooms and conveniently located. Check in line was fast and easy. 
The rooms; We enjoyed our stay at the Mirage because of the clean room and comfortable bed. Very nice marble bathroom with a separate shower too. Very nice view of the strip from our room on the 15th floor. This was only the basic deluxe king room. Loved our stay and we will be back soon!!
Favorite casino\/hotel on the strip, I love the smell & zen like qualities at this place.  It also has cool lounges & clubs.  When I return to Vegas I will definitely stay here!

This is one of the hotels in vegas I always get stay for free. In that case, there's not much to complain. They really know how to take care their VIP customers... They got one of the hottest club in vegas Jet nighclub close next to the lobby area. It's so convinient to stay there, go back to your room after partying. other than that they have couple pretty nice bars & lounges too.  
their 2 bedroom penthouse suite is absolutely beautiful.. great for families & b-day parites.  beautiful view too. I really enjoyed staying there, and definitly I will go back .

Haven't been back here in about 8 years since I had a horrible gambling experience here where I lost about $500 in about 5 minutes. (Won't get into that story...)  However, decided to conquer my aversion to this place and revisit it... and was pleasantly surprised.

The place is so much more hip now than the last time I visited. The crowd is lively, the have this bar called Revolution which have these humungous letters in the front where you can sit in the letters as a seat, there is a Japanese garden like restaurant, you can see tigers and dolphins (for a fee) in the Secret Garden, Jet nightclub is there, and they even have a secluded optionally topless pool area called Bare.  In addition, they have the volcano show and I just read that they are upgrading that to be even more interesting. 

Bottom line: Definitely a casino I'd consider visiting again and staying here too.

The night manager working on April 7th 2017 is a complete douche bag and wannabe hard ass. I purchased a room by third party but was having problems checking in. So the front desk associate who initially was helping me had to go to the back area to grab this useless clown just to tell me "there is nothing we can do." and "you'll just have to eat the cost of the room". The scumbag was completely rude and obnoxious about not wanting to help. Mind you I am a top tier m life member and have never had issues at any other MGM property until now. It was appalling how this situation was handled. Apparently, at the Mirage it's  "Can't check in? Too damn bad!" I was left without a room and in the middle of the night having to find another hotel that had vacancy. I will never stay at this property again and will tell everyone I know not to as well. I will also be reporting this to upper management. No person should have there job after the way he handled my situation.

Lovely Hotel.

Lovely Dcor, lovely staff, lovely rooms.

The hotel is pretty central to the strip.


I stayed in a Tower Suite for my 21st birthday.

The bed linens were divine my boyfriend and I could hardly get out of bed.

There is an awesome whirlpool spa big enough for two and plenty of really nice bathroom amenities.

There was a great big plasma TV ( with nothing to watch, but why watch TV? You're in Vegas)

And an clock radio that you can plug your iPOD into that give pretty good sound, which was a nice touch.

The cleaning ladies are very very nice and helpful.

The concierge I got was wonderful too, she sent me up a free bottle of champagne for my birthday!

For some reason tough the check in and check out lines are horribly long, they're always at least a 20 min wait.

Oh and the pool is pretty nice with plenty of room and a pretty rock formation in the middle. the music SUCKS though, it was all Journey and Uncle Kracker. ugh. I bet it was for all the pasty jiggle Midwestern tourists.


Other than that, my stay was PERFECT!
I will be staying here again.

I would like to say that we had an amazing time staying here, It is our first time in Las Vegas and we would definitely come back and stay here again. It is enormous (The biggest hotel I have ever stayed in) and has numerous shops, restaurants and coffee shops, including a BLT and a Starbucks.

The staff were very helpful, and helped me connect to the internet, with my phone loosing all signal for texting and calling, as I was visiting from The UK.

We ended up upgrading our room for $20 per night, as it was a considerably bigger room and bathroom, with a view of the strip and the volcano, which erupts every hour.

The pool area is fabulous and very welcoming in such hot weather, there is also white tigers and dolphins, which can be seen in the grounds of the hotel, however this is not free.

Was so excited to stay here but unfortunately not the best experience.

PROS: Our check in went smoothly and the desk agent, Arthur, was great. Room was a decent size and clean. Check out was very fast

CONS:  Room was very hot and humid and remained so for our entire stay. About half of our lights worked and the wIfi wouldn't connect. After calling the front desk 3 times for help with the wifi, we finally got it working but it was awfully slow and kept disconnecting. BLT double charged my card for a meal we ate and I'm still waiting for my refund. The tram was out of service our entire stay. Our television didn't work and our hallway was littered with the same wine glasses and room service trays for 3 days even though housekeeping passed by them daily

Now, here's the absolute worst part of our stay.......the cocktail service is HORRENDOUS!! We played the big wheel for over 45 minutes one evening without receiving one beverage. Every time we saw a server and tried to ask for a drink, we were told it wasn't her section and they would send someone which never happened. In our 4 night stay, we didn't recieve a single beverage while on the casino floor, yet at nearly all the other casinos we spent time in we had grear cocktail service. 

Don't think I'll be back to the Mirage again.

The buffet here is just the bomb... every single item we tried tasted like it should have been served at a fancy restaurant.. I had tilapia, sushi, a delicious salad (I got to choose my own ingredients and add the dressing), ribs, just to name a few. It's spacious, chic, and the place settings and tableware are beautiful. Not your typical cruise-ship type of buffet. I am a huge fan.

sure they give you free cohibas and cognac for $1 tips and comp you dinner tabs worth hundreds. and what about those free tickets to see hong kong singers, circus acts. etc.

they're not free. they're thanks for the thousands you and your friends have contributed to their bottom line.

It is clean and looks good. The Venetian and MGM Grand are nicer though. The bathroom was tiny. The iHome clock was broken. The tram to TI was defunct. Bed was very good.  The shopping is ok.  The price of the room though made it worthwhile to stay.  WiFi and the Gym are expensive.

This place was awesome! It was absolutely everything I was hoping it would be. I was a little nervous reading some of the reviews on here but this was my experience with the hotel and casino. First off we got there around 11am on a Sunday the front service guest was super friendly had no issues checking us in early for a small 30$ fee and gave us a beautiful room with a view. The hotel is one of the "staple" hotels on the strip so it has been there since the 80's, so yes it's slightly dated compared to the Cosmo or Venetian but it's still beautiful. I am super sensitive to smoke and never had one issue with these so called "smoke smell problems". When we finally got to our room it was a standard King, nothing special ( I did notice some rust in the tub but that's not going to make or break my trip). My house keeper "Ava" was on top of her game the whole time we were there and always made sure our room was fresh!!! Beds are super comfy and CLEAN! The tv has every channel! The pool is one of the best pools in Vegas! All of the staff from the black jack dealers to the guy at the pool giving  you your towels were amazingly friendly. This place is well worth the money. Thanks mirage! You made this east coaster super happy!!!

Lets rename   this hotel...  lung cancer city... Ashtray ville.  You cannot get from the lobby to the elevator without practically suffering an asthma attack. The smokers are practically sititing in the lobby. the elevators reek of smoke, the room reeks of smoke., the hallways don't have surveillance, so don't leave ANYTHING unattended.. even motel 6 has cameras in the hallway  Upon check in , rec'd the key to 12 089 and it was occupied..... had to travel back through this ashtray to get a new key... The room did  t even have a complimentary bottle of water. worst vacation. .....ever.. to even get to the show.. back trough the ashtray.. trevor noah is not worth getting lung cancer.. never again.. 
Also, there were so many children and babies.. everywhere.. NVER again,,,

I have stayed at the Mirage numerous times. I have stayed in the tower rooms and the penthouses. The rooms have always been nice and room service has been quick to fill any requests. The one big reason I enjoy coming back is I have gotten to know a lot of the casino staff over the years and they are like family now. It is nice to be on vacation and when I sit down at one of the tables have someone know my name. It honestly almost feels like I am coming to my second home. This may not be the fanciest hotel on the strip but it has all that I need at a fair price.

This truly is a nice hotel, however, when compared to some of the other, newer properties, it really is pretty 'average'. The standard rooms are on the small side and pretty sparse. One huge irritation is the doors. They are way too thin and slam very hard. Made me feel like I was sleeping in the hallway. Oddly, the windows in the rooms open outwards at an angle, just a little. There's not a lot of fresh air in Vegas, and opening the window basically lets in the stink of the strip. The Mirage was one of the first 'mega resorts' in Las Vegas. Now, it's been truly overshadowed by the much larger resorts popping up all around it. Honestly, they need a serious remodel and their customer service totally lacks. It's not that this is a bad place, by any means, but it no longer competes on the same level as the newer places. A little attention to detail, would go a long way.

The Mirage is centrally located on the strip which makes it great for walking to places. The volcano spectacle at night is pretty neat. The pool was very nice, but the drinks are outrageously priced, as well as most of the food in the hotel. There should be a discount to the dolphins and tigers for hotel guests, makes no sense that there's not. The rooms were very nice and had a great view. There's lots of things to do and the staff is friendly. It's definitely a good place to stay!
Terrible experience compared to other Vegas hotels. Belligerent staff. Wrote a complaint, which was ignored by Mirage Hotel management.

My parents have been going to Mirage since the hotel opened.  They have been loyal Mirage customers for over 20 years.  When we were kids, we would go to Vegas every other month.  Now that my parents are in their mid-to-late 60s, we travel there just once a year for Christmas.  It's a trip our entire family looks forward to.  My father suffered a stroke almost 8 years ago which has left him paralyzed on the left side of his body.  Christmas at the Mirage is an opportunity to do what my parents love to do...gamble.  But also it's not just the gambling that makes us return year after year.  It's the same dealers and pit bosses that remember my parents each and every year and make their trip such a wonderful experience.  For my father who is at home all the time, it's an opportunity for him to catch up and joke with the dealers and pit bosses he's known for years.  
What has been so disheartening in our last trip for Christmas, is the way the Mirage has treated my parents after all these years.  My father called Himler Audisho, their Casino host, in November to make our annual Christmas arrangements.  Himler agreed to comp our rooms and do RFB on one of the rooms as usual.  This is what the Mirage has done every time my parents have gone to the hotel.  Upon arrival after a 5 hour car journey on Christmas Eve, my family was informed the rating system had changed in the last few weeks and everything that had been promised by Himler and the Mirage was rescinded.  

Himler nor anyone at Mirage had the courtesy to call my parents to let them know this in advance.  This is the news we were greeted with on Christmas Eve, after a 5 hour journey which isn't easy for my father who is wheel chair bound and needs assistance.  Instead of allowing Mirage to ruin our holiday, we decided to stay. Himler had advised that my parents that they just needed to play a certain amount of time and bet a certain amount in order to get what Mirage had originally promised us in the first place.  My mother did this.  Yet upon checkout, Himler nor his boss, Luke Trusty, would honor what they had agreed to.  My sister and I went to go settle the bill and were handed a bill with a certain amount.  My sister just asked the girl checking us out, Alexandria, if she could double check what Luke had promised was correct.  Then we were handed a bill with a $200 increase and were told they had made a mistake and that we actually owed more.  All we asked, is they honor the original bill given to us.  Luke Trusty, Himler Audisho, and the Mirage would rather lose a customer of over 20 years not honoring what they originally agreed to and then hiking up our bill on a mistake they had made.  

Thank you Mirage for ruining our Christmas.  It was one of the things my parents really look forward to each year.   You'll be happy to know we're moving to the Wynn next year.  Steve Wynn was the original reason my parents went to Mirage when it opened and we know he knows how to treat customers.

No one bothered to tell us the hot tub was closed.
It was cold and we looked forward to making use of it.
Went down to it and it was CLOSED!!!!
Nice rooms but no coffee maker or anything like that.

Nice friendly staff, the poker machines geared like the rest of the strip and pretty tight.
Tighter than Dolphin sex,, and that's water tight.

The live casino entertainment is pretty much gone. It gave the place unique character. Now just another strip boiler room. Better when Wynn ran it.

BEWARE!:
No comp drinks at the Mirage unless you have a players club card. Strictly enforced! They do screen for bogus info so they have ya by the nut sac.

Some people don't like their casino\/gaming info being mailed home where the spouse checks it all out. It's what happens when ya join up, so we predict this will come back and pee on them. A really bad idea some Mirage management genius put into play.

We like to be anonymous in casinos and it ain't gonna happen here.
Players club pays about 1 cent in junk\/trinket credit for every $2 you wager.
Nahh, I'd rather be the stealth gambler.

The most expensive room in Vegas is a free room. Do the math.

Great deal on this room. We got room for $65 per night plus $50 dining credit. I confirmed this at Check in but yet it was bit applied at checkout until I had to call and ask for it!! $25 'resort fee' but the gym is included and is nice. Pool is nice too and lots of dining options. Pillow and bed were GREAT but shower sucked.

We were planning to stay at the Riveria, but changed to the Mirage when we realized how far Riviera is in relation to what we wanted to visit. From the outside, it looks like we've got a pretty good deal. First upside? FREE PARKING for hotel guests. Who does that?!?! and in Vegas? I don't know how the other hotels are, but this made me happy. 

Check in on a Thursday around 5 was FAST. 
First downside? We were on the 21st floor, and our elevators were in the middle of the casino. We had to walk a good 10 minutes before we got to our elevator. And the signs aren't much help, especially when you've got all this luggage in hand! Biggest irritation of the weekend. I don't have a problem with walking by slot machines or smoke, but all this for 10  minutes to get to my elevator? Never again. If after reading this you agree with me, start reviewing other hotels. It doesn't get much better once you know where to go. 
Elevators were quick though, in case you do come here!
Now the rooms aren't anything amazing. 2 beds for 4 people on the 21st floor, room 51. Be warned you can't take anything out of the fridge or put anything in because they measure everything by weight! So if it's +\/-, you'll get charged. Also be warned...there is no microwave for your use anywhere in the hotel....apparently that's a "fire hazard" to have one for the patron's use. I call it a bluff. 

Onto the room's restroom....disappointment. It looked dirty to begin with, and that's because it's just plain old and cheap. The tub had something plastered on to it....I'm not good with names but I'm sure it's to prevent slippage. That thing gets unstuck from the tub floor when the water starts to run. Oh, and the water doesn't run down the drain smoothly and quickly. So after about 10-15 min, you're standing up to your ankles in water. GROSS. Then the toilet doesn't flush anywhere. You either need to hold it down for a long time or flush it multiple times. At some points, I thought it was going to clog up on me. Next the counter space....TINY! It's like the size of my sink in my personal bathroom. Even if 2 people were meant for that room, I don't think that sink would have been very comfortable. 
Restrooms are important for me, especially in hotels. I like them clean and comfy. 
Beds were comfy, room was never too hot or too cold. 
The biggest complaints were about the elevator location and the restroom, oh and the fridge\/microwave (we had leftovers that we wanted to eat, but they had to be tossed instead)

In the main floor you have CPK, Starbucks, and lots of other places to eat. The Mirage is close to Treasure Island, the Venetian and Ceasar's Palace. Overall, the location was convenient. But I won't be back.  

Also, don't bring your kids here. Go to Circus Circus. Or better yet, Disneyland in Cali.

Incredible customer service!  We had a problem at the Mirage Buffet (the bartender spilled wine on me, said he'd cover the drinks for the rest of the night, then gave us a bill for the drinks).
I went to the concierge and the gentleman behind the counter asked what he could help with.  I explained what had happened and he told me he was Fran Kallao, Vice President of operations.
He promptly apologized for the accident and even more so for the misunderstanding of the drinks charge.  He escorted me over to the Front Desk, told them to give me the money we were charged in cash and thanked me for my understanding.
He was incredibly polite, very understanding and made me feel like the Mirage would now be a first choice for my stay in Vegas since I know their customer service approach is top quality!
Great service and the rooms were clean. The downstairs was amazing minus the smoke smell on the casino floor but it's Vegas just get use to it. We will be returning again!

Had a staycation here about 2 months ago and the experience was so bad we said we were NEVER staying here again. Fast forward to May 13th-15th we ended up staying here again because of the price of the 2 bedroom penthouse, pretty reasonable compared to other hotels. Everything that could go wrong went wrong. There were many things wrong with our room that didn't get fixed during our stay. My husband is a platinum mlife member and apparently that means nothing! Anyway we did complain when we checked out and we received a discount on our room but two times in a row is a bit much and we won't be returning to this hotel again. 
P.S. Joseph (Joe) in maintenence was very helpful with trying to resolve our issues with the tv and refrigerator.
Milly who worked the priority check out desk was also helpful with resolving our issues.

The mirage was an excellent stay compared to my last stay.

-1, secret garden closed early. 10am-4pm during my stay. I also could not find the fitness center on their map. During my check-out I inquired and was told it's located inside the salon. (next time!) Cigarette Smoke permeated in the halls of the non-smoking floors. It was by far not as bad as when I stayed at Luxor. So that was an upgrade!

Definitely a great location, I was able to walk around to almost all the places I was hoping to visit. Now that I have an idea of where everything is, looking forward to my future stays.

1 star for Mirage Reception. 4 starts for everything else.
Seriously slow check in! Our party of 5 took 45 minutes to check in once we got to the front desk . The lack of a queuing  system made the reception area one big mess. All of us said it was our all time worst check-in experience. We are all in retailing so we understand customer service. Jenna, the receptionist never apologized for or acknowledged our inconvenience until we asked for her name.  If she was a trainee, she should have said so. No sense of urgency or politeness until we asked her name. 
Figuring out a cueing system is one of the simplest things a hotel can do. It's not like it's a novel idea. The poor people behind us eventually gave up and moved to the back of another unclear disorganized line. A poor way to start a hotel experience.

this is a nice hotel except there is NO GYM!!! you pay a resort fee and the only thing they have available is a cardio room only open until 7. to actually lift weights you have to pay an extra $28 dollars???? and the place you lift weights is connected to the Spa on the first floor and you only have until 7pm. i travel all the time and i would expect this from some shifty hotel in the middle of no where but to be in LAS VEGAS and not have an actual gym available to your clients is sad.

Danny Gans is everywhere.  On the outside, on my chips, on the brochures, on the flyers, on the website.  Lucky for my boyfriend, the Danny Gans chips brought him luck at the Blackjack tables.

One star for location and cleanliness
One star for the beautiful pool
One star for  all the restaurants and mostly friendly dealers

I took away one star because we were told we'd get a remodeled room (as everyone else in our group did) but we didn't.  They must have been remodeling the room above ours because at 9 am we'd hear everything they were doing up there.

I took away another star because some of the staff (not dealers) were a little rude.  I got charged for a buffet on my credit card even though they told me the scanner was broken after my card was swiped.  So instead I paid cash and later found the charge on my card.  When I called to dispute they wanted nothing to do with me.  I also wish they had more servers around the pool and that the tasty frozen drinks weren't $16-$20.  I paid the price, though, so I guess I'm not that thrifty.

I'll probably stay here again since all the rooms should be remodeled by the end of the summer.  I wish the volcano was working, but again, it should be the next time I visit.

Was here on business for 2 nights and all was good. It's not too long of a walk from rooms to convention center which was prefect for this event; they had pretty good food. The rooms were a little old with some rust in the shower but the price was right with real comfortable beds. 

Plenty of tables, mostly friendly dealers and staff.  It was everything you'd expect for a hotel at this price.

We had an awesome stay here. It's a pretty moderately priced hotel and I really like the theme of it. The rooms are nice and so is the casino and rest of the hotel. 

The staff was nice upon check in and they upgraded us to a strip view room! Woo! Everyone loves getting upgrades. Check in was quick and there was no line. We were there before check in time, so they said they would text us when our room was ready which we thought was cool. But we never got the text! Around 2\/3 we called the hotel and asked if our room was ready and they said it was and they were sorry we didn't get the text. So I'm not sure if that texting thing happens all the time or if it was just with us. But either way we weren't too happy with that. 

The rooms are nice. I love the headboard on the bed and I love the theme! The bed was super comfortable and I loved the pillows. The bathroom was your typical hotel bathroom. It wasn't huge but it was a decent size. There was only two of us staying in the room, so we didn't have too much to worry about anyway with placing things in the bathroom. 

Love the garden. It's nice to walk through and it's a nice touch to have some green in the hotel. I didn't really gamble but the casino was pretty big. It took a while to walk to the elevators for our rooms. 

I'd recommend trying this hotel out. It's nice and pretty decent priced.

I don't have anything but amazing things to say about this hotel. My boyfriend and I stayed here earlier this month for a couple of days and we found the Mirage to be the best on the strip when it comes to location, food, the casino, ect. This place is beautiful. From the moment you walk in, you are greeted with beautiful plant life and fresh air as opposed to most casinos usual greeting of cigarette smoke clouding the air. When we checked in, we were upgraded to a tower room with a great view of the strip and pool. The pool was gorgeous as well and we loved the waterfall. We ate at the buffet here as well and it was delicious with unlimited beer and wine (can't beat that). We had no trouble getting drinks inside the casino but we did find it was easiest when sitting at a slot machine by the buffet. The air conditioning in the halls to the room is so so so cold but I was totally fine with it since it's so so so hot outside. I will definitely be coming back. The mirage has me as a permanent regular visitor. It was fantastic!
